SourceText: Act Out Emotions
text: Bonisa Iimvakalelo

SourceText:
Let's make silly faces and act out feelings! 😃

This activity helps children understand emotions, connect with others, and build empathy 💛
text:
Masenze ubuso obugezayo kwaye siveze imvakalelo ngaphandle!😃

Lomdlalo unceda abantwana baqonde imvakalelo, uqhagamshelwano nabanye, kwaye bakhe uvelwano 💛

SourceText:
👀 Tell your child, “Let’s see what it looks like when I am happy!”. Act out a happy face and name the emotion again. 

😔 Then try other emotions, like angry, sad, or surprised. Using a gentle voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text:
👀 Xelela umntwana wakho, ''Masibone ijongeka njani xana ndonwabile!''. Veza ubuso obonwabileyo ngaphandle kwaye thiya imvakalelo kwakhona.

😔 Emva koko zama enye imvakalelo, efana nomsindo, ukukhathazeka okanye ukumangaliswa. usebenzise ilizwi ngobunono, Ungacacisa izizathu ezohlukileyo kutheni uziva ngokwala mvakalelo.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Lento ayingo mdlalo nje - lithuba kumntwana wakho ukuba afunde ukuqaphela iimvakalelo nakwabanye abantu💚

SourceText: Adapted from I am Safe, Loved, and Learning by Save the Children
text: Ihlengahlengiswe kwa Ndikhuselekile, Ndiyathandwa, kwaye ndiyafunda ngu Save the Children

SourceText: Be an Artist!
text: Yiba Ligcisa!

SourceText:
Let’s explore drawing and creativity! 📝
 
This open drawing time builds imagination, fine motor skills, and confidence - especially when you celebrate their creations! 🎉
text:
Masiphonononge imizobo kunye nobuchule! 📝

 Eli lixesha elivulekileyo lomzobo lakha ukucinga, izakhono zemveliso zomzimba, kunye nokuzithemba - ngakumbi xa u bhiyozela ubugcisa babo! 🎉

SourceText:
📝 Give Your Child some paper and a pen or pencil.

😃 Let your child draw whatever they want to!

👀 Ask questions about what they are drawing, the size of the thing they are drawing, and the colours they are using.

🏆 If possible, put your child’s picture up on the wall when they are finished. Give praise to your child!
text:
📝 Nika umntwana wakho iphepha kunye nepeni okanye pensile.

😃 Vumela umntwana azobe nantonina ayifunayo!

👀 Buza imibuzo malunga nalento bayizobayo, Ubungakanani balento bayizobayo, kunye nemibala abayisebenzisayo.

🏆 Ukuba kuyenzeka, Xhoma imifanekiso yomntwana wakho edongeni xa begqibile. Mncome umntwana wakho!

SourceText: Echo Songs
text: Iingoma Zolinganiso

SourceText:
Try a simple call-and-response chant with your child. 😃   

This activity build turn-taking, memory, and early conversation skills - all through playful singing. 🎵
text:
Zama umnxeba olula -kwaye uphendule ingoma kunye nomntwana wakho.😃   

Lomdlalo wakha ujika- jika, inkumbulo, kunye nezakhono zencoko ekhawulezayo - Konke kungemidlalo yokucula. 🎵

SourceText:
😃 You say a line, and they copy it back.

👂 For example:
- You: *“Hello there!”*
- Child: *“Hello there!”*
- You: *“How are you?”*
- Child: *“How are you?”*
 
💚 Now try using your own words and language.
text:
😃 Yitsho umgca, kwaye babuya bayilinganise lonto.

👂 Umzekelo:
- Wena: *“Molweni apho!”*
- Umntwana: *“Molweni apho!”*
- Wena: *“Unjani?”*
- Child: *“Unjani?”

💚 Ngoku zama ukusebenzisa amagama kunye nolwimi lwakho.

SourceText: Circle Clap and Dance
text: Ukuqhwaba Kwisekile Nomdaniso

SourceText:
Let’s play a circle game with music and dancing. 👋 

This joyful game builds social confidence, movement skills, and musical rhythm - all while connecting to culture. 💛
text:
Masidlale umdlalo wesanqa ngomculo kwaye nokudanisa. 👋 

Lomdlalo wovuyo wakha intlalo yokuzithemba, izakhono zentshukumo, kwaye nesingqi somnculo - ngelilixa lonke idibanisa incubeko. 💛

SourceText:
👋 Gather a few children (or just you and your little one) and form a small circle. 

🎵 Clap your hands in rhythm and sing a well-known local song!

⭐ As the song plays, take turns dancing into the centre of the circle or copying each other’s moves. Children can jump, spin, or stomp to the beat!
text:
👋 Qokelela abantwana abambalwa (okanye wena nje kunye nomntwana wakho omncinci) kwaye wakhe isangqa esincinci. 

🎵 Qhwaba izandla ngokwesingqi kwaye ucule ingoma yendawo eyaziwayo.

⭐ Njengokuba ingoma idlala, Nikanani ithuba lokudanisa phakathi kwisangqa okanye nilinganisane ngokwentshukumo zenu. Abantwana bangaxhuma-maxhuma, bajikeleze, okanye bangxishe kwisandi!

SourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Ixesha Lomnye Nomnye

SourceText:
One-on-one time with your child helps your bond grow stronger. 💚 

These moments show you care and help your child feel valued, confident, and close to you. 😊
text:
Ixesha lomnye nomnye ninodwa kunye nomntwana wakho lunceda ubudlelwane benu bukhule bomelele. 💚 

Lemizuzu ibonisa ukuba uyakhathala kwaye unceda umntwana wakho azive exabisekile, ezithemba, kwaye asondele kuwe. 😊

SourceText:
👀 When your child is playing by themselves, join them and show interest in what they are doing.

👂Ask questions about their activity, and listen to them.

Let your child lead the activity, follow them to build their confidence and autonomy 😃.

👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your child’s actions.
text:
👀 Xa umntwana wakho edlala yedwa, Ngenelela kwaye ubonise umdla kwinto abayenzayo.

👂Buza umbuzo malunga nomdlalo wabo, kwaye mamela kubo.

Yeka umntwana wakho akhokhele umdlalo, balandele ukwakha ukuzithemba kubo kunye nokuzimela 😃.

👀 Itsho lento uyibonayo - chaza yonke into kwaye uxhasa izenzo zomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Be positive, praise your child, and enjoy spending this time with them 😃💚
text: Yiba nethemba, ncoma umntwana, kwaye wonwabele ukuchitha elixesha kunye naye 😃💚

SourceText: Playtime with Books
text: Ixesha Lokudlala Ngeencwadi

SourceText: Let’s have some playful time with books - a fun way to connect and help your child learn, grow, and feel close to you. 📚
text: Masifumane ixesha lokudlala ngencwadi - indlela yolonwabo yokuqhagamshelana kwaye uncede umntwana wakho afunde, akhule, kwaye azive esondele kuwe.📚

SourceText:
⏰ Choose a quiet time without distractions - turn off the TV and put away phones.

📖 Let your child pick a book, or choose one together.

💚 Sit close and follow your child’s lead. Point to pictures, name things, and repeat words they like.

😃 Talk about what’s in the book, link it to real life, and explore feelings and ideas together.
text:
⏰ Khetha ixesha elizolileyo ngaphandle kokuphazamiseka - cima u MABONAKUDE kwaye beka kude imfonomfono.

📖 Vumela umntwana wakho akhethe incwadi, okanye nikhethe kunye.

💚 Hlala kufuphi kwaye ulandele okukhokelwa ngumntwana wakho. Yolatha kwimifanekiso, biza izinto, kwaye phinda - phinda amagama abawathandayo.

😃 Thetha malunga nento esencwadini, Hlanganisa nokwenzeka kubomu bokwenyani, kwaye phononongani iimvakalelo kunye neengcebiso.

SourceText: 🔄 Try to make reading a regular part of your day - when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.
text: 🔄 Zama ukwenza ukufunda rhoqo ibeyinxalenye yosuku lwakho - xa umntwana wakho engadinwanga kakhulu okanye engalambanga.

SourceText: Animal Acting
text: Linganisa Izilwanyana

SourceText:
Get ready to roar like a lion or hop like a kangaroo! 🧸  

This active game helps kids develop physical skills while also supporting speech and language development in a fun way 💚
text:
Zilungiselele ukugquma okwengonyama okanye xhuma okwekhangaru! 🧸  

Lemidlalo idlamkisayo inceda abantwana ngokwasemzimbeni baphuhle kwizakhono ngelixa nakanjalo ixhasa intetho kunye nolwimi nophuhliso ngendlela eyonwabisayo 💚

SourceText:
📝 To start, write the names of animals on small pieces of paper and put them in a box or container.

👋 Take turns picking a piece of paper and acting out the animal - can you mimic its sounds and movements? Roar, jump, crawl, or fly just like the animal you picked!

🎉 For older kids, turn it into a fun guessing game - see if others can guess which animal you’re pretending to be!
text:
📝 Ukuqala, bhala igama lesilwanyana kwiphetshana kwaye ufake kwibhokisi okanye kwisikhongozeli.

👋 Nikanani ithuba ukukhetha amaphetshana kwaye nilinganisa isilwanyana - ungalinganisa ngokungxola nentshukumo? Gquma, Xhuma, Khasa, okanye Bhabha ngokwesilwanya osikhethileyo!

🎉 Kubantwana abadala, yijike ibeyimidlalo yoqikelelo eyonwabisayo - jonga ukuba abanye bayakwazi uqikelela ukuba sesiphi isilwanyana ozama ukuzenza sona!

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal

SourceText: Freeze Dance
text: Umdaniso ka Freeze

SourceText:
Get ready to dance and freeze with this exciting activity that kids love! 🎵 

This fun game is great for building listening skills and self-control as children practise stopping and starting. ✨
text:
Zilungiselele ukudanisa kwaye ufrize ngalomdlalo ovuyisayo othi uthandwe ngabantwana!🎵 

Lomdlalo wonwabisayo umhle kakhulu ukwakha izakhono zokumamela kwaye nezokuzeyisa njengoko abantwana bezama ukuyeka kunye nokuqala. ✨

SourceText:
📻 Play some music and let your child dance or move however they like. 

⏸ When you press pause and the music stops, tell them to freeze (to not move at all!) in one place. 

📻 Press play again and let your child continue dancing until the next time you pause the music and say freeze!
text:
📻 Dlala umculo kwaye vumela umntana wakho adanise okanye bashukume ngendlela abathanda ngayo. 

⏸ Xa ucofa iqosha lokumisa kwaye umculo ume, baxelele bafrize (banganyakazi kwaphela!) endaweni enye. 

📻 Cofa udlala kwakhona uvumele umntana wakho aqhubekeke edanisa kude kufikelele ixesha elilandelayo loku misa umculo kwaye uthi bafrize!

SourceText: Mystery Bag
text: Ingxowa Yemfihlo

SourceText: Let’s turn an everyday bag into a fun guessing game that builds your child's senses, language and thinking skills! 👜
text: Masijike isingxobo semihla ngemihla sibengumdlalo wokuqikelela owonwabisayo owakha iimvakalelo zomntana wakho, ulwimi kwaye nezakhono zokucinga! 👜

SourceText:
🏆 Simply place different objects into a bag and ask your child to reach in, feel an item, and guess what it is before pulling it out. 

👋 When they pull out the item, ask them questions to describe what they see: Is it smooth or scary? Bumpy or bright? 

💡It’s a fun way to introduce new words and stimulate their sense of touch!
text:
🏆Ngokulula, beka izinto ezahlukeneyo ngaphakathi kwisingxobo kwaye ucele umntwana wakho afake isandla, ayive into, kwaye aqikelele ukuba yintoni phambi kokuba ayitsale ibengaphandle. 

👋Xa etsala into ngaphandle, mbuze imibuzo echaza lento ayibonayo: Ingaba igudile okanye iyoyikeka? Ingamaqhuma okanye iqaqambile? 

💡Yindlela eyonwabisayo yokwazisa amagama amatsha kwaye neyokuvuselela iimvakalelo zabo zokubamba!

SourceText: Adapted from British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabe British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game

SourceText: Fun with Food
text: Ulonwabo ngo Kutya

SourceText: Let’s turn cooking time into learning time - with counting, comparing, and teamwork in the kitchen! 👩🏽‍🍳
text: Masijike ixesha lokupheka silenze ixesha lokufunda - ngokubala, ukuthelekisa, kunye nomsebenzi weqela ekhitshini! 👩🏽‍🍳

SourceText:
💚 Invite your child to help you cook for your family, or to help you prepare a colourful fruit salad.

🍅 As you gather the ingredients, ask them to count: 'How many tomatoes do we have?' This builds maths skills and encourages teamwork.

5️⃣ Help your child to understand adding and subtracting quantities. 'We need five tomatoes, if we have three, how many more do we need?' This makes learning fun!

👀 Let’s make it playful! Ask, 'Which is bigger: the tomato or the onion?' This reinforces comparison skills.
text:
💚 Mema umntwana wakho akuncedise uphekela usapho lwakho, okanye akuncedise ukulungiselela imibala yesalad yeziqhamo.

🍅 Njengokuba uqokelela izinongo, Cela bona babale: Zingaphi tomato esinazo? 'Lento yakha izakhono zezibalo kwaye ikhuthaza ukusebenzisana.
 
5️⃣ Nceda umntwana wakho aqonde ukongeza kunye nothabatha isixa. Sifuna itomato ezintlanu, ukuba sinezintathu, Sidinga zibengaphi ukongeza? Lento yenza kubelulonwabo ukufunda! 

👀 Masiyenze lento umdlalo! Buza, 'Yeyiphi enkulu: yitomato okanye litswele? 'Lena yakha uthelekiso lwezakhono.

SourceText: Adapted from Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/

SourceText: I Spy Colours!
text: Ndihlola Imibala!

SourceText:
Let’s play a fun guessing game to build your child’s focus and word skills - it starts with “I spy!” 👀 

This game is a fun and interactive way to help your child learn words, observe, and stay concentrated. 🏁
text:
Masidlale umdlalo owonwabisayo wokuqikelela ukwakha ingqalelo yomntana wakho kunye nesakhono samagama - iqala ngo '' Ndiyahlola''! 👀

Lomdlalo yindlela eyonwabisayo kwaye esebenzisanayo yokunceda umntana wakho afunde amagama, ajonge kwaye ahlale eqwalasele. 🏁

SourceText:
👀 Choose an object around you and say: “I spy with my little eye, something that is…” and say the colour of the object, like “yellow” or “red”. 

✅ Encourage your child to look around and guess what the object might be. When they guess correctly, give them praise and switch roles! 

🔑 If they’re having trouble guessing, offer clues like, “It’s round” or “It’s somewhere in that corner".

🔄 Keep the game going with new objects and different colours.
text:
👀 Khetha into ekufuphi nawe kwaye uthi: ''Ndiyahlola ngemehlo lam elincinci, into leyo e...'' kwaye utsho umbala walento, njengo'' tyheli okanye ubomvu''.

✅ Mkhuthaze umntana wakho uba ajonga jonge kwaye aqikelele ukuba lento ingayintoni. Ukuba uqikelele ngokuchanekileyo, mncome kwaye utshintshe indima! 

🔑 Xa uyasokola ukuqikelela, mnike umkhondo njenge ''ikwalapha kufuphi'' okanye ''ikulandawo ngakula kona''

🔄 Gcina umdlalo uqhubekeka ngezinto ezintsha kunye nemibala eyahlukeneyo.

SourceText: Adapted from Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/

SourceText: Make up a Story
text: Yenza Ibali

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to have fun with imagination - and to build your child’s creativity! 📖
text: Ukwenza amabali kunye yindlela entle kakhulu yokonwaba ngokuboniswa - kunye nokwakha ubuchule bomntwana wakho! 📖

SourceText:
5️⃣ With your child, come up with 5 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, cooking, wedding. If you need to remember them, write them clearly on a paper with your child.

🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and use one of the words from the list in the first part. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”

📝 Let your child make up the next part using another word from the list.

🔄 Take turns until you have used all the words and created a story.
text:
5️⃣ Kunye nomntwana wakho, iza namagama ayi''5'' anokusetyenziswa. Ingangawo nawaphina amagama owafunayo! Umzekelo: ibanana, isikhitshana, intlanzi, amanzi, ipeyinti, ukupheka, umtshato. Ukuba udinga ukuwakhumbula, wabhale cacileyo kwiphepha kunye nomntwana wakho. 

🎂 Qala ibali nge, ''Ngenye imini, Kwakune... kwaye sebenzisa elinye lamagama akwinxalenye yoluhlu.
Umzekelo, Ngenye imini, Kwakunosapho olwalusebenza kwifama *yebanana.* 

📝 Yeka umntwana wakho enze indawo elandelayo asebenzise elinye igama elikwinxalenye yoluhlu.

🔄 Tshintshanani nide nikwazi ukusebenzisa onke lamagama nisenza ibali.

SourceText: 🔔 Be creative and do not tell your child what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be fun!
text: 🔔 Yiba nobuchule kwaye ungamxeleli umntwana wakho ukuba makathini. Akuyomfuneko ukuba ibe libali lokwenyani ukuze kube mnandi!

SourceText: Playing with Clothes
text: Ukudlala ngeMpahla

SourceText: Let’s turn everyday clothes into fun learning moments - perfect for building thinking, talking, and little finger skills! 👕
text: Masijike iimpahla zemihla ngemihla siyenze ibeyimizuzu yokufunda eyonwabisayo - kulunge kanye ukwakha ukucinga, ukuthetha, kwaye nezakhono zeminwe emincinci! 👕

SourceText:
Clothes can be the perfect ‘toys’ to help your child build fine motor skills, recognise colours, and think! Here are 3 ideas you can try:
 
👋 Practice 
Help your child exercise their fingers by showing them how buttons and zips work on clothes, and letting them practise using them! 

🔵 Colours
Talk about the colours of clothes! Ask your child to name the colours of their clothes and talk about all the things that are that colour: “What are all the things we can think of that are blue?”

🔶 Sorting
When you have done laundry, ask your child to help you sort clothes into piles for each family member.
text:
Impahla zingaba yeyonanto 'yokudlala' ukunceda umntwana wakho ukwakha izakhono zamalungu omzimba, ukuqaphela imibala, kwaye acinge! Nazi ingcebiso eziyi3 omawuzizame:

 👋 Ziqhelise 
Nceda umntwana wakho avocavoce iminwe yabo ngokubabonisa amaqhosha kunye nokusebenza koziphu ezimpahleni, kwaye bayeke baziqhelise ukubasebenzisa! 

🔵Thetha ngemibala yempahla! Cela abantwana bakho babize imibala yempahla zabo, kwaye bathethe ngazo zonke izinto eziyilamibala:'Zintoni izinto esinocinga ngazo ezihobe?''

🔶 Ukuhlela

Xa ugqibile ukuhlamba impahla, cela umntwana wakho akuncedise ukusonga impahla zibeyimfumba ngokwelungu losapho ngalunye.

SourceText: 🧺 Simple activities like these help your child grow their confidence, coordination, and problem-solving - all while spending time with you!
text: 🧺Imidlalo elula njengale inceda umntana wakho akhule ukuzithemba kwakhe, ulungelelaniso, kunye nokusombulula ingxaki - konke oko echitha ixesha kunye nawe!

SourceText: Thinking Games
text: Imidlalo Ecingisisayo

SourceText:
Let’s play some games to help your child think and follow instructions!

These games are a playful way to build your child’s focus and confidence - and enjoy learning together! 👏
text:
Masidlale imidlalo ethile ukunceda umntana wakho acinge kwaye alandele imiyalelo!

Lemidlalo yindlela yokwakha ingqwalasela yomntwana wakho kunye nokuzithemba - kwaye nonwabele ukufunda kunye!👏

SourceText:
❗ **Game 1: Mama/Daddy Says**
Give your child simple instructions that begin with “Mama says…” or “Daddy says…”
For example:
• “Mama says… touch your head”
• “Daddy says… jump twice”

Once your child understands, you can make it more fun by adding extra steps:
• “Mama says… jump, then clap and sit!”

🔵🔴 **Game 2: Blue-Red**
Say a colour, and your child must quickly find and touch something that matches.
To make it harder, try opposites:
• “If I say blue, touch something red.”
• “If I say red, touch something blue.”
text:
❗ **Umdlalo 1: Mama/Tata Uthi**
Nika umntwana wakho umyalelo olula oqala ngo''Mama uthi...'' okanye u''Tata uthi...''
Umzekelo:
• u''Mama uthi... bamba intloko yakho'' 
• u''Tata uthi... Xhuma kabini''
 
 Akuqonda umntwana wakho, ungayenza ibeyinto eyonwabisayo ngokufakela amanye amabakala ongezelelweyo:
• uMama uthi... xhuma, emva koko uqhwabe kwaye uhlale!''

🔵🔴 **Umdlalo 2: Luhlaza-Bomvu**
Itsho umbala, kwaye umntwana wakho kumele ngokukhawuleza ayifumane ayibambe kwaye abambe into efanayo.
Ukuyenza nzima, zama echaseneyo:
• “Ukuba ndithi luhlaza, bamba into ebomvu.”
• “Ukuba ndithi bomvu, Bamba into eluhlaza.”

SourceText:
Talk to your child about something that they are interested in! 😃
 
Talking about their interests builds trust, confidence, and communication skills - and shows your child that what they care about matters to you 💛
text:
Thetha nomntwana wakho ngento abanomdla kuyo! 😃

Ukuthetha ngomdla wabo kwakha ukuthembeka, ukuzithemba, kwaye izakhono zonxibelelwano - kwaye ibonisa umntwana wakho ukuba into abayikhathaleleyo ibalulkekile kuwe 💛

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your child is to ask them about something they are interested in, for example you could talk about topics such as: sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽ Indlela elula ukuqalisa ukuthetha nomntwana wakho kukubuza malunga nento abanomdla kuyo. Umzekelo, ungathetha malunga nezihloko ezinjenge: imidlalo, iincwadi, imiboniso bhanyabhanya, abahlobo, umculo, oosaziwayo, okanye isikolo.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your child shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 Ungangafumani yonke into abelana ngayo umntwana wakho inikisa umdla, kodwa kubalulekile ukubonisa umdla kwaye nentumakelelo yokufunda.

SourceText: Skipping Rope Song
text: Ingoma Yotsiba Intambo

SourceText:
Let’s get moving with a skipping game. 🎈
 
This energetic game builds coordination, confidence, and teamwork. 🌈
text:
Masishukume ngomdlalo wokutsiba.🎈
 
Lomdlalo udlamkileyo wakha ulungelelaniso, ukuzithemba, kunye nomsebenzi weqela. 🌈

SourceText:
🎈 Find a long rope or make one from tied-up tights or string. 

2️⃣ Two people turn the rope while one jumps in the middle. 

🎵 Sing a song together as they jump – do you remember one from your childhood or can you use a different song you all know? 

🏆 You can add fun moves like hopping, clapping, or even dancing while skipping. 

💛 Then switch places so everyone gets a turn.
text:
🎈Fumana intambo ende okanye yenza enye ngomtya obotshwayo iqine okanye umtya.

2️⃣Abantu ababini bajikelezisa intambo ngelixa omnye exhuma phakathi

🎵 Sicula ingoma sonke njengokuba bexhuma – ikhona oyikhumbulayo ngokuya wawusengumntwana okanye ungasebenzisa ingoma eyahlukileyo eniyazi nonke?

🏆 Ungongeza intshukumo ezonwabisayo ezifana nokutsiba, ukuqhwaba, okanye ungadanisa ngelixa utsiba- tsibayo.

💛 Emva koko tshintsha indawo ukwenzela wonke umntu afumane ithuba.

SourceText: Hot or Cold
text: Shushu okanye Banda

SourceText:
Ready to hunt for hidden treasure using clues? 🎁 

This fun-filled game is perfect for challenging problem-solving and communication skills while keeping everyone engaged with exciting clues! ✨
text:
Ukulungele ukukhangela ubutyebi obufihliweyo usebenzisa umkhondo? 🎁

Lomdlalo ululonwabo olugqibeleleyo kwimiceli mngeni nokusombulula ingxaki kwaye nakwisakhono sonxibelelwano ngelixa ugcine wonke umntu ebandakanyeka ngemikhondo evuyisayo! ✨

SourceText: ⚽ Here’s what you’ll need: something easy to hide, like toys or balls.
text: ⚽ Nantsi into ozakuyidinga: into elula ukuyifihla, njenge toyizi okanye ibhola.

SourceText:
👀 One player hides an object, while the others close their eyes. The player who hid the object will now give clues to help the others find it. 

☀️ When the person searching is getting close to where the object is hidden, the hider can say “getting warm!” or “hot!”, and when the searcher is going in the wrong direction, the hider can say “getting colder…”.

🔄 Take turns hiding objects and giving clues - it’s fun for everyone to get involved!
text:
👀Umdlali oyedwa ufihle isixhobo, ngelixa abanye bevale amehlo. Umdlali ofihle isixhobo ngoku uzakunika intluva ukunceda abanye bayifumane.

☀️ Xa umntu ekhangela esondela kufuphi nesixhobo esifihliweyo, umfihli angathi'' uyafudumala!'' okanye ''ubashushu!'', kwaye umkhangeli xa esiya kwicala elingelilo, Umfihli angathi ''uyabanda....''

🔄 Tshintshanani ukufihla isixhobo kwaye nikanani intluva - ilulonwabo kumntu wonke oyinxalenye!

SourceText: 💡 For an extra challenge, hide multiple objects around the house and create a treasure map.
text: 💡 Ngokomceli mngeni owongezelelweyo, fihla izinto eziliqela endlini ngaphakathi kwaye wenze imephu yobuncwane.

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt

SourceText: Round & Round
text: Jikeleza

SourceText:
Let’s make a circle, sing, and get moving with some fun and silly moves! 🎶 

This activity builds connection, encourages coordination and balance, and sparks lots of laughter and creativity 😃
text:
Masenze isangqa, sicule, kwaye sishukume sonwabile ngeentshukumo ezonwabisayo kwaye nezisileyo!🎶 

Lomsebenzi wakha unxibelelwano, ukhuthaze ulungelelaniso kunye nebhalansi, kwaye ukuhleka okuninzi kunye nobuchule😃

SourceText:
👋 Grab each other’s hands and form a circle. 

🎵 Walk round and round while you sing a song you know - it could be one from your childhood like “Ring-a-Rosy” or “Sawa Sonke”, or a favourite your child loves. 

🎉 As you go round, add some silly moves to make it even more fun. Try hopping on one leg, see if you can put your leg over the next person’s arm, or gently fall to the ground when the song finishes. 

🔄 Take turns choosing the next move or song!
text:
👋 Bambanani ngezandla kwaye nenze isangqa.

🎵 Hamba hambani nijikeleza ngelixa nicula ingoma eniyaziyo - ingaba yenye yasebuntwaneni bakho njengo ''Ring-a-Rosy'' okanye ''Sawa Sonke'', okanye intandokazi ethandwa ngumntana wakho.

🔄 Njengoko ujikeleza, fakela iintshukumo ezisileyo ukuyenza yonwabise nangakumbi. Zama ukutsibatsiba ngomlenze omnye, bona ukuba ungabeka umlenze wakho phezu kwengalo yomntu olandelayo, okanye uwele phantsi ngobunono xa ingoma iphela.

🔄 Tshintsha tshintshani ekukhetheni intshukumo okanye ingoma elandelayo!

SourceText: Blanket Forts
text: Iinqaba Zengubo

SourceText:
Let’s dive into creating your very own cosy hideaway! 🧸  
 
Building a blanket fort is more than just a fun activity - it’s a chance to spark creativity, solve problems, and share special moments together. So, grab those blankets and start building your adventure today! 💡
text:
Makhe singene ekwakheni indawo yokuzifihla eshushu yethu!🧸  
 
Ukwakha inqaba ngengubo ayiwuwo nje umdlalo wolonwabo - ikwalithuba lokuchonga ubuchule, ukusombulula iingxaki, kwaye ikwakukwabelana ngenizuzu elibalulekileyo kunye Ngoko, tsala ezongubo kwaye uqalise ukwakha adventsha yakho namhlanje!💡

SourceText: 👋 You’ll need blankets, pillows, chairs, and maybe even a table. If you want to add a little magic, grab a light to light up your fort.
text: 👋Uzakudinga iingubo, imiqamelo, izitulo kwaye mhlawumbi nkqu netafile. Xa ufuna ukongeza umlingo omcinci, bamba ukukhanya ukuya ekukhanyisa kwinqaba yakho.

SourceText:
🔷 Start by setting up two chairs facing each other, or use a table as the main structure of your fort. 

👋 Drape the blankets over the chairs or table to create a roof. Don’t forget to secure them - use clothing pegs or something heavy to hold everything in place so your fort stays strong!

🔴 Next, make the inside extra comfy with pillows or blankets. 

🎈 Once your fort is built, add some fun decorations. Ask your child to bring their favourite toys or books, and decorate the space however you like. 

🌙 Now, crawl inside and enjoy your new fort! This is your cosy, creative space for reading stories, playing games, or just spending some quiet time together.
text:
🔷 Qala ngokumisela izitulo ezimbini nijongene, okanye usebenzise itafile njenge sakhiwo esingundoqo ye nqaba yakho. 

👋 Nxibisa iingubo phezu kwezitulo okanye itafile ukwenza uphahla. Ungalibali ukuzikhusela - sebenzisa iphegs zempahla okanye into enzima ukubamba yonke into endaweni ukwenzela inqaba yakho ihlale yomelele

🔴 Okulandelayo, yenza umphakathi ubetofotofo ngokwaneleyo ngemiqamelo okanye iingubo. 

🎈 Ekubeni lenqaba yakho yakhiwe, yongeza imihombiso eyonwabisayo. Cela umntana wakho azise izinto zakhe zokudlala azithandayo okanye iincwadi kwaye ahombise indawo nangaluphi uhlobo athanda ngalo. 

🌙 Ngoku, khasa ngaphakathi kwaye uyonwabele inqaba yakho entsha! Le yindawo yenu eshushu, yobuchule ukufunda amabali, yokudlala imidlalo, okanye ukuchitha ixesha elizolileyo kunye.

SourceText: Can You Catch It?
text: Ungakwazi ukuyiBamba?

SourceText:
Let’s see if you can follow instructions while catching a ball! ⚽ 

This activity is a great way to improve coordination, concentration, and quick thinking - all while having fun! 💡
text:
Masibone uba uyakwazi ukulandela imiyalelo ngelixa ubamba ibhola!⚽ 

Lomdlalo yindlela enkulu yokuphucula ulungelelaniso, ugxininiso, kunye nokucinga okukhawulezileyo - konke oku ngelixa nonwabile! 💡

SourceText:
✅ Start by standing about three metres apart and gently throw a ball at each other. After a few easy throws, it’s time to introduce the rules!

1️⃣ When the thrower shouts ‘one’, the catcher has to catch the ball with their right hand and put their left foot out. 

2️⃣ If the thrower shouts ‘two’, the catcher catches with their left hand and puts their right foot out.

⭐ Once you’re confident, add some extra numbers and rules! 

⏰ For the game to work, make sure the number is called before you throw the ball, so the catcher has time to react!
text:
✅ Qala ngokuma malunga nemithazi ezintathu kwaye ngokucothayo phosa ibhola komnye nomnye. Emva kokuphosa kambalwa lula, lixesha lokwazisa imithetho!

 1️⃣ Xa umphosi ekhwaza ''kanye'', Umbambi kumele abambe ibhola ngesandla sakhe sasekunene kwaye babeke inyawo lakhe lasekhohlo ngaphandle.

2️⃣ Ukuba umphosi ukhwaze ''kabini',' umbambi ubamba ngesandla sasekhohlo kwaye babeke unyawo lwasekunene ngaphandle.

⭐Wakube uzithemba, fakela amanani ongezelelweyo kunye nemithetho!!

Ngokuba lomdlalo usebenze, qinisekisa inani libizwa ngaphambi kokuba kujwilwe ibhola, ukwenzela umbambi abanexesha lokuphendula!

SourceText: 🚩 You can adjust the rules to make it perfect for every age.
text: 🚩 Ungakwazi ukuhlenga hlengisa imithetho uyenze ilungele yonke iminyaka.

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it

SourceText: Unseen Guesses
text: Uqikelelo Olungabonakaliyo

SourceText:
You can do this activity when you are together with at least three people in total. 3️⃣  

This game is not only fun but also helps children develop strong communication skills and teaches them how to work together to achieve a goal. 💚
text:
Ningawenza lomdlalo xa ninobabini kunye nje nabantu abathathu bebonke. 3️⃣ 

Lomdlalo awonwabisi nje kuphela kodwa uyabanceda abantwana baphuhlise izakhono zonxibelelwano ezomeleleyo kwaye ibafundise uba basebenza njani kunye ukufezekisa iinjongo.💚

SourceText:
👀 Ask your child and another child/adult to sit next to each other. Blindfold both using a scarf or hat. 

🚗 Give your child an object and ask them to feel it and describe it, without saying the name of the object!

🎁 The other person’s job is to figure out what the object is based on the description. 

✅ The “guesser” can ask questions, but the “speaker” can only answer with "yes" or "no".

🔄 After each round, swap roles and play again, giving everyone a chance to be the “speaker” and “guesser” and the one to provides the object.
text:
👀Buza umntwana wakho kunye nomnye umntwana/ umntu omdala bahlale caleni komnye. Bagquma amehlo bonke ngesikhafu okanye umnqwazi.

🚗 Nika umntwana wakho isixhobo bacele basive basichaze, ngaphandle kokutsho igama lwesixhobo!

🎁 Umsebenzi womnye umntu kukufumanisa yintoni esisixhobo ngokwengcaciso.

✅ ''Umthekeleli'' angabuza imibuzo, kodwa ''isithethi''singaphendula ngo ''ewe'' qha okanye ''Hayi''.

🔄Emva komjikelo ngamnye, tshintshanani indima kwaye nidlale kwakhona, nika wonke umntu abe ''sisithethi'' kunye ''nomthekeleli''.

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses

SourceText: A Friendly Chat
text: Incoko Yobuhlobo

SourceText:
Want to connect with your teen? Start by talking about what they care about! 😃

These small chats can lead to stronger connections and bigger conversations down the road.👂❤️
text:
Ufuna ukunxibelelana kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo? Qala ngokuthetha malunga nento abayikhathaleleyo!😃

Ezincokwana zincinci zingakhokelela kunxibelelwano olomeleleyo kunye neengxoxo ezinkulu ekuhambeni kwendlela.👂❤️

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your teen is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽Indlela elula yokuqala ukuthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kukubuza malunga nento abanomdla kuyo. Umzekelo, ungathetha malunga nomdlalo, iincwadi, imiboniso bhanyabhanya, abahlobo, umculo, oosaziwayo, okanye isikolo.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your teen shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂Ungangafumani yonke into abelana ngayo umntwana wakho ofikisayo inomdla, kodwa kubalulekile ukubonisa umdla kwaye nogqozi lokufunda.

SourceText: Reflect on the Positive
text: Cinga Ngezinto Ezilungileyo

SourceText:
Looking for a simple way to boost your mood and connect as a family? Try this quick daily check-in! 🌈

Sharing positive moments - big or small - helps everyone feel more grateful and supported.
text:
Ukhangela indlela elula yokunyusa umdla wakho kwaye unxulumane njengo sapho? Zama okuku tshekitshwa kukhawulezileyo kwemihla ngemihla!🌈

Ukwabelana ngemizuzu elungileyo - emikhulu okanye emincinci - inceda wonke umntu azive enombulelo kwaye exhasekile nangakumbi.

SourceText:
💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today. 

☀️ Take turns sharing one positive or fun thing that happened. This could be something small, like feeling good because you cleaned the house, or something big, like spending time with family and friends. 

⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.
text:
💡Sikunye, thatha imizuzu ucinge ngazozonke izinto ozenzileyo namhlanje.

☀️ Tshitshanani nabelane ngezinto ezilungileyo ezilulonwabo ezenzekileyo. Ingayinto encinci, efana nokuziva wonwabile njengokucoca indlu, okanye into enkulu, enjengokuchitha ixesha nosapho lwakho kunye nabahlobo.

⏰ Zama ukwenza lonto rhoqo ngemini - nangakumbi ngentsuku oziva ngathi akhonto uyenzayo ebalulekileyo.

SourceText: Dance Moves
text: Iintshukumo Zomdaniso

SourceText: Let's get moving! 👋 Dancing is a great way to exercise, have fun, and bond with your teen at the same time!  🎵
text: Masishukume! 👋Ukudanisa yindlela enkulu yokuzivocavoca, yokonwaba, kwaye unxulumane nomntana wakho ofikisayo  ngaxesha linye!🎵

SourceText:
This game can be played in pairs or a group with everyone taking turns being the leader:

📱 Let your teen choose a song they like and create a set of dance moves.
👀 First person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.
☀️ Don’t worry about perfecting the dance moves, it’s all about having fun together!
💡 If you want to, you can perform your dance for the household!
text:
Lomdlalo ungakwazi ukudlalwa ngababini okanye ngamaqela umntu wonke etshintsha tshintshana ngokuba yinkokheli:

📱 Vumela umntana wakho ofikisayo akhethe ingoma ayithandayo kwaye enze iseti yeentshukumo zomdaniso.
👀 Umntu wokuqala wenza intshukumo zomdaniso kwaye wonke omnye umntu abonele kuye.
☀️ Ungabinaxhala malunga ngokugqibelela kwiintshukumo zomdaniso, konke kumalunga nokonwaba kunye!
💡 Ukuba uyafuna, ungenza umdaniso wakho ekhayeni!

SourceText: Check-in Chat
text: Ngena Kwincoko

SourceText: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐
text: Ukumana njalo nijongana omnye nomnye kunganceda ukugcina ubudlelwane busempilweni!⭐

SourceText:
Ask each other questions: 
👂🏾 “What made you happy today?” 
💛 “What was difficult today?”  
🫶🏾 “How can I help you?”
text:
Buzanani imibuzo: 
👂🏾"Yintoni ekwenze wonwaba namhlanje?"
👂"Yintoni ibinzima namhlanje?" 
🫶🏾 “Ndingakunceda ngantoni?''?

SourceText:
Go easy on yourself if your teen does not want to share their problems with you. 💙 

Often, teens are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷
text:
Zicingele nawe ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akafuni ukwabelana ngeengxaki zakhe kunye nawe. 💙 

Rhoqo, abantwana abafikisayo bayoyika ukwabelana njengokuba besoyikela ukuba bazakungena engxakini. Ukucaphuka akuzokunceda - hlala ubabonisa uthando kwaye ubanika nexesha!🌷

SourceText: Express Yourself
text: Zivakalise Nawe

SourceText:
This playful dance game is a great way to get moving and boost everyone’s mood! 💃🕺

It encourages creativity, memory, and teamwork - all while having fun as a family. 🎶
text:
Lo mdaniso wokudlala yindlela elungileyo kakhulu ukushukumisa kwaye ukunyusa umdla womntu wonke!💃🕺

Ikhuthaza ubuchule, inkumbulo, kunye nomsebenzi weqela - konke oku ngelixa nizonwabisa njengo sapho.🎶

SourceText:
🌈 This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
🎵 Together, choose a fun and upbeat song to play and a person to start the game by creating one dance move.
👀 The person to their right must copy that dance move and add their own move to it.
✨ Go around the circle, each person adding their own dance move to the full song.
🔄 The first one who forgets someone's dance moves or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song and starts the game again.
🎉 Try new dance moves with this game and have fun!
text:
🌈Lomdlalo ungadlalwa ningababini okanye amaqela - phakamani nijongane okanye nibesisangqa.
🎵 Sisonke, khetha ulonwabo kwaye uvulele umculo phezulu kwaye umntu uqala umdlalo ngokwenza intshukumo yomdaniso enye.
👀 Umntu osekunene makalinganise lantshukumo kwaye afakele nezakhe intshukumo.
✨ Jikeleza kwisangqa, Umntu ngamnye afakele ezakhe intshukumo kwingoma iphelele. 
🔄 Osekuqaleni olibele intshukumo zomnye umntu okanye azenze kakubi ukhetha ingoma elandelayo kwaye uqale umdlalo kwakhona.
🎉Zama intshukumo ezintsha ngalemidlalo kwaye wonwabe!

SourceText: Weekly Goal Setting
text: Ukumisela Injongo Yeveki

SourceText:
Setting goals together is a great way to build confidence and stay motivated! ⭐

Weekly goals are small steps that help you and your teen grow - one week at a time. 🎉
text:
Ukubeka iinjongo kunye yeyona ndlela enkulu yokwakha ukuzithemba kwaye uhlale ukhuthazekile! ⭐

Iinjongo ngeveki ngamanyathelo amancinci akuncedayo wena kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisa nikhule - iveki enye ngexesha. 🎉

SourceText:
1. ⭐ At the start of the week, help your teen set one specific and achievable goal.
2. 🤝 Share your own goal too - support each other throughout the week.
3. 🎉 Praise your teen’s effort and celebrate their progress.
4. 💬 If they don’t reach their goal, talk about what happened and how to try again next time.
text:
1. ⭐ Ekuqaleni kweveki, nceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo abeke injongo enye ecacileyo kwaye nefikelelayo.
2. 🤝 Nawe yabelana ngenjongo yakho - xhasa omnye nomnye apha evekini.
3. 🎉 Ncoma umzamo womntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye ubhiyozele inkqubela yakhe.
4. 💬 Ukuba akafikeleli kwinjongo yakhe, thethani malunga nokuba kwenzeke ntoni kwaye ningazama njani kwakhona kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText: 🔁 Make this a weekly habit to build confidence and success step by step!
text: 🔁 Yenze ibeyinto yeveki ukwakha ukuzithemba kunye nempumelelo inyathelo nenyathelo!

SourceText: Role play
text: Umdlalo Wolingisa

SourceText:
Let’s start acting! ⭐

Role-playing is when you pretend to be someone in a certain situation, and act out how you think things will go. 

This is a fun way to help your teen understand how others might act or feel, and for you to learn more about how your teen thinks and feels. ✨
text:
Masiqale ngokulinganisa!⭐

Ukudlala ukulinganisa kuxa uzenza umntu ongenguye ngendlela ethile yalomeko, kwaye ubonise ngokuphandle ucinga zizakuhamba njani izinto.

Yindlela elulonwabo yokunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo aqonde ngabanye abantu benza njani okanye baziva njani, kwaye nawe ukufunda ngakumbi ukuba ngomntwana wakho ofikisayo ucinga kwaye uziva njani. ✨

SourceText:
1. 😊 Ask your teen if they’d like to try a fun “role-playing” game with you.
2. 🎭 Let them choose a situation to act out - it could be something from school or even social media. For example, playing a teacher and student, or a teen being offered a drink at a party.
3. 🎬 Let your teen decide who plays each role, and act it out together!
4. 💬 After the role-play, talk about what you both learned. Ask questions like, “How did that feel?” or “What did you notice about the situation?” This helps your teen understand different perspectives and emotions.
text:
1. 😊 Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba angathanda na ukuzama umdlalo owonwabisayo '' umdlalo wokulinganisa'' kunye nawe.
2. 🎭 Umvumele akhethe into anokuyidlala - isenokuba yinto yasesikolweni okanye izikhundla zokuxhumana. Umzekelo, ukudlala utishala kunye nomfundi, okanye umntwana ofikisayo enikwa isiselo epatini.
3. 🎬 Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo agqibe ngokwakhe ukuba ngubani ozakudlala indawo nganye, kwaye niyenze kunye!
4. 💬 Emveni kokulinganisa, thethani malunga ngezinto eniye nazifunda nobabini. Buza imibuzo efana, ''uzive njani?'' okanye ''Uqaphele ntoni ngalemeko?'' Lento inceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo aqonde imbono kunye neemvakalelo ezahlukeneyo.

SourceText: Make Housework Fun
text: Yenza Umsebenzi Wekhaya Wonwabise

SourceText:
Turn your chores into games! 🏆 

Making housework fun is a good way to teach your teen to be responsible and to rely on themselves. ☀️
text:
Tshintsha imisebenzi yakho yasekhaya ibe yimidlalo! 🏆 

Ukwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya yonwabise yeyona ndlela ilungileyo yokufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo abenoxanduva kwaye axhomekeke kuye. ☀️

SourceText:
📝 Together, make a list of all the chores that must be done in your home. 

💡 Make sure the tasks are fair and things your teen can do. For example, washing up, sweeping, mopping, making the beds, and laundry.

🔄 Each week, let a different person in the family choose a chore first.

🎵 Play some music or turn on the radio. Music is a great way to make a boring task fun!

✅ Tick off the tasks when they are done so you can see your progress as a family. 
📺 You could offer small rewards as motivation to complete activities. For example, you could let your teen watch more TV or have something sweet if they do their chores in a fair amount of time.
text:
📝 Kunye, yenzani uludwe lemisebenzi yasekhaya ekufuneka yenziwe ekhayeni lakho. 

💡 Qiniseka ukuba imisebenzi ifanelekile kwaye zizinto umntwana wakho ofikisayo anokuzenza. Umzekelo, ukuvasa, ukutshayela, ukukorobha, ukondlula ibhedi, kunye nokuhlamba impahla.

🔄 Kwiveki nganye, vumela umntu ongomnye ekhayeni akhethe umsebenzi wasekhayeni kuqala.

🎵 Dlala umculo okanye uvule unomamthotholo. Umculo yindlela entle yokwenza umsebenzi ongathandeki ubemnandi.

✅ Phawula imisebenzi esele niyigqibile ukuze nibone indlela esenisebenze ngayo njengosapho. 
📺 Unganikeza ngemivizo emincinci njengento ekhuthazayo ukugqiba umsebenzi. Umzekelo, ungamvumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo abukele iTV nangakumbi okanye afumane ilekese ukuba uwenzile umsebenzi wakhe wasekhaya ngexesha elifanelekileyo.

SourceText: ❓ If your child does not complete a chore, ask them why, and come up with a fair consequence together.
text: ❓Ukuba umntwana wakho akawugqibi umsebenzi wasekhaya, babuze ukuba kutheni, kwaye nize nesiphumo esifanelekileyo kunye.

SourceText: Walking Together
text: Ukuhamba Kunye

SourceText: Walking together is a fun, healthy way to connect and help your teen learn more about their community. 🚶‍♂️🌿
text: Ukuhamba kunye yindela elulonwabo, indlela eyimpilo yokuqhagamshelana kwaye uncede umntwana wakho ofikisayo afunde ngakumbi malunga nendawo ahlala kuyo.🚶‍♂️🌿

SourceText:
🗓️ Plan together: Choose a time and place to walk - a park, market, or anywhere nearby. If you’re going out, invite your teen to join!

👀 Explore: Encourage your teen to ask questions about what they see - people, nature, or buildings.

💬 Share: Tell them fun facts or memories about the area, like who lives nearby or how things looked before.
text:
🗓️ Cwangcisani kunye: Khethani ixesha kunye nendawo yokuhamba - ipaki, imarike okanye nakweyiphi indawo ekufutshane. Ukuba uyaphuma, mema umntwana wakho ofikisayo azibandakanye kunye nawe!

👀 Phonononga: Khuthaza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba abuze imibuzo ngezinto azibonayo - abantu, indalo, okanye izakhiwo.

💬 Yabelana: Baxelele ngezinto eziyinyani ezonwabisayo okanye iinkumbulo malunga nendawo leyo, njengokokuba ngubani ohlala kufutshane okanye indlela izinto ebezibukeka ngayo ngaphambili.

SourceText: Gardening
text: Ukwenza Igadi

SourceText: Gardening is a fun way to bond with your teen while teaching them how to grow food and care for nature. 🌿
text: Ukwenza igadi yindlela elulonwabo yokusondelelana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngelixa ubafundisa ukuba kukhuliswa njani ukutya kunye nokukhathalela indalo. 🌿

SourceText:
🌿 Choose plants: Let your teen pick veggies or herbs to grow - they’ll love being involved and can help cook them later!

🪴 Get creative: No garden? No problem! Use old buckets, cans, or bottles as plant pots.

🎉 Plant together: Turn planting into a fun “planting party” - take turns putting seeds in the soil.

💧 Care routine: Make a watering schedule and let your teen take charge of their plants.

📏 Track growth: Each week, have your teen note the changes and see how much the plants have grown!
text:
🌿 Khetha izityalo: Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba akhethe imifuno okanye imifuno anokuyikhulisa - Uzakuyithanda into yokuba abandakanywe kwaye angancedisa ukuzipheka emva koko!

🪴 Yiba nobuchule: Akukho gadi? Akukho ngxaki! Sebenzisa amabhakethi amadala, iitoti, okanye iibhotile, njengezitya zokutyala. 

🎉 Tyalani kunye: Guqula ukutyala ibeyinto eyonwabisayo ''ipati yokutyala'' - tshintsha tshintshani ukufaka iimbewu emhlabeni.

💧 Inkqubo yokukhathalela: Yenza amaxesha okunkcenkceshela kwaye umvumele umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba athathe inxaxheba ngezityalo zakhe.

📏 Ukulandelela ukhukhula: Kwiveki nganye, yenza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba aqaphele umahluko kwaye ajonge ukuba isityalo ngasinye sikhule kangakanani!

SourceText: Charades
text: Iikharedi

SourceText: Charades is an easy, fun game that will teach your teen to think quickly, work together and be bold. 🎭
text: Iikharedi ngumdlalo olula, umdlalo olulonwabo ongafundisa umntwana ofikisayo acinge ngokukhawuleza, sebenzani kunye kwaye ubenesibindi. 🎭

SourceText:
1. 🤫 One person quietly thinks of a word but doesn’t say it out loud to anyone.

2. 🎭 That person then acts out the word using only actions - no speaking, sounds, or pointing to objects.

3. 🧹 Others try to guess what the word is! You can choose fun everyday actions like sweeping, eating, playing football, or brushing teeth.

4. ✅ When someone guesses correctly, it becomes their turn to think of a new word and act it out. Keep taking turns and enjoy the game!
text:
1. 🤫 Umntu abemnye acinge igama ngokuthuleyo kodwa angalikhwazi emntwini.

2. 🎭 Lomntu lowo azame ukwenza elogama esebenzisa kuphela izenzo - angathethi, angangxoli, okanye angakhombi izinto.

3. 🧹 Abanye bazame ukuchaza ukuma lithini igama! Ungazama ukukhetha ulonwabo lwantsuku zonke okufana nokutshayela, ukutya, ukudlala ibhola, okanye ukuvasa amazinyo.

4. ✅ Ukuba umntu uye waluchana uqikelelo lwakhe, ibalithuba lakhe ukuba acinge igama elitsha kwaye alidlale. Qhubekekani ninikana amathuba kwaye niwonwabele umdlalo!

SourceText:
* Make sure everyone gets a turn to act out words or phrases.  
* Remember to praise your teen for trying. 
* If your teen is struggling to guess, give them hints on what it could be.
* If the game is too easy, try more difficult words. 
* Remember to have fun and support each other!
text:
* Qinisekisa wonke umntu uyatshintshana ekwenzeni amagama okanye uwabiza.
* Khumbula ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngokuzama.
*Ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo uyazama ukuqikelela, banike intluva kulento ingayiyo.
*Ukuba umdlalo ulula kakhulu, zama ngakumbi amagama anzima.
* Khumbula ukonwabisa kwaye nixhasane!

SourceText: Cooking
text: Ukupheka

SourceText: Cooking with your teen is a fun way to spend time together while teaching helpful life skills. 🍳👨‍🍳
text: Ukupheka kunye nomtwana wakho ofikisayo yindlela elulonwabo yokuchitha ixesha nikunye ngelixa umfundisa ngezakhono zobomi eziluncedo.🍳👨‍🍳

SourceText:
🗓️ Pick a time and day to cook together - planning ahead makes it easier.
🥬 Show your teen the recipe and ingredients, and let them help with measuring.
🍲 Give them a task like fetching water, chopping, or stirring.
🍽️ Eat together with the family and let your teen feel proud for helping make the meal!
text:
🗓️ Khethani ixesha kunye nosuku lokupheka kunye - ukuzilungiselela ngethuba kwenza kubelula. 
🥬 Bonisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo izithako kunye nezinto zokupheka, kwaye mvumele ancedise ngokwenza imilinganiselo. 
🍲 Mnike umsebenzi ofana nokukha amanzi, ukunqunqa, okanye ukuzamisa. 
🍽️ Ukutya nikunye nosapho kwaye uvumele umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ezingca ngokuba ancedise ekwenzeni isidlo!

SourceText:
- Let your teen help choose the recipe or ingredients.
- Involve them in different things, like washing, measuring, cutting, and mixing.
- Praise their effort, even if the food isn’t perfect.
text:
- Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ancedise ekukhetheni izithako okanye izinto zokupheka.
- Mbandakanye kwizinto ezahlukileyo, ezifana nokuhlamba, umlinganiselo, ukunqunqa, kunye nokuxuba.
- Mncome ngomdla wakhe, nokuba ukutya akugqibelelanga.

SourceText: Storytelling
text: Ukubalisa Ibali

SourceText: Storytelling is a wonderful way to help your teen feel more connected with you, as well as with their family, history and culture. 💬✨
text: Ukubalisa ibali yindlela emangalisayo yokunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive esondelelene ngakumbi nawe, kwakunye nakusapho lwabo, imbali kunye nenkcubekho.💬✨

SourceText:
📅 Choose a time and place where you and your teen can talk comfortably - like after dinner, before bed, or during a walk.

🗣️ Begin by sharing a story of your own. It might be something from today, a childhood memory, or a special moment.

❓ When you’re done, invite your teen to ask questions or share a story of their own.

👂 Listen with interest, ask questions, and show you care about what they say.

💡 If they’re unsure, ask something like “What’s your favourite childhood memory?” or “What’s a family tradition you enjoy?” They can even make up a story just for fun!
text:
📅 Khetha ixesha kunye nendawo apho wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ningathetha ngokukhululekileyo - emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa, phambi kokuba niyolala, okanye xa nithatha uhambo ngexesha lasemini.

🗣️Qalisa ngokwabelana ngebali lakho. Ingaba yinto yanamhlanje, iinkumbulo zasebuntwaneni, okanye umzuzu obalulekileyo. 

❓ Xa ugqibile, mema umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba abuze imibuzo okanye abelane ngebali lakhe.

👂 Mamela ngomdla, buza imibuzo, kwaye bonisa ukuba uyakhathala malunga ngento ayithethayo.

💡 Ukuba awuqinisekanga, ubuza into efana '' Ngeyiphi inkumbulo yobuntwana oyithandayo?'' okanye '' Leliphi isiko losapho olonwabelayo?'' Angenza nebali ngokuno kwakhe ukwenzela ukuba nonwabe!

SourceText: - Create a safe space for your teen to share their stories. They will share more with you if they feel like you won’t be upset with them.
text: - Yakha indawo ekhuselekileyo yomntwana wakho ofikisayo yokwabelana ngamabali. Uzakwabelana ngakumbi nawe xa eziva ukuba awuzokubanomsindo kuye.

SourceText: Music and Dance
text: Umculo Nomdaniso

SourceText: Dancing is a fun way to get exercise, and a great way to learn about your teen’s interests. 🎶
text: Ukudanisa yindlela yolonwabo yokuzivocavoca, kwaye yindlela elungileyo yokufunda ngomdla womntana wakho.🎶

SourceText:
🎶 Ask your teen what music they like - show real interest by asking where they heard it and what they enjoy about it.

💃 Teach each other your favourite dance moves or learn new ones together.

🎉 Once you’ve got some moves down, practise them together and just have fun!
text:
🎶 Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ngowuphi umculo awuthandayo - bonisa umdla wokwenene ngokubuza ukuba wayeyiva phi kwaye yintoni ayonwabelayo malunga ngayo.

💃 Fundisanani iintshukumo zemidaniso oyithandayo okanye nifunde emitsha kunye.

🎉 Emveni kokuba ufumene imidaniso, yizameni kunye kwaye niyonwabele!

SourceText:
- Let your teen show you their music and dance moves.
- Don't take it too seriously, be silly and have fun together.
text:
- Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akubonise umculo kunye nemidaniso.
- Ungayithathi ngamandla, dlala kwaye wonwabe kunye naye.

SourceText: Dream Travel
text: UHambo Oluliphupha

SourceText: Exploring the world through imagination is a fun way to bond and spark your teen’s curiosity - no suitcase needed! ✈️
text: Ukujonga ilizwe ngokuboniswa yindlela eyonwabisayo kubudlelwane kunye nokuvusa umdla womntwana wakho ofikisayo - akudingeki nto yakuphatha impahla! ✈️

SourceText:
🌍 Ask your teen these questions: *Where would you want to travel to? How long would you be away? What would you pack? What would you do on your trip? What would you see?*

🗺️ Look at a map or draw one together.

📚 Pick a country your teen hasn’t heard of and explore fun facts about it together!
text:
🌍 Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo imibuzo: *Ungathanda ukuya phi? Uzakuthatha ixesha elingakanani ukude? Ungapakisha ntoni? Ungenza ntoni kuhambo lwakho? Yintoni ozakuyibona?*

🗺️ Jonga imephu okanye nizobe eyenu kunye. 

📚 Khetha ilizwe umntwana wakho ofikisayo angazange eve ngalo kwaye funani izinto zokwenene ezonwabisayo malunga ngalo kunye!

SourceText: Famous Party
text: Ipati Edumileyo

SourceText: Planning a dream party is a fun and creative way to spark conversation with your teen - and learn more about who inspires them! 🌟
text: Ukucwangcisa ipati yamaphupho kuyonwabisa kwaye yokuyila ukwenza intlantsi kwingxoxo yakho nomntwana wakho ofikisayo -kwaye funda ngakumbi malunga ukuba ngubani omkhuthazayo! 🌟

SourceText:
🎉 You and your teen can plan a dream guestlist of famous people to invite to your party!

📜 Each of you chooses five guests - they can be from the past or present.

🤔 Who would you invite? And do you think your guests would get along at the party?
text:
🎉 Wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ningacwangcisa uluhlu lwamandwendwe wenu asemaphupheni yabantu abadumileyo ukuba nibameme kwipati yenu! 

📜 Umntu ngamnye kuni uzakukhetha amandwendwe amahlanu - ingaba ngabantu bakudala okanye abangoku.

🤔 Ungamema bani? Kwaye ucinga ukuba amandwendwe akho azakuvana kule pati?

SourceText: Two Truths, One Lie
text: Iinyaniso Ezimbini, Nobuxoki Obunye

SourceText: Want a fun way to laugh and learn more about each other? Try this quick game of “Two Truths and a Lie” with your teen! 🤗
text: Ufuna indlela elulonwabo yokuhleka kunye nokufundana ngakumbi? Zama lomdlalo ukhawulezayo we ''Nyaniso ezimbini' kunye Nobuxoki'' kunye nontwana wakho ofikisayo! 🤗

SourceText:
🧠 Think of three statements about yourself - two true and one that’s a lie.
- It can help to think about dreams, school, likes or dislikes. For example: *I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing.*

🗣️ Share them with your teen and ask them to guess which one is the lie.

😲 Did they guess right? Were they surprised?

🔁 Now let your teen try! Did you learn something new about each other?
text:
🧠 Cinga ngeenkcazelo ezintathu malunga ngawe - ezimbini ziyinyani kwaye enye bubuxoki.
- Kunokunceda ukucinga malunga namaphupho, isikolo, izinto ozithandayo okanye ongazithandiyo. Umzekelo: *Ndiyazicaphukela ibhanana, isifundo sam endisithandayo zezenzululwazi, kwaye ndiyanqwena ngokwenene ukuba ndingakwazi ukucula.*

🗣️Yabelana ngazo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye umbuze ukuba aqikelele ukuba yeyiphi ebubuxoki. 

😲 Ingaba uqikelele ngokuchanekilwe kakuhle? Baye bamangaliseka?

🔁 Ngoku vumela umntwana wakho azame! Ingaba ufunde into entsha ngomnye nomnye?

SourceText: Superpower
text: Amandla Amakhulu

SourceText: Imagining superpowers is a fun way to spark creativity, play and connection with your teen!🦸‍♀️
text: Ukucinga ngamandla amakhulu yindlela yolonwabo ukudlamkisa ubuchule, dlala kwaye udibane kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!🦸‍♀️

SourceText:
💥 Think of a superpower - like travelling through time, or reading minds.

❓ Ask your teen, “If you had the superpower to […], how would you use it?”

🦸 Encourage them to name their superhero and act it out!

🔁 Let your teen choose a superpower for you too.

🎭 Don’t forget to act out your superpower and have fun together!
text:
💥Cinga ngamandla amakhulu - njengokuhamba ngexesha, okanye ukufunda ingqondo. 

❓ Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo, ''Ukuba ubunamandla amakhulu oku [...], ubuzakuwasebenzisa njani?''

🦸 Khuthaza umntwana wakho ukuba anike igama iqhawe lakhe kwaye alilinganise!

🔁 Vumela umntwana wakho akukhethele amandla amakhulu nawe. 

🎭Ungalibali ukudlala ngamadla akho amakhulu kwaye nonwabe kunye!

SourceText: The Interrupter
text: Umphazamisi

SourceText: This fun and silly storytelling game is a great way to boost creativity and laughter with your teen! 💥
text: Lena ilulonwabo kwaye ibalisa amabali obudenge omdlalo yindlela elungileyo yokunyusa ubuchule kunye nokuhleka kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!💥

SourceText:
📚 Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.

🗣️ Listeners can jump in anytime with any word, at any time.

🔄 The storyteller must include that word in their story - no matter how silly!

🎉 When the story ends, switch roles and let someone else be the storyteller!
text:
📚 Khetha umbalisi webali uzokuqala ukwenza ibali.

🗣️ Abamameli bangaxhuma nangeliphi na ixesha nakweliphina igama, nangeliphina ixesha.

🔄 Umbalisi webali kufuneka afakelele elogama ebalini lakhe - nokuba lihlekisa kangakanani!

🎉 Xa ibali liphela, tshintshani indawo zokudlala kwaye uvumele omnye umntu ibe ngumbalisi webali!

SourceText: Shadow Play
text: Umdlalo Wesithunzi

SourceText: Step into a world of imagination and light with this exciting shadow play activity! 🌙
text: Ngena kwilizwe lokucinga kunye nokukhanya ngalo msebenzi womdlalo wesithunzi unika umdla! 🌙

SourceText:
💡 In a darkened room, grab a light and shine it at your hand, casting fun shadows onto the wall. 

👋 Wave at your child and create silly shapes with your fingers - maybe a bunny, a bird, or whatever your imagination dreams up! 

👀 Watch as their curiosity grows, and invite them to try waving their shadow hand back.

🔑 Encourage your little one to take a turn with the flashlight, giving them the thrill of seeing how light can create different shapes and movements on the wall. 

🏁 Older children might want to join in the fun and make a shadow animal of their own!
text:
💡 Kwigumbi elimnyama, bamba isibane kwaye umenyezelise esandleni sakho, uphosa izithunzi ezonwabisayo eludongeni.

👋 Bulisa umntwana wakho ngokushukumisa isandla, wenze ubuso obuhlekisayo ngeminwe yakho. mhlawumbi umvundla, intaka okanye noba yintoni esemaphupheni akho!

👀 Bukela njengoba umdla wabo ukhula kwaye ubameme bazame ukushukumisa isithunzi sesandla sabo nabo.

🔑 Khuthaza omncinci athathe elakhe ithuba ngokudlala nge totshi, ubanika umdla wokuba babone ukuba ukukhanya kungenza ukumila okohluke kanjani kunye nentshukumo eludongeni.
🏁Abantwana abadala bangafuna ukungenelela kubumnandi kwaye benze isithunzi sesilwanyana esisesabo!

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe kwabaka Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/

SourceText: Mini Obstacle Race
text: Ugqatso Oluncinci Lesithintelo

SourceText: Get ready to set up an exciting adventure right in your home with this mini obstacle race! 🚩
text: Lungiselela ukumisa umngcelele wolonwabo kanye ekhayeni lakho ngalu gqatso luncinci lesithintelo.🚩

SourceText:
🔶 Using pillows, chairs, and blankets, create a fun and safe obstacle race for your toddler to explore. 

👋 The goal? For your little one to navigate the course by crawling, jumping, and climbing over, under, and through the obstacles.

💡 As they tackle each challenge, they’ll be developing important gross motor skills like coordination, balance, and strength. 

💛Not only will this activity get them moving, but it will also boost their confidence as they conquer each part of the race.
text: Sebenzisa imiqamelo, izitulo kunye neengubo, yenza into eyonwabisayo kunye nogqantso olukhuselekileyo lwesithintelo ukuze umntwana wakho omncinci aphonononge.

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/

SourceText: Emotion Cards
text: Amakhadi emvakalelo

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with Your Child: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: Yenza amakhadi ezona mvakalelo zintandathu kunye nomntwana wakho: onwabile, ekhathazekile, enomsindo, onyanyile, emangalisekile, esoyika😃😔😣

SourceText:
🔶 Draw, cut-out pictures from magazines, or take photos of family members showing different emotions. 

📝 Label each emotion and describe how each family member feels those emotions. 

🚩 Put the cards in a spot everyone agrees on, and use it throughout the day to name how everyone is feeling. For example, after school, everyone can point out the emotion they are experiencing. 

💡 This can help everyone in the family become experts in understanding themselves and be aware of what their bodies need! 💛
text:
🔶Zoba, sika ukhuphe imifanekiso kwincwadi yemifanekiso, okanye uthathe izithombe zosapho ezibonisa imvakalelo ezohlukeneyo. 

📝Bhala imvakalelo nganye kwaye uchaze indlela ilungu ngalinye losapho eliziva ngayo kwezomvakalelo. 

🚩Beka amakhadi kwindawo umntu wonke avumelene ngayo, kwaye yisebenzise usuku lonke ukuthiya indlela umntu ngamnye aziva ngayo. Umzekelo emva kwesikolo, umntu ngamnye angakhomba imvakalelo adlula kuyo. 

💡Oku kunganceda wonke umntu kusapho abe yingcaphephe ekuziqondeni babe nokuzazi izidingo zomzimba wabo!💛

SourceText: Get Active
text: Qala ukusebenza

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health. Find a sport or exercise that both you and your teen want to do and try it out together! 🌱
text: Ukuzivocavoca yindlela entle yokuchitha ixesha kunye kwaye kulungele impilo yakho. Fumana umdlalo okanye sebenzisa lonto wena nomntwana wakho nifuna ukuyizama kunye! 🌱

SourceText:
⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you. 

⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport..

🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward, like getting to decide the next activity?
text:
⏰ Nditsho ukuhamba imizuzu eli 10 ngemini kukulungele oko. 

⚽ Ningahamba kunye, nibaleke, nidlale ibhola ekhatywayo, niqubhe, nidanise, okanye nenze nawuphina umdlalo..

🏆 Cingani kunye indlela zokuwenza wonwabise ngakumbi. Ningabaleka kancinci umgama othile? tshintshanani ukuba ngumqeqeshi? Kungabakhona intwana, yembuyekezo yasimahla, efana nokugqiba ngomdlalo ozokulandela?

SourceText: This is Who I Am
text: Ndingulomntu Ndinguye

SourceText: Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your teen to have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! 🏆
text: Ukuzithemba yindlela ozixabisa ngayo wena, nokuba ilungile okanye ayilunganga. Ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba nokuzothemba ngokukhulu yi resiphi yempumelelo!🏆

SourceText:
⭐Share with your teen 3 things you like about yourself!

3️⃣ Ask your teen to tell you 3 things they like about themselves. 
For example: I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at styling my hair. I am great at football. ⚽
text:
⭐ Yabelana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngezinto ezi 3 ozithandayo ngawe!

3️⃣Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akuxelele izinto ezi 3 abazithandayo ngabo. 
Umzekelo: Ndikwazi kakhulu ukuphatha abanye ngobubele. Ndikwazi kakhulu ukulungisa inwele zam. Ndikwazi kakhulu ukudlala ibhola ekhatywayo.⚽

SourceText: 📝 If your teen does not feel comfortable sharing these, ask them to write them down.
text: 📝Ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akaziva ekhululekile ukwabelana ngazo, bacele bazibhale phantsi.

SourceText: Traffic Lights
text: Iirobhothi

SourceText: A group activity is a great way to bond with others! 💛
text: Umsebenzi weqela yindlela entle yokudibanisa nabanye! 💛

SourceText:
💡 Choose one person to turn and face a wall. This will be the traffic officer. 

🏁 Everyone else will begin the game at the other side of the room, or if you are outside, at a starting line. Set a long distance between the traffic officer and the players. 

💚 The game begins when the officer shouts “Green”, and everyone can start moving towards the traffic officer at any speed they choose. 

🔴 The officer can shout “Red!” at any time, without looking behind them. When they shout this, everyone must stop and freeze! 

⏸ The officer turns around to see if everyone is frozen. If they see anyone moving, they have to send them back to the start line.

🏆 The winner is the first person to get to the officer without being sent back to the start.

👑 The winner then becomes the traffic officer and you can play another round!
text:
💡 Khetha umntu omnye ukuba ajike ajonge edongeni. Lo uzakuba legosa lendlela. 

🏁 Wonke omnye umntu uzakuqalisa umdlalo kwelinye icala legumbi, ukuba ungaphandle, komgca wokuqala. Beka umgaba omde phakathi kwegosa lendlela kunye nabadlali. 

💚 Lo mdlalo uqala xa igosa lendlela likhwaza "Luhlaza", kwaye wonke umntu aqalise ukuya kwigosa lendlela ngesantya abasikhathayo. 

🔴 Igosa lendlela lingakhwaza "Bomvu!" nangeliphi na ixesha, ngaphandle kokujonga ngemva. X ekhwaza leyo, wonke umntu uyama kwaye afrize! 

⏸ Igosa lendlela liyajika libone ukuba wonke umntu ufrizile. Ukuba ubona omnye umntu eshukuma, kumele amthumele emva kumgca wokuqala.

🏆 Ophumeleleyo ngumntu wokuqala ukuya kwigosa ngaphandle kokubuyiselwa ekuqaleni. 

👑 Ophumeleleyo ke uba ligosa lezendlela kwaye ungadlala omnye umjikelo!

SourceText: Think Big, Think Small
text: Cinga Kakhulu, Cinga Kancinci

SourceText: Working towards big goals can be hard! Here is a way you can help your teen set new goals for the things they want to achieve. 👑
text: Ukusebenza ngokufikelela kwinjongo kunganzima! Nantsi indlela ongakwazi ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo amisele iinjongo ezintsha ngezinto afuna ukufikelela kuzo.👑

SourceText:
👑 Ask your teen to come up with three things that they are good at, and discuss what they did to become so good at them. For example: keeping their room neat, helping your family with housework, or playing a sport.

🏆 Next, ask your teen what they wish they were good at. 

🔑 Remind them that it took work and practice to become good at the skills they have. They will have to do the same for any new goal.

⏰ Help your teen break down their goal and set up smaller goals they need to achieve to reach their greater goal.
text:
👑 Cela umntana wakho ofikisayo ukuba eze neezinto ezintathu anobuchule kuzo, kwaye nixoxe ngento ayenzileyo ukuze abenobuchule kuzo. Umzekelo: ukungcina igumbi lakhe licocekile, ukunceda usapho lwakho kumsebenzi wasekhaya, okanye ukudlala imidlalo.

🏆 Okulandelayo buza umntana wakho ofikisayo yintoni ebebenqwenela babeno buchule kuyo. 

🔑 Bakhumbuze ukuba ifuna umsebenzi kwaye nokuziqhelanisa ukuze baphumelele kwizakhono abanazo. Kuzakufuneka benze kwangokufanayo nakweyiphi na injongo entsha.

⏰ Nceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo acalu calule injongo yakhe kwaye abeke iinjongo ezincinci ekufuneka azifezekise ukufikelela kwiinjongo zakhe ezinkulu.

SourceText: 📝 It is much easier to achieve a goal if you write it down! This way, you can be reminded of it as you work towards it.
text: 📝 Kulula kakhulu ukufikelela injongo ukuba uyibhala phantsi! Ngale ndlela, unokukhunjuzwa ngayo njengoko usebenzela kuyo.

SourceText: Take A Pause with your Teen
text: Yithi Nqumama Kunye Nomntwana Wakho Ofikisayo

SourceText: Take a pause with your teen. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
text: Yithi nqumama kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Lento ibanceda bamelane noxinzelelo ngendlela esempilweni!

SourceText:
👂 Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. 

⭐ Take 5 more deep breaths.

👀 When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different? 

⏸ Ask your teen what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.
text:
👂 Hlalani phantsi kunye nonmtwana wakho nivale amehlo. Mamela umoya wakho njengoko ungena uphuma. Qaphela indlela oziva ngayo.

⭐ Phefumlela phezulu ka 5.

👀 Xa ulungile, vula amehlo akho kwakhona. Ingaba uziva ukhona umahluko?

⏸ Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba bekunjani ukunqumama. Mamela kwaye wamkele noba yintoni abayitshoyo ngalonto.

SourceText: Name That Tune
text: Chaza Ela Culo

SourceText: Listening to music is a great way to lower your stress and have fun with your family. 💚
text: Ukumamela umculo yindlela entle ukwehlisa uxinzelelo kwaye nonwabe kunye nosapho lwakho.💚

SourceText:
📻 Gather your family members and choose one person to play, sing or hum a song.

❓ Everyone else must guess the name and artist of the song.

🎉 The first one to guess it right becomes the next person to sing or play a song. 

🔄 Keep going around until everyone has been able to play their favourite song and let the rest hear.
text:
📻 Qokelela usapho lwakho kwaye ukhethe umntu omnye wokudlala, wokucula okanye wokudumzela ingoma.

❓ Wonke omnye umntu kufuneka aqashele igama kunye nomculi wengoma.

🎉 Owokuqala ukuqikelela kakuhle uba ngumntu olandelayo ukucula okanye ukudlala ngoma.

🔄 Qhubeka ujikeleza de wonke umntu akwazi uku dlala ingoma ayithandayo kwaye bonke abanye beve.

SourceText: What’s New?
text: Yintoni Entsha?

SourceText: Learning is fun! 🎓
text: Ukufunda kukonwaba!🎓

SourceText:
❓ Ask your teen to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together. 
- For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the countries in Africa. 

🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill.  Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!

💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your teen or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text:
❓Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba acinge ngesakhono esitsha, esonwabisayo eningasifunda kunye. 
- Umzekelo: ukugcina ibhola emoyeni ngonyawo lwakho, ukuphosa, ukwenza i suphu, ukuhamba enyangeni, ukukhalisa umlozi, ukubiza oonobumba ubuyela umva, ukufunda ngamazwe onke ase Afrika. 

🔄Tshintsha tshintshanani ukuzama isakhono. Qinisekisa ukuba niyancomana kwaye niyafunda kwaye niyadlala kunye!

💛Ngena ngokufunda isakhono ngendlela enobubele kwaye eyonwabisayo, Ungamgwebi umntwana wakho ofikisayo okanye wena ngomzamo wakho kwisakhono.

SourceText: Yes, No or Maybe
text: Ewe, Hayi okanye Mhlawumbi

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your teen say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈
text: Ingaba udiniwe kukuva umntwana wakho ofikisayo esithi ewe, hayi, okanye mhlawumbi kwimibuzo yakho yonke? Tshintsha incoko yakho ibengu mdlalo, kwaye ungavumeli ilizwi elinye libeyi mpendulo.🎈

SourceText:
⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses, such as Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
⚽ You can ask about things your teen likes or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited for? Is there anything worrying you?
🔄 It is important to let your teen ask a question as well. Trust is built when your teen can see that you are also sharing your life with them, and not only trying to learn about their life.
text:
⭐ Tshintsha tshintshanani ukubuzana imibuzo. Umthetho kuphela awukwazi ukusebenzisa igama elinye ukuphendula, njengo Ewe, Hayi, Mhlawumbi, Kulungile.
⚽ Ungakwazi ukubuza ngezinto umntwana wakho ofikisayo azithandayo okanye azenzileyo namhlanje. Umzekelo, belunjani usuku lwakho? Yintoni le ikonwabise kangaka? Ingaba ikhona into ekukhathazayo?
🔄 Kubalulekile ukuvumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo abuze imibuzo naye. Ukuthembana kuyakheka xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ebona ukuba nawe uyabelana ngobakho ubomi kunye naye, kwaye hayi nje ukuba ufuna ukwazi malunga nobakhe ubomi.

SourceText: Secret Handshake
text: Ukuxhamla isandla Ngokwemfihlo

SourceText:
Let’s make a special, fun, and unique handshake that only you and your child share 👋  

This isn’t just about having fun - it helps build your child’s confidence and teamwork skills while creating a special tradition you both can enjoy. ✅
text:
Masenze ukubambana ngesandla okukhethekileyo, okonwabisayo, kwaye okukodwa okukokwakho kuphela enabelana ngako kunye nomntwana wakho 👋  

Lento ayikukonwaba nje kuphela - inceda ukwakha ukuzethemba komntwana wakho kunye nesakhono somsebenzi weqela ngelixa nisakha isiko elikhethekileyo lenu nobabini eningakwazi ukulonwabela. ✅

SourceText:
🔶 First, sit down together and talk about the kind of handshake you want. Should it be quick and silly, or cool and complicated? It’s totally up to you! 

🎵 You can start by choosing a few simple moves like clapping patterns, high fives, fist bumps, or snapping fingers.

🔄 Next, practice adding different steps. Maybe a spin, a shoulder tap, or even a fun dance move. The more creative and playful, the better!

💛 Once you’ve mastered your moves, make your secret handshake a part of your routine! Use it as a fun greeting after school, or anytime you want to feel that special connection.
text:
🔶 Okokuqala, hlalani phantsi nobabini kwaye nithethe malunga nokubambana ngesandla enikufunayo. Ifanele ikhawuleze kwaye ihlanye, okanye ibe ilungile kwaye ibenobunzima? Yonke lento ixhomekeke kuwe! 

🎵 Ungaqalisa ngokukhetha iintshukumo ezilula ezinjengo kuqhwaba izandla ngendlela efanayo, phakamisa isandla, amanqindi, okanye ukuqhwitha iminwe.

🔄 Okulandelayo, zama ukongeza iintshukumo ezahlukeneyo. Mhlawumbi ukujikezela, ukuchatha egxalabeni, okanye nentshukumo eyonwabisayo yomdaniso. Kungona nisenza kwaye nidlala, kuye kubengcono!

💛 Xana uthe wazazi iintshukumo zakho, yenza ukubambana ngesandla okuyimfihlo kubeyinxenye yenkqubo yakho! Yisebenzise njengombuliso owonwabisayo emva kwesikolo, okanye nangaliphina ixesha apho ufuna uziva ninxulumene ngokukhethekileyo.

SourceText: Quick
text: Ngokukhawuleza

SourceText: Group
text: Iqela

SourceText: Active
text: Phithizela

SourceText: Calm
text: Zola

SourceText: Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Thatha ithuba ukuzikhangela wena.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well.
text: Kuhle, ndivuya kakhulu izinto zihamba kakuhle.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.
text: Kulungile! Kuhle ukuva ukuba usendaweni elungileyo.

SourceText: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!
text: Izinto azisoloko zilula. Kodwa yindlela esingakhula kwaye sifunde ngayo ntsuku zonke!

SourceText: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!
text: Ubomi bunganzima. Nangayiphi indlela oziva ngayo, unganebhongo ngawe ngokubalapha!

SourceText: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Ubalulekile! Thatha ithuba ukuzikhangela wena.

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Kumnandi ukuva ukuba uqhuba kakuhle. Ungumzali osemagqabini!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Uxolo ngoba usuku lwakho alukuhambeli kakuhle. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama ukubona yonke into. Akakho umntu onazo zonke iimpendulo kodwa eneneni wenza konke okusemandleni akho!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Uxolo ngokuva ukuba alumnandanga usuku lwakho. Uqhube kakuhle ngokuvuka rhoqo ngentsasa nganye uphinde uzame kwakhona naxa sele udiniwe. Kukukhalipha nokuzinikela kokwenene!

SourceText: Recognising how you feel helps you care for yourself well. You deserve it.
text: Ukuziqonda indlela oziva ngayo kukunceda wena ukwazi ukuzikhathalela kakuhle. Ikufanele lonto.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Kuhle, ndivuya kakhulu! Qhubekeka nomsebenzi mhle.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. @global.app_name is here to help!
text: Uxolo ngokuba izinto zinzima. Zonke intsapho ziyasokola. @global.app_name ulapha ukunceda!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Whatever went ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It is okay!
text: Nokuba yintoni engahambanga kakuhle namhlanje, yiyeke idlule kwaye zama kwakhona ngomso. Kulungile!

SourceText: Looking after yourself matters. And how you feel matters too!
text: Ukuzihoya kubalulekile. Kwaye ibalulekile indlela oziva ngayo!

SourceText: Sometimes things go great. Sometimes they do not. And sometimes we do not quite know what to think... and that is totally okay! Remember that you are not alone.
text: Maxa wambi izinto zihamba kakuhle. Maxa wambi azihambi kakuhle. Kwaye maxa wambi sivela singayazi ukuba masicinge ntoni... Kwaye kulungile ngokupheleleyo! Khumbula into yokuba awukho wedwa.

SourceText: Sorry that things are hard right now. You deserve good things and @global.app_name is here to support you every step of the way.
text: Uxolo ngokuba izinto zinzima okwangoku. Ufanelwe zizinto ezilungileyo kwaye u @global.app_name ukhona ukukuxhasa naliphina inyathelo lendlela.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential. When you know how you feel, you can see what you need.
text: Ukuzikhathalela kubalulekile. Xa uyazi indlela oziva ngayo, uyayibona into oyidingayo.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Kuhle, ndivuya kakhulu izinto zihamba kakuhle. Qhubeka nalo msebenzi mhle.

SourceText: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here shows courage and commitment!
text: Sonke sinemini ezintle nezimbi. Into yokuba lapha kwakho ibonisa ukukhalipha nokuzinikela!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter! Let’s check in with our emotions first.
text: Khumbula ukuba Ubalulekile! Makhe sijonge indlela esiziva ngayo kuqala.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Wenze kakuhle ekuqondeni imvakalelo ezilungileyo. Ndiyavuya ukuva ukuba uziva uphilile namhlanje!

SourceText: Well done for recognising that you are not feeling great. Be kind to yourself, you deserve it.
text: Kuhle ukuziqaphela xa ungaziva kakuhle. Yiba nobubele kuwe, ikufanele lonto.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It is okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember @global.app_name is here to support you.
text: Kuhle ukuqonda imvakalelo ezinzima. Kulungile ukungazivi kakuhle maxa wambi. Khumbula i @global.app_name ikhona ukukuxhasa.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Self-care is a key parenting tool. It starts with recognising how we feel.
