text: Ukuzikhathalela sesona sixhobo sobuzali. Iqala ngokuziqaphela indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Kuhle. Yaye kuyamangalisa ukubona usebenzisa le app – loo nto ibonisa ukuzimisela kwakho njengomzali. Qiniseka ukuba uyazincoma uze uzizukise ngoko ukwenzayo.

SourceText: Every day has its highs and lows. Praise yourself for being here and trying – you are moving forward.
text: Zonke intsuku zinamahla ndenyuka azo. Zincome ngokuba ulapha kwaye uzama- uhambela phambili.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult right now. Take a deep breath and know that you are valued.
text: Uxolo ngokuba iimeko zinzima ngoku. Tsala umoya kwaye wazi ukuba uxatyisiwe.

SourceText: Recognising how you feel is key to handling life well. Be real and kind to yourself.
text: Ukuqaphela indlela oziva ngayo ngundoqo ekuphatheni kakuhle ubomi. Nyaniseka kwaye ube nobubele kuwe.

SourceText: You are a star. And you are making a real difference. You can be proud of yourself.
text: Uyinkwenkwezi. Kwaye wenza oyena umehluko. Unganebhongo ngawe.

SourceText: Everyone has good and bad days. Well done for using this app. It shows you are a committed parent. Remember to praise yourself for it!
text: Wonke umntu unemini ezintle nezimbi. Wenze kakuhle ngokusebenzisa le app. Ibonisa ukuba ungumzali ozinikeleyo. Khumbula ukuzincoma ngalonto!

SourceText: Sorry that things are not easy today. All parents have these days. You are trying and moving forward!
text: Uxolo ngokuba izinto zingekho lula namhlanje. Bonke abazali babanazo ezimini. Uyazama kwaye uhambela phambili!

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day. It starts with recognising how you feel.
text: Ukuba ngumzali olungileyo kukwathetha ukuthi yibanexesha lakho lokuzikhathalela ntsukuzonke. Lonto iqala ekuziqapheleni indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kamnandi namhlanje. Uyamangalisa!

SourceText: We all have days where we just don’t know. That is okay! You are here and that is what matters.
text: Sonke sibanentsuku apho sivele singayazi nje. Ilungile lonto! Ulapha kwaye lonto ibalulekile.

SourceText: Being a parent can be hard. But you are here and that shows you want to keep improving things. That is a big accomplishment already!
text: Ukuba ngumzali kunganzima. Kodwa ulapha kwaye lonto ibonisa ukuba ufuna ukuphucula izinto. Sele iyimpumelelo enkulu leyo!

SourceText: Taking a moment for YOU makes a big difference for everyone!
text: Ukuthatha ixesha LAKHO kwenza umehluko omkhulu kumntu wonke!

SourceText: Great that today is going well! What is one thing that has gone well today? Remember to praise yourself for it.
text: Kuhle kuba namhlanje izinto zihamba kakuhle! Yintoni into enye ehambe kakuhle namhlanje? Khumbula ukuzincoma ngaloo nto.

SourceText: Every day has its good and hard parts. Praise yourself for everything you have done so far – you are amazing.
text: Zonke intsuku zibanendawo ezinzima kunye nezintle. Zincome ngako konke osele ukwenzile ngoku - uyamangalisa.

SourceText: Sorry to hear you are feeling difficult feelings today. Well done for recognising those emotions and trying to be calm and kind to yourself. You are setting a great example for your family.
text: Uxolo ngokuziva unemvakalelelo ezinzima namhlanje. Wenze kakuhle ngokuqaphela ezomvakalelo kwaye wazama ukuzola wanobubele kuwe. Ubonisa umzekelo omhle kusapho lwakho.

SourceText: Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Ukuzijonga kakuhle kuqala ngokuqonda indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: Fantastic! And well done for investing in yourself and your family – you have accomplished a lot.
text: Uyamangalisa. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzinikela kunye nosapho lwakho - uzuze lukhulu.

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. @global.app_name is here to help.
text: Uxolo ngokuba ungenasuku luhle. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama ukufumana yonke into. i@global.app_name ikhona ukunceda.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Being a parent can be challenging. Take a deep breath and recognise all you have done for your family – you deserve praise!
text: Ukuba ngumzali kungaba ngumceli mngeni. Tsala umoya kwaye qaphela konke okwenzileyo kusapho lwakho - kukufanele ukunconywa!

SourceText: Take a moment for yourself first.
text: Thatha ithuba lakho kuqala.

SourceText: It is great to hear you are feeling positive today. You make a real difference for your family!
text: Kuhle ukuva ukuba uziva ulungile namhlanje. Wenza umehluko nyhani kusapho lwakho!

SourceText: Life has its great and hard moments – that is okay. You are on the right track.
text: Ubomi bunamaxesha anzima namnandi - kulungile. Usendleleni elungileyo.

SourceText: It is normal to have hard days as a parent. Take a deep breath and know you are not alone!
text: Kuqhelekile ukuba nentsuku ezinzima njengomzali. Tsala umoya kwaye wazi ukuba awuwedwa!

SourceText: Take a moment to notice how you are doing.
text: Thatha ithuba uqaphele ukuba uqhuba njani.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear that you are in a good space today. What a wonderful feeling!
text: Kulunge kakhulu! Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba ukwimeko entle namhlanje. Onjani wona umangaliso wemvakalelo!

SourceText: Some days will have their challenges. That is okay. You are on the right path!
text: Ezinye intsuku zizakuba nemiceli mingeni yazo. Kulungile. Usendleleni elungileyo!

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!
text: Uxolo ngokuba iimeko zinzima ngoku. Kuyinto eqhelekileyo ukuba usokole maxa wambi. Khumbula ukuba awukho wedwa!

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to feel. However you are feeling, it is okay.
text: Akukho ndlela ilungileyo nengalunganga omawuzive ngayo. Noba uziva njani, kulungile.

SourceText: Well done for recognising how you feel. Good to hear that you are feeling well today!
text: Wenze kakuhle ngokuqonda indlela oziva ngayo. Kuhle ukuva ukuba uziva kamandi namhlanje!

SourceText: We all have good and hard days. Remember, you are the best parent for your teen and you deserve praise!
text: Sonke sinemini ezilungileyo nezinzima. Khumbula, ungumzali ongcono kubantwana bakho abafikisayo kwaye ufanelwe kukunconywa!

SourceText: It can be hard to cope with everything happening in our lives. Remember, you are stronger than you may think!
text: Kunganzima ukumelana nezinto zonke eziqhubekayo ebomini bethu. Khumbula, womelele kunokuba ucinga!

SourceText: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Masithathe ithuba NAWE. Ukuzijongisa kakuhle kuqala ngokuziqaphela indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: Amazing, life is the best when you're feeling good.
text: Kuyamangalisa, ubomi bulungile xa uziva kamandi.

SourceText: Everyone has times when they are not feeling good. This is completely normal. Hopefully you feel better soon.
text: Sonke sinamaxesha okungazivi kamandi. Oku kuqhelekile. Ngethemba uzoziva ungcono kwamsinya.

SourceText: It is part of life to have bad days. Always remember, tough times never last and tomorrow is another day!
text: Yinxalenye yobomi ukuba neentsuku ezimbi, hlala ukhumbula, amaxesha anzima awapheli kwaye ngomso lolunye usuku!

SourceText: How are you feeling today?
text: Uziva njani namhlanje?

SourceText: Happy
text: Uyavuya

SourceText: Okay
text: Kulungile

SourceText: Sad
text: Ulusizi

SourceText: Your home activity was to spend 5 minutes of one-on-one time with your child.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya ibikukuchitha imizuzu emi-5 ye xesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: That’s wonderful! Well done for spending time together. It lays the foundation for a great relationship with your child!
text: Kwaze kwakuhle! Wenze kakuhle ngokuchitha ixesha kunye. Yenza isiseko sobundlelwano obuhle kunye nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: Sometimes it will be easy and fun to spend time with your child and sometimes it will be difficult. Spending time together will definitely improve your relationship!
text: Ngamanye amaxesha kungalula kwaye konwabise ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho kwaye ngamanye amaxesha ingaba nzima. Ukuchitha ixesha kunye kuya kuphucula kakhulu ubudlwelane benu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult for you to spend time with your child. We all have challenges sometimes. Just be patient with yourself and your child – things will get better. Well done for trying!
text: Siyaxolisa ukuva ukuba bekunzima ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho. Sonke sibanayo imiceli-mngeni ngamanye amaxesha. Yiba nomonde kuwe kunye nomntwana wakho - izinto ziza kuba ngcono. Usebenzile ngokuzama!

SourceText: How did one-on-one time go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuchitha ixesha omnye nomnye?

SourceText: Your goal was to spend one-on-one time with your teen.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukuchitha ixesha ukunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: That’s wonderful! Well done for spending time together. It lays the foundation for a great relationship with your teen!
text: Kwaze kwakuhle! Wenze kakuhle ngokuchitha ixesha kunye. Yenza isiseko sobudlelwano obuhle kunye nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: Sometimes it will be easy and fun to spend time with your teens and sometimes it will be more challenging. Spending time together will definitely improve your relationship!
text: Ngamanye amaxesha kungalula kwaye konwabise ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho kwaye ngamanye amaxesha ingaba nzima. Ukuchitha ixesha kunye kuya kuphucula kakhulu ubudlwelane benu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult for you to spend time with your teen. We all have challenges sometimes. Just be patient with yourself and your teen – things will get better. Well done for trying!
text: Siyaxolisa ukuva ukuba bekunzima ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho. Sonke sibanayo imiceli-mngeni ngamanye amaxesha. Yiba nomonde kuwe kunye nomntwana wakho - izinto ziza kuba ngcono. Usebenzile ngokuzama!

SourceText: How did talking about feelings go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuthetha ngemvakalelo?

SourceText: Your home activity was to take a moment each day to talk with your child about feelings.
text: Umsebenzi wasekhaya kukuthatha ixesha ngosuku ngalunye uthethe nomntwana wakho malunga ngemvakalelo.

SourceText: That’s wonderful! Well done for talking with your child about their feelings. It lays the foundation for a great relationship with your child!
text: Kwaze kwakuhle! Wenze kakuhle ngokuchitha ixesha kunye. Yenza isiseko sobundlelwano obuhle kunye nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: Talking about feelings can be both easy and tough at times. The effort you put in to discuss them will surely help strengthen your bond!
text: Ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo kungalula kwaye kubenzima exesheni. Umgudu owenzileyo ukuxoxa naye ngokuqinisekileyo kuyakunceda ukuqinisa ubudlelwane benu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was challenging to talk about feelings. It’s normal to face difficulties sometimes. Keep being patient with yourself and your child – it will get easier. Good job for making the effort!
text: Uxolo ngokuva ukuba bekungumceli mngeni ukuthetha malunga ngeemvakalelo. Kuyinto eqhelekileyo ukujongana nobunzima ngamanye amaxesha. Hlala unomonde kuwe kunye nakumntwana wakho- izakude ibelula. Umsebenzi omhle ngokwenza umgudu!

SourceText: How did praising your child go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuncoma umntwana wakho?

SourceText: Your home activity was to praise your child for 2 things every day.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukuncoma umntwana wakho ngento ezi 2 qho ngosuku.

SourceText:
It can sometimes be hard to remember to praise our children. 

Next time you spend one-on-one time with your child, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say, “Thank you for spending time with me!”
text:
Kunganzima ngamanye amaxesha ukukhumbula ukuncoma abantwana bethu. 

Kwixesha elilandelayo nichitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho, zama ukucinga ngento enye onokuba ncoma ngayo. Unako nokuthi, “Enkosi ngokuchitha ixesha kunye nam!!"!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Keep up the praise – you will see your child do more and more of the behaviour you like to see!
text: Kumnandi ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! qhubeka uncoma - uzakubona umntwana esenza ngakumbi nangakumbi isimilo othanda ukusibona!

SourceText: How did praising your teen go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: Your goal was to praise your teen once a day.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo kanye ngosuku.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Keep up the praise – you will see your teen do more and more of the behaviour you like to see!
text: Kumnandi ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! Qhubeka uncoma - uzakubona umntwana esenza ngakumbi nangakumbi isimilo othanda ukusibona!

SourceText: It sometimes takes a bit of time to adjust to praising, but it makes a big difference – you will see.
text: Ngamanye amaxesha kuthatha ixeshana ukuqhela ukuncoma, kodwa kwenza umahluko omkhulu - uzakuwubona.

SourceText: Sorry that you struggled with this. Starting with praise can take some practice, but you will see the positive results soon!
text: Uxolo ngokuba usokolo ngalento. Ukuqala ngokuncoma kungathatha ukuzama okuthile, kodwa uzakubona iziphumo elungileyo kungekudala!

SourceText: You deserve some praise, too. Thank you again for using @global.app_name. It shows you really care!
text: Nawe ukufanele ukunconywa. Enkosi kwakhona ngokusebenzisa i-@global.app_name. Kubonisa ukuba uyakhathala ngokwenene!
note: The string @global.app_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Your home activity was to give your child specific, realistic, and positive instructions.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukunika umntwana wakho imiyalelo ecacileyo eyinyani, elungileyo.

SourceText:
Thank you for sharing! Well done for trying to give your child positive instructions and for building a positive relationship with your child. 

Your child deserves praise and YOU do as well!
text:
Enkosi ngokwabelana! Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama ukunika umntana wakho imiyalelo elungileyo kunye nokwakha ubundlelwano obulungileyo nomntwana wakho. 

Umntwana wakho ufanelwe kukunconywa kwaye NAWE ukufanele nje kakuhle!

SourceText: How did making a rule and routine go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukwenza imigaqo kunye nenqubo yemihla yonke?

SourceText: Your goal was to make ONE rule and ONE routine with your child.
text: Injongo yakho kukwenza umthetho OMNYE kwaye nenkqubo ENYE kunye nomntana wakho.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Consistent rules help make our child feel secure and keep them safe!
text: Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle! Imithetho esisigxina inceda ekwenzeni abantwana bethu bazive bekhuselekile kwaye bagcine bekhuselekile!

SourceText: Well done for this! It is not easy, and children will not keep to the rules all the time, but making a few key rules together is a great start. Praise yourself for trying this – we are proud of you!
text: Usebenzile ngalento! Ayikho lula, kwaye abantwana abayi ngcini imithetho ngalo lonke ixesha, kodwa ikwenza imithetho embalwa ebalulekileyo kusisiqalo esihle. Zincome ngokuzama oku - siyazingca ngawe!

SourceText: How did talking about consequences go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuthetha ngeziphumo?

SourceText: Your home activity was to discuss one household rule that your child finds hard to follow and agree on a fair consequence together.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya ibikukuxoxa ngomthetho omnye wasekhaya onganzima ukuba umntwana wakho ukuwulandela kwaye nivumelane ngesiphumo esifanelekileyo kunye.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Getting consequences right helps children behave better and makes family life calmer.
text: Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba ihambe kakuhle! Ukufumana iziphumo ngendlela efanelekileyo kunceda abantwana baziphathe ngcono kwaye kwenze ubomi bentsapho buzole.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that this was difficult for you. Setting consequences together will make your child want to follow the rules more often!
text: Siyaxolisa ukuva ukuba ibinzima lento kuwe. Ukubeka iziphumo kunye kungenza umntwana wakho afune ukulandela imithetho rhoqo!

SourceText:
Your goal was to to identify a problem your child may have and practise the four steps of problem-solving together: 
Know It, Solve It, Try It, Reflect.
text:
Injongo yakho ibikukuchonga ingxaki anokuba nayo umntwana wakho kwaye nizame namanyathelo amane okusombulula ingxaki kunye. 
Yazi, Yisombulule, Yizame, Yicingisise.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! When your child learns how to solve problems, they can use that skill their whole life. What a gift to give them!
text: Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! Xa umntwana wakho efunda ukusombulula iingxaki, unokusebenzisa eso sakhono ubomi bakhe bonke. Esinjani sona isipho onomnika yena!

SourceText: Solving problems together takes some practice. The more often you involve your child when you are both calm, the better it will go. Well done for trying!
text: Ukusombulula ingxaki kunye kuthatha ixesha elithile lokuzama. Okukhona rhoqo ubandakanya umntwana wakho xa nizolile nobabini, Kukhona kuya kuhamba ngcono. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that this was hard. Sometimes we just have to keep trying. Find a time when you and your child are calm and try again to talk through a problem using the four steps of problem-solving. Together, you can do so much!
text: Uxolo ngokuva ukuba oko kuye kwanzima. Ngamanye amaxesha kufuneka siqhubeke sizama. Fumana ixesha xa wena nomntwana wakho nizolileyo kwaye nizame ukuthetha ngengxaki kwakhona nisebenzisa amanyathelo amane okusombulula iingxaki. Nibambisene, ningenza lukhulu!

SourceText: How did solving a problem together go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukusombulula ingxaki nikunye?

SourceText: Your goal was to try and resolve a problem together with your teen using the four steps of problem-solving: Know It, Solve It, Try It, Test It.
text:
Injongo yakho ibikukuzama ukusombulula ingxaki kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nisebenzisa amanyathelo amane okusombulula ingxaki:
Yazi, Yisombulule, Yizame, Yivavanye..

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! When your teen learns how to solve problems, they can use that skill their whole life. What a gift!
text: Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! Xa umntwana wakho efunda ukusombulula iingxaki, unokusebenzisa eso sakhono ubomi bakhe bonke. Esinjani sona isipho!

SourceText: Solving problems together takes some practice. The more often you involve your teen when you are both calm, the better it will go. Well done for trying!
text: Ukusombulula ingxaki kunye kuthatha ixesha elithile lokuzama. Okukhona rhoqo ubandakanya umntwana wakho xa nizolile nobabini, Kukhona kuya kuhamba ngcono. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama!

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Sometimes we just have to keep trying. Find a time when you and your teen are calm and try again to talk through a problem using the four steps of problem-solving. Together, you can do so much!
text: Uxolo ngokuva ukuba oko kuye kwanzima. Ngamanye amaxesha kufuneka siqhubeke sizama. Fumana ixesha xa wena nomntwana wakho nizolileyo kwaye nizame ukuthetha ngengxaki kwakhona nisebenzisa amanyathelo amane okusombulula iingxaki. Nibambisene, ningenza lukhulu!

SourceText: Your home activity was to pause, praise your efforts and reward yourself.
text: Umsebenze wakho wasekhaya ibi kukuthi nqumama, uncome imigudu yakho kwaye uzinike umvuzo.

SourceText: How did taking care of yourself go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuzikhathalela wena siqu?

SourceText: Your home activity was to relax, recognise your efforts, and reward yourself.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya ibikukuphumla, uqaphela imizamo yakho, kwaye uzinike umvuzo.

SourceText: Great to hear you took time for yourself! Taking care of yourself helps you be the best parent you can be.
text: Kumnandi ukuva ukuba uthatha ixesha eli lelakho! Ukuzikhathalela wena kunceda ukuba ubengoyena mzali ongoyena onokuba nguye.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult to prioritise yourself. Remember, taking care of yourself is essential and will help you take care of others even better!
text: Uxolo ngokuva ukuba bekunzima ukuzibeka phambili. Khumbula, ukuzikhathalela kubalulekile kwaye kuya kukunceda uzikhathelele nabanye ngcono!

SourceText: How did playing with your child go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukudlala nomntana wakho?

SourceText: Your home activity was to play with your child.
text: Umsebenzi wasekhaya ibikukudlala kunye nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: That is great to hear! Spending time with your child is a great way to build a good relationship with them!
text: Kuhle ukuva oko! Ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo yindlela entle yokwakha ubudlelwane obulungileyo kunye nabo!

SourceText: Every time you play with your child, you’re building something special, even if it doesn’t always go perfectly. Well done for staying committed!
text: Ngalolonke ixesha udlala nomntwana wakho, wakha into ekhethekileyo, nokuba ayisoloko ihamba kakuhle. Wenze kakuhle ngokuhlala uzimisele!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was hard. Sometimes it takes a few tries to find the right way. Keep trying, and remember that playtime is a valuable way to connect with your child. You’re doing your best, and that’s what matters!
text:
Uxolo ngokuva ukuba bekunzima. Ngamanye amaxesha ukuzama kambalwa ufumana indlela elungileyo. Qhubeka uzama, kwaye ukhumbule ukuba ixesha londlalo liyindlela ebalulekileyo yonxibelelwano nomntwana wakho.
Wenza konke okusemandleni akho, kwaye yiloo nto ibalulekileyo!

SourceText: How did giving clear instructions go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukunika imiyalelo ecacileyo?

SourceText: Your home practice was to give your teen positive instructions.
text: Umsebenzi wasekhaya wakho ibikukunika umntwana wakho ofikisayo imiyalelo elungileyo.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. You are a star!
text: Kumnandi ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle. Uyinkwekwezi!

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!
text: Siyaxolisa ngokuba oko kube nzima kuwe. Usebenzile ngokuzama!

SourceText: Giving instructions in a new way takes some practice. Keep trying, you will soon see the difference it makes!
text: Ukunika imiyalelo ngendlela entsha kuthatha ukuzama obuthile. Qhubeka uzama, kungekudala uza kuwubona umehluko eyenzayo!

SourceText: How did keeping calm under stress go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukugcina uzolile phantsi konxinzelo?

SourceText:
This week, your goal was to respond calmly and talk to your teen about how you both felt in a stressful situation.

Your other goal was to pick a Safety Word together.
text: Kuleveki, amaphupha akho kukuphendula ngokuzolileyo kwaye thetha nomntwana wam ofikisayo malunga nokuba nizive njani kwimeko yoxinzelelo.

SourceText: Wonderful! You deserve all the happy times!
text: Kuhle gqitha! Ufanelwe ngawo onke amaxesha olonwabo!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. You are a star for trying!
text: Siyaxolisa ngokuba oko kube nzima kuwe. Ungungqa phambili ngokuzama!

SourceText: Life can be so stressful. Every small step counts. Keep up the good work!
text: Ubomi bunokuba kunganoxinzelelo. Inyathelo ngalinye elincinci liyabala. Qhubeka nomsebenzi omhle!

SourceText: How did setting a rule go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukumisela umthetho?

SourceText: Your goal was to set one rule together with your teen.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukuhlala kunye umisele umgaqo nomtwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Consistent rules help make our teens feel secure and keep them safe!
text: Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle! Imithetho esisigxina inceda ekwenzeni abantwana bethu bazive bekhuselekile kwaye bagcine bekhuselekile!

SourceText: It can be hard to create your first rule together, but you will see the benefits of involving your family. Keep trying!
text: Kunokubanzima ukwenza umthetho wokuqala kunye, kodwa uyakubona imivuzo yokubandakanya usapho lwakho. Qhubeka uzama!

SourceText: Sorry that this has been difficult. Creating rules together requires some practice but it is worth it!
text: Uxolo ukuba oku kuye kwabanzima. Ukuyila nemithetho kunye kufuna ukuzama okuthile kodwa oko kufanelekile!

SourceText: Well done for this! It is not easy, and teenagers will not keep to the rules all the time, but making a few key rules together is a great start. Praise yourself for trying this – we are proud of you!
text: Usebenzile ngalento! Ayikho lula, kwaye abantwana abayi ngcini imithetho ngalo lonke ixesha, kodwa ikwenza imithetho embalwa ebalulekileyo kusisiqalo esihle. Zincome ngokuzama oku - siyazingca ngawe!

SourceText: How did introducing a positive consequence go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukwazisa iziphumo ezintle?

SourceText: Your goal was to introduce one POSITIVE consequence (for your teen taking good actions) and one NEGATIVE consequence (for your teen breaking a household rule).
text: Injongo yakho ibikukwazisa isiphumo esinye esi LUNGILEYO (kumntwana wakho ukwenzela enze amanyathelo alungileyo) kunye nesiphumo esinye esi NGALUNGANGA (xa umntwana wakho engawuthobelanga umthetho wekhaya).

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text: Kuhle kakhulu ukuva ukuba ihambe kakuhle! Ukufumana iziphumo ngendlela efanelekileyo kunceda abantwana baziphathe ngcono kwaye kwenze ubomi bentsapho buzole.

SourceText: Staying calm and consistent can be hard, but you are doing so well. You can do this!
text: Ukuhlala uzolile kwaye ungaguquguquki kunganobunzima, kodwa wenze kakuhle. Ungayenza le nto!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. Setting consequences together will make your teen want to follow the rules more often!
text: Siyaxolisa ukuva ukuba ibinzima lento kuwe. Ukubeka iziphumo kunye kungenza umntwana wakho afune ukulandela imithetho rhoqo!

SourceText: How did making safety maps go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukwenza imephu ekhuselekileyo?

SourceText: Your goal was to make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places – both in your community and online.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukwenza imephu kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga - kwindawo yakho nakwi nakwi intanethi.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Talking about risks and support options prevents problems and really helps to keep your teen safe.
text: Kuhle ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! Ukuthetha malunga nemingcipheko kunye nokhetho lwenkxaso kuthintela iingxaki kwaye kunceda ngokwenene ekugcineni umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile.

SourceText: Even if it did not go so well yet, you will get there! Mapping risks and support systems together will help your family. Well done for trying.
text: Nokuba akuhambanga kakuhle okwangoku, uzakufika apho!. Ukwenza imephu ngemingcipheko kunye neenkqubo zenkxaso kunye kuya kuzakunceda usapho lwakho. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama.

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Mapping risks and places to get support can be challenging and emotional. It really does help to keep your teen safe!
text: Uxolo ukuba oku kube nzima. Ukwenza imephu ngendawo ezinobungozi kunye nokufumana inkxaso kungangumceli mngeni kunye nokudinwa ngokwasemoyeni. Kuyanceda ngokwenene ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile!

SourceText: How did talking about a crisis plan go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuthetha ngezicwangciso zeengxaki?

SourceText: Your goal was to discuss a possible crisis situation with your teen and make a plan for how you could respond together.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukuxoxa ngengxaki enokwenzeka kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye nenze isicwangciso sokuba ningakwazi njani ukuphendula kunye.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well!
text: Kuhle ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle!

SourceText: It can be hard to think and talk about a crisis happening in your family. By trying you are already on the right path. Keep up the good work!
text: Kunokuba nzima ukucinga kwaye uthethe malunga ngengxaki eyenzekayo kusapho lwakho. Ngokuzama sewukuyo indlela elungileyo. Qhubeka usenza umsebenzi olungileyo!

SourceText: Sorry it didn’t go so well. This can be tough. Try sitting down with your teen again — and think about whether someone they trust could join the conversation to help.
text: Uxolo khange ihambe kakuhle. Oku kunokuba nzima. Zama ukuhlala phantsi nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwakhona - kwaye ucinge malunga nokuba omnye umntu omthembileyo onokujoyina incoko ukuze ancede.

SourceText: How did making a family budget go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho?

SourceText: Your goal was to make a family budget.
text: Injongo yakho kukwenza uhlalo lwabiwo mali losapho.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. Talking about your finances together really makes your family stronger!
text: Kuhle ukuva ukuba izinto zihambe kakuhle. Ukuthetha malunga ngezimali zenu kunye eneneni yenza usapho lwakho lomelele!

SourceText: It is never easy to talk about money. Well done on starting the conversation and teaching your teen about this.
text: Akuzange kubelula ukuthetha malunga nemali. Wenze kakuhle ukuqala incoko kunye nokufundisa umtwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nalento.

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying. Helping your teen understand money better will benefit them so much in life!
text: Uxolo ukuva bekunzima kuwe. Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama. Ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba aqonde imali ngcono kuza kubayinzuzo kakhulu ebomini!

SourceText:
Thank you for sharing your experiences! Well done for thinking about how you can budget and save with your family. This will really help you to work towards your family goals.

Together you can achieve so many good things!
text:
Enkosi kakhulu ngokwabelana ngamava akho! Wenze kakuhle ngokucinga malunga nokuba ungalwenza njani uhlalo lwabiwo mali kunye nokonga kunye nosapho lwakho. Oku kungakunceda ngokwenene ukuba usebenzele ukufika kwiinjongo zosapho lwakho.

Kunye sinokufezekisa Izinto ezilungileyo!

SourceText: How did reading the stories and talking about body changes go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukufunda amabali kunye nokuthetha ngokutshintsha komzimba?

SourceText: Your goal was to look at the stories in this module together with your teen and use them to start a conversation about body changes and relationships.
text: Injongo yakho ibikukujonga lamabali akule modyuli kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye niwasebenzise ukuqala ingxoxo malunga notshintsho kunye nobudlelwane.

SourceText: Well done for trying it out – you took a very important step to help your teen!
text: Wenze kakuhle ngokuyizama oku - uthathe inyathelo elibalulekileyo kakhulu ukunceda umntwana ofikisayo!

SourceText: It can be hard to talk to your teen about these things. That is okay. Well done for trying, you will get another opportunity again soon!
text: Kunganzima ukuthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nezizinto. Kulungile, Wenze kakuhle ngokuzama, uzaphinda ufumane elinye ithuba kwamsinyane!

SourceText: How did talking about staying safe with your teen go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuthetha ngokuhlala ukhuselekile kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: Your goal was to discuss the Staying Safe module with your teen.
text: Injongo yakho yayikukuxoxa ngemodyuli Ukuhlala Ukhuselekile kunye nomtwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: Well done for involving your teen! Discussing these difficult topics can help keep your teen safe when it matters most.
text: Wenze kakuhle ngokubandaka umntwana wakho ofikisayo! Ukuxoxa ngezizihloko zinzima kunganceda ukungcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile xa kubalulekile kakhulu.

SourceText: Talking about potentially dangerous situations with your teen can be challenging, but just know that you started an important conversation! Keep up the good work.
text: Ukuthetha malunga ngeemeko ezinokuba yingozi kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunokuba ngumceli mngeni, kodwa yazi nje ukuba uqala incoko ebalulekileyo! Qhubeka nomsebenzi olungileyo.

SourceText: Discussing potential dangers and how to respond can be a trigger for any parent and teen. The fact that you tried already makes a big difference and really shows you care.
text: Ukuxoxa ngezinto ezinokuba yingozi kunye nendlela yokuphendula ingakuchukumisa nawuphina umzali kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Ngenxa yokuba sele udiniwe yenza umahluko omkhulu kwaye ibonakalisa ngokwenene uyakhathala.

SourceText: How did sharing feelings of grief with your teen go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukwabelana ngeemvakalelo zosizi kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: This week, your goal was to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.
text: Kuleveki, injongo yakho kukwabelana kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendlela oziva ngayo, kwaye umcele ukuba achaze iimvakalelo zakhe.

SourceText: Well done! Sharing feelings will help your family to support each other and get through this difficult time together.
text: Wenze kakuhle! Ukwabelana ngemvakalelo kuya kunceda usapho lwakho luxhasane omnye nomnye kwaye luphumelele kweli xesha linzima kunye.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can be challenging at first. Try again another time. It will help you and your family.
text: Ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo kungangumceli mngeni ekuqaleni. Zama kwakhona ngelinye ixesha. Ingakunceda wena nosapho lwakho.

SourceText: Losing someone impacts everyone differently. Be kind to yourself and take some time to notice and share how you feel when you are ready. You will see it will help you and your family.
text: Ukulahlekelwa ngomnye umntu kungachaphazela wonke umntu ngokwahlukileyo. Yiba nobubele kuwe kwaye uthathe ixesha lokuqaphela kwaye wabelane ngendlela oviza ngayo xa ukulungele oko. Uzakuyibona izakunceda wena kunye nosapho lwakho.

SourceText: How did trying a fun activity with your teen go?
text: Kuhambe njani ukuzama imidlalo yolonwabo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: Your goal was to try a fun activity with your teen.
text: Injongo yakho yayikukuzama umsebenzi owonwabisayo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Spending fun, relaxed time with your teen helps them learn important life skills  —  and it strengthens your bond.
text: Kuhle ukuva ukuba kuhambeke kakuhle! Ukuchitha ixesha lokonwaba, nelokuphumla kunye  nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kumnceda afunde izakhono ezibalulekileyo - kwaye komeleza ubundlelwane benu.

SourceText: You're doing well! Even small moments of fun and conversation can help your teen feel valued and motivated. Keep it up!
text: Wenza kakuhle!! Namaxesha amancinci okonwaba kunye nokuncokola kungamnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ebalulekile kwaye ekhuthazekile. Qhubeka!

SourceText: Taking time for yourself can be challenging, but you’re doing great. Keep it up — you deserve it!
text: Ukuthatha ixesha lakho kungaba ngumceli mngeni, kodwa wenza kakuhle. Qhubekeka - ukufanele oku!

SourceText: How did making an Online Family Agreement with your teen go?
text: Senzeke njani iSivumelwano sosapho kwi- Intanethi kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: Your goal was to make an Online Family Agreement with your teen.
text: Iinjongo zakho ibikukwenza iSivumelwano soSapho esikwi- Intanethi kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Creating an Online Family Agreement together can help your teen feel trusted and supported.
text: Kulungile ukuva ukuba kuhambe kakuhle! ukwenza iSivumelwano soSapho kwi- Intanethi kunye kunokunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ethenjiwe kwaye exhasekile.

SourceText: Talking about these sensitive topics can be uncomfortable for both you and your teen. The more you try, the better it will get. It is worth every bit of your effort!
text: Ukuthetha malunga nezizihloko zinobuthathaka inganako ukukhululeki kuni nobababini wena kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Okona uzama, kokukhona uyifumana. iwufanele umgudu ngamnye wakho!

SourceText: Sorry it was difficult this time. Talking about online behaviour can be tricky, especially when teens value their privacy. Try again another day when you’re both calm.
text: Uxolo ibixesha elinzima eli. Ukuthetha ngokuziphatha kwi-Intanethi kunokuba nzima, ngakumbi xa abantwana abafikisayo bebuxabisa ubumfihlo babo. Zamani kwakhona ngenye imini xa nobabini nizolile.

SourceText: Let’s check in on your home activity!
text: Masijonge umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya!

SourceText: Did you have a chance to try this?
text: Ukhe wanalo ithuba lokuzama lento?

SourceText: That is okay, do not be too hard on yourself. We encourage you to try and do it when you can.
text: Kulungile, sukuzicingela kakhulu, Siyakukhuthaza ukuba uzame kwaye uyenze xa ukwazi ukuyenza.

SourceText: How did it go?
text: Ihambe njani?

SourceText: Well done for exploring solutions to your challenges. Go try these solutions out. Your relationship with your child will get stronger and stronger!
text: Wenze kakuhle ngokukhangela izisombululo kwimiceli-mngeni yakho. Yiya uyokuzama ezisombululo. Ubundlelwano bakho kunye nomntwana wakho kuya ngokomelela nangokomolela!

SourceText:
It can be hard to find time with work, chores, and everything else.

Try to find 5 minutes during moments you already share with your child – like school runs, wake-ups, or during bedtime.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the ‘Play’ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Kunganzima ukufumana ixesha kumsebenzi, imisebenzi yasendlini kunye nezinye izinto.

Zama ukufumana imizuzu eyi 5 ngexesha lemizuzu esele nabelane ngayo nomntwana wakho - ezifana nokulungiselela sikolo, xa nivuka, okanye ngexesha lokulala.

Udinga ingcebiso ngemidlalo? Ucofa iqhosha 'dlala' ezantsi kweApp.

SourceText: My child did not want to spend one-on-one time with me
text: Umntwana wam akavumanga ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nam

SourceText:
It can hurt when your child does not want to spend one-on-one time with you.

Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? In the morning? Right before bedtime?

Try again so that your child can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
text:
Ingakukhathaza xa umntwana wakho engavumi ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nawe.

Zicingele: Kunini apho baye bakhululeke ngakumbi kuwe? Kusasa? Phambi kwexesha lokulala?

Zama kwakhona ukwenzela umntwana wakho akubone ukuba uyakhathala kwaye uyafuna ukuchitha ixesha kunye naye.

SourceText: All my child wanted to do was watch T.V. or play with a gadget
text: Iyonke nje into afuna ukuyenza umntwana wam kukubukela umabonakude okanye ukudlala ngesixhobo

SourceText:
Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget.

You could watch or play on the gadget with them – showing interest is a great first step!

Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the ‘Play’ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Abantwana basoloko befuna ukuchitha ixesha bebukele umabonakude okanye bedlala ngesixhobo.

Ungabukela okanye udlale ngesixhobo kunye naye - ukubonisa umdla linyathelo lokuqala elihle!

Xa niye naqalisa ukuchitha ixesha kunye ungacebisa ngomnye umdlalo.

Udinga iingcebiso ngemidlalo? Cofa iqhosha "dlala' ezantsi kweApp.

SourceText: My child wanted to do activities that I could not physically do
text: Umntwana wam ebefuna ukwenza imidlalo bendingenakwazi ukuyenza ngokomzimba

SourceText:
If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them.

You could describe what they are doing like a sports announcer.

You can also show enthusiasm by clapping, smiling, or offering a thumbs-up.

Praise them while they do it!
text:
Ukuba umntwana wakho ufuna ukwenza izinto ezinzima kakhulu kuwe ongenakuzenza, ungambukela.

Ungachaza lonto ayenzayo njengomntu ongumchazi wezemidlalo.

Ungabonisa umdlandla ngokuqhwaba izandla, uncume, okanye unikeze ngokumpha ubhontsi.

Mncome ngexesha esenza!

SourceText: My child chose a competitive activity. I won and then they got angry
text: Umntwana wam ukhetha imidlalo enokhuphiswano. Ndiphumelele kwaye waba nomsindo

SourceText: All my children wanted one-on-one time at the same time
text: Bonke abantwana bam bebefuna ukuchitha ixesha lethu sikunye ngexesha elinye

SourceText:
It can be hard to find time with work, chores, and everything else.

Try to find 5 minutes during moments you already share with your child — like school runs, wake-ups, or during bedtime.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the ‘Play’ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Kunganzima ukufumana ixesha kumsebenzi, imisebenzi yasendlini kunye nezinye izinto.

Zama ukufumana imizuzu eyi 5 ngexesha lemizuzu esele nabelane ngayo nomntwana wakho - ezifana nokulungiselela sikolo, xa nivuka, okanye ngexesha lokulala.

Udinga ingcebiso ngemidlalo? Ucofa iqhosha 'dlala' ezantsi kweApp.

SourceText:
Yes, it can be really hard to find time during the day, with work, chores, and everything else.

You’re doing great by making the effort to connect!
text: Ewe, kunganzima kakhulu ukufumana ixesha emini, ngumsebenzi, imisebenzi yasekhaya, kunye nezinye izinto!

SourceText: My teen does not want to spend time with me
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo akafuni kuchitha ixesha kunye nam

SourceText:
Sorry that you struggled with that. It can make us feel bad if our children do not want to spend one-on-one time with us.

You’re doing great by making the effort to connect!
text:
Uxolo ngokuba usokole yilonto. Ingasenza sizive kakubi ukuba abantwana bethu abafuni ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nathi.

Wenza kakuhle ngokwenza okusemandleni ukuqhagamshelana!

SourceText: My teen only wants to watch TV or play on his/her phone
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo ufuna ukubukela i-TV okanye adlale ngefowuni yakhe

SourceText:
Sorry that you had that challenge. Teens often want to spend time watching TV or playing with a gadget. 

You could watch or play on the gadget with them – showing interest is a great first step!

Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the ‘Play’ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Uxolo ukuba uye wafumana umceli mngeni. Abantwana abafikisayo basoloko befuna ukuchitha ixesha bebukele umabonakude okanye bedlala ngesixhobo.

Ungabukela okanye udlale ngesixhobo kunye naye - ukubonisa umdla linyathelo lokuqala elihle!

Xa niye naqalisa ukuchitha ixesha kunye ungacebisa ngomnye umdlalo.

Udinga iingcebiso ngemidlalo? Cofa iqhosha "dlala' ezantsi kweApp.

SourceText: My teen wants to do things that are not safe or that cost money
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo ufuna ukwenza izinto ezingakhuselekanga okanye ezibiza imali eninzi

SourceText: You are not alone here. Many parents have this challenge, too. One-on-one time should always be safe and it does not have to cost a thing!
text: Awukho wedwa apha. Abazali abaninzi nabo banalo mceli mngeni. Ixesha lomnye nomnyekufuneka likhuselekile ngalo lonke ixesha, kwayeakumelanga libe libiza nanye into!

SourceText: My teen wants to do things that I cannot physically do
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo ufuna ukwenza izinto umzimba wam ongandivumeli ukuba ndizenze

SourceText:
Sorry to hear that. Teens can feel sad if we can’t do what they want, like playing sports or other active things.

But the most important thing is spending time together – and that can look different for every family.
text:
Uxolo ukuva lonto. Abantwana abafikisayo bangaziva bekhathazekile xa ungakwazi ukwenza into abayifunayo, ekufana nokudlala imidlalo okanye ezinye izinto ezishukumisa umzimba.

Kodwa eyona nto ibalulekileyo kukuchitha ixesha kunye - kwaye oko kungabonakala kohlukile kusapho ngalunye.

SourceText: All my children want one-on-one time with me at the same time
text: Bonke abantwana bam bebefuna ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nam ngexesha elinye

SourceText:
It’s okay! Life gets busy. Try setting aside just 5 minutes at the same time every day. 

You’re doing great by making the effort to connect!
text:
Kulungile! Ubomi buye buxakeke. Zama ukubeka imizuzu emi 5 ngexesha elinye mihla yonke.

Wenza kakuhle ngokuthi uthathe amandla ukuqhagamshelana!

SourceText: My child did not want to share their feelings
text: Umtwana wam akafunanga ukwabelana nam ngemvakalelo zakhe

SourceText:
It’s normal for children to feel shy about sharing feelings, especially at first.

Keep being patient and give them chances to talk. You’re doing well by showing them how – like saying, “I feel happy!”
text:
Kuqhelekile ukuba abantwana bazive benentloni ukwabelana ngemvakalelo zabo, kakhulu ekuqaleni.

Qhubeka nokunyamezela kwaye ubaphe ixesha lokuthetha. Wenza kakuhle ngokubabonisa ukuba kunjani- kufana nokuth, "ndiziva ndonwabile!"

SourceText: I felt uncomfortable talking about my feelings
text: Ndiziva ndingakhululekanga ukuthetha malunga neemvakalelo zam

SourceText:
It’s okay to feel that way! Start small and use ‘I feel…’ to ease into it.

You’re taking a brave step in being open, and that’s something to be proud of!
text:
Kulungile ukuziva ngalondlela! Qala kancinci kwaye usebenzise 'Ndiziva...' ukungena kancinci kuyo.

Uthatha elona nyathelo linesibindi ekubeni ukhululeke, kwaye yinto ekufanele uzingce ngayo!

SourceText: Others in the household don’t think it’s a good idea to talk about emotions
text: Abanye ekhayeni abacingi ukuba licebo elihle ukuthetha ngemvakalelo

SourceText:
It’s okay if not everyone agrees at first.

Try talking with them about why it might help, and gently encourage them to give it a try.

You’re doing something important by supporting open communication!
text:
Kulungile ukuba abantu bonke abavumelani ekuqaleni.

Zama ukuthetha nabo ngokuba kutheni inokunceda, kwaye bakhuthaze ngokuthambileyo ukuba bazame.

Wenza into ebalulekileyo ngokuthi uxhase ukuthetha okukhululekileyo!

SourceText: Others in the household don’t think it’s a good idea to talk about negative emotions
text: Abanye ekhayeni abacingi ukuba licebo elihle ukuthetha malunga ngemvakalelo ezingalunganga

SourceText:
It’s okay to feel unsure about this.

You can explain that talking about sad or angry feelings helps us feel better and brings us closer to others. Encourage them to give it a try.

You’re showing care by helping your child understand their feelings.
text:
Kulungile ukuziva ungaqinisekanga ngalento.

Ungaccisa ukuba ukuthetha malunga nokukhathazeka okanye imvakalelo zomsindo kuyasinceda sizive ngcono kwaye kusisondeza kwabanye. Bakhuthaza ukuba bakhe bazame.

Ubonakalisa ukukhathala ngokunceda umntwana wakho aqonde imvakalelo zakhe.

SourceText: I don’t know how to name some of the feelings I am experiencing
text: Andiyazi ukuba ndingazibiza njani ezinye imvakalelo endizivayo

SourceText:
That’s okay! It can be hard to find the right words.

Try combining the names of emotions you do know. 

You’re doing a great job by simply acknowledging your feelings!
text:
Kulungile! Kusenokubanzima ukufumana amazwi alungileyo.

Zama ukudibanisa amagama emvakalelo ozaziyo. 

Wenza umsebenzi omhle xa uziqonda kalula imvakalelo zakho!

SourceText:
Many parents face this. It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time with our teens when we have more than one child.

You can also spend time with all your children together — just make sure everyone can join in.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the ‘Play’ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Abazali abaninzi bajongana nalento. Kubanzima ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo xa sinabantwana abangaphezulu komnye.

Ungachitha ixesha nabantwana bakho bonke kunye - qiniseka nje wena ukuba wonke umntu uyazibandakanya.

Udinga iingcebiso ngemidlalo? Cofa iqhosha 'dlala' ezantsi kwe App.

SourceText: My child was surprised or suspicious
text: Umntwana wam ebemangalisekile okanye ebekrokra

SourceText: Remember, it takes some time for your child to get used to seeing you praise them. The more time you spend with them, the better it will go!
text: Khumbula, kuthatha ixesha ukuba umntwana wakho akuqhele ukubona wena umncoma. Okukhona uchitha ixesha kunye naye, nezinto zizohamba ngcono!

SourceText: My child did not like it
text: Umntwana wam akayithandanga lento

SourceText: It happens – just be patient. Try to remember to ask your child to decide what activity they would like to do with you. This will make it more likely that they enjoy the activity too.
text: Iyenzeka - nyamezela. Zama ukukhumbula ukuba ucele umntana wakho azikhethele ukuba ngowuphi umdlalo angathanda ukuwenza kunye nawe. Lento inokwenza ukuba bawonwabele umdlalo ngakumbi nabo.

SourceText:
That’s completely normal. If you’re not used to giving praise, it can feel strange at first. Start with something simple, like “Thanks for helping with that.” 

The more you praise, the easier it becomes — and it really helps build your child's confidence.
text:
Iqhelekile ngokupheleleyo lonto. Ukuba awuyiqhelanga into yokuncoma, ingavakala ingaqhelekanga ekuqaleni. Qala ngento elula, enjengo "Enkosi ngokunceda ngalonto."

Ukuncoma ngakumbi, kwenza izinto zibelula - kwaye kuyanceda ukwakha ukuzithemba komntwana wakho.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to remember to praise our teens. Next time you spend one-on-one time with your teen, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say, “Thank you for spending time with me!”
text: Kunganzima ngamanye amaxesha ukukhumbula ukuncoma abantwana bethu. Kwixesha elilandelayo nichitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho, zama ukucinga ngento enye onokuba ncoma ngayo. Unako nokuthi, “Enkosi ngokuchitha ixesha kunye nam!!"!

SourceText: My teen was surprised or suspicious
text: Umntwana wam ebemangalisekile okanye ebekrokra

SourceText: Remember, it takes some time for your teen to get used to seeing you praise them. The more time you spend with them, the better it will go!
text: Khumbula, kuthatha ixesha ukuba umntwana wakho akuqhele ukubona wena umncoma. Okukhona uchitha ixesha kunye naye, nezinto zizohamba ngcono!

SourceText: My teen did not like it
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo akayithandanga lento

SourceText: It happens – just be patient. Make sure to keep spending time with your teen, so they will value your opinion more and more. When your praise is genuine, you will see the benefits soon!
text: Iyenzeka into enjalo - yiba nomonde. Qinisekisa ukuba uqhubeka uchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuze azokuluxabisa uluvo lwakho nangakumbi. Xa ukuncoma kwakho kusuka entliziyweni, uza kubona imivuzo kungekudala!

SourceText: It felt unnatural
text: Ivakele ingaqhelekanga

SourceText:
That’s completely normal. If you’re not used to giving praise, it can feel strange at first. Start with something simple, like “Thanks for helping with that.” 

The more you give praise, the easier it becomes — and it really helps build your teen’s confidence.
text:
Iqhelekile ngokupheleleyo lonto. Ukuba awuyiqhelanga into yokuncoma, ingavakala ingaqhelekanga ekuqaleni. Qala ngento elula, enjengo "Enkosi ngokunceda ngalonto."

Ukuncoma ngakumbi, kwenza izinto zibelula - kwaye kuyanceda ukwakha ukuzithemba komntwana wakho.

SourceText: It can be really hard to find time during the day, with work, chores, and everything else. You're doing great, try to do it when you can!
text: Ewe, kunganzima kakhulu ukufumana ixesha emini, ngumsebenzi, imisebenzi yasekhaya, kunye nezinye izinto! Wenza umsebenzi omhle, zama ukuwenza ngeloxesha unako!

SourceText: My child did not follow my instructions even when I used the tips
text: Umntwana wam khange alandele imiyalelo yam nokuba naxa ndisebenzise iingcebiso

SourceText: Children need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient. Try again. Remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction.
text: Ndiyazi; abantwana bethu badinga ukufunda ukulandela imiyalelo. Yiba nomonde, zama kwakhona, khumbula ukubancoma ngalo lonke ixesha belandela umyalelo.

SourceText: It is hard to remember to use positive words when giving instructions
text: Kunzima ukukhumbula ukusebenzisa amagama alungileyo xa unika imiyalelo

SourceText: This is difficult to remember for everyone at first! Try to take a breath before giving an instruction. Also, remember to be gentle with yourself when you forget. It happens to everyone!
text: Kunzima ukukhumbula kumntu wonke ekuqaleni. Zama ukuphefumla phambi kokuba unike umyalelo. Kanjalo, khumbula ukuzixolela xa ulibele. Iyenzeka kumntu wonke!

SourceText: I shouted at my child when they behaved negatively instead of giving them a positive instruction for what they should do
text: Ndimngxolisile umntwana wam ngokuziphatha ngendlela engalunganga endaweni yokuba ndimnike umyalelo olungileyo wokuba yintoni ekufanele ayenze

SourceText: It’s difficult to give instructions in a calm way when we are still angry. Try to find a time when you are calm or to use a calming strategy like Take a Pause before you introduce a positive instruction.
text: Kunzima ukunika imiyalelo ngendlela ezolileyo xa sisacaphukile. Zama ukufumana ixesha xa uzolile okanye usebenzise indlela ezolileyo enjengokuthi Nqumama kancinci phambi kokuba wazise ngomyalelo olungileyo.

SourceText: That is okay. Some days are full and we forget things. When you have a bit of time, you can try it then. Every time you practise, it helps.
text: Kulungile. Ezinye intsuku zixakekile kwaye siyazilibala izinto. xa unexeshana, ngoko ungazama. Ngalo lonke ixesha uzama, kuyanceda.

SourceText: My child could not agree on one specific rule or routine
text: Umntwana wam khange avumelane kumgaqo omnye ocacileyo okanye isiqhelo

SourceText:
When creating rules, it is important to think about the age of each child so you can come up with routines that are fair for their age.

This is most important for bedtime, the time to come home, and household chores.

Try to agree on a small and meaningful incentive that can motivate your child to follow the rule. Consider options like playing a 15-minute board game with the family, choosing the food for the day, or enjoying a 30-minute trip to the park.

What other ideas come to mind?
text:
Xa sisakha imigaqo, kubalulekile ukuba sicinge ngeminyaka yomntwana ukwenzela uze nenkqubo eziyilungeleyo ngokweminyaka yabo.

Lento ibalulekile ngexesha lokulala, ngexesha lokubuyela ekhaya, kwaye nangemisebenzi yasekhaya.

Zama ukuvumelana ngento encinci kwaye nesibonelelo esinentsingiselo esinokuthi simkhuthaze umntwana wakho alandele imigaqo. Qwalasela izinto ezifana nokudlala umdlalo webhodi wemizuzu eyi 15 kunye nosapho, ngokukhetha ukutya kosuku, okanye nonwabele imizuzu eyi - 30 yohambo oluya epakini.

Zeziphi ezinye iingcebiso ezifikayo engqondweni?

SourceText: My child felt it was unfair that they had to follow the rule while I didn’t have to follow it
text: Umntwana wam ebesiva kungalunganga ukuba alandele umgaqo ngelixa ndinganyanzelekanga ndiwulandela

SourceText:
Our children learn best from us.

The more we follow the rules, the more they will follow the rules too.

You can adapt the rule to make sure that it is something everyone can follow.
text:
Abantwana bethu bafunda kakuhle kuthi.

kukhona silandela umgaqo, kuba kukhona nabo bezakuyilandela imigaqo nabo.

Ungawulungiselela umgaqo ukuqinisekisa ukuba uyinto wonke umntu angakwazi ukuwulandela.

SourceText: I felt uncomfortable because I think an adult should create the rule, not my child
text: Ndizive ndingakhululekanga kuba ndicinga umntu omdala kufuneka enze imigaqo, ingabi ngumntwana wam

SourceText:
When we create rules together with our children, we build trust and an open relationship with them.

The rules we set will be more realistic and your child will be more willing and able to follow the rules.

Think about the valuable lessons you’ll be teaching Your Child, such as working together and taking initiative.
text:
Xa sisenza imigaqo sisonke nabantwana, sakha ukuthemba kunye nobudlelwane obukhululekileyo nabo.

Imigaqo esithi siyibetke izaba yenyanisekileyo kwaye umntwana wakho uzakufuna kangangoko kwaye akwazi ukuyilandela.

Cinga ngemfundiso ezinexabiso ozakuzifundisa umntwana wakho, ezifana nokusebenza kunye kwaye nithathe inxaxheba.

SourceText: The rule needs to be specific and realistic. Make sure to have a rule that can be kept easily, like having one meal together every Sunday instead of every night. Do you need to be more flexible about the rules?
text: Umthetho kufuneka ucace uze kwaye unyaniseke. Qinisekisa ukuba umgaqo obekwayo unokugcinwa lula, njengokutya isidlo kunye qho ngeCawa endaweni yokwenza oko ubusuku ngabunye. Ingaba udinga ukuba ufikeleleke ngakumbi malunga nomgaqo?

SourceText: I got very angry when my child broke the rule
text: Ndiye ndanomsindo kakhulu xa umntwana wam ofikisayo eye wophula umgaqo

SourceText:
When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better. 

Next time your child makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!
text:
Xa sithi sime phambi kokuba siphendule, oko kusinceda sizole kwaye siphendule ngcono. 

Xa ephinda ekucaphukisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo, zama ukuma kancinci kuqala. Nokuthatha umoya kungenza umehluko omkhulu!

SourceText: My child got very angry with me after I gave the consequence
text: Umntwana wam uye wacaphuka kakhulu kum emveni kokuba ndimnike umphumela

SourceText: Try talking to them about why the rule is important to follow. You can also discuss the consequence with them, so that they feel it is fair and realistic.
text: Zama ukuthetha naye malunga nokuba kutheni ukulandela imithetho kubalulekile ukuyilandela. Ningathetha nangemiphumela, ukwenzela bayive ukuba ilungile kwaye iyinyani.

SourceText: I introduced the consequence without first discussing it with my child
text: Ndiye ndabazisa ngemiphumela ngaphandle ngokuxoxa nomntwana wam kuqala

SourceText: Can you create a consequence if this happens again? When we establish a consequence together with our child, the consequence will be more realistic, and our child will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Ungakwazi ukwenza imiphumela ukuba oku kunophinda kwenzeke? Xa sisenza imiphumela kunye nabantwana bethu, imiphumela iyanyaniseka ngakumbi, kwaye abantwana bethu bakulungele ngakumbi kwaye bayayilandela imigaqo.

SourceText: I forgot to follow through with the consequence
text: Ndiye ndalibala ukulandelela ngokunika umphumela

SourceText: We all make mistakes! The more consistent we are with our consequences, the more likely our children will choose to behave positively in the future.
text: Sonke siyazenza iimpazamo! Okukhona sizinzile kwimiphumela yethu, kokukhona kunokwenzeka ukuba bakhethe ukuziphatha kakuhle kwixa elizayo abantwana bethu.

SourceText: Even with the consequence, my child still does not follow the rule
text: Nokuba iziphumo zikhona, umntwana wam akayilandeli imigaqo

SourceText: My child suggested being hit as a negative consequence
text: Umntwana wam ucebise ukuba ukubethwa ngumphumela ongalunganga

SourceText:
Children can be used to seeing hitting as the only possible consequence for breaking rules. 

Brainstorm some calm consequences with them that could help them understand that they have done something wrong. These will be more effective and will set positive examples!
text:
Abantwana bangasetyenziswa ukuba babone ukubetha njengomphumela owodwa onokwenzeka xa wophule imigaqo. 

Cingani ngemiphumela ezolileyo kunye nabo enokubanceda baqonde ukuba benze into engalunganga. Ezizinto zizoba zihle kwaye zizokuba yimizekelo elungileyo!

SourceText: I got very angry when my teen broke the rules
text: Ndiye ndanomsindo kakhulu xa umntwana wam ofikisayo eye wophula umgaqo

SourceText:
When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better.

Next time your teen makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!
text:
Xa sisithi nqumama phambi kokuba siphendule, kuyasinceda ukuba sizole kwaye siphendule ngcono.

Kwixesha elizayo xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekwenza ubenomsindo, zama ukuthi nqumama kuqala. Nokuphefumla nzulu kwenza umahluko omkhulu!

SourceText: My teen got very angry with me after I gave the consequences
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo uye wanomsindo kakhulu emva kokuba ndimnike isiphumo

SourceText:
When your teen gets angry, you might need to walk away until you are both calm.

Check to make sure your consequence is fair and reasonable. Listen to your teen’s explanation and react calmly as you agreed if they used the “Safety Word” or broke a rule in order to stay safe.
text:
Xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo esiba nomsindo, kungadingeka umshiye yedwa nide nobabini nibe nizolile. 

Hlola ukuba umphumela awufumeneyo ulungile kwaye unobulungisa. Mamela ingcaciso yomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye uphendule ngokuzolileyo njengokuba uvumile ukuba basebenzise u “Igama Lokhuseleko” okanye wophule umthetho ukwenzela ahlale ekhuselekile.

SourceText: I introduced the consequence without first discussing it with my teen
text: Ndiye ndazisa ngesiphumo ngaphandle kokuyithetha nomtwana wam ofikisayo kuqala

SourceText: Can you make a consequence if this happens again? When we establish a consequence together with our teens, the consequence will be more realistic and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Ungakwazi ukuwusebenzisa lomphumela xa kusenzeka oku kwakhona? Xa sisakha imiphumela kunye nabantwana bethu, Imiphumela izakuba yinyani ngakumbi kwaye abantwana bethu bazakukulungela ukuyenza nangakumbi kwaye bakulungele ukulandela imigaqo.

SourceText: Even with the consequence, my teen still does not follow the rule
text: Nokuba iziphumo zikhona, umntwana wam akayilandeli imigaqo

SourceText:
If your child keeps breaking rules, you might need to spend more positive time with them. 

Try to keep going with your other goals — like self-care, one-on-one time, and praise. All these skills will help your child feel more loved and secure… and you, less stressed!
text:
Ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo eqhubeka esophula imithetho, kusenokufuneka uchithe ixesha elilungileye kunye nangakumbi. 

Zama ukungaziyeki ezinye injongo onazo – njengoku uzinyamekela, ubene xesha enilichitha kunye no kuncoma. Zonke ezi zakhono ziza kumnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ethandwa kwaye ekhuselekile... kwaye nawe ungaxinezelekanga kakhulu!

SourceText: We only created a negative consequence, not a positive consequence
text: Siye senza iziphumo ezingalunganga, engezizo iziphumo ezilungileyo

SourceText: It can be difficult to think of positive consequences sometimes. Positive consequences will encourage your teen to take more responsibility and you will see the difference!
text: Kunganzima ukucinga ngemiphumela elungileyo ngamanye amaxesha. Imiphumela elungileyo ingamkhuthaza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba athathe uxanduva nangakumbi kwaye uzakuwubona umahluko!

SourceText: My teen suggested being hit as a negative consequence
text: Umntwana wam uye wacebisa ukuba ukubethwa sisiphumo esingalunganga

SourceText:
Teens can be used to seeing hitting as the only possible consequence for breaking rules.

Think together of some calm consequences that could help them understand that they have done something wrong. These will be more effective and will set positive examples!
text:
Abantwana abafikisayo bangayiqhela ukuba babone ukubetha njengomphumela olungileyo kuphela ukwaphula imigaqo.

Ukucinga kunye ngeminye imiphumela ezolileyo enokwazi ukubanceda baqonde ukuba benze into engalunganga. Ezizinto zizoba zizakusebenza kwaye zingakha imizekelo elungileyo!

SourceText: It takes some practice to use all four steps of problem-solving. Next time a problem comes up, look at the four steps together with your child — it will make a big difference!
text: Kungangumzamo othile ukusebenzisa onke lamanyathelo mane okusombulula ingxaki. Kwixesha elizayo xa kuvela ingxaki, jonga amanyathelo amane kunye nomntwana wakho - kuya kwenza umahluko omkhulu!

SourceText: My child got angry and did not want to talk about the problem
text: Umtwana wam uye wanomsindo kwaye khange afune ukuthetha malunga ngengxaki

SourceText: Your child might be too overwhelmed to deal with the problem right away. Recognise and name their emotions. Create a time later in the day or week to discuss and solve the problem together. By giving your child time, the problem can be solved well.
text: Umntwana wakho unokunzinyelwa kukujongana nengxaki ngoko nangoko. Qaphela kwaye uchaze iimvakalelo zabo. Yenza ixesha emva kwemini okanye iveki ukuxoxa kwaye nisombulule ingxaki kunye. Ngokunika umntwana wakho ixesha, ingxaki ingasombululeka kakuhle.

SourceText: I forgot the steps of problem-solving
text: Ndiwalibele amanyathelo okusombulula ingxaki

SourceText: It takes some practice to use all four steps of problem solving. Next time a problem comes up, look at the four steps together with your teen – it will make a big difference!
text: Kungangumzamo othile ukusebenzisa onke lamanyathelo mane okusombulula ingxaki. Kwixesha elizayo xa kuvela ingxaki, jonga amanyathelo amane kunye nomntwana wakho - kuya kwenza umahluko omkhulu!

SourceText: I started with the solutions right away
text: Ndiye ndaqala ngezisombululo ngoko nangoko

SourceText:
When we have a problem, we often want to get to the quickest end result and can forget about the steps. 

To come up with the best solution together, it is helpful to first have a full understanding of the problem and the different solutions.
text:
Xana sinengxaki, sisoloko sifuna ukufumana isiphumo esikhawulezileyo kwaye silibale malunga namanyathelo. 

Ukuza nezisombululo esona silungileyo kunye, kuluncedo kakhulu ukuyiqonda ngokuphelelyo ingxaki kuqala kunye nezisombululo ezohlukeneyo.

SourceText: We could not agree on a solution to try out and we got into an argument
text: Asikwazanga ukuvumelana ngesisombululo esinokusizama kwaye siye sangena kwingxabano

SourceText:
Sometimes it can be difficult to agree with everyone in the family, especially if everyone is not calm. 

You can try one solution first, then try another if needed. If things get stuck, take a break and come back later to decide together.
text:
Ngamanye amaxesha kunganzima ukuvumelana nomntu wonke kusapho, kanye xa abantu bengazolanga. 

Ungazama isisombululo sibesinye kuqala, ulandele ngozama esinye ukuba kuyadingeka. Ukuba izinto ziye zaxinga, thatha ikhefu kwaye ubuye emva kwexesha ukuze nizokuthatha isigqibo kunye.

SourceText: I got angry when the problem came up and I forgot to use the problem-solving steps
text: Ndiye ndanomsido xa bekuvela ingxaki ndaza ndalibala ukusebenzisa amanyathelo okusombulula ingxaki

SourceText: When a problem comes up, we all get angry or stressed sometimes. Remember, when you feel angry or stressed, you can take a pause to help you stay calm and then solve the problem you are facing.
text: Xa kuvela ingxaki, ngamanye amaxesha sonke siye sibe nomsindo okanye sibe noxinezeleko. Khumbula, ukuba xa uziva unomsindo okanye unoxinzelelo, ungathi nqumama ukuze ikuncede uhlale uzolile kwaye ulandele ngokusombulula ingxaki enijongene nayo.

SourceText: My teen got angry and did not want to talk about the problem
text: Umtwana wam okanye umntwana ofikisayo uye wanomsindo kwaye khange afune ukuthetha ngengxaki

SourceText: Your teen might be too overwhelmed to deal with the problem right away. Recognise and name their emotions. Create a time later in the day or week to discuss and solve the problem together. By giving your teen time, the problem can be solved well.
text: Umntwana wakho unokunzinyelwa kukujongana nengxaki ngoko nangoko. Qaphela uze uyazi indlela avakalelwa ngayo, uze wenze ixesha kamva kwangolo suku okanye kuloo veki ukuze nithethe nize niyisombulule kunye ingxaki. Ngokwenza ixesha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, ingxaki ingasonjululwa kakuhle.

SourceText: I forgot to do the activity
text: Ndilibele ukwenza umsebenzi

SourceText: It happens! Life gets busy. You could try setting a reminder or choosing a regular time each week to make it easier to remember.
text: Iyenzeka! Ubomi buyaxakeka. Ungakwazi ukuzama ukwenza isikhumbuzo okanye ukhethe ixesha eliqhelekileyo kwiveki nganye ukwenza izinto zibelula ukuzikhumbula.

SourceText: I didn’t understand the activity
text: Khange ndiwuqonde umsebenzi

SourceText: It didn't feel right to take time for myself
text: Khange ndizive kamnandi ukuzithathela ixesha lam

SourceText: That’s okay. Self-care can mean different things to different people. It could be anything that helps you feel calmer or more rested — like taking a short walk, listening to music, or having a quiet moment to yourself. Try starting small.
text: Kulungile. Ukuzikhathalela kungathetha izinto ezohlukeneyo kubantu abohlukeneyo. Ingayiyo nantoni na ekuncedayo uzive uzolile okanye uphumle ngokwaneleyo - njengokuthatha uhambo olufutshane, umamela umculo, okanye ubenomzuzwana othecwaka wedwa. Zama ukuqala kancinci.

SourceText: I was too tired to do anything for myself
text: Bendidinwe kakhulu ukuba mandizenzele into

SourceText: That’s completely understandable. When you’re exhausted, self-care can feel like one more task. Start with something very small — even resting is a form of self-care.
text: Iyavakala ngokupheleleyo lonto. Xa udiniwe, ukuzikhathalela kungavakala njengomnye umsebenzi owongezelekileyo. Qala ngento encinci kakhulu - kwanokuphumla lolunye uhlobo lokuzikhathalela.

SourceText: I don’t have time to play with my child
text: Andinalo ixesha lokudlala nomntwana wam

SourceText:
It’s okay to feel that way. There are many small ways to spend time with your children!

You can talk with your child while doing other things. For example, ask them to name colours or things they see while you walk or ride the bus.

Even short moments like these show your child you care.
text:
Kulungile ukuziva olohlobo. Zininzi indlela ezincinci onokuchitha ngazo ixesha nabantwana bakho! 

Ungathetha nomntwana wakho ngexesha usenza ezinye izinto. Umzekelo, mcele ukuba achaze amagama emibala okanye izinto azibonayo ngexesha nihamba okanye nikhwele ibhasi.

Kwanemizuzu emifutshane enjengale ibonisa umntwana wakho ukuba uyakhathala.

SourceText: My child is not interested in playing with me
text: Umntwana wam akanawo umdla wokudlala kunye nam

SourceText:
You may feel hurt because Your Child doesn't want to spend time with you. It is important to give them their space, be patient and listen to what is happening to her or him. Open yourself to opportunities to play with them another time.

Sometimes, Your Child just needs time to engage with you. It helps to remain calm, patient, and kind while you try to connect with Your Child.

As girls and boys grow, they may want independence from you. That’s normal! You can support them to find friends based on their interests.
text:
Ungaziva ubuhlungu ngoba umntwana wakho engafuni ukuchitha ixesha kunye nawe. Kubalulekile ukubanika umtyhi, yibanomonde kwaye umamele ukuba yintoni eyenzekayo kuye. Zivulle kumathuba okudlala kunye naye ngelinye ixesha.

Ngamanye amaxesha, umntwana wakho udinga ixesha lokuqhagamshelana nawe. Kuyanceda ukuba uhlale uzolile, unomonde, kwaye unobubele ngexesha uzama ukunxibelelana kunye nomntwana wakho.

Njengokuba abantwana abangamantombazana nabangamakhwenkwe bekhula, bangathanda ukungaxhomekeki kuwe. Iqhelekile lonto! Ungabaxhasa ukufumana abahlobo ngokusekelwe kwimfuno zabo.

SourceText: My child keeps getting hurt from exploring or making new friends
text: Umntwana wam uhlala ebuhlungu ekufuneni ukuhlola okanye ukwenza abahlobo abatsha

SourceText:
It can be hard to see your child get hurt or feel sad.

But making mistakes is how children learn and grow. As long as you’re aware of what they’re doing and keep them safe from danger, they’ll be okay.

Encourage them to try fun, safe activities with others – and praise them when they do well.

Let your child know you trust them to be safe and follow your rules.
text:
Kunganzima ukubona umntwana wakho ebuhlungu okanye ekhathazekile.

Kodwa ukwenza impazamo kulapho abantwana bafunda khona kwaye bakhule. Egameni lokuba usazi ukuba yintoni abayenzayo kwaye bagcine bekhuselekile kwingozi, bazakulunga.

Bakhuthaze bazame imidlalo, ekhuselekileyo kunye nabanye - kwaye ubancome xa benze kakuhle.

Mazise umntwana wakho ukuba uyamthemba ukuba uzakukhuseleka kwaye alandele imigaqo.

SourceText: My child likes competitive activities but gets angry when they lose or need to share the win
text: Umntwana wam uyayithanda imidlalo yokhuphiswano kodwa ubanomsindo xa engaphumelelanga okanye kudingeka ukuba abelane nabanye ngokuphumelela

SourceText:
Competitive games can be tough if your child doesn’t like losing.

Once they’ve calmed down, talk about what it means to win or lose kindly.

Try suggesting activities where you work together instead of compete.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the ‘Play’ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Imidlalo yokhuphisana inokuba nzima ukuba umntwana wakho akakuthandi ukungaphumeleli

Kanye xana umoya uphantsi, thetha malunga nokuba kuthetha ukuthini ukuphemelela okanye ukungaphumeleli ngobunono.

Zama ukucebisa ngemidlalo apho nisebenza kunye endaweni yokukhuphisana.

Udinga iingcebiso ngemidlalo? Cofa iqhosha 'Dlala' ezantsi kweApp.

SourceText: My teenager did not want to follow the instruction
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo khange afune ukulandela umyalelo

SourceText: Our teens need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient, try again, and remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction!
text: Abantwana bethu badinga ukufunda ukulandela imiyalelo. Yiba nomonde, zama kwakhona, kwaye ukhumbule ukubancoma ngalo lonke ixesha belandela umyalelo!

SourceText: I did not find time to spend one-on-one time with my teen
text: Khange ndilifumane ixesha lomnye nomnnye kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo

SourceText:
Getting used to giving positive instructions can take time. Try finding a few minutes each day to practise. 

You can try asking your teen or someone else to help out with a chore at home, so you have more time to practice this new skill.
text:
Ukuqhela ukunikisa imiyalelo elungileyo kungathatha ixesha. Zama ukufumana imizuzwana yokuziqhelanisa ngosuku ngaluny ngalinye. 

Ungazama ukucela umntwana wakho ofikisayo okanye omnye umntu akuncedise ngemisebenzi ekhayeni, ukwenzela ukuba ubenexesha elithe krantya lokuziqhelanisa nesisakhono sitsha.

SourceText: I gave a negative instead of a positive instruction
text: Ndiye ndamnika umyalelo ongalunganga endaweni yomyalelo olungileyo

SourceText: Yes, it takes some time to get used to giving positive instructions – it is really worth trying again! Think about the behaviour you would love to see your teen do more and think of positive ways to give that instruction!
text: Ewe, kuthatha ixesha ukuqhelana nokunika imiyalelo elungileyo – kubalulekile ngenene ukuzama kwakhona! Cinga malunga nesimilo ongathanda ukusibona sisenziwa ngumntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye ucinge ngeendlela elungileyo zokunika loo myalelo!

SourceText: I shouted at my teen instead of giving them a positive instruction for what they should do
text: Ndimngxolisile umntwana wam ofikisayo endaweni yokuba ndimnike umyalelo olungileyo wokuba makenze ntoni

SourceText: It is difficult to come up with instructions while we are still angry. Try and find a time when you are calm to introduce a positive instruction to your teen.
text: Kunzima ukuza nemiyalelo ngexesha sisenomsindo. Zama kwaye ufumane ixesha xa uzolile wazise ngomyalelo olungileyo kumntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: I was afraid my teen would think I was weak
text: Bendisoyika kuba umntwana wam ebezocinga ukuba ndibuthathaka

SourceText: Sharing feelings helps your teen to be aware and learn to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It is up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later by saying, *“I am feeling angry/stressed now. Could you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight.”
text: Ukwabelana ngeemvakalelo kunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ayazi kwaye afunde ukwenza into efanayo. Usenokwazi ukukhetha ukuba ziingakanani iinkcukacha ozakwabelana ngazo malunga nemeko. Kuxhomekeke kuwe! Unako nokukhetha ukuphendula imibuzo ngelinye ixesha ngokuthi, *“Ndiziva ndinomsindo/ndinoxinzelelo ngoku. Ingaba ungakwazi ukundinika ixeshana? Singathetha malunga nalento ngakumbi ngokuhlwa".

SourceText: My teen and I could not agree on a rule
text: Mna nomntwana wam ofikisayo asikwazanga ukuvumelana ngomgaqo

SourceText: Think about whether the rule is reasonable. Can your teen follow it? When making rules as a family, it helps to think about your teen, how old they are and what is important to them.
text: Cinga malunga nokuba lomthetho umlungele. Ingaba umntwana wakho ofikisayo angakwazi ukuwuthobela? Xa nisenza imithetho njengosapho, kuyanceda ukucinga ngomntwana wakho ofikisayo, mingaphi iminyaka yakhe, kwaye nezinto ezibalulekileyo kuye.

SourceText: My teen felt it was unfair that they have to follow the rule while I dont have to follow it
text: Umntwana wam ofikisayo ebeziva kungalunganga ukuba alandele umthetho ngelixa ndinganyanzelekanga ndiwulandele

SourceText:
We should always remember that our teens learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, the more they will follow the rules, too.

You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow.
text: Kumele sikhumbule ngalo lonke ixesha ukuba abantwana bethu abafikisayo bafunda kakhulu kuthi. Kukhona silandela imithetho nangakumbi, kukwakukhona nabo bezakuyilandela imithetho.

SourceText: I felt uncomfortable because I feel that I should be the one making the rule, not my teen
text: Ndizive ndingakhululekanga kuba ndizive ingathi kufanele ukuba ndim obeka umgaqo, ingabingumntwana wam ofikisayo

SourceText: When we make rules together with our teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rules.
text: Xa sisenza imigaqo kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo, lonto inceda usapho lwazane omnye nomnye ngcono. Imigaqo izakunyaniseka nangakumbi, kwaye abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazakufuna kangangoko kwaye bakwazi ukulandela imithetho.

SourceText: My partner felt uncomfortable, because they feel that they should be the one making the rule, not the teen
text: Iqabane lam liye laziva lingakhululekanga, ngenxa yokuba liziva ukuba lilo elimele ukuba libeka umthetho, kungenguye umntwana ofikisayo

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rules.
text: Xa sisenza imigaqo kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo, lonto inceda usapho lwazane omnye nomnye ngcono. Imigaqo izakunyaniseka nangakumbi, kwaye abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazakufuna kangangoko kwaye bakwazi ukulandela imithetho.

SourceText: When we tried to set a rule, we got into an argument
text: Xa besizama ukubeka umthetho, siye saxabana

SourceText: Was your teen in a good mood when you tried to set the rule? It is best to set rules when the situation is calm. If you or your teen are tired or hungry, it is better to talk about rules at a later time.
text: Ingaba umntwana wakho ofikisayo ebekwi mo entle xana ubuzama ukubeka umthetho? Kuhle ukubeka imithetho xa imeko izolile. Ukuba wena okanye umntwana wakho nidiniwe okanye nilambile, kungcono ukuthetha ngemithetho ngelinye ixesha.
