text: Ngoku masibuyele emva ku @data.characters.f1_son_18.name kunye notata wakhe, @data.characters.f1_father.name:

SourceText: Let's think about this story.
text: Makhe sicinge ngeli bali.

SourceText:
It is time to learn and practise!

Plan a calm consequence for your teenagers arguing with each other during dinner.
text:
Lixesha ngoku lokufunda kwaye nokuzama!

Cwangcisa iziphumo ezolileyo zabantwana bakho abafikisayo abaxambulisanayo ngelixa lesidlo sasebusuku.

SourceText:
It is time to learn and practise!

Your home activity this week is to try using one **positive consequence** when your teen does something well — and one **negative consequence** when they break a household rule.
text:
Lixesha lokufunda kwaye nokuzama!

Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kuleveki kukuzama ukusebenzisa **isiphumo esilungileyo** sibesinye xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo enze into kakuhle - kwaye **isiphumo esilunganga** esisodwa xa esophule umthetho wasekhaya.

SourceText:
**Remember, consequences should be:** 
⚖️ FAIR (not too harsh) 
💨 IMMEDIATE (do it straight away) 
🎯 CONSISTENT (same every time)
text:
**Khumbula, iziphumo ingayi:** 
⚖️ IKULUNGELE (ingabi qatha) 
💨 NGOKO NANGOKO (Yenze ngokonangoko) 
🎯 IBESISIGXINA (ifane ngalo lonke ixesha)

SourceText: When consequences are calm, clear, and agreed on together, teens are more likely to follow the rules. They will feel respected, not punished, and that is the best way to help our teens learn.
text: Xa iziphumo zizolile, zicacile, kwaye nibe nivumelene kunye, abantwana abafikisayo kubalula nokulandela imithetho. Baya kuziva behloniphekile, bengohlwaywa, kwaye leyo yeyonandlela yokunceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singohlahlo lwabiwo mali lwentsapho.

Iintsapho ezininzi zinoxinzelelo ngenxa yemali, ingakumbi ukuba abantwana abafikisayo baqhubeka becela izinto! 

Xa sisenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kunye, singavumelana ngendlela yokwenza yokusebenzisa KUNYE nokonga ukuthintela uxinzeleko kwaye basebenzele ukufezekissa amaphupha osapho lwabo.

SourceText: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?
text: Xa siba bandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali, bafunda ukuthatha uxanduva ngemali kwaye basebenzele amaphupha. Yinto leyo esiyifuna sonke ngabantwana bethu abafikisayo, akunjalo?

SourceText:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem!

Including @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name – let's have a look:
text:
Kunganzima ukuziphilisa nyanga zonke. Iintsapho ezininzi zinale ngxaki! 

Kuquka u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - makhe sijonge:
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Dealing with money challenges, like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name's situation, is stressful. 

A family budget can help @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - and YOU!
text:
Ukujongana nemiceli mingeni yemali,njengemeko ka@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name, yenza uxinzelelo..

Uhlahlo labiwo mali losapho lunganceda u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name-kunye NAWE!

SourceText:
**There are four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK 
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE 
⚒️  Step 3: BUILD 
📋 Step 4: PLAN
text:
**Sinamanyathelo amane okwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali lwentsapho.**

💭 Inyathelo 1: CINGA 
🎯 Inyathelo 2: KHETHA 
⚒️  Inyathelo 3: YAKHA 
📋 Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA

SourceText:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.
text:
**Inyathelo 1: CINGA**
Cinga ngento oyichitha kuyo imali nyanga nganye.

SourceText:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text:
- Zoba imifanekiso yezinto zonke enichitha kuzo imali nosapho lwakho nyanga nganye.
- Bhala ecaleni komfanekiso ngamye ukuba into nganye yimalini ngenyanga (akukho mfuneko yokuba wabelane ngamanani ukuba awufuni).
- Dibanisa yimalini oyichithayo ngenyanga.

SourceText:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.
text:
**Inyathelo 2: KHETHA**
Cinga ngezidingo neemfuno zakho.
- IMFUNO yinto onokuphila ngaphandle kwayo. 
- ISIDINGO yinto ongakwazi ukuphila ngaphandle kwayo.

SourceText:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?
text:
Jongani kuluhlu lwenu lwezinto enisebenzisa imali kuzo nize nikhethe:

- Zeziphi IZIDINGO eningenakuphila ngaphandle kwazo? Kutheni?
- Zeziphi IIMFUNO eningathanda nje ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekanga? Kutheni? 
- Zeziphi izinto eninokuzama ukungachithi mali eninzi kuzo?

SourceText:
**Step 3: BUILD**
Make a budget!
text:
**Inyathelo 3: YAKHA**
Yenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali!

SourceText:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is R2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is R100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.
text:
- Bhala phantsi ukuba uyimalini umvuzo wakho wenyanga.
- Thathani amatye athile okanye iimbotyi okanye nantoni na enamasuntswana amaninzi - lo ngumvuzo wakho wenyanga. Umzekelo: Ukuba umvuzo wakho yi-R2000, yaye uneembotyi ezingama 20, mbotyi nganye yi-R100.

SourceText:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
text:

Cwangcisa indlela onokonga ngayo imali, ukuze uhlangabezane neemeko ezingxamisekileyo ukuze ufikelele ekuwaqondeni amaphupho osapho lwakho!

SourceText:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called “emergencies”.
- Add a circle called “family goals”.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.
text:
Ukuba unokonga neyona mali incinci ukwenzela ikamva okanye imeko engxamisekileyo - ingenza umahluko omkhulu ngokuhamba kwexesha. 

- Yongeza isangqa esibizwa ngokuba “ungxamiseko”.
- Yongeza isangqa esithi “amaphupho osapho.”
- Ngoku zama ukuhamba hambisa imali yakho ukuze wonge intwana nyanga nganye ukwenzela amaphupha kunye nongxamiseko.

SourceText:
CONGRATULATIONS!!! 🎉 

You have made your budget! Remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

We all have dreams for our family, just like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!

Let’s come up with some ideas for savings goals for you to make a budget plan.

SourceText: Here are this week’s takeaway skills to help you budget and save!
text: Nazi izakhono zaleveki ohamba nazo ezikuncede kuhlahlo labiwo mali kunye nokonga!

SourceText:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.
text:
Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya kukuzama ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kwakhona - kwelixesha KUNYE nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nosapho!

Yinto ebalulekileyo neyonwabisayo ukuyenza nosapho lwakho - ithatha malunga nemizuzu eyi 30.

SourceText:
**Remember to use the four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK (what do we spend on now?)
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE (what are our needs and wants?)
⚒️ Step 3: BUILD (make your budget) 
📋 Step 4: PLAN (plan for emergencies and family goals)
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa amanyathelo amane ngokwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho.**

💭 Inyathelo 1: CINGA (siyichitha kwintoni imali ngoku?)
🎯 Inyathelo 2: KHETHA (zeziphi izidingo nemfuno zethu?)
⚒️ Inyathelo 3: YAKHA (yenza uhlahlo labiwo mali lwakho) 
📋 Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA (cwangcisela ungxamiseko namaphupha osapho)

SourceText:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!
text:
Xa sibandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali, bafunda izakhono zobomi ezibalulekileyo, njengokuqonda umehluko phakathi kwemfuno nezidingo.

Ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali nabantwana bakho kuyanceda sibone ukuba sonke sidinga ukwenza ukhetho olunzima ngamanye amaxesha, kodwa lonto iyasinceda sibe nemali eyaneleyo ekupheleni kwenyanga - kunye nokuqonda amaphupha wethu!

SourceText:
Today’s topic is about solving problems.

Every family has challenges, but working together helps us find calm, good solutions — at home, at school, in the community and online.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokusombulula ingxaki.

Zonke intsapho zinemicelimngeni, kodwa ukusebenzisana kunye kuyasincedisa sifumane ukuzola, izisombululo ezilungileyo --- ekhaya, esikolweni, ekuhlaleni kunye nakwi-intanethi.

SourceText:
As parents, we sometimes think we need to fix every problem by ourselves. And teens can think the same! 

By involving your teen, you strengthen your relationship as well as their confidence. Together you can overcome anything.
text:
Singabazali, ngamanye amaxesha sicinga ukuba kufuneka silungise zonke iingxaki ngokwethu. Kwaye nabantwana abafikisiyo bacinga ngendlela enye!

Ngokubandakanya umntwana wakho ofikisayo, uqinisa ubudlelwane kwakunye nokuzithemba kwabo. Ninonke ningoyisa yonke into.

SourceText:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. 

Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!
text:
Xa kusenzeka into embi, amaxesha amaninzi siye sikhathazeke siphinde sisole. Kodwa okona kufunwa ngabantwana bethu abafikisayo ngumntu onokubanceda bafumane isisombululo bekunye.

Bamamele, wamnkele indlela ababona ngayo nabaziva ngayo izinto, ubabulele ngokuba bekuthemba.

Ukufundisa abantwana bakho abafikisayo ngokuqubisana neengxaki kunganceda ubomi babo bonke. Eso sipho!

SourceText:
**Here are some examples of problems other parents solved with their teens:**

- My teenager does not want to go to school
- My teenager is on their phone too much
- I am worried my teenager will get pregnant or will get someone pregnant
- I am worried about what my teen does online
- My teenager is hanging out with bad friends
- My teenager is not doing their school work
- My teenager might be using drugs
text:
**Nantsi eminye imizekelo yeengxaki ezisonjululwa ngabanye abazali nabantwana babo abafikisayo:**

- Umntwana wam ofikisayo akafuni ukuya esikolweni
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo ubasefowunini kakhulu
- Ndinexhala lokuba umntwana wam ofikisayo angakhulelwa okanye akhulelise umntu
- Ndinexhala ngezinto ezenziwa ngumntwana wam ofikisayo kwi-intanethi
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo uhlala nabahlobo abangalunganga
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo akawenzi umsebenzi wakhe wesikolo
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo kusenokwenzeka usebenzisa iziyobisi

SourceText: Your home activity this week is to teach your teenagers the steps for problem-solving and use them together when a problem comes up.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kuleveki kukufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendlela zokusombulula ingxaki aphinde azisebenzise zonke xa iingxaki zifika.

SourceText:
**Remember to use the four steps of problem-solving:** 
💭 Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
📋 Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions) 
⚒️ Step 3: TRY IT (try one) 
🎯 Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa amanyathelo amane ukusombulula ingxaki:**
💭 Inyathelo 1: YAZI (chonga ingxaki)
📋 Inyathelo 2: YISOMBULULE (chonga isisombululo)
⚒️ Inyathelo 3: YIZAME (zama enye)
🎯 Inyathelo 4: YIVAVANYE (zama esinye isisombululo ukuba le ayisebenzi)

SourceText:
We all have problems, but they don’t define us! You can choose to address challenges and try different solutions together with your teen. 
This shows your teen that they are never alone and gives them a key skill to use at home, with friends, and for life!
text:
Sonke sinengxaki, kodwa azichazi ubuthina! Ungakhetha ukuchaza imiceli mingeni uzame izisombululo ezahlukeneyo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.
Oku kubonisa ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akayedwa kuphinde kubanike isakhono esingundoqo abanokusisebenzisa ekhaya, nezihlobo, nasebomini!

SourceText:
Today’s topic is about teen safety.

Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe. Talking together about safe and unsafe places — and how to prevent problems — really helps.

This guidance is important for both girls and boys so they learn to make responsible choices that protect themselves and others.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singokuseleko lomntwana ofikisayo.

Abantwana bafikisayo banokuchitha ixesha elinzi ngaphandle kwekhaya okanye kwi-intanethi, apho kuzima khona kuthi ukuba sibagcine bekhuselekile. Ukuthetha kunye ngokhuseleko kunye nendawo ezingakhuselekanga - kunye nendlela zokunqanda iingxaki - kuyanceda kakhulu.

Esi sikhokelo sibalulekile kumantobazana kunye nakumakhwenkwe ukuze afunde ukwenza ukhetho olufanelekileyo olukhuselayo kunye nabanye.

SourceText:
Sometimes our teens notice things about their surroundings that we don’t. By talking and listening, we can better understand their world and guide them through challenges – including the risks they face online.

With our support, they can learn to stay safe and make good decisions.
text:
Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana bethu abafikisayo baqaphela izinto ezisingqongileyo thina esingaziboniyo. Ngokuthetha nangokumamela, singaliqonda ngcono ihlabathi labo kwaye sibakhokhele kwimiceli mngeni – kuquka imingcipheko abajongene nayo kwi intanethi.

Ngenxaso yethu, bangafunda ukuhlala bekhuselekile kwaye benze izigqibo ezifanelekileyo.

SourceText:
The most important way to help keep your teen safe is to make sure that they know they can talk to you about anything. 

Work with your teen to notice risks — like when someone pressures or makes them feel uncomfortable, online or offline.

Boys experience sexual abuse almost as often as girls, so talk openly with both about staying safe.

Let’s look at examples of risky situations to help you spot warning signs.
text:
Eyona ndlela ibalulekileyo yokunceda umntana wakho ofikisayo ahlale ekhuselekile kukuqinisekisa ukuba bayayazi bangathetha nawe malunga ngayo nantoni na.

Sebenzisana nomntana wakho ofikisayo ukuqaphela imingcipheko - efana naxa umntu emcinizelela okanye emenza azive engakhululekanga kwi-intanethi okanye ngaphandle kwe intanethi.

Amakhwenkwe axhatshazwa ngokwesondo phantse rhoqo njengamantombazana, ngoko ke thetha nabo bobabini ngokuphandle ngokuhlala bekhuselekile.

Masijonge imizekelo yeemeko ezinomngcipheko ukukunceda ubone iimpawu ezilumkisayo.

SourceText:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand the dangerous situations they could get into! 

Let’s get practical now, and draw two maps of safe and unsafe places:
- 🗺️ A map of our community
- 🌐 A map of apps/websites we use online
text:
Ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile, kufuneka siqonde iimeko eziyingozi abanokungena kuzo!

Makhe senze ngoku, kwaye sizobe iimephu ezimbini zeendawo ezikhuselekileyo neziyingozi:
- 🗺️ Imephu yendawo esihlala kuyo
- 🌐 Imephu yee-app/iiwebhsayithi esizisebenzisayo kwi intanethi

SourceText: Step 1: Draw all the important places in your community.
text: Inyathelo 1: Zoba zonke indawo ezibalulekileyo kwindawo ohlala kuyo.

SourceText:
Draw a map of your teen’s community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits.

Remember to include your phone and other internet devices, as mobile apps and websites are also places where you and your teen can spend a lot of time!
text:
Zoba imephu yokuhlala yomntwana wakho ofikisayo, enemifanekiso yazo zonke iindawo eziphambili njengezitrato, indlu yakho, isikolo, iivenkile, iindawo ezindwendwelwa ngabantwana bakho abafikisayo.

Khumbula ukubandakanya ifowuni yakho kunye nezinye izixhobo ze-intanethi, njengee-apps eziphathwayo kunye neewebhusayithi zikwayindawo apho wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ninokuchitha ixesha elininzi!

SourceText: Step 2: Choose which places are safe and unsafe.
text: Inyathelo 2: Khetha indawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga.

SourceText:
- Which areas on your map are safe for teenagers? CIRCLE these
- Which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers? CROSS those off
- What makes a place safe or unsafe? Is this different for boys and girls? 
- Looking at the places you mapped out, what rules could you come up with together to help your teen stay safe?
text:
- Zeziphi iindawo kwimephu yakho ezikhuselekileyo kumntwana wakho ofikisayo? Faka isangqa kuzo
- Zeziphi iindawo kwimephu yakho ezingakhuselekanga kumntwana wakho ofikisayo? Zihlabe ezo
- Yintoni eyenza indawo ikhuseleke okanye ingakhuseleki? Ingaba ezi zahlukile kumakhwenkwe namantombazana?
- Xa ujonga iindawo ozizobele ngaphandle, yeyiphi imigaqo eninokuza nayo kunye ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ahlale ekhuselekile?

SourceText: Step 3: Identify where you can get support.
text: Inyathelo 3: Chonga apho ungafumana inkxaso.

SourceText:
Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.

- Where can you and your teen get support when you face a crisis? MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper.
- Remember your phone and other internet devices. There is a lot of support available online!
text:
Ngamanye amaxesha, singazifumana sisengxakini.

- Wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ningayifumana phi inkxaso xa nijamelene negxaki? PHAWULA ezo ndawo ngento encinci enjengelitye okanye iphephatshana.
- Khumbula ifowuni yakho kunye nezinye izixhobo zeinternet. Kukho inxaso eninzi ekhoyo kwiinternet!

Now that we understand our safe and unsafe places better, let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

SourceText: Here are some skills to help you keep your teen safe!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono ezingakunceda ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile!

SourceText:
If you have not done it together yet, this week's home assignment is to make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places:

1) 🗺️ Map of your community
2) 🌐 Map of apps and websites your teen uses

Make sure you are both happy with the safety plan. What really matters is that you talk with your teen as you do this – often teens know much more than we do about where it is safe and unsafe!
text:
Ukuba anikayenzi kunye okwangoku, umsebenzi wasekhaya waleveki kukwenza imephu ezimbini kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga.

1) 🗺️ Imephu yendawo ohlala kuyo
2) 🌐 Imephu yee-app neewebhsayithi ezisetyenziswa ngumntwana wakho ofikisayo 

Qinisekisa ukuba nobabini nonwabile ngesicwangciso sokhuseleko. Eyona nto ibalulekileyo ngokwenene kukuba uthethe nomntwana wakho ofikisayo njengoko usenza lento – abantwana abafikisayo basoloko besazi kakhulu ngendawo ekhuselekileyo nengakhuselekanga!

SourceText: When teens know they can turn to us without fear, they are more likely to ask for help when something feels unsafe - both offline and online. Talking calmly and making safety plans together builds trust that lasts.
text: Xa abantwana abafikisayo besazi bangeza kuthi ngaphandle koloyiko, badla ngokucela uncedo xa besiva into engathi ayikhuselekanga-noba ku kungaphandle kwi intanethi nangaphakathi. Ukuthetha ngomoya ozolileyo nokwenza izicwangciso ezikhuselekileyo kunye nokwakha ukuthembana okungapheliyo.

SourceText:
Today’s lesson is about helping children follow rules and instructions by using consequences.

Consequences are the good or negative things that happen after a child’s actions. When children don’t follow a rule, giving consequences can help them learn and take responsibility for their actions.
text:
Isifundo sanamhlanje singokunceda abantwana balandele imithetho kunye nemiyalelo ngokusebenzisa iziphumo.

Iziphumo zizinto ezilungileyo okanye ezimbi ezenzekayo emva kwezenzo zomntwana. Xa abantwana bengawulandeli umthetho ukunika iziphumo kunokubanceda bafunde kwaye bathathe uxanduva ngesenzo sabo.

SourceText:
Some consequences happen naturally – like when a toy breaks, it can’t be used.

Others are set by you to help your child follow rules (_“if you don’t pack away your toys, you can’t play with them tomorrow”_). 

Let’s see how @data.characters.f1_father.name uses consequences to help his son, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name, follow instructions:

Ezinye zibekiwe nguwe ukunceda umntwana wakho alandele imithetho(_" ukuba awuzibeki kude izinto zakho zokudlala, awuzokwazi ukudlala ngazo ngomso"_)

@data.characters.f1_father.name did this by:
- 😌 Staying calm 
- 🤝🏾 Involving @data.characters.f1_son_5.name in planning the consequence 
- 💜 Giving a fair consequence related to the behaviour (no playing after dinner if you don't put toys away) 
- ⭐ Being consistent by following through with the consequence

SourceText: Here are some easy steps to use consequences when your child does not listen.

SourceText:
Your home activity is to discuss one household rule that your child finds hard to follow and agree on a fair consequence together. 

Remember, if you praise your child when they follow rules, you will see more positive behaviour in your home.

Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukuxoxa ngomthetho omnye wasekhaya umntwana wakho awufumanisa kunzima ukuwulandela kwaye nivumelane ngesiphumo esifanelekileyo kunye.

Khumbula, ukuba uyamncoma umntwana wakho xa elandela imithetho uya kubona ukuziphatha okulungileyo kwikhaya lakho.

SourceText:
Today’s topic is about helping your child learn and grow.

Play helps children learn what is expected and how to get along with others. It supports their development, both in school and at home.

This is true for all children, including those who are shy, have a disability, or struggle to keep up in class.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuncedisa umntwana wakho afunde kwaye akhule.

Ukudlala kunceda abantwana bafunde oko kulindelekileyo kunye nokwazi ukusebenzisana nabanye. Ixhasa indlela abakhula ngayo, esikolweni nasekhaya.

Oku kuyinyani kubantwana bonke, ukuquka nabo banentloni, nabakhubazekileyo, okanye batsala nzima kwigumbi lokufundela.

SourceText:

- 🏆 **Letting him lead**: She allowed him to ask questions and explore. Curiosity helps children become confident and creative.
- 👏🏾 **Praising him**: She showed him that being curious and trying ideas is a good thing.

- 🏆 **Wamvumela akhokele**: Uye wamvumela abuze imibuzo kwaye aphonononge. Ukuthanda ukwazi kunceda abantwana bazithembe kwaye babenobuchule.

SourceText:
Today we are learning to talk about feelings with our children. 

Recognising emotions in ourselves and our children is an important skill.

Talking about feelings helps our children learn to express and manage their emotions – even the difficult ones.

Ukuthetha malunga nemvakalelo kunceda abantwana bethu bafunde ukuveza kwaye bakwazi ukumelana nemvakalelo zabo - nezinzima ngakumbi.

How we give instructions matters – children are more likely to listen when we say what we want them to do, not what not to do.
Instead of “Don’t touch that!”, try: “Please only touch things that belong to us.”

Endaweni yokuba "sukubamba lonto!", zama: "Ndicela ubambe izinto ezi zezethu qha."

SourceText:
I'M HUNGRY! HE HIT ME! I'M BORED!
Sound familiar? 

Every family faces challenges. Learning how to solve problems together with your child can help you when you have conflict in your home. 

It also teaches your children how to solve problems on their own. This will set them up for success throughout their life. What a gift!

Ikwafundisa abantwana bakho ukuba bangayisombulula njani ngokunokwabo. Oku kuya kubamisela impumelelo ebomini babo bonke. Esinjani isipho!

**In the next story, @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name and @data.characters.f2_son_8.name use four steps to solve a problem:**

1) 💡 KNOW IT: Talk to your child about what the problem is
2) 🔧 SOLVE IT: Think of possible solutions together
3) 🎯 TRY IT: Choose one solution to try
4) 💭 REFLECT: See if it worked. If not, try another solution

SourceText:
Today’s topic is about creating rules and routines with our children.

When rules are part of a routine, they’re easier to follow. They help children understand what’s expected, take responsibility, and stay safe – all while making the home more calm and peaceful. And that’s something we all want, right?

SourceText:
Today’s topic is praise.

Praise is a great way to guide our teens in all parts of life — at home, with friends, or online.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:

Ukuncoma yindlela elungileyo yokukhokela abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuzozonke indawo zobomi --- ekhaya, kunye nezihlobo okanye kwi-intanethi.

Ukuba siyabancoma abantwana bethu abafikisayo xa benze into kakuhle, sizakubabona besenza ngakumbi nangakumbi izinto ezilungileyo!

SourceText: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!

- Being kind to someone

- Keeping to the agreed phone screen time

- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'

SourceText: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour — both online and offline — the more positive behaviour you will see.
text: Khumbula, ukuncoma sisixhobo esinamandla. Okukhona uthatha ingqalelo kwindlela yokuziphatha entle, kuzozombini kwi-intanethinangaphandle kwe-intanethi - kukona uzakubona isimilo esilungileyo ngakumbi.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about rules.

Rules help teens understand what is expected of them – both online and offline.

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!
text:

SourceText: When we make rules together, teens see that rules are not there to control them but to make sure everyone is safe and respected. Setting rules as a family helps build trust and responsibility for both teens and parents.

Umntana wakho ofikisayo usenokuziva engakhululekanga okanye esoyika ukuqala loncoko kunye nawe.

SourceText:
Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and it’s okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, it’s also okay not to know everything. You can say, “I’m not sure - let me find out and tell you later.”
text:
Ewe, kungadingeka uyiqale incoko - kwaye kulungile ukuziva unentloni. Thetha ngokungafihlisiyo kwaye usebenzise amagama afanelekileyo nakwawaphi na amalungu omzimba enixoxa ngawo (njenga mabele, ilungu lobudoda, okanye ilungu lobufazi).

Ungazama kunye nomhlobo kwaye ubuze umsebenzi weziko lezempilo okanye unontlalontle ngenkcukhacha ezithe vetshe. okukona usazi, okungcono ukunceda umntana wakho ofikisayo.

Kwaye khumbula, kukwalungile ukungazi yonke into. Ungathi, '' Andiqinisekanga - mandike ndifumanise ndikuxelele mva.''.

That’s not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.
text:
Ayilunganga ncam lonto 

Abantwana abafikisayo badinga ukufunda malunga notshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane kwangethuba, kwenzele balungele kwaye benze ukhetho olulungileyo.

Xa ufumanisa uba umntana wakho ofikisayo wabelana ngesondo, zama ukuzola kwaye wabelane ngenkxalabo zakho ngoku thambileyo. Ukuba nomsindo kungenza nzima ukuba umntana wakho ofikisayo athethe nawe.

SourceText:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.
text:
Iminyaka eyi 10 kulapho abantwana abaninzi beqala ukufikisa, ke ngoko kudingeka babe sebeqonda ukuba imizimba neemvakelelo zabo zisenokutshintsha njani. 

Oku kungabanceda bamelane ngcono nemizwa yesondo ngokuphephileyo.

SourceText:
That's right! 

Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.
text:
Ilungile lonto! 

Iminyaka eyi 10 kulapho abantwana abaninzi beqala ukufikisa, ke ngoko kudingeka babe sebeqonda ukuba imizimba neemvakalelo zabo zisenokutshintsha njani.

Oku kungabanceda ukuba bamelane ngcono nemvakalelo zabo zesondo ngokukhuselekileyo.

SourceText:
It’s good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your child’s questions.

You don’t need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.
text:
Kulungile ukuqala ukuthetha malunga notshintsho lomzimba kunye nobudlelwane kwange thuba - ngokuphendula imibuzo yomntana wakho ngokuthambileyo.

Akukho sidingo sokucacisa yonke into. Nika nje iimpendulo ezilula, eziyinyani ezingqamene neminyaka nokuqonda kwabo.

SourceText: Many parents also ask:
text: Abazali abaninzi bayabuza nabo:

SourceText:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices – both online and offline – they often act more responsibly.
text:
Mhlawumbi lento ayinokusebenza.

Xa sizama ukulalwula kakhulu, abantwana abafikisayo banokwenza okwahlukile koko sikufunayo.

Kodwa xa sibakhokela kwaye sibanika ithuba lokuba bazikhethele --- zombini kwinternet nagaphandle kweinternet-- bahlala besenza izinto ngokuthembakeleyo.

SourceText:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we can’t control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrong – and help them feel confident to make good decisions in their day-to-day life and online.
text:
Lento ingangasebenzi.

Abantwana abasafikisayo bafumana uxinzelelo kwaye nolwazi olusuka kwindawo ezininzi esingenakuzilawula.

Nje ngabazali singaba nqwanqwada kwaye sibalungise bakwazi okulungileyo nokungalunganga.-Sibancede bazive benokuzithemba ekwenzeni izigqibo ezilungileyo kubomi babo bemihla ngemihla nakwi intanethi.

SourceText:
That’s right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help when something happens online, at school, or in the community..

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.
text:
Ilungile lonto.

Xa umntana wakho ofikisayo eziva ethenjiwe, baye bakuthembe ngakumbi kwaye baze kuwe ngengcebiso okanye uncedo xa kukho into eyenzekayo kwi intanethi, esikolweni, okanye ekuhlaleni.

Bancome kwaye ubabulele xa besabelana. Kuphephe ukugweba, ukwenzele bazive bekhuselekile ukuthetha nawe kwakhona.

SourceText:
That’s right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when there’s a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequences—and you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.
text:
Kulungile.

Iziqgibo ezilungileyo zifumaneka ekucingisiseni kakuhle kwiziphumo. Thetha ngoku phandle nomntana wakho ofikisayo xa kukho ingxaki. Mamelanani nikhangele isisombululo kunye.

Umceli mngeni ngamnye lithuba lokufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba zonke izenzo zinezi phumo kwaye funeka nijongane nazo niliqembu.

Khumbula ukuncomana omnye nomnye ngokusebenzisana kwimeko ezinzima kunye.

SourceText:
That’s right.

To stay safe, your teen needs to know the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones..

Respectful relationships feel caring, safe, and fair – both online and offline. Unhealthy ones involve pressure, discomfort, or feeling unsafe.

No one should be forced to do something they’re not okay with.
text:
Kuhle oko.

Ukuhlala ukhuselekile, umntana wakho ofikisayo funeka awazi umahluko phakathi kokuziphatha okuhloniphekileyo kunye nobudlelwane, kunye nezingalunganga.

Ubudlelwane obuhloniphekileyo uziva ukhathalelekile, ukhuselekile kwaye kulinganwe - kuzo zombini kwi internet nangaphandle kwe intanethi. Ezingalunganga kubakho uxinzelelo, uhlupho, uzive ungakhuselekanga.

Akukhomntu kufuneka enyanzelisiwe ukuba enze into angayifuniyo.

SourceText: Another common question among parents:
text: Omnye umbuzo oqhelekileyo phakathi kwabazali:

SourceText:
That’s not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sex—from school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesn’t mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.
text:
Lonto ayilunganga ncam.

Abantwana abafikisayo bava izinto ezininzi malunga nesondo - esikolweni, kubahlobo, okanye kumakhasi onxibelelwano. Ezinye zazo azilunganga.

Ukwazi malunga nesondo ayitsho ukuba babelana ngesondo. Ulwazi olulungileyo lunceda bona ukuba bahlale bephephile kwaye beqonda kakuhle ukuba kutheni kufuneka belindile ukwabelaneni ngesondo kungaba sisigqibo esihle.

Ukungabi nalo olulwazi, kungabangela bajongane neengxaki, nje ngongazi ukuba kwenzeka njani ngokukhulelwa okanye ubungozi besondo.

SourceText:
That’s not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problems—and this can lead to risky situations.
text:
Lento ayilunganga ncam.

Umntwana wakho ofikisayo anganayo inkwenkwe okanye intombazana kwaye angakuxeleli.

Ukuba ubenza bakufihlele, banganga kwazi ukuza kuwe ngemibuzo okanye iingxaki-kwaye lonto ingakhokelela kwizimo ezinobungozi.

SourceText:
That’s right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things they’re not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.
text:
Lento ilungile.

Abantwana abafikisayo bayazibonela ukuba bangobani. Bajonga ebahlobeni nakwi midiya ukufumana iimpendulo, kwaye bangaziva becinezelekile ukuba benze into abangalungelanga ukuyenza.

Thetha pholileyo nomntana wakho ofikisayo malunga nokulinda nokwabelana ngesondo bade bazive bekulungele, bekubudlelwanwe obukhuselekileyo kwaye aziqondisise kakuhle iziphumo. Qwalasela ekubakhokheleni ngokuzolileyo ekwenzeni izigqibo ezilungileyo.

SourceText:
Now let's practise making rules.

Write down one important rule you would like to make with your teenager – you will be doing this as your home practice this week.
text:
Ngoku masiziqhelanise nokwenza imigaqo.

Bhala phantsi umgaqo ubemnye obalulekileyo ongathanda ukuwenza kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo - Uzakuyenza lento njengento yokuziqhelanisa ekhaya kuleveki.

SourceText:
**Here are some examples of rules other families made:**
- ⚽ Teen can play outside after finishing homework
- 👪🏽 All family members eat dinner together
- 💬 We talk about anything that worries us – no keeping secrets.
- 📱 We use phones responsibly – no phones at bedtime and only private accounts.
- ❤️ We treat others with respect, online and offline.
text:
**Nantsi eminye imizekelo yemigaqo eyenziwa zezinye iintsapho.**
- ⚽Abantwana abafikisayo bangadlala phandle xa begqibile ukwenza umsebenzi wasekhaya
- 👪🏽Onke amalungu osapho atya isidlo sangokuhlwa kunye
- 💬 Sithetha ngento yonke esixhalabisayo - akugcinwa zimfihlo. 
- 📱Sisebenzisa ifowuni ngenkathalo - akuvumelekanga fowuni ngexesha lokulala, kuphela i akhawunti zabucala.
- ❤️ Siphatha abanye ngentlonipho, kwi intanethi nangaphandle kwe intanethi.

SourceText:
This week's home activity is to set one rule together with your teen.

Remember to praise your teen afterwards!
text:
Owaleveki umsebenzi, kukwenza umthetho ube mnye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Khumbula ukumncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo emva koko!

SourceText:
**Remember to use your skills for rule setting:**

⚽ Team rules: When making the rule, work together like a team. 
🔎 Real rules: Agree on real rules that are clear and fair. For example, you could agree that everyone says where they are going before leaving the house.
🎉 Praise rules: Praise when rules are followed!
💛 Relationship rules: Make rules to guide safe choices in relationships and online.
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa izakhono zokuseka imithetho:**

⚽ Imithetho yeqela: Xa nisenza umthetho, sebenzani njengeqela.
🔎 Imithetho eyiyo: Vumelanani kwimithetho eyiyo ecacileyo kwaye elungileyo. Umzekelo, ningavumelana ekubeni wonke umntu atsho ukuba uyaphi phambi kokuba ahambe endlini.
🎉 Imithetho yokuncoma: Ncoma xa imithetho ilandelwe!
💛 Imithetho yobudlelwane: Yenza imithetho yokukhokhela ukhetho olukhuselekileyo kubudlelwane nakwi intanethi.

SourceText: Clear, simple rules made together with your teen are not about control - they are about keeping them safe and building responsibility. When teens understand the reasons behind the rules, they are more likely to follow them.
text: Imithetho ecacileyo nelula eniyenze kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ayikho ngokulawula - ingokubagcina bekhuselekile kunye nokwakha uxanduva. Xa abantwana abafikisayo beziqonda izizathu ezingaphaya kwemithetho, bangakwazi ukuyilandela kakuhle.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about spending one-on-one time with our teens. 

Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our teens never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo. 

Ukuba ngumzali kunganzima. Ngamanye amaxesha kuvakala ngathi abantwana bethu abasimameli.

Kodwa ingcali zisibonisa ukuchitha imizuzwana embalwa ngosuku nigxile kwixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kungancedisa ukwakha ukuthembana kunye no thando.

SourceText:
Let's discuss, what is one-on-one time?

One-on-one time is when you focus on your teens, without distractions like TVs or phones. Let your teens take the lead in choosing what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can spend fifteen minutes a day together, but even five minutes a day is really good.
text:
Makhe sixoxe, Yintoni ixesha lomnye nomnye?

Ixesha lomnye nomnye kuxa unike ingqwalasela kubantwana bakho abafikisayo, ngaphandle kweziphazamisi ezinje ngo MABONAKUDE okanye ifowuni. Yeka abantwana bakho abafikisayo bakhokhele ekukhetheni into eninokuyenza okanye eninokuthetha ngayo.

Kungakuhle ukuchitha imizuzu elishumi elinesihlanu ngosuku kunye, kodwa nemizuzu emihlanu ngosuku nayo ilungile.

SourceText: Helping with schoolwork is one simple way to start. Let’s see how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name do this together.
text: Ukuncedisa kumsebenzi wesikolo yenye indlela elula yokuqalisa. Masibone u@data.characters.f3_uncle.name kunye no@data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name bayenza njani lento kunye.

SourceText: _5 minutes later..._
text: _Emva kwemizuzu eyi 5..._

SourceText:
@data.characters.f3_uncle.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name showed us how one-on-one time can be simple and fun. They listened to each other, shared tasks, and laughed together.
Now, let’s think about what made this time successful for them — and why it matters when both mothers and fathers spend time with their teens.
text:
U@data.characters.f3_uncle.name kunye no@data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name usibonisile ukuba ixesha lomnye nomnye lingalula njani kwaye lonwabise. Bayamamelana bebodwa, babelane ngomsebenzi, kwaye bahleke kunye.
Ngoku, masicinge ukuba yintoni eyenze elixesha libeyimpumemlelo kubo --- kwaye kutheni kubalulekile xa bobabini oomama kunye nootata bechitha ixesha kunye nabantwana babo abafikisayo.

SourceText: Here are some skills to help guide you in spending one-on-one time with your teen!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono ezinokunceda ukukukhokhela ekuchitheni ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText:
Spending one-on-one time with your teen can be hard to plan. 

**Remember to use your new skills:**
📅 **DAY**: try to do it every day
⚽ **PLAY**: let your teen choose how to spend one-on-one time  
🎯 **STAY**: be focused on your teen
📓 **LEARN**: connect with your teen — this helps them learn!
text:
Ukuchitha ixesha omnye nomnye nomntwana wam ofikisayo kungabanzima ukucwangcisa.

**Khumbula ukusebenzisa izakhono zakho ezintsha.** 
📅 **IMINI**: zama ukuyenza intsuku zonke,
⚽ **DLALA**: Yeka umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe ukuba kunjani ukuchitha ixesha omnye nomnye, kwaye
🎯 **HLALA**: Iba nengqwalasela kumntwana wakho ofikisayo!
📓 FUNDA: Nxibelelana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo — oku kuyamnceda afunde!

SourceText: This week's home activity is to spend 5-15 minutes of one-on-one time with your teen, every day that you can.
text: Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya kukuchitha imizuzu 5-15 yexesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, ngosuku ngalunye ukuba ninako.

SourceText:
Remember, spending even a few minutes of one-on-one time with your teen each day can strengthen your relationship and build trust. 

Listening closely and sharing small moments helps teens feel loved and supported.
text:
Khumbula, ukuchitha imizuzwana yexesha lomnye nomnye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngosuku ngalunye bungabuqinisa ubudlelwane benu kwaye nakhe ukuthembana. 

Ukumamelela kufutshane kunye nokwabelana ngemizuzu emancinci kunganceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ethandwa kwaye exhasekile.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about taking care of yourself.

We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent!

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our teenagers.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokhathalela isiqu sakho.

Asisoloko sizijonga ngokwaneleyo iziqu zethu. Kodwa oku kubaluleke kakhulu, ingakumbi xa ungumzali! 

Ukunciphisa uxinzelelo lwethu nokuzikhathalela kungasinceda thina KUNYE nabantwana bethu abafikisayo.

SourceText:
Why self-care?

We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent!

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our teenagers.
text:
Kutheni sizikhathalela?

Asisoloko sizikhathalela ngokwaneleyo iziqu zethu. Kodwa oku kubalulekile kakhulu, ingakumbi xa ungumzali!

Ukunciphisa uxinzelelo lwethu nokuzikhathalela kungasinceda thina KUNYE nabantwana bethu abafikisayo.

SourceText:
Today’s topic is dealing with crises.

All families face crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help before something happens, we can handle it more calmly and confidently.

Crises can be scary, but you can get through them together.
text:
Isihoko sanamhlanje kukumelana neengxaki.

Zonke iintsapho ziyahlanga neengxaki. Xa silungiselela kunye kwaye sisazi apho sinokufumana khona uncedo phambi kokuba kwenzeke into, singakwazi ukuyiphatha ngokuzolileyo ngakumbi kunye nokuzithemba.

Iingxaki zingoyikisa, kodwa ningadlula kuzo kunye.

SourceText:
Appreciating ourselves is one way to care for ourselves. 

Let’s give it a try.
text:
Ukuzincoma kwethu yindlela enye yokukhathela iziqu zethu. 

Makhe siyizameni.

SourceText: Every crisis is a challenge, but it is also a chance to grow stronger as a family and show your teen that together, you can get through anything.
text: Yonke intlekele ingumceli mngeni kodwa ke ikwalithuba lokukhula somelele njengosapho kwaye ibonisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba nikunye, kwaye ningadlula kuyo nantonina.

SourceText:
Treating ourselves well is another way of looking after ourselves.

You can give yourself a small reward every day, and it does not have to cost a thing!
text:
Ukuziphatha kakuhle iziqu zethu yenye yendlela yokujongana neziqu zethu.

Ungasinika isiqu sakho umvuzo omncinci mihla yonke, kwaye akunyanzelekanga ibe lixabiso lanto!

SourceText:
Crisis can happen to anyone.

Let's see what happened with @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name:
text:
Intlekele ingenzeka nakubani na.

Masibone ukuba kwenzeka ntoni ku@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name nakumzukulwana wake oyintombi, u@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name:

SourceText:
You cannot pour from an empty cup! That is why it is important to care for ourselves. When both parents rest and relax, everyone in the family feels better!
Let’s see how parents can support each other to do this too.
text: Awunakugalela ngekomityi engenanto! Yiyo loo nto kubalulekile ukuba sizikhathalele. Xa bobabini abazali bephumla kwaye wonke umntu kusapho uziva engcono! Masibone indleal abazali abanokuxhasana ngayo omnye komnye ngokwenza oku.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you take care of yourself.
text: Nazi ezinye ingcebiso ezinokunceda wena ukhathalele isiqu sakho.

SourceText:
Remember: Small moments of self-care matter. This week, find time to relax, recognize your efforts, and reward yourself whenever you can.
 
Care for yourself every day. You deserve it!
text:
Khumbula: Imizuzwana emincinci yokuzikhathalela kubalulekile. Kule veki, fumana ithuba lokuphola, qaphelaimizamo yakho kwaye uzivuze kangangoko unako.
 
Zikhathalele yonke imihla. Ukufanele oko!

SourceText:
This was such a difficult situation for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and her @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name!  

Let's think about how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name supported @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name through this crisis.
text:
Le yayiyimeko enzima kakhulu ku@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name kunye no@data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name!

Masicinge ukuba u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name umxhase wamxhasa njani u@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name kule ngxaki.

SourceText:
Remember, taking small moments for self-care helps us stay calm, strong, and connected to our families. 

When we look after ourselves, we are better able to support our teens!
text:
Khumbula, ukuthatha imizuzwana emincinci ngesiqu sakho kuyasinceda sihlale sizolile, somelele kwaye siqhagamshelene nentsapho zethu.

Xa sizijonga iziqu zethu, singakwazi ngcono ukuxhasa abantwana bethu abafikisayo!

SourceText:
Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think. 

Here are some tips to help you deal with a crisis!
text:
Intlekele ingasenza sizive sinomsindo okanye singenancedo. Kodwa kulapho abantwana bethu abafikisayo basidinga ngokwenene sitsale umoya, simamele kwaye sicinge.

Nanga amanye amacebiso anokunceda xa uhlangabezana nentlekele!

SourceText:
It is helpful to practise dealing with crises before something happens.

Let's look at five family crisis examples together. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: CONNECT - BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK
text:
Kuluncedo ukuziqhelanisa nokuhlangabezana nentlekele phambi kokuba kwenzeke into.

Makhe sijonge le mizekelo mihlanu yentlekele zosapho sisonke. Khawuzibone ungumzali: Ungenza ntoni?

SourceText: This week's home activity is to look back at the five crisis examples and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family.
text: Umsebenzi waleveki wasekhaya kukujonga emva kwimizekelo emihlanu yentlekele kwaye sixoxe ukuba singenza njani sisonke ukuba oku kungenzeka kwisihlobo okanye kwilungu losapho.

SourceText:

- Crisis 1: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name shares a nude picture at school
- Crisis 2: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name gets pregnant

😌 PHEFUMLA: Hlala uzolile

SourceText: Remember to support and encourage each other. It is hard to remain calm and listen to each other in a crisis - you can be proud of yourself.
text: Khumbulani ukuxhasana nokukhuthazana. Kunzima ukuhlala uzolile nokuphulaphulana xa kukho intlekele - ungazidla ngawe.

SourceText:
Teens spend lots of time online to learn, have fun, and connect with friends. It can help them grow, but also brings risks.
As parents, we don’t need to know every new app — what matters most is trust. When we listen and guide with care, our teens feel safe to share. 
Let’s keep them safe together!
text:
Abantwana abafikisayo bachitha ixesha elininzi ukufunda kwi intanethi, bonwabe, kwaye banxulumane nabahlobo babo. Ingabanceda bakhule, kodwa kananjalo ize nemingcipheko.
Njengabazali, asidingiukwazi zonke ii-app ezintsha — eyonanto ebalulekileyo kukuthemba. Xa simamela kwaye sikhokhela ngenkathalo, abantwana bethu abafikisayo baziva bekhuselekile ngokwabelana.
Masibagcine bekhuselekile kunye!

SourceText:
When we explore the online world together, we understand our teens better. It shows them that online safety is about trust and support, not control.
Learning simple steps as a family builds confidence and helps teens make good choices.
text:
Xa siphonononga ilizwe le-intaneti kunye, siyabaqonda ngcono abantwana bethu abafikisayo. Ibabonisa ukuba ukhuseleko lwe-intanethi limalunga nokuthemba nenkxaso, hayi ulawulo.
Ukufunda amanyathelo alula njengo sapho kwakha ukuzithemba kwaye ibancedisa abantwana abafikisayo benze ukhetho olulungileyo.

SourceText: For teens, the online world feels just as real and important as the offline world.
text: Kubantwana abafikisayo, ilizwe le-intanethi libenza bazive liyinyani kwaye libalulekile njengelizwe elingaphandle kwe-intanethi.

SourceText: Talking about online safety can feel hard. Many parents don’t know how to begin. A good start is to show interest in what your teen enjoys online. Let’s see how @data.characters.f1_son_14.name’s mother does this…
text: Ukuthetha ngokhuseleko lwe-intanethi lungavakala kunzima. Abazali abaninzi abayazi mabaqale njani. Isiqalo esilungileyo kukubonisa umdla kwinto umntana wakho ofikisayo ayonwabelayo kwi-intanethi. Masibone ukuba uyenza njani umama ka @data.characters.f1_son_14.name lento…
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_14.name’s should not be translated.

SourceText:
We saw how @data.characters.f1_son_14.name and his mother talked openly about his time online.
Being online can help teens learn, create, and connect — but we also need to guide them to stay safe and use it wisely.
text:
Simbonile u @data.characters.f1_son_14.name kunye nomama wakhe bethetha njani kunye ngexesha lakhe lokuba kwi-intanethi.
Ukuba kwi-intanethi kunganceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde, benze, kwaye banxulumane — kodwa kukwadinga nathi sibakhokhele ukuhlala bekhuselekile kwaye beyisebenzisa ngobulumko.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_14.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Here are 4 things you can discuss with your teen about online safety:
text: Nazi izinto eziyi4 ongaxoxa ngazo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nokhuseleko lwe-intanethi:

SourceText:
Sometimes teens run into tricky or even dangerous situations online, and as parents it’s not always easy to know what to do.

Let’s look at 5 examples of online warning signs and how we can support our teens.
text:
Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana abafikisayo bagaxeleka kwimeko ezikhohlasiyo okanye neziyi ngozi kwi-intanethi, kwaye njengabazali akusoloko kulula ukuyazi ukuba mawenze ntoni.

Masijonge imizekelo eyi5 yeempawu zezilumkiso ze-intanethi kwaye singabaxhasa njani abantwana bethu abafikisayo.

SourceText: **Warning Sign 1: Lerato is quiet and withdrawn — a change in mood can signal something is wrong.**
text: **Uphawu lwesilumkiso 1: u-Lerato uthule kwaye urhoxile - ukutshintsha kwemo kubonisa ukuba kukho into engalunganga.**

SourceText: **Warning Sign 2: @data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name hears about a classmate sharing private photos — hearing such stories is a warning sign to talk with your teen about pressure and safety online.**
text: **Impawu zesilumkiso 2: U@data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name uve ngomntana afunda naye oye wabelana ngeefoto zabucala - ukuva amabali anjalo zimpawu zesilumkiso ukuba uthethe nomntana wakho ofikisayo kunye nokhuseleko lwe-intanethi**
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_12.name should not be translated.

SourceText: **Warning Sign 3: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name is being threatened online — fear and threats are warning signs of sextortion or blackmail.**
text: **Uphawu lwesilumkiso 3: u @data.characters.f1_son_18.name uyagrogriswa kwi-intanethi - uloyiko kunye nezigrogriso zimpawu zezilumkiso ze sextortion okanye iblackmail.**
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name should not be translated.

SourceText: **Warning Sign 4: @data.characters.friend_male_4.name shared private pictures at school — sharing or showing harmful images is a warning sign that teens need clear guidance.**
text: **Uphawu lwesilumkiso 4: u@data.characters.friend_male_4.name wabelene ngemifanekiso yabucala esikolweni - ukwabelana okanye ukubonisa imifanekiso eyonzakalisayo zimpawu zesilumkiso ezibonisa ukuba abantwana abafikisayo badinga isikhokhelo esicacileyo.**
note: The string @data.characters.friend_male_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText: **Warning Sign 5: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name gets a message from a stranger while showing his grandpa his game. When strangers offer gifts or ask to chat, it’s a warning sign.**
text: **Impawu zesilumkiso 5: U@data.characters.f2_son_15.name ufumana umyalezo kumntu angamaziyo ngexesha ebonisa utatomkhulu wakhe ngomdlalo wakhe. Xa abantu ongabaziyobenikela ngezipho okanye becela ukuncokola, olo luphawu lwesilumkiso.**
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Keeping your teen safe online starts with understanding their experiences. Let’s come up with easy ways to get involved in your teen’s world online.
text: Ukugcina abantwana abafikisayo bekhuselekile kwi-intanethi kuqala ngokuqonda amava wabo. Masize nendlela ezilula ukuzibandakanya kwilizwe lwe-intanethi lomntana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText:
**Here are some examples of shared online moments:**

🖥️ Watch a short video or song together
💜 Share memes and funny clips
😊 Ask your teen to teach you something online (like posting a family photo)
💬 Ask “Did you see anything fun or interesting online today?” 
📓 Help with research or homework online
text:
**Nantsi eminye imizekelo yamaxesha okwabelana kwi-intanethi:**

🖥️ Bukelani ividiyo emfutshane okanye ingoma kunye
💜 Yabelana ngeememes kunye neeklip ezihlekisayo
😊 Cela umntana wakho ofikisayo akufundise into kwi-intanethi ( njengokufaka ifoto yosapho)
💬 Buza "Ingaba ubone nantoni na ehlekisayo okanye eenza umdla kwi-intanethi namhlanje?"
📓 Uncedo ngophando okanye umsebenzi wasekhaya kwi-intanethi

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you with online safety:
text: Nazi ezinye iingcebiso ezinokunceda ngokhuseleko kwi-intanethi:

SourceText:
This week’s activity is to make an Online Family Agreement with your teen. 

When you create rules together, teens feel part of the team — not controlled — and are more likely to follow them.
text:
Umsebenzi waleveki kukwenza isivumelwano sosapho kwi-intanethi kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Xa niyila imigaqokunye, abantwana abafikisayo baziva beyinxalenye yeqela - hayi ukulawulwa- kwaye kunokwenzeka ukuba bayilandele.

SourceText:
**Sit with your teen and make 5 rules for safe and fun online time.
Stick them on the wall when you’re done!**
👩‍👩‍👦 When both mom and dad join in, your teen sees that everyone helps keep the family safe ❤️.

**Sample Online Family Agreement**

Our family agrees to these rules for safe and fun online time:
🔑 Keep accounts private
🚩 Do not share school, address, or phone number
✅ Ask permission before sharing photos of others
⏰ No phones during meals or at bedtime
☀️ Be kind and respectful to others online
😃 Share one positive or funny post or video with the family each week
💛 Teens: I will talk to an adult if anything feels wrong or uncomfortable online
✨ Parents: I will listen and support my teens without judging or blaming

Signed by:
🔶 Parent / caregiver __________
🔷 Teen __________
text:
**Hlala nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye wenze imigaqo eyi-5 yokhuseleko kunye nexesha elimnandi kwi-intanethi. 
Zincamathelise edongeni xa nigqibile!**
👩‍👩‍👦Xa bobabini umama notata bengenelela, umntwana wakho ofikisayo uyabona ukuba wonke umntu uyancedisa ukugcina usapho lukhuselekile ❤️.

**Isampuli yesivumelwano sosapho kwi-intanethi**

Usapho lwethu luyavumelana nalemigaqo ngexesha elikhuselekileyo nelolonwabo kwi-intanethi:
🔑 Gcina ii-akhawunti ziyimfihlo
🚩 Musa ukwabelana ngesikolo, idilesi okanye inombolo yefowuni
✅ Cela imvume phambi kokuba wabelane ngemifanekiso yabanye
⏰ Azivumelekanga iifowuni ngexesha lesidlo okanye elokulala
☀️ Yiba nobubele kunye netlonipho kwabanye kwi-intanethi
😃 Yabelana ngento ibenye elungileyo, okanye uxhome okuhlekisayo okanye ividiyo kunye nosapho lwakho veki nganye
💛 Abantwana abafikisayo: Ndizakuthetha nomntu omdala ukuba kukho into engalunganga okanye engakhululekanga kwi-intanethi
✨ Abazali: Ndizakubamamela kwaye ndibaxhase abantwana bam abafikisayo ngaphandle ngokugxeka okanye ukusola

Ityikitywe ngu:
🔶 Umzali / umnakekeli __________
🔷 Umntwana ofikisayo __________

SourceText:
Online risks can look different for boys and girls. They may hide or act out in different ways. When we blame or punish, they stop sharing — and the risk grows.

You don’t need to know everything. The best way to keep your teen safe is to build trust, stay calm, and let them know they can always come to you for help.
text:
Imingcipheko ye-Intanethi ingajongeka ngendlela eyahlukileyo kamakhwenkwe namantombazana. Banokuzifihla okanye benze ngendlela ezahlukeneyo. Xa sigxeka okanye sisohlwaya bayayeka ukwabelana - kwaye umngcipheko uyakhula.

Akunyanzelekanga ukuba wazi yonke into. Indlela engcono kugcina abantwana bakho abafikisayo bekhuselekile kukwakha ukuthembana, uhlale uzolile, kwaye bayeke bayazi ukuba bangeza kuwe bafumane uncedo ngalolonke ixesha.

SourceText: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out
text: Ingaba ukulawula uxinzelelo kungakunceda wena nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje kukulawula uxinzelelo. 

Kubalulekile ukwazi indlela yokulawula uxinzelelo lwethu. Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana bethu bangaziphatha ngeendlela ezinokusenza sizive sinoxinzelelo yaye nathi bazali sinokwenza abantwana bethu bazive benonxinzelelo nabo. 

Ngoko, kubalulekile ukuqaphela xa siziva sinoxinzelelo kwaye sime siphefumle. Loo nto iya kunceda ulawule uxinzelelo.

SourceText: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens
text: Yima, phefumla. Ngoku mamela ukuba ukuma ithutyana kunceda njani u@data.characters.media_female_4.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!
text:
Ubomi bunzima ngamanye amaxesha. Phambi kokuba ndizibandakanye kwi @global.app_name, bendihlala ndinengcwangu ngalo lonke ixesha. Bendikhuphela umsindo wam kumntu wonke osekhayeni, ibingengobantwana bam bodwa kodwa nomyeni wam. Babebalekela kude xa ndifika ekhayeni kuba babeyazi ndizakubangxolisa.

Ukufunda ukuma kwaye ndiphefumle bekunzima ekuqaleni. Kodwa ngalo lonke ixesha ndizama, yandinceda ndehlisa umoya. Ngoku abantwana bam abasabalekeli kude xa ndifika ekhayeni kwaye bamamela ngcono kunangexesha bendithethela phezulu nabo!
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father
text: Mamela indlela u@data.characters.media_son_1.name afunde ngayo ukuhlala ezolile kutata wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_son_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing at everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
text:
Naninina ndisenza into engalunganga, utata wam uye abenomsindo kakhulu kum kwaye andibethe. Uye angakwazi nokundimamela kwaye ndiye ndibenomsindo kakhulu kuye nakwabanye abantu.

Ngoku, xa enomsindo uye aphefumle kambalwa kuqala phambi kokuba aphendule. Lonto yenza wonke umntu abenomoya ozolileyo endaweni yokubangela umlo omkhulu.

Indincedile nyhani lonto ekhaya kunye nasesikolweni, ngokuba nam andisabaphoxi bonke abantu kwaye andise ngomntu onengcwangu. Xa ndiziva ndinomsindo nyani okanye ndinoxinzelelo, Nam ndiye ndiphefumle ngohlobo uTata wam enza ngalo. Ndingumntu owohlukileyo.

SourceText: Giving positive instructions really works! Tap play to learn more
text: Ukunika imiyalelo elungileyo kuyasebenza ngokwenene! Cofa udlala ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions.

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do and they do it the way we want them to do it.

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Molweni, Molweni nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje yimiyalelo elungileyo.

Kubalulekile ukunika imiyalelo elungileyo kubantwana bethu, kuba xana sibanika imiyalelo elungileyo bayakwazi kwaye bayayiqonda into esilindele ukuba bayenze kwaye bayenze ngohlobo esifuna bayenze ngalo.

Oko, kwenza wonke umntu ekugqibeleni onwabe.

SourceText: Press play to hear how positive instructions worked for @data.characters.media_female_3.name and her teens
text: Cofa udlala ukuze umamele imiyalelo elungileyo esebenzela u@data.characters.media_female_3.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “don’t do this.”

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day “I really love this new mom,” and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Ngaphambili, ndandiqhele ukukhulisa abantwana bam abafikisayo ngendlela endakhula ngayo: Ndandibaxelela ukuba "sanukuyenza lento, sanukuyenza naleya". Sasiqhele ukuxabana kakhulu, kodwa okunene izinto ziye zatshintsha xa bendifunda malunga nokunika imiyalelo elungileyo.

Ngoku ndigxile kwisimilo endifuna ukusibona, kwaye ndinike imiyalelo ecacileyo kwaye elula kubantwana bam abafikisayo. Kuthathe ixesha ukuthi "ndicela wenze lento" endaweni yokuba "sukuyenza lento"

Abantwana bam abafikisayo kunye nomyeni wam bayandixelela ukuba bayayithanda lendlela yokwenza izinto, kuba ngoku bayayazi into ekufuneka yenziwe. Umntwana wam ofikisayo wathi ngenye imini "Ndiyamthanda ngokwenene lomama wam umtsha," kwaye nowam umthambo woxinzelelo usezantsi kakhulu.

SourceText: Hear how positive instructions helped @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name and her mother
text: Yiva imiyalelo elungileyo indlela emncede ngayo u@data.characters.media_daughter_3.name kunye nomama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was using with @global.app_name. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like “Hmmm okay,” because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted – she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home.

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said “Thank you for being on time.” It was strange, but I liked it.

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.
text:
Ekuqaleni, ndandingakhathali kakhulu ngokuba umama wayesebenzisa i@global.app_name. Kodwa emva koko ndaqala ndabona utshintsho ngendlela umama wam athetha ngayo nathi.

Ngenye imini xana ndandiphuma nabahlobo bam, wathi kufuneka ndifike ekhaya ngo 6pm. Bendinje "Hmmmm kulungile". ngokuba uqhele ukungandiniki myalelo ocacileyo ngento ayifunayo - wayengathethi nto kwaye asuke andingxolise ngokufika ekhaya emva kwexesha.

Xa ndandifika ekhaya malunga no 5pm, umama wam waye wandanga ngobubele wathi "Enkosi ngokufika ngethuba". Yaba ngumnqa lonto, kodwa ndayithanda.

Ukususela ngoko, saba nonxibelelwano olucacileyo ekhaya.
note: The string @global.app_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: How will introducing calm consequences help you and your family? Play to learn more
text: Ingaba ukwazisa iziphumo ngokuzolileyo kunceda njani wena kunye nosapho lwakho? Dlala ukuze ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers, and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje ngeziphumo ezizolileyo.

Kubalulekile ukuba xa sisazisa iziphumo ebantwaneni bethu abafikisayo sibabandakanye nabo, kodwa kukwabalulekile ukuba sibe sizolile xa sisazisa iziphumo.

Oko kuzakusinceda sivumelane ekwaziseni iziphumo ezizolileyo kubantwana bethu, kwaye abantwana bethu kuzokubalula ukuba bazikhumbule xa bebandakanyiwe kwaye lonto izakubenza babenoxanduva.

SourceText: Let's celebrate our journey together and all your achievements!
text: Masivuyisane ngohambo lwethu kunye nempumelelo yakho yonke!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today’s topic is celebration and next steps.

It has been amazing, it has been wonderful having you on this journey. Today we are celebrating our journey together.

Today we are celebrating all the learnings that we have learnt throughout this time together.

Now, let's think of the next steps. What could be the next steps after this? Maybe we are planning to continue all the learnings that we have learnt here. We don't know, we are hoping that for the next steps, the skills, the learnings will continue. We wish you a pleasant, happy, family time. 

Thank you.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje ngumbhiyozo namanyathelo alandelayo.

Bekumnandi, kukuhle ukuba nawe koluhambo. Namhlanje sibhiyozela uhambo lwethu kunye.

Namhlanje sibhiyozela zonke iimfundiso esizifundileyo kulo lonke elixesha sikunye.

Ngoku, masicinge ngamanyathelo alandelayo. Ingangawaphi amanyathelo alandelayo emva koku? Mhalwumbi silungiselela ukuqhubeka nazo zonke iimfundiso esiye sazifunda apha. Asiyazi, siyathemba ukuba kwinyathelo elilandelayo, izakhono, nezifundo zizakulandela. Sikunqwenelela okumnandi, ulonwabo, kwixesha losapho.

Enkosi.

SourceText: Agreeing on consequences together works! Tap play to hear @data.characters.media_female_13.name tell her story
text: Ukuvumelana ngeziphumo kunye kuyasebenza! Cofa udlala ukuva @data.characters.media_female_13.name exela ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my teenagers did something to make me angry, I would shout at them and punish them right away. But the next time they did it again! I could not understand why they did not hear me even when I shouted.

@global.app_name helped me understand that my teenagers will listen to me more when I am calm. So, when something happens, I take a deep breath and say “we will talk about this later when we are both calm.”

We even agree on the consequences together now before something goes wrong. This has worked wonders – I have seen a huge change in my teen’s behaviour now that they are more involved, and I have less stress.

I wish I knew this long ago, but it is never too late to start!
text:
Xana abantwana bam abafikisayo benze into endenza ndibenomsindo, bendibangxolisa, ndibohlwaye kwangoko. Kodwa kwilixa elizayo bebeyiphinda kwakhona! bendingayiqondi ukuba kutheni bengandiva noba sendibangxolisile.

I @global.app_name indincedile ndaqonda ukuba abantwana bam abafikisayo bangamamela kakhulu xana ndizolile. Ngoko, xana kusenzeka into ndiyaphefumla ngokunzulu ndithi "sakuthetha ngayo ngelinye ixesha xana sobabini sizolile".

Siye savumelane kunye ngeziphumo ngoku ngaphambi kokuba kwenzeke into engalunganga. Lento isebenze ngokumangalisayo- Ndibone umehluko omkhulu kwisimilo somntwana wam ofikisayo ngokuba abeyinxalenye, kwaye lwatsho lwehla noxinzelelo.

Akwaba bendiyazile kwangaphambili, kodwa akukapheli xesha lingako ukuba ndingangaqali!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: You've done an amazing job. Tap play to reflect on how far you've come
text: Wenze umsebenzi omhle. Cofa u dlala ukujonga apho usuka khona

SourceText:
Close your eyes and relax.

Think of your family life before you started your journey with this app.

Think back on skills you learned:

Self-care
One-on-one time
Praise
Positive instructions
Managing stress
Family budgeting
Rules
Calm consequences
Problem solving
Teen safety
Dealing with crisis
Reflect on the journey – how was it for you to:

Share ideas and experiences
Reflect on and learn from the stories
Practice skills with your teen
Did anything change for you and your family?

What do you need to continue to use skills?
text:
Vala amehlo wakho kwaye ukhululeke.

Cinga ngobomi bosapho lwakho ngaphambi kokuba uqalise uhambo lwakho kule App.

Cinga ngezakhono othe wazifunda:

Ukuzikhathalela
Ixesha Lomnye Nomnye
Ukuncoma
Imiyalelo Elungileyo
Ukulawula Uxinzelelo

Imithetho

Ukusombulula ingxaki
Ukhuseleko lwabantwana abafikisayo

Cinga ngohambo - belunjani kuwe

Yabelana ngamacebiso kunye nangamava
Cingisisa kwaye ufunde nakumabali

Ingaba ikhona into etshintshileyo kuwe nakusapho lwakho?

Yintoni oyidingayo ukuze uqhubekeke usebenzisa izakhono?

SourceText: This song is for parents everywhere. Listen, dance and celebrate yourself!
text: Le ngoma yingoma yabazali kuzo zonke indawo. Phulaphula, danisa kwaye uzibhiyozele!

You can take pause, you can count to 10 Play a game or do something fun You can phone a friend, someone to confide in Remember you're not the only one
