SourceText: Tap play to hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_6.name learned to appreciate calm consequences
text: Cofa udlala ukumamela ukuba u@data.characters.media_daughter_6.name ufunde njani ukwamnkela iziphumo ezizolileyo
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_6.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My mom and dad would always punish me when they were angry with me. They would shout at me and I would also get angry. I often did not follow the rules, because they were too harsh, I did not understand what they were saying, or I would not even bother listening to them, because we were all angry.

One day, they asked me: Let's think together what the consequence should be for not coming home in time. It was great to give my view – before something happens that makes us all angry. We are all calm and agree first. It is easier for me to follow the rules now because I know I agreed on the rule and on the consequence if I do not follow the rule.
text:
Umama notata wam bebesoloko bendohlwaya xana benomsindo ngakum. bebendingxolisa kwaye nam bendiye ndibenomsindo. bendingasoloko ndiyilandela imithetho, ngokuba ibingqwabalala, bendingayiqondi into abayithethayo, okanye bendingazidini ngokubamamela, ngoba sonke sinomsindo.

Ngenye imini, bandibuza: Makhe sicinge ngokuba izokuba zeziphi iziphumo zokungabuyi ekhaya ngexesha. Bekukuhle kakhulu ukunika uluvo lwam - phambi kokuba kwenzeke into ezakusenza sonke sibenomsindo. Sonke sizolile kwaye siyavumelana kuqala. Kulula kum ukulandela imithetho ngoku ngokuba ndiyayazi ndivumile ngomthetho kunye nakwisiphumo ukuba ndithe andalandela umthetho.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje luhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho.

Kubalulekile ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali, kodwa kubaluleke nangakumbi ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali olubandakanya usapho lonke. 

Ukuyenza kunye kunceda ekwandiseni umlinganiselo wokuqonda indlela yokuchitha imali nilusapho nokuba longa kanganani usapho, yaye ningeza nendlela yokonga imali nilusapho.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_6.name involved her teens in budgeting
text: Yiva indlela u@data.characters.media_female_6.name abandakanye ngayo abantwana bakhe abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_6.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Saving and budgeting helps me as a parent, and it helps my teens as well to understand where the money goes.

My teens always asked for a lot of things and they did not understand when I said “I do not have money.” They would say “but you have a job!”

I sat down with them and showed them all the things we pay for and how much is left. They understand now and even give ideas on how we can save to work towards our goals like new shoes or a birthday and bigger goals like their school fees. For the older one, I even opened a savings account.
text:
Ukonga nokucwangcisa kuyandinceda njengomzali, kwaye iyabanceda nabantwana bam abafikisayo baqonde ukuba imali iyephi. 

Abantwana bam abafikisayo basoloko befuna izinto ezininzi kwaye abaqondi xa ndisithi "andinamali." Basoloko besithi "kodwa unawo umsebenzi!"

Ndihleli phantsi nabo ndababonisa zonke izinto esizibhatalayo nemali eshekileyo. Bayaqonda ngoku kwaye banika nezimvo ukuba singonga njani ukuze sisebenzele injongo zethu njengezihlangu ezitsha okanye usuku lokuzalwa nenjongo ezinkulu ezinjengokubhatala imirhumo yesikolo. Komdala, ndiye ndamvulela uvimba wokonga imali.

SourceText: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
text: Ingaba ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kungalunceda kusapho lwakho? Cofa dlala ufunde nangaphezulu

SourceText:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say “I do not have money,” but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point “she does not love me.”

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked “what are the needs and wants in our house.” I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
text:
Bendidla ngokumcela umama wam andithengele impahla ezintle maxa onke. Ngalo lonke ixesha, ebesithi "andinamali," kodwa bendiyazi ufumana imali kumalume wam. Bendingaqondi ukuba kutheni engavumi ukundithengela impahla. Bendikhe ndicinge ngelinye xesha "akandithandi."

Kodwa ngenye imini wandibiza wandihlalisa phantsi wandibuza "zeziphi iizidingo neemfuno apha ekhayeni lethu." Ndaqala ndadwelisa zonke iizidingo nemfuno zam. Waze umama wandincedisa ukuba ndisele ndicinga ngeezidingo zosapho.

Ukususela ngalamini, ndiyayiqonda andinokungena ndicele nangaliphi ixesha. Ngoku, xa ndifuna into, ndilinda kuphele inyanga xa sele sixoxile ngohlahlo lwabiwo mali sibone ukuba iyangena. Siqondana ngcono ngoku.

SourceText: How can problem solving help you and your family?
text: Ukusombulula ingxaki kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokusombulula ingxaki.

Sonke siyayazi ebomini kunamaxesha apho sidibana neengxaki, kwaye sonke siyayazi ngendlela yokuba xa sizifumna sikwezimeko, kunzima ukucinga ngokukhawuleza ngezisombululo ezilungileyo.

Ngoko ke, kubalulekile ukuba xa sidibana neengxaki sime, siphefumle, sihlale sizolile kwaye sicinge ngezakhono esinokuzisebenzisa zokusombulula iingxaki.

SourceText: Can problem solving keep your teens safe? It did for @data.characters.media_female_4.name - tap play to hear her story
text: Ingaba ukusombulula iingxaki kungangcina abantwana bakho abafikisayo bekhuselekile? Yenzekile ku@data.characters.media_female_4.name - cofa dlala uzokuva ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the 6 steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.
text:
Bendingenabo ubudlelwane ubuhle kunye nentombi yam. Bendisoloko ngalo lonke ixesha ndimngxolisa, kwaye bengafuni ukuya ukuya esikolweni. 

Kuphela xa ndaqalisa ukuchitha ixesha Lomnye Nomnye kunye naye, ndaye ndaqonda ukuba engafuni nje ukuya esikolweni uyaxhatshazwa esikolweni. Siye sahlala phantsi sasebenzisa amanyathelo ama 6 okusombulula ingxaki. Siyibonile ingxaki, kwaye sakhangela izisombululo kunye: "Yintoni endingayenza njengomzali ukwenzela ukwazi ukuya esikolweni kwaye uzive ukhuselekile?"

Sivumelene ukuba ndizakuya ku titshala ukufumana indlela eya phambili. Siye sazifumana ngokwenene izisombululo kunye, kwaye sisondelene ngoku.

SourceText: Can you make an impact on your community with these skills? Hear @data.characters.media_son_2.name's story
text: Ungenza igalelo ekuhlaleni ngezizakhono? Mamela ibali lika@data.characters.media_son_2.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_son_2.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree “okay let’s try this one.”

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
text:
Xa utata wam wayendixelela ngamanyathelo okusombulula ingxaki, yandinceda nosapho lwam, yaphinda yandinceda nakwizihlobo zam.

Ndizixelele izihlobo zam ngalamanyathelo, ngoku xa siphikisana sihlala phantsi wonke umntu aze nezisombululo. Siye sijonge okuhle nokubi kwisisombululo ngasinye, sivumelane " kulungile masizame esi"

Izihlobo zam ziye lento zayithatha ukuyenza emakhayeni abo, kwaye iyazinceda iintsapho zabo nazo!

Kuhle xa abanye bekumamela kwaye bazamkele izimvo zakho nokuba umncinci. Singayenza imvisiswano nezihlobo kunye nentsapho zethu.

SourceText: Why is teen safety important for you and your family?
text: Kutheni ukhuseleko lwabantwana bakho abafikisayo lubalulekile kuwe nosapho lwakho?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.
text:
Molweni noke

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokhuseleko lwabantwana abafikisayo.

Luxanduva lwethu njengabazali ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile ngalolonke ixesha. Sidinga ukuqinisekika ukuba abvantwana bethu abafikisayo bakhuselekile kwindawo esihlala kuzo. Luxanduva lwethu ukuba baqonde ngendawo ezikhuselekileyo nezingakhuselekanga ekuhlaleni.

SourceText: A safety plan helped @data.characters.media_female_8.name protect her teen. Tap play to hear more
text: Isicwangciso sokhuseleko sisebenzile ku@data.characters.media_female_8.name ukukhusela umntwana wakhe ofikisayo. Cofa udlala umamele nangakumbi
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_8.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.
text:
Ndibe nombulelo omkhulu ukwenza isicwangciso sokhuseleko nomntwana wam ofikisayo. Bendicinga ndiyazazi indawo ezikhuselekileyo zomntwana wam ofikisayo nkunye nezingalunganga. Kodwa xa besisenza izicwangciso zokhuseleko kunye, Ndiye ndaqonda ukuba intombi yam yazi indawo ezininzi kunoba ndisazi.

Bendisoloko ndicinga ukuba ukhuselekile esikolweni, kodwa ngalomsebenzi ndiye ndaqonda ukuba uyaxhatshazwa kwaye abafundisi ntsapho abenzinto ngalonto.

Ngokuya sithetha, ngokuya ndiqonda kwaye ndafumana inkcukacha kubantwana bam abafikisayo. Ngokwenene lonto indincedile ukukhusela umntwana wam ofikisayo kwaye ndimgcine ekhuselekile.

SourceText: Safety planning helped @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name open up. Hear her story
text: Ukucwangisa okukhuselekileyo kuncede u @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name ukuba akhululeke. Yiva ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot – also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!
text:
Xana abahlobo bam okanye umna ndisengxakini, bendiye ndizame ukuyifihla kumama wam ngokuba ebezakuba nomsindo kwaye andingxolise. 

Xana sisenza imephu yeendawo ezikhuselekileyo kunye nezingakhuselekanga, ndifunde lukhulu - kwaye kutheni kuyingozi ukwabelana ngomfanekiso ngamnye kwi intanethi. Umama wam wandixelela ukuba ndingakwazi ngalo lonke ixesha ukumbuza ukuba kukhe kwakho ingxaki kwaye wathembisa ukuba akazokucaphuka.

Uye wasigcina isithembiso, ngoku ukuba ndinengxaki okanye andiziva ndikhuselekile ndiyayazi singakwazi ukuza nesisombululo kunye. Ndingakwazi nokuthetha nomama wam malunga nezinto endizenzayo kwi intanethi ngoku!

SourceText: How can calm consequences help you and your family?
text: Zingakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho iziphumo ezizolileyo?

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Even if you do everything right, your child will misbehave sometimes. We may be tempted to scream and shout, but that just leaves everyone more angry. 

If we stay calm, and give them a calm consequence, they will learn to take responsibility for their actions instead.
text:
Molweni nonke.

Nokuba ungenza yonke into kakuhle, umntwana wakho angaziphatha kakubi ngamanye amaxesha. Singazibona sele sifuna ukukhwaza kwaye singxole, kodwa oko kushiya wonke umntu enomsindo ngakumbi.

Ukuba sihlala sizolile, kwaye sibanike iziphumo ezizolileyo, bazokufunda ukuthatha inxaxheba ngeziphumo zabo.

SourceText: Agreeing on consequences together works! Tap play to hear @data.characters.media_female_13.name's story
text: Ukuvumelana ngemiphumela ninonke kuyasebenza! Cofa udlala ukuva @data.characters.media_female_13.name exela ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_13.name's should not be translated.
The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Did you know that playing is the best way to relax AND learn? Tap play to learn more
text: Ubusazi ukuba ukudlala yeyona ndlela yokuphumla KWAYE ufunde? Cofa dlala ukuze ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!
Do you know what is the best way to relax? Playing! 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.
text:
Molweni nonke
Uyayazi ukuba yeyiphi eyona ndlela yokuphumla? Ukudlala! 

Kwaye masinyaniseke, ngomphi umntwana ongathandiyo ukudlala? 

Ukufunda kuthatha ixesha, kodwa kuninzi onokwenza njengomzali ukunceda umntwana wakho. Bayeke badlale kwaye baphonononge. Bayeke babuze imibuzo kwaye bafunde kwimpazamo. Kwaye ubenomonde, Inkxaso yakho iyakubanceda bakhule kwaye baphuhle.

SourceText: Play helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her son become closer. Tap play to hear how
text: Ukudlala kuncede u @data.characters.media_female_14.name nonyana wakhe basondelelana. Cofa udlala ukuva kanjani
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_14.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My son was not really talking. I was worried about it but did not know how I could help him.

@global.app_name gave me lots of ideas for what I could do to help him develop at home. By playing together, we were able to practise many words in a fun way. He is speaking much more now, and we are closer because of the time we spend together.
text:
Unyana wam ebengathethi ncam. Ibindikhathaza lonto kodwa ndingayazi ukuba ndingamnceda njani.

I @global.app_name indinike iimbono ezininzi zokuba ndingenza njani ukumnceda aphuhle ekhaya. Ngokudlala sonke, siye sikwazi ukuzama amagama amaninzi ngendlela eyonwabisayo. Uthetha kakhulu ngoku, kwaye sisondelene ngenxa yexesha esilichithileyo kunye.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: How will talking about feelings with your children help you and your family? Tap play to find out
text: Ukuthetha nabantwana bakho malunga ne mvakalelo kungakunceda njani kunye nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ufumanise

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Does your child ever get really angry, upset and you don’t know what to do? 

You can help your child to manage their emotions better by showing them how to talk about their feelings. You start with noticing and accepting all the emotions we have. We are all human.
text:
Molweni, kumntu wonke.

Ingaba umntwana wakho ukhe ebenomsindo, akhathazeke kwaye ungazi ukuba mawenze ntoni?

Ungamnceda umntwana wakho amelane nemvakalelo zakhe ngcono ngokubabonisa ngokuthetha malunga ne mvakalelo. Uqala ngokuqaphela kwaye wamnkele zonke imvakalelo esinazo. Sonke singabantu.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_8.name taught her daughter skills by naming her emotions
text: Mamela ukuba wenze njani u@data.characters.media_female_8.name ukufundisa intombi yakhe isakhono sokuchaza imvakalelo zakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_8.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My daughter used to get so frustrated and angry when she did not get her way. She would shout and scream, even when we went out, and I would also feel very angry and embarrassed. 

When I learned about emotions, I started to name and acknowledge her emotions. I helped her understand that it is okay to feel angry sometimes, but that she can show it in a different way. Now, she will tell me when she starts to feel angry, and we can find a solution together that works for everyone.
text:
Intombi yam ibisoloko ingxuphala kwaye ibanomsindo xa izinto zingahambanga ngendlela yakhe. Wayemane ekhwaza kwaye akhale, naxa siphumile, kwaye nam bendiziva ndinomsindo kakhulu kwaye ndineentloni.

Xa ndisiva ngemvakalelo, ndaqala ukuchaza kwaye ndivuma iimvakalelo zakhe. Ndamnceda aqonde ukuba kulungile ukuziva unomsindo ngamanye amaxesha, kodwa angayibonakalisa ngendlela eyohlukileyo. Ngoku, uzakundixelela xa eqalisa eziva enomsindo, kwaye sizokufumana isisombululo kunye esinosebenzela umntu wonke.

SourceText: Tap play to learn how giving positive instructions can help you and your family
text: Cofa dlala ukufunda ukuba ukunikeza ngemiyalelo elungileyo kungakunceda njani wena kunye nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Let’s try something: Don’t think about a pink elephant…
What did you think about? A pink elephant?

The same happens when we give negative instructions to our children. When we tell them “stop fighting” or “stop playing with your food”, they don’t know how to think about what we DO want them to do, only what we DON’T want them to do.”

When you give a positive instruction, your child is more likely to follow it.
text:
Molweni nonke.

Masizame into: Sukucinga ngendlovu epinki...
Ucinga ngantoni? Nge ndlovu epinki?

Kwenzeka into efanayo xa sinika imiyalelo engalunganga ebantwaneni bethu. Xa sisithi' mabayeke ukulwa "ókanye yekani udlala ngokutya kwenu'. Abayazi indlela yokucinga ngalento SIFUNA ukuba bayenze, bacinga kuphela into ESINGAFUNI ukuba bayenze.

Xa unika imiyalelo elungileyo, kunokwenzeka ukuba umntwana ayilandele.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_3.name learned to give her children positive instructions
text: Yiva ukuba u@data.characters.media_female_3.name wenze njani ukufunda ukunika abantwana bakhe imiyalelo elungileyo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my children the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learned about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my children. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “ don’t do this.” 
My children and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My child said one day “I really love this new mom,” and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Ngaphambili, ndandibakhulisa abantwana bam ngendlela endakhuliswa ngayo: Ndandibaxelela ukuba "musa ukuyenza lena, sukuyenza leya." Sasikade sisilwa, kodwa izinto ziye zatshintsha ngokwenene xa ndafunda ngokunikela imiyalelo elungileyo.

Ngoku ndigxile kwindlela yokuziphatha endifuna ukuyibona, kwaye ndinike imiyalelo ecacileyo nelula ebantwaneni bam. Ithathe ixesha ukufunda ukuthi "ndicela wenze lento" endaweni yokuba "ungayenzi lento."
Abantwana bam kunye nomyeni wam bandixelele ukuba lendlela yokwenza izinto, kuba ngoku bayayazi into ekufuneka yenziwe. Umntwana ngenye imini uthe "ndiyamthanda ngokwenene lo mama mtsha," kwaye nolwam uxinzelelo lwehle kakhulu.

SourceText: Why is spending one-on-one time with your child important? Tap play to learn
text: Kutheni kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha elinye omnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufunde

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!

Our children don't need expensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one on one time with them.

By spending time together, you will understand your child better and they will learn many new things.

Having this time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. That will make everything easier at home!
text:
Molweni nonke!

Abantwana bethu abadingi zipho zexabiso. Esona sipho esingabanika sona kukuchitha ixesha elinye lomnye nomnye kunye.

Ngokuchitha ixesha kunye, uyakumqonda ngakumbi umntwana wakho kwaye uyakufunda izinto ezintsha ezininzi.

Ukuba neli xesha kunye nomntwana wakho kuyamenza azive ebalulekile kuba iyakumnceda ukuba azive ethandwa kwaye exabisekile. Iyakwenza yonke into ibelula ekhaya!

SourceText: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her child connect
text: Mamela ukuba ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye kuncede njani ku@data.characters.media_female_1.name ukuba banxibelelane
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I first heard I have to spend one-on-one time with my daughter, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my daughter so that she thinks we have to do everything together. 

But I really wanted to build my relationship with her and I wanted her to open up about what was troubling her. 

So we tried the One-on-One Time. 

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we play her favourite game together and talk about things happening at school and with her friends.
text:
Ukuqala kwam ukuva kufuneka sichithe ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo, kwaye kwanzima kum. Ndandingayazi ukuba ndiqale nini okanye ndithini. Ndandingafuni ukumosha umntwana wam ofikisayo acinge ukuba kumele senze yonke into sisobabini.

Kodwa enyanisweni bendifuna ukwakha ubudlelwane nomntwana wam ofikisayo kwaye athethe ngokukhululekileyo malunga nento emhluphayo. 

Siye sazama ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye.

Ekuqaleni ibivakala ingaqhelekanga kodwa yaphela inika umdla! Ngoku sidlala umdlalo awuthandayo kunye kwaye sithetha ngezinto eziqhubekayo esikolweni kunye nangabahlobo bakhe.

SourceText: Tap play to hear how praise can help you and your family
text: Cofa udlala umamele ukuba ukuncoma kungakunceda njani wena kunye nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!
text:
Molweni nonke.

Ugqibele nini ukunconywa? uyakwazi ukuzincoma ngento ngoku? Ukunconywa kusenza sizive sonwabile.

Kuhle ukubancoma abantwana bethu xa benze kakuhle. kuba xa sisenza loo nto, bayakwenza ngakumbi ngendlela entle yokuziphatha esifuna ukuyibona.

Kwaye masikhumbule ukuzincoma nathi ngezinto ezinkulu okanye ezincinci!

SourceText: Tap play to hear how simple praises helped @data.characters.media_female_2.name's family
text: Cofa udlala ukuze umamele ukuncoma okulula kuncede u@data.characters.media_female_2.name nosapho
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_2.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
When we learned about this praising thing, I thought “We were never praised for things as children, so why should we start now?”. But I got interested when I learned what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after learning about praise, I noticed my son doing what he does every day: Packing away his toys after playing. And I said “Thank you for packing away your toys, my boy, it really makes me happy that you are helping out to keep the house tidy.” My son was smiling and he even came to give me a hug, which he never does. 

This praising business is hard. I still forget to do it sometimes. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!
text:
Xa besifunda ngalento yokuncoma, ndicinge ukuba, Asizange sinconywe ngezinto sisengabantwana, ngoko ke kutheni sifanele siqalise ngoku? Kodwa ndaba nomdla xa ndandifunda ukuba inzuzo yokuncoma ingaba yintoni.

Kanye emva kokuba ndifunde ngokuncoma, ndaqaphela unyana wam esenza into ayenzayo mihla le. Ukupakisha izinto zakhe zokudlala emva kokudlala, Ndaye ndathi "Enkosi ngokupakisha izinto zakho zokudlala mfo wam, indenza ndonwabe nyani into yokuba uncedise ukugcina indlu icocekile. Unyana wam wayencumile wade wafika wandanga into angazange ayenze.

Lomsebenzi wokuncoma unzima Ndiyalibala ukuwenza ngamanye amaxesha. Kodwa ukuncoma kuyawenza umahluko nyani. Zange ndiyicinge into yokuncoma nje inokwenza utshintsho emntwini!

SourceText: Tap play to hear how solving problems with your children can you and your family
text: Cofa udlala ukuva ukusombulula iingxaki kunye nabantwana bakho unako kunye nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

As parents, it can feel like we have to solve a million problems for our children every day: Where is my toy car? I am not going to school! Why can’t you buy me new shoes now?

By involving our children in solving problems, they learn to find solutions more and more independently. 

Life has its challenges. If you help your child solve small problems today, you give them the skills to deal with any bigger challenges later in life.
text:
Molweni nonke!

Njengabazali, ingavakala ngathi kumele sisombulule izigidi zeengxaki zabantwana bethu mihla yonke. Iphi imoto yam yokudlala? Andiyi esikolweni! Kutheni ungandithengeli izihlangu ezintsha ngoku?

Ngokubandakanya abantwana bethu ekusombululeni iingxaki, bafunda ukuzifumanela izisombululo kunye nokuzimela ngakumbi nangakumbi.

Ubomi bunemiceli mngeni yabo. Ukuba unceda umntwana wakho akwazi ukusombulula iingxaki ezincinci namhlanje, ubanika isakhono sokumelana nayo nayiphi na imiceli mngeni emikhulu phambili phaya ebomini.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_5.name and her daughter use the four steps of problem solving
text: Mamela u @data.characters.media_female_5.name kunye nentombi yakhe besebenzisa njani amanyathelo amane okusombulula ingxaki
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_5.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school. 

Only when I started spending One-on-One Time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the four steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.
text:
Bendingenabo ubudlelwana obulungileyo nentombi yam. Bendisoloko ndimngxolisa kwaye ebengafuni ukuya esikolweni. 

Xa ndandiqala ukuchitha ixesha naye lomnye nomnye, ndafumanisa ukuba akafuni ukuya esikolweni kuba exhatshazwa esikolweni. Sihleli phantsi sasebenzisa amanyathelo ayi 6 wokusombulula ingxaki. Siyibonile ingxaki, kwaye sakhangela isisombululo sisonke. "Ndingenza ntoni njengomzali ukuze ukwazi ukuya esikolweni kwaye uzive ukhuselekile?"

Siye savumelana ukuba ndizothetha notitshala ukuze sizokufumana izisombululo kunye kwaye sisondelelene ngoku.

SourceText: Tap play to learn how rules and routines can help you and your family
text: Cofa udlala ufunde uba imithetho nesiqhelo zingakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Do you have moments in the day with your child that feel stressful? Is it bedtime or getting ready for school?

Rules can help! Having clear rules and routines actually helps children know what is expected of them, which helps reduce the struggles of the more stressful moments in the day.
text:
Molweni nonke

Ingaba ninawo amaxesha ngosuku nomntwana wakho apho niziva ninoxinzelelo? Ingaba lixesha lokudlala okanye elokulungiselela isikolo? 

Imithetho inganceda! Ukuba nemithetho ecacileyo kunye nenkqubo zesiqhelo kuye kuncede abantwana bayazi okulindelekileyo kubo, yinto leyo enceda ukunciphisa ubunzima ngexesha loxinzelelo olungamandla ngosuku.

SourceText: Routines helped @data.characters.media_female_7.name and her family. Tap play to hear their story
text: Iinkqubo zanceda u@data.characters.media_female_7.name kunye nosapho lwakhe. Cofa dlala ukuze uve ibali labo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Bedtime was always a struggle in our house. My children wanted to keep watching TV and I would always end up shouting at them: “Go to bed now! You know you have to be ready for school early in the morning!”. Some days I was just too tired, and I would let them watch more TV. 

When we learned in @global.app_name about rules, I learned that it is important to be consistent. I discussed with my children why watching TV till late is a problem, and we came up with a rule together to switch off the TV at 8 and be ready for bed by 8.30. Now everyone knows what is expected of them, and we can end the day peacefully.
text:
Ixesha lokulala lalisoloko linzima endlwini yethu. Abantwana bam babefuna ukuzigcina bebukele umabonakude kwaye. Ndandiphela ndibangxolisa oko: "Hamba uyolala ngoku! Uyayazi ukuba kufuneka ulungele ukuya esikolweni kwangethuba kusasa!". Ngezinye iintsuku ndiye ndidinwe kakhulu, kwaye bendibavumela babukele u mabonakude ngakumbi.

X besifunda kwi @global.app_name malunga nemithetho, Ndifundile ukuba kubalulekile ukungaguquguquki. Ndixoxile kunye nabantwana bam kukuba kutheni ukubukela umabonakude. kude kude kudlule ixesha kuyingxaki, kwaye siye saza nomthetho kunye wokucima mabonakude ngentsimbi yesi 8 kwaye silungele ukuyolala ngentsimbi 8.30. Ngoku wonke umntu uyayazi okulindelekileyo kubo, kwaye singakwazi ukuligqiba usuku ngoxolo.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems, and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves every day, so we are ready to handle those times well and stay calm. 

When we are calm, we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.
text:
Molweni nonke.

Kukho amaxesha apho siye sibe neengxaki, sijongane neengxaki, singazi ukuba masenze ntoni na. kubalulekile ukuba sizikhathalele yonke imihla, sikulungele ukumelana nalomaxesha kakuhle kwaye sihlale sizolile

Xa sizolile, sikwimeko entle yokucinga ngendlela eyakhayo kwaye size nezisombululo ezakhayo kuyo nayiphina imiceli mngeni esinokuthi sijongane nayo.

SourceText: Self care works! Hear @data.characters.media_male_1.name’s story
text: Ukuzikhathalela kuyasebenza! Yiva ibali lika @data.characters.media_male_1.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_male_1.name’s should not be translated.

SourceText:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through @global.app_name, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family! 

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even five minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
text:
Kum njengomzali, kwakunzima ukufumana ixesha lam. Ndandisoloko ndixakekekile ndikhathalela wonke umntu. Nge@global.app_name, ndiye ndabona ukuba kubaluleke kangakanani ukuzikhathalela. Iyandinceda mna KUNYE nosapho lwam! 

Ukuba nomzumzu wam kuyandinceda ndiphefumle kwaye ndiqaphele indlela endiziva ngayo. Nokuba yimizuzu emi-5 yokufumana ikomityi yeti kwenza umahluko omkhulu. Ngoku ndiyakwazi ukumelana noxinzelelo ngcono.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!
text: Ukuncoma kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufumanise!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!
text:
Molweni nonke.

Isihloko sethu sanamamhlanje simalunga nokuncoma.

Kulungile kakhulu ukuncoma abantwana bethu xa besenza kakuhle ngokuba xa sisenza njalo, bazakwenza ngakumbi kwisimilo esilungileyo esifuna ukusibona.

Kwaye nathi masingalibali ukuzincoma xa sisenza kakuhle!

SourceText: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home
text: Ukuncoma kuyasebenza, kodwa akusoloko kulula.Yiva ukuba u @data.characters.media_female_2.name waqala njani ukuyisebenzisa ekhaya
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!
text:
Xa besifunda ngalento yokuncoma, ndicinge ukuba, Asizange sinconywe ngezinto sisengabantwana, ngoko ke kutheni sifanele siqalise ngoku? Kodwa ndaba nomdla xa ndandifunda ukuba inzuzo yokuncoma ingaba yintoni.

Kanye emva kweworkshop yeveki, ndaqaphela ukuba umtwana wam ofikisayo esenza into ayenzayo mihla yonke: Ukuhlamba izitya. Ndaye ndathi "Enkosi ngokuhlamba izitya, ntombi yam, indenza ndonwabe nyani into yokuba uncedise. Umntwana wam ofikisayo wayencumile wade wandanga into angazange ayenze.

Lomsebenzi wokuncoma unzima. Ndisalibala ngamanye amaxesha okanye ndincome ngaxeshanye ndibe ndigxeke. Kodwa ukuncoma kuyawenza umahluko nyani. Zange ndiyicinge into yokuncoma nje inokwenza utshintsho emntwini!

SourceText: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother
text: Mamela ku@data.characters.media_daughter_2.name ukuba ivakala njani into yokunconywa ngumama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I was grateful that my mother learnt about praise.

My mother always noticed when I was doing something wrong. She would shout at me and hit me.

But when my mother did the workshop, she would praise me for little things. First I thought “What is going on?” but then it continued. I liked it so I did more good things I thought she would like.

It feels great that my mother sees the good things I do, and not just the bad things.

I even said it to her once. During one-on-one time, I said “Thank you, mom, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.” This made us both very happy.
text:
Bendinombulelo yinto yokufunda kukamama malunga nokuncoma.

Umama wam ebesoloko eqaphela xa ndisenza into engalunganga. Ebedla ngokundingxolisa kwaye andibethe.

Kodwa ngethuba umama wam esenza izifundo, ebendincoma ngezinto ezincinci. Kuqala bendicinga "Kuqhubeka ntoni?" kodwa yaqhubekeka. Ndiyithandile kwaye ndenza izinto ezilungileyo endicinga uzakuzithanda.

Ivakala kamnandi into yokuba umama wam eyibona imisebenzi emihle endiyenzayo, hayi izinto ezingalunganga kuphela.

Bendikhe ndamxelela kanye. Ngexesha lomnye nomnye, ndithe " Enkosi, mama, ngokuthetha into entle xa ndisenza kakuhle, hayi xa ndisenza izinto ezingalunganga kuphela." Lento isenze sonwaba xa sisobabini.

SourceText: Should rules be important for you and your family? Click play to find out
text: Ingaba kufanele ibaluleke imithetho kuwe nakusapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is rules.

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members.

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules.

A household with family rules lives in peace.
text:
Molweni, kuni nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje yimithetho.

Imithetho ikhuthaza uxolo ekhayeni ize ikhuthaze ukuqondana phakathi kwamalungu osapho.

Imithetho ikhuthaza uxanduva kwilungu ngalinye losapho, ngoko, kubalulekile ukuba nemithetho yosapho.

Ikhaya elinemithetho yosapho liphila ngoxolo.

SourceText: Rules worked for @data.characters.media_female_7.name and her teens. Tap play to hear more
text: Imithetho imsebenzele u@data.characters.media_female_7.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo. Cofa udlala ukuva ngakumbi
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My teenagers always just disappeared. I did not know where they were and I would get so worried and angry with them. I used to say, “This is my house, and these are my rules, if you do not want to follow them you can leave and stay in your own place.”

When we learnt in @global.app_name about rules, I learnt that there are rules for teens and for adults and for everyone. If we follow the rules as parents, our teens will follow our example.

I explained my worry and we all agreed: We all follow the rule and say where we are going when we leave the house. Coming up with rules together helped us a lot, as my teens do not see me anymore as that annoying parent that just makes up unnecessary rules.
text:
Abantwana bam abafikisayo basoloko benyamalala. Ndiye ndingabazi apho bakhoyo kwaye ndiyakhathazeka kakhulu kwaye ndibanimsindo ngakubo. Bendiqhele ukuthi, Yindlu yam lena, kwaye yimithetho yam, ukuba awufuni kuyilandela ungahamba uyokuzihlalela kweyakho indawo.

Xana besifunde ku @global.app_name malunga nemithetho, Ndifunde into yokuba kunemithetho yabantwana abafikisayo kunye neyabantu abadala kunye neyomntu wonke. Ukuba silandela imithetho singabazali, abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazakulandela umzekelo wethu.

Ndikucacisile ukuxhalaba kwam kubo kwaye sivumelene: Sonke silandela umthetho kwaye siyatsho ukuba siyaphi xana simnka endlini. Ukuza nemithetho sisonke kuncede kakhulu, njengabantwana bam abafikisayo abandiboni njengamzali odikayo kwakhona owenza nje imithetho engenamsebenzi.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Hear how @global.app_name helped @data.characters.media_son_4.name talk honestly with his parents
text: Yiva ukuba i@global.app_name imncede njani u@data.characters.media_son_4.name athethe ngokunyanisekileyo nabazali bakhe

SourceText:
As teens, we hear all these things about sex from others at school and on the internet. A few of my friends said they were already having sex, and I kept hearing that having sex makes you a real man and not a little boy. I believed it and I was afraid to tell my parents.
 
When we did @global.app_name, we made a family rule to share questions at home instead of keeping secrets. When I told my parents what I heard, they listened calmly and helped me understand what it means to have sex and be a man, and that real friends never pressure you to do anything.

Whenever I have a question or problem now, I know I can ask my parents and they will help me think of answers and find solutions together.
text:
Jengabantwana abafikisayo, siziva zonke ezizinto zimalunga ngezesondo kwabanye esikolweni kunye nakwi-intanethi. Abambalwa kubahlobo bam baye bathi sele besabelana ngesondo, kwaye bendiqhubeka ndisiva ukuba ukwabelana ngesondo kukwenza ubeyindoda yokwenyani kwaye ungabi yinkwenkwe encinci. Ndaye ndayikholelwa kwaye ndandisoyika ukuxelela abazali bam.

Xa sasisenza i@global.app_name, Senza umgaqo wosapho ukwabelana ngemibuzo ekhaya endaweni yokugcina iimfihlo. Xa ndixelela abazali bam into endiyivileyo, baye bandimamela ngokuzolileyo kwaye bandinceda ukuqonda ukuba kuthetha ukuthini ukwabelana ngesondo nokubayindoda, kwaye abahlobo bokwenene soze bakunike uxinzelelo lokwenza nayiphina into.

Naninina ndibanombuzo okanye ingxaki ngoku, ndiyayazi ndingababuza abazali bam kwaye bazakundinceda ndicinge ngempendulo kwaye sifumane isisombululo kunye.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Why is spending one-on-one time with your teens important? Tap play to learn
text: Kutheni kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo? Cofa udlala ukuze ufunde

SourceText:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.
text:
Molo. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu sisodwa. 

Kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu ukuze basazi, ukwenzela nathi sifumane ithuba lokuba sibazi.

Khumbula, usapho olwazanayo luphila ngoxolo.

SourceText: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her teen
text: Mamela limnceda njani ixesha lomnye nomnye @data.characters.media_female_1.name kunye nomntwana wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together.

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time.

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence and even about girlfriends and those things!
text:
Xana ndandiqala ukuva ukuba kufuneka ndichithe Ixesha Lomnye Nomnye kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo, kwakunzima kum. Ndandingayazi ukuba mandiyenze nini okanye yintoni emandiyithethe. Ndandingafuni ukumosha umntwana wam ofikisayo ukwenzela acinge kufuneka senze yonke into kunye.

Kodwa ndandifuna nyhani ukwakha ubudlelwane nomntwana wam ofikisayo kwaye ndandifuna avule isifuba malunga nento emhluphayo. Ngoko sazama Ixesha Lomnye Nomnye kunye.

Ekuqaleni ibivakala ingaqhelekanga, kodwa iphele isonwabisa! Ngoku sibukela inkqubo yakhe kwi TV kunye kwaye sincokole ngayo. kwaye siyathetha nkqu malunga nohlobo unyana wam atshintsha ngalo ekubeni engumntana ofikisayo, kunye nangamantombazane nezinye izinto!

SourceText: Here's what @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name has to say about one-on-one time with her mother
text: Nantsi enye @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name angakuyithetha malunga nexesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought “Maybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick.” But she said “No, I just want to spend time.” I was sceptical, but I accepted.

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own.

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.
text:
Xa umama wam ecela ukuba achithe ixesha kunye nam, Bendicinga "Mhlawumbi ikhona into engalunganga, mhlawubi uyagula". Kodwa wathi " Hayi, ndifuna nje ukuchitha ixesha". Ndandithandabuza, kodwa ndayamnkela.

Wandibuza ukuba ndithanda ukwenza ntoni na. Yayingaqhelekanga kwaye ndandingakhululekanga, kuba akazange achithe ixesha kunye nam ndindodwa.

 Qho emana ezama kwaye sichithe elixesha kunye, bekuvakala kamnandi. Uye wandibalisela ngokukhula kwakhe, izinto endangazange ndizive ngaphambili. Lonto indincede ukuba nam ndibalise ngokuqhubekekayo ebomini bam. Siye sathetha nangamakhwenkwe kwakunye nezinye iingxaki endinazo. Ndiyayazi ukuba ndingakwazi ukuthethe nomama wam ngoku.

SourceText: How will caring for yourself help you and your family? Listen to find out
text: Ukukhathalela isiqu sakho kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho? Mamela ukuze wazi

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is self-care.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves to learn the techniques for keeping ourselves calm, in case problems, challenges or issues come up.

When we are calm we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.
text:
Ndiyabulisa, kuni nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje kukuzikhathalela.

Akhona amaxesha apho sisiva imiceli mngeni, sijongene neengxaki kwaye singazi ukuba masenze ntoni. Kubalulekile ukuba sikhathalele iziqu zethu kwaye sifunde iindlela zokugcina umoya wethu uphantsi, xa kwenzeka iingxaki, imiceli mngeni okanye imiba enokuthi ivele.

Xa sinomoya ophantsi sikwisimo sokucinga lungileyo kwaye singeza neziphumo ezilungileyo kuyo yonke imiceli mngeni esinokuthi sijongane nayo.

SourceText: Self care works! Hear @data.characters.media_female_14.name’s story
text: Ukuzikhathalela kuyasebenza! Yiva ibali lika @data.characters.media_female_14.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_14.name’s should not be translated.

SourceText:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through @global.app_name, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family!

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even 5 minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
text:
Kum njengomzali, kwakunzima ukufumana ixesha lam. Ndandisoloko ndixakekekile ndikhathalela wonke umntu. Nge@global.app_name, ndiye ndabona ukuba kubaluleke kangakanani ukuzikhathalela. Iyandinceda mna KUNYE nosapho lwam! 

Ukuba nomzumzu wam kuyandinceda ndiphefumle kwaye ndiqaphele indlela endiziva ngayo. Nokuba yimizuzu emi-5 yokufumana ikomityi yeti kwenza umahluko omkhulu. Ngoku ndiyakwazi ukumelana noxinzelelo ngcono.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Can skills to handle crises help your family? Click play to find out
text: Ingaba izakhono zokumelana nentlekele zungalunceda usapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufumanise

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crisis may occur anywhere. Crisis may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje sesokumelana nentlekele.

Intlekele ingavela naphina Intlekele ingavela nangaliphi na ixesha. Ngoko, kubalulekile ukuba njengosapho nibe nezicwangciso ezikhoyo ukulungiselela naliphi na ilungu losapho eliziifumana likwimeko yentlekele. 

Kubalulekile ukuba nezicwangciso ukuze ilungu ngalinye losapho lizive likhuselekile. 

Xa sijongene nentlkele, masikhumbule ukuma kancinci, siphefumle, uze uhlale uzolile. Oko kuya kukunceda ukumelana ngcono nentlekele.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_female_9.name and her teen learned to handle crises together. Hear their story
text: U@data.characters.media_female_9.name kunye nomntwana wakhe ofikisiyo bafunde ukumelana nentlekele kunye. Mamela ibali labo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_9.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.app_name, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!
text:
Umntwana wam ofikisayo ebedla ngokubanomsindo ngalolonke ixesha. Ebengasoze aphulaphule kwaye besixambulisana kakhulu yonke imihla. Ngokusebenzisa i@global.app_name, ndaqalisa ukuchitha ixesha ngakumbi kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo ukuqinisa ubudlelwana bethu. Ngenye imin wandixelela ukuba wayeyinxalenye yeqela lemigulukudu kodwa waye wafuna ukuphuma.

Senze izicwangciso zexesha elifutshane nezexesha elide kunye nendlela esinokuyenza ngayo loonto. Ubomi bethu bujongeka bohlukile ngoku!
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember @data.characters.media_male_1.name? Here’s what his son says about his father practising self care
text: Khumbula @data.characters.media_male_1.name? Nantsi into ethethwa ngunyana wakhe malunga ngo tata wakhe ngokulungiselela ukukhathalela isiqu sakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_male_1.name? should not be translated.

SourceText:
My dad was always busy. He would come home from work and snap at us when we started asking him questions.

@global.app_name helped us a lot. We no longer fight. Now, when my dad comes home, he first sits down by himself for 5 minutes and then we do a relaxing activity from @global.app_name together, so we can all take a deep breath and relax. Then we can chat about our day, about anything good or bad that happened. Everyone is so much happier now.
text:
Utata wam wayehlala exakekile. Wayebuya emsebenzini asiphoxe xa siqala ukumbuza imibuzo.

@global.app_name yasinceda kakhulu. Asisalwi. Ngoku,utata xa efika endlini, uqala azihlalelele imizuzu eyi-5 emva koko senze umsebenzi wokuphumla kwi@global.app_name sisonke,siye siphefumle nzulu kwaye siphole. Emva koko sincokole ngosuku lwethu,malunga nezinto ezintle okanye ezimbi ezithe zenzeka. Wonke umntu wonwabile kakhulu ngoku.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_daughter_12.name overcame a difficult crisis with the help of her mother. Tap play to learn how
text: U@data.characters.media_daughter_12.name woyisa intlekele enzima ngoncedo luka mama wakhe. Cofa udlala ukufunda ukuba njani
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_12.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with @global.app_name, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
text:
Kwiminyaka emibini edlulileyo, ndadlwengulwa ngumalume owayehlala eyadini yethu. Andizange ndimxelele umama wam, ngokuba ndandisoyika kuba wayenokundibetha, andingxolise, okanye andigxothe endlini. Bendingenayo enye indawo yokuya.

Xana umama wam eqalile ne @global.app_name, siqalise ukuchitha ixesha nangakumbi kunye. Bendisamoyika, kodwa ekugqibeleni ndabelana naye umama wam. Umama wam akandingxolisanga, kodwa uye wamamela kwaye wandixelela ukuba ayilotyala lam. Siye saya emapoliseni nase kliniki kunye. Ndiyavuya kakhulu ndingazophinda ndithwale lemfihlo.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Why is discussing online safety with your teen important? Click play to find out.
text: Kutheni ukuxoxa ngokhuseleko lwe-intanethi nomntana wakho ofikisayo kubalulekile? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa.

SourceText:
Our teens spend a lot of time online — watching videos, learning, and chatting with friends. The internet can be a great place to learn and connect, but it also comes with risks.

Did you know 1 in 3 young people have been bullied online? Some are even pressured to share private photos or personal information.

We can’t stop everything that happens online. But we can listen, stay calm, and let our teens know they can always come to us. When they feel safe to talk to us, we can help them stay safer.
text:
Abantwana bethu abafikisayo bachitha ixesha elininzi kwi -intanethi bebukele iividiyo, befunda kwaye bencokola nabahlobo. I-intanethi ingayindawo elungileyo yokufunda kunye nokunxibelelana, kodwa inako ukuza neengozi.

Ingaba ubuyazi oyi1 kwabayi3 kubantu abatsha bakhe baxhatshazwa kwi-internet? Abanye bade banyanzelwe ngokwabelana ngemifanekiso eyimfihlo okanye ngenkcukacha ezizezakhe.

Asinako ukunqanda yonke into eyenzekayo kwi-intanethi. Kodwa singamamela, kwaye sivumele abantwana bethu abafikisayo bayazi ukuba ngalolonke ixesha bangeza kuthi. Xa beziva bekhuselekile ukuthetha nathi, singabanceda bahlale bekhuselekile.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_male_1.name learned to talk to his son about online safety
text: Mamela ukuba @data.characters.media_male_1.name ufunde njani ukuthetha nonyana wakhe ngokhuseleko lwe-intanethi
note: The string @data.characters.media_male_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My son was always on his phone, but I did not pay too much attention to it. To be honest, I was busy with other things and happy he was safely at home and not out on the streets. The only time we spoke about his phone was when I was taking it away as punishment for something he did. 

The SinovuyoApp helped me realize that the online world is big and can have good and bad sides. We can now talk about what he does online, and we have created rules together to ensure he can enjoy his time online and still stay safe. His phone is no longer a punishment tool but a way we can connect.
text:
Unyana wam ebesoloko esefowunini yakhe, kodwa zange ndiyihoye kakhulu lonto. Ukuthetha inyani bendixakekile zezinye izinto kwaye bendivuya kuba ebekhuselekile ekhaya engekho estratweni. Elona xesha sasithetha ngalo ngefowuni yakhe kungexesha ndandiyithatha. njengesohlwayo sento ayenzileyo. 

IsinovuyoApp yandinceda ndaqonda ukuba ilizwe le-intanethi likhulu kwaye kungaba namacala amahle kunye namabi. Ngoku singakwazi ukuthetha ngakwenzayo kwi-intanethi, kwaye senze imigaqo kunye ukuqinisekisa ukuba angalonwabela ixesha lakhe kwi-intanethi kwaye ahlale ekhuselekile. Ifowuni yakhe ayisesosixhobo sesohlwayo kodwayindlela esinokunxulumana ngayo.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name’s mother helped her keep safe online
text: Makhe sibone ukuba umama ka @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name umnceda njani ukuba ahlale ekhuselekile kwi-intanethi
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name’s should not be translated.

SourceText: Someone took my photo and put it on a naked body in a video. I freaked out and didn’t want to tell anyone, because I thought my parents would just take my phone away. But when my mom saw I was upset and asked, she stayed calm. We reported it together and got the video taken down. Now I know I don’t have to deal with things like this by myself.
text: Omnye umntu uthathe ifoto yam kwaye wayibeka kumzimba ohambaze kwividiyo. Ndoyike kakhulu kwaye andifunanga kuxelela mntu kuba ndicinge ukuba abazali bam bazovele baxuthe ifowuni yam. Kodwa xa umama wam endibona ukuba ndikhathazekile wabuza, enomoya ophantsi. Siye sayirepota kunye kwaye ividiyo yasuswa ngoku ndiyayazi andinakujongana nezinto ezifana nezi ndindedwa.

SourceText: Leave me alone and mind your own business!
text: Yohlukana nam kwaye hoya umsebenzi wakho!

SourceText: What did I do? You never listen!
text: Yintoni endiyenzileyo? Zange wamamela!

SourceText: I said leave me alone or you will get a beating!
text: Ndithe yohlukana nam okanye uzakubethwa!

SourceText: Look! I have made a house!
text: Jonga! Ndenze indlu!

SourceText: Who cares about your stupid house!
text: Ngubani oyikhathaleleyo londlu yobudenge yakho!

SourceText: Can I have money to buy some airtime?
text: Ndingakwazi ukufumana imali yokuthenga airtime?

SourceText: *(taking a breath)* I’m sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.
text: *(ephefumlo)* Uxolo nyana. Bendinemini enzima namhlanje. Umphathi wam undigxothile.

SourceText: Oh no! I need a new school uniform.
text: Oh hayi! Ndidinga impahla entsha yesikolo.

SourceText: I’ll try, son, and your @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name's job will help us get by while I look for another job.
text: Ndizakuzama, nyana, kwaye U@data.characters.f1_mother.role_name umsebenzi wakhe uzokusinceda ngethuba ndisakhangela omnye umsebenzi.

SourceText: Should I also help you look for work, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name?
text: Ndingakunceda nam ukukhangela umsebenzi, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name? should not be translated.

SourceText: No it’s okay, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.
text: Hayi kulungile, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. Ndiyakwamkela ukuzinikela kwakho. Eyonanto ibalulekileyo kukuba usebenze nzima esikolweni. Enkosi ngokundimamela.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.
text: Masidlale ibhola ekhatywayo sobabini. Izakundinceda ndikhuphe uxinzelelo olusengqondweni yam oko mzuzwana.

SourceText: Okay, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name!
text: Kulungile, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Don’t make such a mess while I am cleaning the house. You are in the way!
text: Sukungcolisa xa ndi coca indlu. Usendleleni!

SourceText: But I need to practise for the school competition. You never let me do anything.
text: Kodwa ndifuna ukulungiselela ukuphiswano lwase sikolweni. Awundivumeli ndenze kwanto.

SourceText: Don't you talk back to me!
text: Sukundiphendula!

SourceText: Arrg!! Why am I being yelled at all the time????
text: Arrg!! Kutheni nje ndingxoliswa ngalo lonke ixesha????

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) That child is always making trouble.
text: (🤔_Ecinga_) Lamntwana uhleli nje wenza ingxaki.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, it is nice to see you practise dance moves with your friend. Please take it outside so I can finish cleaning the house. Afterwards, you can show me your dance.
text: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, Kuhle ukubona ulungiselela intshuntshukumo zomdaniso kunye nomhlobo wakho. Ndicela uyikhuphele phandle ukuze ndigqibezele ukucoca indlu. Emva koko,ungandibonisa umdaniso wakho.

SourceText: Thank you for practising outside while I finished cleaning, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name. Now I have some time to watch your dance.
text: Ndiyabulela ngokuziqhelanisa phandle ndide ndigqibe ukucoca, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name. ngoku ndinexesha lokukubukela umdaniso wakho.

SourceText: Wow, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name! You have such good dance moves!
text: Wow, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name! Nidanisa kakuhle!

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! What time is this? You are late!
text: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! Ngubani ixesha ngoku? Ufike emva kwexesha!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, you broke our rule! I should take away that phone of yours and give you a hiding!
text: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, Uyophule imithetho yethu! Ndifanele ndixuthe lo fowuni yakho ndiyifihle!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: That’s unfair! You never listen to me!! I hate you!
text: Ayilungile lonto! Awuzange wandimamela!! Ndiyakucaphukela!

SourceText: I am concerned that you are often still coming home late, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. What can we do to help you remember to come home in time?
text: Iyandixhalabisa into yokuhlala ubuya emva kwexesha ekhaya, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. Singenza ntoni ukunceda ukuba ukhumbule ukubuya ekhaya kwangethuba?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: If I come home in time, maybe I can stay up 30 minutes later than usual?
text: Ukuba ndibuyela ekhaya ngethuba, mhlawumbi ndingakwazi ukuhlala imizuzu eyi 30 ngaphezulu kunesiqhelo?

SourceText: That is a good idea! And what should we do if you don’t follow the rule?
text: Ngumbono omhle lowo! Kwaye singenza ntoni xa ungalandeli umthetho?

SourceText: (mumbles) Mgmluuhm...
text: (mumbles) Mgmluuhm...

SourceText: Oh come on, I know you have some ideas.
text: Oh khawuze, ndiyayazi unazo iimbono ezithile.

SourceText: Okay…. What about, I have to do my homework?
text: Kulungile…. Uthini malunga, Kufanele ndenze umsebenzi wam wesikolo?

SourceText: You have to do your homework anyway. If you forget the rule, is it fair that you will not be able to see your friends the next day?
text: Kufanele wenze umsebenzi wesikolo wakho nakanjani. Ukuba uwulibele umthetho, ingaba ilungile into yokuba awuzokwazi ukubona abahlobo bakho ngosuku olulandelayo?

SourceText: Okay, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name.
text: Kulungile, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! What time is it! It is late!
text: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! Ngubani ixesha ngoku! Kusemva kwexesha!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry @data.characters.f1_father.role_name – you can go back to sleep.
text: Uxolo @data.characters.f1_father.role_name - ungabuyela uyolala.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name should not be translated.

SourceText: It is WAY past the time you were supposed to be home!
text: Lidlule KUDALA ixesha ebekufanele ubuye ngalo ekhaya!

SourceText: I can explain, @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, I can.
text: Ndingacacisa @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, ndinako.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, it is the middle of the night and you came home later than we agreed. Whatever the reason is, you must understand that this is not acceptable. Your @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name and I felt really worried.
text: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, kusezinzulwini zobusuku kwaye ubuyele ekhaya emva kwexesha ebesivumelene ngalo.Nokuba isizathu sithini, kufanele uqonde ukuba ayamkelekanga lonto. @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name wakho kunye nam sizive sikhathazekile nyhani.

SourceText: My friends wanted me to stay longer. They were calling me a baby for having to go home already.
text: Abahlobo bam bebefuna ndihlale ixesha elide, Bebendibiza ngokuba ndingumntwana kuba kufuneke ndigodukile.

SourceText: I know it can be hard to say no to your friends. Let’s talk more about this in the morning when we have had some rest.
text: Ndiyayazi ukuba kunganzima ukuthi hayi kubahlobo bakho. Masithethe ngakumbi ngalento kusasa xa sithe safumana ithuba lokuphumla.

SourceText: I am sorry I worried you and @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
text: Ndicela uxolo ngokunikhathaza wena kunye no @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Thank you. Now go to bed, but just to be clear, as you came home later than we agreed, you will not be allowed to see your friends tomorrow.
text: Enkosi. Ngoku hamba uyokulala, kodwa ukucacisa nje, njengokuba ubuye ekhaya emva kwexesha besivumelene ngalo, awuzukuvumeleka ukuba uyokubona abahlobo bakho ngomso.

SourceText: I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant.
text: Bendikhathalela abazukulwana bam, u@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name kunye no@data.characters.f2_son_15.name, kususela ukusweleka kwabazali babo beselula. Sihlala sisokola ngemali, njengoba ndifumana isibonelelo esincinci.

SourceText: I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I am fighting with my teens over things they want – again.
text: Ndinoxinzelelo olukhulu. Andinamali eshekileyo. Yaye ngoku ndilwa nabantwana bam abafikisayo ngezinto abazifunayo – kwakhona.

SourceText:
I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive.

I should save, but that feels impossible!
text:
Ndibafunela ikamva eliqaqambileyo abazukulwana bam, kodwa andazi ukuba ndingayifumana phi imali. Oomatshonisa bayingozi kwaye ukubabuyisela kubiza kakhulu. 

Ndimele ndonge imali, kodwa lonto ivakala ngathi ayinakwenzeka!

SourceText: My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?
text: Iphupha lam kukuqinisekisa ukuba umzukulwana wam ongumfana uyakwazi ukuya kwisikolo samabanga aphezulu kwaye umzukulwana wam oyintombazana akwazi ukufezekisa iphupha lakhe lokuya edyunivesithi. Ndingakwazi njani ukugcina imali eninzi ngale malana encinci endinayo?

SourceText: I know – let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a stokvel.
text: Ndiyazi - masiqale ngesicwangciso! Okokuqala, mandenze uhlahlo lwabiwo mali – isicwangciso sendlela endinokonga ngayo imali yam. Emva koko ndiza konga intwana yemali ngexesha – ndingade ndijoyine namaqela okonga mali.

SourceText: I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but do not need.
text: Kufanele ndithethe nabazukulwana bam ukuze sikhethe izinto esinokunciphisa inkcitho kuzo veki nganye. Baza kundincedisa ndicinge ngezinto esizifunayo kodwa esingazidingiyo.

SourceText: Look, we reached our dreams! I did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name’s high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s university. I am so proud of this.
text: Jonga, siwafezekisile amaphupha ethu! Andikhange ndiboleke mali kwizihlobo okanye koomatshonisa. Ngokubeka imali encinci veki nganye, ndikwazile ukuhlawula imali ka@data.characters.f2_son_15.name yamabanga aphakamileyo ndaza ndabeka imali ethile ka@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name yasedyunivesithi. Ndiyazidla ngale nto.

SourceText: One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.
text: Ngobunye ubusuku kwabakho isichotho esibi esonakalisa uphahla lwam. Yonke into yayikhukhulisekile. Ngesaquphe kwafuneka ndizame imali yokulungisa uphahla. Ndaziva ndoyisakele.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! Look at all those dishes, why did you not wash those like we agreed!
text: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! Jonga kuzo zonke ezazitya, kutheni ungazivasanga njengoba besivumelene!
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name… I can explain, there is this guy from my class, on WhatsApp he…
text: Uxolo, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name…Ndingacacisa,Kukhona lomfana eklasini yam, kuWhatsApp u…
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name… should not be translated.

SourceText: (_thinking_): Let me take a pause… just breathe…
text: (_ecinga_): Makhe ndiphumle... ukuphefumla nje…

SourceText: I am sorry, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
text: Ndiyaxolisa, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Now tell me, what happened on WhatsApp?
text: Ngoku ndixelele, yintoni eyenzekileyo ku WhatApp?

SourceText: This boy in class shared a video of me in a WhatsApp group, and now everyone is making fun of me.
text: Le nkwenkwe yabelane ngevidiyo yam kwiqumrhu lika-Whatsapp, kwaye wonke umntu ngoku uhlekisa ngam.

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that, but I am glad you told me, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. It does not mean you can leave your chores. After we speak, you need to do the dishes so I can make dinner. But first, what do you think we should do about the bully problem?
text: Ndiyaxolisa ukuyiva lonto, kodwa ndiyavuya undixelele,@data.characters.f2_son_15.name. Loo nto ayithethi ukuba uyeke umsebenzi wakho. Emva kokuba sithethile, kumele uvase izitya ndizokwazi ukwenza isidlo sangokuhlwa. Kodwa kuqala, ucinga ukuba sifanele senze ntoni ngengxaki yokuxhatshazwa?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: He makes me so angry, I just want to hit him. Or maybe I should tell my teacher?
text: Undenza ndibenomsindo kakhulu, ndifuna nje ukumbetha. Okanye ndingaxelela utitshala wam?

SourceText: Hmm… What do you think will happen if you hit him? And if you tell your teacher?
text: Hmm... Ucinga ukuba yintoni enokwenzeka xa umbethile? Kwaye ukuba uxele utitshala wakho?

SourceText: I don’t know. If I hit him we may get into a big fight and I could get hurt or get into trouble at school. But if I tell my teacher they may call me a snitch… Maybe you could talk to the teacher?
text: Andiyazi. Ukuba ndiyambetha singangena emlweni omkhulu kwaye ndingonzakala okanye ndibesengxakini esikolweni. Kodwa ukuba ndixelela utitshala wam bangandibiza ngokuba ndiyimpimpi... Mhlawumbi ungathetha notitshala wam?

SourceText: That sounds like a good idea. I could also go talk to his parents if you want me to.
text: Ivakala ngathi ngumbono omhle lowo. Ndingaya noyokuthetha nabazali bakhe ukuba uyafuna ndiye.

SourceText: No @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, please don’t! Maybe I can skip school tomorrow instead?
text: Hayi @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, ndiyakucela sukuya. Mhlawumbi endaweni yoko ndingangayi esikolweni ngomso?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText:
No, Thabo — you can’t miss school. 
I have an idea! Let’s practise how you might reply if classmates tease you. Do you want to try ignoring it or making a small joke?
text:
Hayi, Thabo - awukwazi ukuphosa isikolo.
Ndinombono! Masiziqhelanise ukuba ungabaphendula njani ukuba abantwana ofunda nabo bayakugezela. Ufunua ukuzama ungayihoyi okanye wenze isiqhulo esincinci?

SourceText: Maybe I’ll just say, “Don’t worry, I was testing gravity — it still works!
text: Mhlawumbi ndingathi, " Sukukhathazeka, bendizama amandla - isasebenza!

SourceText: Haha! That’s good! Remember, keeping calm or laughing along takes away their power.
text: Haha! Kulungile! Khumbula, ukungcina uzolile okanye uhleka kunye kususa amandla abo.

SourceText: How are things going at school now?
text: Zihamba njani izinto ngoku esikolweni?

SourceText: It is going better, the boy deleted the video from the WhatsApp group chat. But he is still being really mean to me.
text: Ihmba ngcono, inkwenkwe iyicimile ividiyo kwiqumrhu lika-Whatsapp lokuncokola. Kodwa usandicaphukisa.

SourceText:
I am sorry to hear that, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. I will be speaking to your teacher tomorrow — your school knows how to handle this safely.
If that does not work, we will try something else.
text:
Ndiyaxolisa ukuyiva lonto,@data.characters.f2_son_15.name. Ndizakuthetha notitshala wakho ngomso - isikolo sakho siyayazi singayiphatha jani lento ngokukhuselekileyo.
Ukuba ayisebenzi, sizakuzama enye into.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Yes, thank you, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. At least I know you are on my side.
text: Ewe, enkosi, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. Noko ndiyayazi usecaleni kwam.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: You cannot go out for the next month
text: Awuzuphuma kulenyanga izayo

SourceText: Uuugh… that’s so unfair, I did not do anything wrong!
text: Uuugh... ayilunganga lonto, Andenzanga nto embi!

SourceText: I am not trying to accuse your friend or be jealous. I am worried that when someone gives a gift it is hard to say 'no' when they ask something in return – like sex. If you want to have a phone, we will save up together so you can make your own decisions without owing him anything.
text: Andizami kutyhola umhlobo wakho okanye ukuba nomona. Ndikhathazwa kukuba xa umntu ekuphe isipho kunzima ukuthi ‘hayi’ xa efuna ukubhatalwa – njengokwabelana ngesondo. Ukuba ufuna ukuba nefowuni, siza konga sobabini ukuze ukwazi ukwenza izigqibo zakho ngaphandle kokumtyala into ethile.

SourceText: That makes sense, thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
text: Iyavakala, enkosi, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: This makes me realise we should talk about boyfriends and protecting yourself. Many teens your age get pregnant or become HIV positive. Let’s go to the clinic so you can talk with the nurse to learn how you can stay safe.
text: Oku kwenza ndiqonde ukuba simele sithethe ngamakhwenkwe nokuzikhusela. Abantwana abasafikisayo abaninzi abalingana nawe bayakhulelwa okanye babe ne- ngculaza (HIV). Masiye ekliniki ukuze uthethe nomongikazi ukuze ubone indlela onokuhlala ngayo ukhuselekile.

SourceText: Okay, thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
text: Kulungile, enkosi, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: I don't think I am ready..
text: Andiziqondi uba ndikulungele..

SourceText: Oh come on... We are ready for the next step. We see each other all the time and we never do anything more… You know I love you, right!
text: Hayi wethu... Sisilungele isigaba esilandelayo. Siyabonana kunye lonke ixesha kwaye asizange senze enye into... Uyayazi ndiyakuthanda, nheee!

SourceText: Hi beautiful, can I buy you a snack?
text: Molo nobuhle, ndingakuthengela izinto ezimnandi?

SourceText: Uhmmm... I don’t…
text: Uhmmm... Andi…

SourceText: Yes, she’ll have it!
text: Ewe, uzakusithatha!

SourceText: Hey pretty, why are you walking so fast! Don’t you want to come show us what is under that skirt?
text: Yhee nobuhle, kutheni uhamba ngokukhawuleza! Awufuni ukuza uzosibonisa uba yintoni ephantsi kweso siketi?

SourceText: @data.characters.friend_female_4.name, if you want to get good grades this year you need to stay after school when everyone is gone so I can tutor you.
text: @data.characters.friend_female_4.name**:, ukuba ufuna ukufumana amanqaku amahle kulo nyaka, kufuneka uhlale emveni kokuphuma kwesikolo xa wonke umntu emkile ukuze ndikufundise.
note: The string @data.characters.friend_female_4.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: My friend also needs support. Can I invite her too?
text: Umhlobo wam naye udinga inkxaso. Ndingammema naye?

SourceText: No, this will be our secret. You don't want people to think you are stupid, right?
text: Hayi, le iyakuba yimfihlo yethu. Awufuni abantu bacinge usisidenge, nhee?

SourceText: Look, I still have this sexy picture that @data.characters.friend_female_2.name sent me! I will post it online, that should teach her not to break up with me.
text: Jonga, ndisenawo lomfanekiso onomtsalane ka @data.characters.friend_female_2.name owandithumelelayo! ndizakuwu xhoma kumakhasi onxibelelwano, oko kuyakumfundisa ukuba angohlukani nam.
note: The string @data.characters.friend_female_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText: I just wanted to…
text: Bendifuna uku…

SourceText: No, you are staying here. You always leave me alone to go see your friends. Don’t you love me? Or are you meeting your other boyfriend?!
text: Hayi, uyahlala apha. Usoloko undishiya ndodwa uyokubona abahlobo bakho. Awundithandi? Okanye uyokudibana nelinye iqabane lakho?!

SourceText: No, I don't want to...
text: Hayi, andifuni...

SourceText: Your friends left, so this is the only way you can get home, you idiot!
text: Abahlobo bakho bamkile, ke ngoko yilena qha indlela yogoduka, wena sibhanxa!

SourceText: Don’t tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.
text: Ungabaxeleli abantu abadala, kodwa ndiya emzini othengisa utywala nabahlobo bam ebusuku.

SourceText: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.
text: Yonwaba! Ndibaxelele ukuba ndihlala nentombi yam endithandana nayo, kodwa apho ndiya khona ndiya epatini.

SourceText: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can’t tell my parents – they will be so angry!
text: Ndicinga ukuba basebenzisa iziyobisi. Singabanjwa sonke. Kodwa andinakubaxelela abazali bam – baya kuba nomsindo kakhulu!

SourceText: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can’t tell my parents – I lied about coming to this party.
text: Ndiyoyika. Wonke umntu unxile kakhulu ukuba angandigodusa. Lo mfana uthi angandigodusa, kodwa ufuna siqale kwakhe. Andinakubaxelela abazali bam - ndibaxokisile ngokuza kule pati.
