SourceText: Here are some easy steps to use consequences when your child does not listen.
text: Nanga amanye amanyathelo alula okusebenzisa iziphumo xa umntwana wakho engamameli.

SourceText: BE CALM
text: ZOLA

SourceText:
Take some deep breaths or walk away from the situation if you need to.

Then, respond in a calm, clear way.
text:
Tsala umoya ezantsi, okanye umke kwindawo ukuba ufuna njalo.

Emva koko, phendula ngokuzolileyo, ngendlela ecacileyo.

SourceText: Shouting at our children only makes things worse. It also teaches them that it is okay to treat others like this when they are upset.
text: Ukubangxolisa abantwana bethu kwenza izinto zibe ngakumbi. ikwabafundisa ukuba kulungile ukuphatha abanye ngoluhlobo xa becaphukile.

SourceText: BE FAIR
text: YIBA NOBULUNGISA

SourceText: Give a consequence connected to the behaviour, and make sure it is something you can follow through with.
text: Nika iziphumo ezinxulumene nokuziphatha kwaye uqiniseke ukuba yinto onokuthi uyilandele.

SourceText:
For example, if they do not clean up their toys, they cannot play with them the next day (rather than the whole week).

If your child is experiencing a natural consequence for their action (like not being able to play with their toy after breaking it), you might not need to give them an additional consequence.
text:
Umzekelo, ukuba abazicoci izinto zabo zokudlala, abanakudlala ngazo ngosuku olulandelayo (kuneveki yonke).

Ukuba umntwana wakho ufumana isiphumo sendalo ngesenzo sakhe (njengokungakwazi ukudlala ngento yakhe yokudlala emveni kokuba eyophulile), akudingeki ukumnika esinye isiphumo kwakhona.

SourceText: BE CONSISTENT
text: UKUNGAGUQUGUQUKI

SourceText: Follow through with a consequence every time a rule is broken, even if it feels small. Being consistent shows your child you mean what you say and helps them take the rules seriously.
text: Landela ngeziphumo ngalo lonke ixesha kusaphulwa umthetho, nokuba uvakala umncinci. Ukungaguquki kubonisa umntwana wakho ukuba uthetha lento uyithethayo kwaye umncede ayithathele ingqalelo imithetho.

SourceText: If you miss a chance to follow through, do not worry – just try again next time.
text: Ukuba uphose ithuba lokulandela, sukukhathazeka - zama kwakhona kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText: INVOLVE THEM
text: BABANDAKANYE

SourceText: Ask your child what a fair consequence might be if a rule is not followed. This helps them learn responsibility and makes it more likely they will stick to the rule.
text: Buza umntwana wakho ukuba sesiphi isiphumo esifanelekileyo ukuba umthetho awulandelwanga. Oku kunokubanceda bafunde uxanduva kwaye kwenza kubelula ukuba babambelele kumthetho.

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye ingcebiso

SourceText: You can also involve your child in choosing simple and free rewards for their behaviours. This will encourage them to follow the rules more often!
text: Unokumbandakanya umntwana wakho ekukhetheni imivuzo elula kwaye esimahla ngokuziphatha kwakhe. Oku kuya kumkhuthaza ukuba alandele imithetho rhoqo!

SourceText: Now that we have learned a few useful tips, let’s come up with some ideas for reasonable and realistic consequences.
text: Ngoku sifundile ngeengcebiso ezimbalwa eziluncedo, masize neengcebiso ezithile zeziphumo ezifanelekileyo nezinenyani.

SourceText: Would any of these consequences be helpful for you and your child?
text: Ingaba enye yezi ziphumo zingaluncedo kakhulu kuwe kunye nomntwana wakho?

SourceText: If you are late for dinner, your food will be cold
text: Ukuba ufike emvakwexesha kwesidlo sangokuhlwa, ukutya kwakho kuzakubanda

SourceText: If you continue splashing water out of the bath, bath time will be over
text: Ukuba uyaqhubeka uchitha amanzi ngaphandle ebhafini, ixesha lokuhlamba lizakuphela

SourceText: If you break your toy, you will have no toy to play with
text: Ukuba uyophulile into yakho yokudlala, awuzokuba nayo into yokudlala

SourceText: If you can’t play close to home where I can see you, then you have to come inside
text: Ukuba awukwazi ukudlala kufutshane nekhaya apho ndinokubona khona, kumele ungene ngaphakathi

SourceText: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out together.
text: Kulungile. Xoxani lento (okanye enye) iziphumo nomntwana wakho kunye nosapho, kwaye nizame kunye.

SourceText: If you do not put away your toys, then you cannot play with them tomorrow morning
text: Ukuba awuzibeki kude izinto zakho zokudlala, awuzokwazi ukudlala ngazo ngomso kusasa

SourceText: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out tomorrow.
text: Kulungile. Xoxani lesi (okanye esinye) isiphumo nomntwana wakho kunye nosapho, kwaye nizame kunye.

SourceText: None of these will work in my home
text: Akukho nenye kwezi eyakusebenza ekhayeni lam

SourceText: That's okay! Try to think of just one consequence that you feel confident you can follow-through with in a calm way. Try starting with something small.
text: Kulungile! Zama ukucinga ngesiphumo sibesinye oziva uzithembile ukuba ungasilandela ngokuzolileyo. Zama ukuqala ngento encinci.

SourceText:
Your home activity is to discuss one household rule that your child finds hard to follow and agree on a fair consequence together. 

Remember, if you praise your child when they follow rules, you will see more positive behaviour in your home.
text:
Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukuxoxa ngomthetho omnye wasekhaya umntwana wakho awufumanisa kunzima ukuwulandela kwaye nivumelane ngesiphumo esifanelekileyo kunye.

Khumbula, ukuba uyamncoma umntwana wakho xa elandela imithetho uya kubona ukuziphatha okulungileyo kwikhaya lakho.

SourceText: Agreeing on consequences together works! Tap play to hear @data.characters.media_female_13.name's story
text: Ukuvumelana ngemiphumela ninonke kuyasebenza! Cofa udlala ukuva @data.characters.media_female_13.name exela ibali lakhe

The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: The next time your child does not follow a rule, can you use a fair consequence in a calm way?
text: Kwixesha elizayo xa umntwana wakho engawulandeli umthetho, ingaba ungakwazi ukusebenzisa iziphumo ezifanelekileyo ngendlela ezolileyo?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That's great! Remember to take a pause before you give the consequence so that you're able to remain calm, and praise yourself afterwards for a job well done!
text: Kulungile! Khumbula ukuma kancinci phambi kokuba unike isiphumo ukuze ukwazi ukuhlala uzolile, kwaye zincome emva koko ngomsebenzi wakho owenze kakuhle!

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Keep trying. It will get easier in time. You can start by considering smaller behaviours that your child struggles with and planning a fair consequence in advance so you're ready.
text: Kulungile. Qhubeka uzame. Kuyakubalula ekuhambeni kwexesha. Ungaqala ngokuqwalasela isimilo esincinci umntwana wakho asokola ngaso kwaye ucwangcise iziphumo ezifanelekileyo kwangaphambili ukuze ube ulungile.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about calm consequences.

Our actions have consequences. Some consequences happen naturally (“if you break something, you can’t use it anymore”). Other consequences we set as a family to motivate us to follow the rules (“if you come home late, you can’t go out with friends tomorrow”).

HOW you set and use consequences together matters.

Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singeziphumo ezizolileyo.

Izenzo zethu zineziphumo. Ezinye iziphumo zenzeka ngokwendalo ("ukuba wophula into, awuphindi uyisebenzise nanini na"). Ezinye iziphumo sizihlela silusapho ukukhuthazana ukulandela imithetho ("ukuba ubuyela ekhaya emva kwexesha, awuzuphuma nezihlobo ngomso").

INDLELA obeka kwaye nosebenzisa ngayo iziphumo zombini zibalulekile.

Ukufumana iziphumo ngokulungileyo kunceda abantwana ofikisayo baziphathe ngcono kwaye kwenza nobomi bosapho buzole.

SourceText: How will introducing calm consequences help you and your family? Play to learn more
text: Ingaba ukwazisa iziphumo ngokuzolileyo kunceda njani wena kunye nosapho lwakho? Dlala ukuze ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers, and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje ngeziphumo ezizolileyo.

Kubalulekile ukuba xa sisazisa iziphumo ebantwaneni bethu abafikisayo sibabandakanye nabo, kodwa kukwabalulekile ukuba sibe sizolile xa sisazisa iziphumo.

Oko kuzakusinceda sivumelane ekwaziseni iziphumo ezizolileyo kubantwana
bethu, kwaye abantwana bethu kuzokubalula ukuba bazikhumbule xa bebandakanyiwe kwaye lonto izakubenza babenoxanduva.

SourceText: Calm consequences work best when they are fair, agreed on together, and followed through consistently - not in anger.
text: Iziphumo ezizolileyo zisebenza ngcono xa zilungile, nivumelene nonke, kwaye zilandelwe ngokuqhubekaya - kungekho msindo.

SourceText: Agreeing on consequences together works! Tap play to hear @data.characters.media_female_13.name tell her story
text: Ukuvumelana ngeziphumo kunye kuyasebenza! Cofa udlala ukuva @data.characters.media_female_13.name exela ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my teenagers did something to make me angry, I would shout at them and punish them right away. But the next time they did it again! I could not understand why they did not hear me even when I shouted.

@global.app_name helped me understand that my teenagers will listen to me more when I am calm. So, when something happens, I take a deep breath and say “we will talk about this later when we are both calm.”

We even agree on the consequences together now before something goes wrong. This has worked wonders – I have seen a huge change in my teen’s behaviour now that they are more involved, and I have less stress.

I wish I knew this long ago, but it is never too late to start!
text:
Xana abantwana bam abafikisayo benze into endenza ndibenomsindo, bendibangxolisa, ndibohlwaye kwangoko. Kodwa kwilixa elizayo bebeyiphinda kwakhona! bendingayiqondi ukuba kutheni bengandiva noba sendibangxolisile.

I @global.app_name indincedile ndaqonda ukuba abantwana bam abafikisayo bangamamela kakhulu xana ndizolile. Ngoko, xana kusenzeka into ndiyaphefumla ngokunzulu ndithi "sakuthetha ngayo ngelinye ixesha xana sobabini sizolile".

Siye savumelane kunye ngeziphumo ngoku ngaphambi kokuba kwenzeke into engalunganga. Lento isebenze ngokumangalisayo- Ndibone umehluko omkhulu kwisimilo somntwana wam ofikisayo ngokuba abeyinxalenye, kwaye lwatsho lwehla noxinzelelo.

Akwaba bendiyazile kwangaphambili, kodwa akukapheli xesha lingako ukuba ndingangaqali!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Let's read what happened with @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and his father, @data.characters.f1_father.name:

note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name! should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, you broke our rule! I will give you a hiding!
text: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, uwophule umthetho wethu! Ndizakubetha!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: That’s unfair! You never listen to me!! I hate you!
text: Ayilungile lonto! Awuzange wandimamela!! Ndiyakucaphukela!

SourceText: Let's think about what happened in this story.
text: Makhe sicinge ngoko kwenzekileyo kweli bali.

SourceText: Why did giving a consequence this way not work well?
text: Kutheni ukunika isiphumo ngoluhlobo kungenako ukusebenza?

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_father.name was angry
text: @data.characters.f1_father.name ebenomsindo
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.name should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_father.name did not let his son, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, explain
text: @data.characters.f1_father.name akamvumelanga unyana wakhe,@data.characters.f1_son_18.name, acacise

SourceText: The consequence was not discussed beforehand with @data.characters.f1_son_18.name
text: Isiphumo asikhange sixoxwe kwangaphambili no @data.characters.f1_son_18.name
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name should not be translated.

SourceText: The consequence was too strong
text: Isiphumo besinzima kakhulu

SourceText: Yes, a strong reaction like that just made everyone more angry and upset.
text: Ewe, impendulo ebukhali ngolo hlobo yenza wonke umntu abenomsindo ngakumbi kwaye bacaphuke.

SourceText:
Teens often break rules. This is normal - growing up is a difficult time when they are learning about who they are.

Luckily, there are ways to discipline without getting angry or using violence… and they work well!

Giving calm consequences is important because it helps teens learn from their actions and take responsibility for their choices.
text:
Abantwana abafikisayo bahlala beyophula imithetho. Oku kuqhelekile - ukukhula lixesha elinzima xa befunda malunga ukuba bangobani. 

Ngethamsanqa, zikhona iindlela zokuqeqesha ngaphandle kokuba nomsindo okanye ukusebenzisa ubundlobongela… kwaye zisebenza kakuhle!

Ukunika iziphumo ezizolileyo kubalulekile ngokuba kunceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde kwizenzo zabo kwaye bathathe uxanduva ngezinto abazikhethela bona.

SourceText:
Imagine you are the parent and @data.characters.f1_son_18.name came home late. 
What consequence would help here?
text:
Khawube nombono ukuba ungumzali kwaye @data.characters.f1_son_18.name afike ekhaya emva kwexesha. 
Sesiphi isiphumo esinokunceda apha?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_son_18.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Cannot play with phone the next day
text: Awuzokukwazi ukudlala ngefowuni kusuku olulandelayo

SourceText:
That's right!

And remember, consequences are not quite the same as punishment: they give our teens a chance to learn responsibility for their actions.

And they are more controlled AND effective than hitting or shouting!
text:
Kulungile!

Kwaye khumbula, iziphumo azifani ncam nesohlwayo: zinika abantwana bethu abafikisayo ithuba lokuba bafunde uxanduva ngezenzo zabo.

Kwaye ziyalawuleka ngakumbi KWAYE zisebenza kakuhle kunokubetha okanye ukubangxolisa!

SourceText:
Now imagine @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name fight over a phone. 
What consequence would help here?
text:
Ngoku yibanombono @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name no @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name besilwa ngefowuni.
Zeziphi iziphumo ezinokunceda apha?

SourceText: No gadget use the next day
text: Makungasetyenziswa sixhobo kusuku olulandelayo

SourceText: Write a letter of apology
text: Bhala ileta yokuxolisa

SourceText: Cannot see friends the next day
text: Akakwazi ukubabona abahlobo bakhe ngosuku olulandelayo

SourceText: Cannot play with phone after dinner (or next hour)
text: Awuzokudlala ngefowuni emva kwedinala (okanye kwiyure elandelayo)

SourceText: Take 5 minutes' pause in a separate part of the room
text: Yithi nqumama imizuzu emi 5 kwicala elibucala legumbi

SourceText: Great idea! Calm consequences work best when they are fair, happen soon after the behaviour, and are used the same way each time. This helps your teen understand what to expect and gives them a clear chance to learn from their actions.
text: Umbono omhle! Iziphumo ezizolileyo zisebenza ngcono xa zilunglile, zisenzeka kwangoko emva kwesimilo, kwaye zisetyenziswe ngendlela efanayo ngalo lonke ixesha. Oku kunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ukuqonde amakakulindele kwaye kubanike ithuba elicacileyo lokuba bafunde kwizenzo zabo.

SourceText:
Now imagine @data.characters.f2_son_15.name is helping with a special chore. 
What consequence would help here?
text:
Ngoku yibanombono @data.characters.f2_son_15.name encedisa kwimisebenzi yasekhaya ekhethekileyo. 
Zeziphi iziphumo ezinokunceda apha?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_son_15.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Extra time with friends on weekend (1 hr)
text: Ixesha elongezelelweyo nabahlobo ngempelaveki (iyure e-1)

SourceText: Cooking teen's favourite meal
text: Ukupheka ukutya okuthandwa ngumntwana ofikisayo

SourceText: Extra time with phone after dinner (30 min)
text: Ixesha elongezelelweyo nefowuni emva kwedinala (imizuzu engama - 30)

SourceText: Watching teen's TV show together
text: Ukubukela inkqubo ka MABONAKUDE yomntwana ofikisayo

SourceText: Extra one-on-one time on Sunday (30 min)
text: Ixesha lomnye nomnye ngeCawa (imizuzu engama- 30)

SourceText: Wonderful! Positive consequences like this build trust and show your teen that helpful behaviour is noticed and appreciated. When rewards are fair, timely, and consistent, they motivate teens to keep making good choices and strengthen your bond too.
text: Kwakuhle! Iziphumo ezilungileyo ezifana nezi zakha ukuthembeka kwaye zibonise umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba isimilo sokuncedisa siqatshelwe kwaye samkelekile. Xa imivuzo ikulungele, ngexesha, kwaye ingajikajiki, ikhuthaza abantwana abafikisayo baqhubeke besenza okulungileyo kwaye iqinise ubudlelwane benu.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you with calm consequences:
text: Nazi ezinye iingcebiso ezinokunceda kwiziphumo ezolileyo:

SourceText: EXPLAIN
text: CACISA

SourceText:
Check you are both calm. Take a few breaths. Explain to your teen why you are concerned about their behaviour.

Explain the reasons why the rule mattered. You can share your feelings – it is okay to say you are disappointed.
text:
Jonga ukuba nobabini nizolile. Phefumla kambalwa. Cacisela kumntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba kutheni uxakekile malunga nesimilo sakhe.

Cacisa izizathu zokuba kutheni lo mthetho ubalulekile. Ningabelana ngemvakalelo zenu - kulungile ukutsho ukuba uphoxekile.

SourceText: How you introduce calm consequences is important. When you involve your teen, things usually go better!
text: Indlela owazisa ngayo iziphumo ezizolileyo kubalulekile. Xa ubandakanya umntwana wakho ofikisayo, izinto ziya zibangcono!

SourceText: AGREE
text: VUMA

SourceText:
Plan consequences with your teen for following and not following the rule.

Ask for their ideas. Talk until you agree on something realistic.

Make a consequence for NOT following the rule and a privilege when they DO follow the rule.
text:
Cwangcisa iziphumo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngokulandela kwaye nokungawulandeli umthetho.

Cela ezabo izimvo. Thethani nide nivumelane ngento eqondakalayo.

Yenza isiphumo SOKUNGAWULANDELI umthetho kwaye nelungelo xa BEWULANDELA umthetho.

SourceText: Remember, consequences are more successful if you discuss and agree in advance with teens before you apply them.
text: Khumbula, iziphumo ziyimpumelelo ngakumbi xa nibonisana kwaye nivumelane kwangethuba nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngaphambi kokuba usisebenzise.

SourceText: ACT
text: YENZA

SourceText:
**When your teen follows the rule, give praise and privileges!** 
They will feel respected and valued. Remember: The more we praise them, the more they will show that good behaviour!


**When your teen does not follow the rule, follow through with the consequence.** 
When your teen breaks the rule, calmly give the consequence. This should be FAIR (not too harsh), IMMEDIATE (do it straight away), CONSISTENT (same every time).
text:
**Xa umtwana wakho ofikisayo elandela umthetho, mncome kwaye umnike namalungelo!** 
Bayakuziva behloniphekile kwaye bexabisekile. Khumbula: Xa siqubeka sibancoma, kuxa beqhubeka nokubonisa isimilo esilungileyo!

**Xa umntwana wakho engalandeli umthetho, landelela ngeziphumo.** 
Xa umntwana wakho esophula umthetho, ngokuzolileyo mnike isiphumo. Kufanele lento ilungelane (ungabiqatha),
NGOKONANGOKO (yenze ngokonangoko), INGAJIKAJIKI (ngohlobo olunye ngalo lonke ixesha).

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye iingcebiso

SourceText: Remember, you can also agree on GOOD consequences for GOOD actions to see more positive behaviour!
text: Khumbula, kananjalo ningavumelana ngeziphumo EZILUNGILEYO ukwenzela izenzo EZILUNGILEYO ukuze ubone isimilo esilungileyo ngakumbi!

SourceText: Now let's go back to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and his father, @data.characters.f1_father.name:

SourceText: I am concerned that you are often still coming home late, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name. What can we do to help you remember to come home in time?

SourceText: If I come home in time, maybe I can stay up 30 minutes later than usual?

SourceText: That is a good idea! And what should we do if you don’t follow the rule?

SourceText: Thank you. Now go to bed, but just to be clear, as you came home later than we agreed, you will not be allowed to go out tomorrow night.

SourceText: The consequence was realistic and appropriate

SourceText: Exactly! Consequences work best when they are set calmly, agreed on together, and followed through with care. By listening to your teen and staying firm but kind, you are correcting behaviour AND building trust and helping them learn responsibility.
text: Ngokwenene! Iziphumo zisebenza ngcono xa zibekwa ngokuzolileyo, nivumelana kunye, kwaye ilandelwe ngenkathalo. Ngokumamela umntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye uhlale uuzinzile kodwa unobubele, ulungisa isimilo KWAYE wakha ukuthembana kwaye nokumncenda ukufundeni uxanduva.

SourceText:
It is time to learn and practise!

Plan a calm consequence for your teenagers arguing with each other during dinner.
text:
Lixesha ngoku lokufunda kwaye nokuzama!

Cwangcisa iziphumo ezolileyo zabantwana bakho abafikisayo abaxambulisanayo ngelixa lesidlo sasebusuku.

SourceText: Here are some ideas from other parents. Tap each behaviour to see an example of a fair consequence!

SourceText:
It is time to learn and practise!

Your home activity this week is to try using one **positive consequence** when your teen does something well — and one **negative consequence** when they break a household rule.
text:
Lixesha lokufunda kwaye nokuzama!

Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kuleveki kukuzama ukusebenzisa **isiphumo esilungileyo** sibesinye xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo enze into kakuhle - kwaye **isiphumo esilunganga** esisodwa xa esophule umthetho wasekhaya.

SourceText:
**Remember, consequences should be:** 
⚖️ FAIR (not too harsh) 
💨 IMMEDIATE (do it straight away) 
🎯 CONSISTENT (same every time)
text:
**Khumbula, iziphumo ingayi:** 
⚖️ IKULUNGELE (ingabi qatha) 
💨 NGOKO NANGOKO (Yenze ngokonangoko) 
🎯 IBESISIGXINA (ifane ngalo lonke ixesha)

SourceText: Can you agree on one NEGATIVE consequence and one POSITIVE consequence with your teen?

SourceText: Yes

SourceText: That's fantastic! When teens help choose their own consequences - both positive and negative - they are more likely to understand and stick to them. You are helping them grow into a responsible young adult.
text: Kuyamangalisa! Xa abantwana abafikisayo bezikhethela ngokwabo iziphumo - ezilungileyo nezingalunganga - bangakwazi ukuqonda kwaye bahlale bezibambile. Uyabanceda bakhule belulutsha oluthatha uxanduva.

SourceText: No

SourceText: That's okay. These conversations can be tricky at first. Keep spending time together and try again when the moment feels right. You are already on the right path.

SourceText: When consequences are calm, clear, and agreed on together, teens are more likely to follow the rules. They will feel respected, not punished, and that is the best way to help our teens learn.
text: Xa iziphumo zizolile, zicacile, kwaye nibe nivumelene kunye, abantwana abafikisayo kubalula nokulandela imithetho. Baya kuziva behloniphekile, bengohlwaywa, kwaye leyo yeyonandlela yokunceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde.

SourceText: Tap play to hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_6.name learned to appreciate calm consequences

SourceText:
My mom and dad would always punish me when they were angry with me. They would shout at me and I would also get angry. I often did not follow the rules, because they were too harsh, I did not understand what they were saying, or I would not even bother listening to them, because we were all angry.

One day, they asked me: Let's think together what the consequence should be for not coming home in time. It was great to give my view – before something happens that makes us all angry. We are all calm and agree first. It is easier for me to follow the rules now because I know I agreed on the rule and on the consequence if I do not follow the rule.
text:
Umama notata wam bebesoloko bendohlwaya xana benomsindo ngakum. bebendingxolisa kwaye nam bendiye ndibenomsindo. bendingasoloko ndiyilandela imithetho, ngokuba ibingqwabalala, bendingayiqondi into abayithethayo, okanye bendingazidini ngokubamamela, ngoba sonke sinomsindo.

Ngenye imini, bandibuza: Makhe sicinge ngokuba izokuba zeziphi iziphumo zokungabuyi ekhaya ngexesha. Bekukuhle kakhulu ukunika uluvo lwam - phambi kokuba kwenzeke into ezakusenza sonke sibenomsindo. Sonke sizolile kwaye siyavumelana kuqala. Kulula kum ukulandela imithetho ngoku ngokuba ndiyayazi ndivumile ngomthetho kunye nakwisiphumo ukuba ndithe andalandela umthetho.

SourceText: ⚠️ Sensitive Content Notice
text: ⚠️ Isaziso Somxholo Obuthathaka

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.
text: Le modyuli ibandakanya umxholo onokuba thathaka. Ungayijonga ngokwakho kuqala. Oku kuya kukulungiselela kakuhle ukwabelana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, kunye nabanye emva koko.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about dealing with crises.

All families experience crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help BEFORE something bad happens, we can overcome any crisis.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singokujongana nentlekele.

Zonke zanamava entlekele. Xa silungiselela kunye kwaye sisazi ukuba singalufumana phi uncedo PHAMBI kokuba kwenzeke into embi, singayoyisa neyiphi na intlekele.

SourceText: Can skills to handle crises help your family? Click play to find out
text: Ingaba izakhono zokumelana nentlekele zungalunceda usapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufumanise

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crisis may occur anywhere. Crisis may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.
text:
Molweni, nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje sesokumelana nentlekele.

Intlekele ingavela naphina Intlekele ingavela nangaliphi na ixesha. Ngoko, kubalulekile ukuba njengosapho nibe nezicwangciso ezikhoyo ukulungiselela naliphi na ilungu losapho eliziifumana likwimeko yentlekele. 

Kubalulekile ukuba nezicwangciso ukuze ilungu ngalinye losapho lizive likhuselekile. 

Xa sijongene nentlkele, masikhumbule ukuma kancinci, siphefumle, uze uhlale uzolile. Oko kuya kukunceda ukumelana ngcono nentlekele.

SourceText: Every crisis is a challenge, but it is also a chance to grow stronger as a family and show your teen that together, you can get through anything.
text: Yonke intlekele ingumceli mngeni kodwa ke ikwalithuba lokukhula somelele njengosapho kwaye ibonisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba nikunye, kwaye ningadlula kuyo nantonina.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_female_9.name and her teen learned to handle crises together. Hear their story
text: U@data.characters.media_female_9.name kunye nomntwana wakhe ofikisiyo bafunde ukumelana nentlekele kunye. Mamela ibali labo

SourceText:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.app_name, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!
text:
Umntwana wam ofikisayo ebedla ngokubanomsindo ngalolonke ixesha. Ebengasoze aphulaphule kwaye besixambulisana kakhulu yonke imihla. Ngokusebenzisa i@global.app_name, ndaqalisa ukuchitha ixesha ngakumbi kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo ukuqinisa ubudlelwana bethu.
Ngenye imin wandixelela ukuba wayeyinxalenye yeqela lemigulukudu kodwa waye wafuna ukuphuma.

Senze izicwangciso zexesha elifutshane nezexesha elide kunye nendlela esinokuyenza ngayo loonto. Ubomi bethu bujongeka bohlukile ngoku!
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Crisis can happen to anyone.

Intlekele ingenzeka nakubani na.

SourceText: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?

SourceText: It’s my Uncle, he… he… he touched me.
text: Ngumalume wam, u... u... uye wandiphatha.

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.
text: (🤔_ecinga_): Tsala umoya... Ufuna ntoni umntwana wam? Ufuna ndizole kwaye ndimamele.

SourceText: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I am listening.
text: Yiza uzokuhlala phantsi ecaleni kwam. Thatha ixesha lakho, ndimamele.

SourceText: It is true, he… he… made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.
text: Yinyani, u... u... undenze ukuba ndiyenze! Undenze ndabelana naye ngesondo! Bendingafuni, ndiyafunga, kwaye ndide ndathi HAYI, kodwa wandixelela ukuba ndiza kuba sengxakini.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.
text: Enkosi ngokwabelana nam ngalento. Awukho sengxakini. Ayilotyala lakho eli.

SourceText: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that’s when it happened.

SourceText: It is okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?

SourceText: Ah I know, let’s go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?

SourceText: Yes… Okay… But will you come with me?
text: Ewe… Kulungile… Kodwa ungahamba nam?

SourceText: Of course I will. And @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this.
text: Ngokuqinisekileyo ndiya kwenza njalo. kwaye @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? ukhumbule ayilotyala lakho eli. Ndiyakuthanda. Ungumntu olungileyo. Siza kudlula kulento.

This was such a difficult situation for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name! And this can happen to other girls, and boys too.

Thankfully, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name gave great support to @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name. Let's think about what she did well.

Le yeyona meko inzima ku@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name kunye no @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name kwaye oku kusenokwenzeka kwamanye amantombazana namakhwenkwe.

Ngombulelo ongazenzisiyo, u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name unike inkxaso enkulu kakhulu u@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name masicinge ngento ayenze kakuhle.

SourceText: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let’s look at an example together.
text: Enye ingxaki ekhathaza abazali abaninzi lugonyamelo nolwaphulo-mthetho. Makhe sijonge kunye umzekelo.

SourceText: Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend.
text: Izolo, mna nabahlobo bam besiye kumdlalo webhola ekhatywayo. Abanye abafana bebenxilile baqalisa umlo nomhlobo wam.

SourceText: Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?

SourceText:
Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think. 

Here are some tips to help you deal with a crisis!
text:
Intlekele ingasenza sizive sinomsindo okanye singenancedo. Kodwa kulapho abantwana bethu abafikisayo basidinga ngokwenene sitsale umoya, simamele kwaye sicinge.

Nanga amanye amacebiso anokunceda xa uhlangabezana nentlekele!

SourceText: BREATHE
text: PHEFUMLA

SourceText: Stay calm. Ask yourself, "What does my teen need right now?"
text: Hlala uzolile, Zibuze, "umntwana wam ofikisayo udinga ntoni ngoku?"

SourceText: LISTEN
text: MAMELA

SourceText: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
text: Mxelele ukuba ukunye nabo yaye uyabathanda.

SourceText: THINK
text: CINGA

SourceText: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now and then long-term plans later.
text: Thetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Yintoni enokunceda le meko? Kusenokufuneka wenze izicwangciso ezingxamisekileyo ngoku, uze wenze izicwangciso zexesha elide kamva.

SourceText: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!

SourceText:
It is helpful to practise dealing with crises before something happens.

Let's look at five family crisis examples together. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK

SourceText:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with @global.app_name, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
text:
Kwiminyaka emibini edlulileyo, ndadlwengulwa ngumalume owayehlala eyadini yethu. Andizange ndimxelele umama wam, ngokuba ndandisoyika kuba wayenokundibetha, andingxolise, okanye andigxothe endlini. Bendingenayo enye indawo yokuya.

Xana umama wam eqalile ne @global.app_name, siqalise ukuchitha ixesha nangakumbi kunye. Bendisamoyika, kodwa ekugqibeleni ndabelana naye umama wam. 
Umama wam akandingxolisanga, kodwa uye wamamela kwaye wandixelela ukuba ayilotyala lam. Siye saya emapoliseni nase kliniki kunye. Ndiyavuya kakhulu ndingazophinda ndithwale lemfihlo..
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Today’s topic is about helping your child learn and grow.

Play helps children learn what is expected and how to get along with others. It supports their development, both in school and at home.

This is true for all children, including those who are shy, have a disability, or struggle to keep up in class.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuncedisa umntwana wakho afunde kwaye akhule.

Ukudlala kunceda abantwana bafunde oko kulindelekileyo kunye nokwazi ukusebenzisana nabanye. Ixhasa indlela abakhula ngayo, esikolweni nasekhaya.

Oku kuyinyani kubantwana bonke, ukuquka nabo banentloni, nabakhubazekileyo, okanye batsala nzima kwigumbi lokufundela.

SourceText: Did you know that playing is the best way to relax AND learn? Tap play to learn more
text: Ubusazi ukuba ukudlala yeyona ndlela yokuphumla KWAYE ufunde? Cofa dlala ukuze ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!
Do you know what is the best way to relax? Playing! 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.
text:
Molweni nonke
Uyayazi ukuba yeyiphi eyona ndlela yokuphumla? Ukudlala! 

Kwaye masinyaniseke, ngomphi umntwana ongathandiyo ukudlala? 

Ukufunda kuthatha ixesha, kodwa kuninzi onokwenza njengomzali ukunceda umntwana wakho. Bayeke badlale kwaye baphonononge. Bayeke babuze imibuzo kwaye bafunde kwimpazamo. Kwaye ubenomonde, Inkxaso yakho iyakubanceda bakhule kwaye baphuhle.

SourceText:
@data.characters.f3_mother.name knows that children learn best by playing.

SourceText:
@data.characters.f3_mother.name helped her son learn new skills by:
- ⚽ **Playing with him**: This let @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learn through doing. @data.characters.f3_mother.name didn’t need to show him how to build a house, he figured it out on his own.
- 🏆 **Letting him lead**: She allowed him to ask questions and explore. Curiosity helps children become confident and creative.
- 👏🏾 **Praising him**: She showed him that being curious and trying ideas is a good thing.
text:
U@data.characters.f3_mother.name uncedise unyana wakhe ukuba afunde isakhono esitsha ngokuthi:
- ⚽ **Edlala naye**: Lento yenze u@data.characters.f3_son_4.name afunde ngokwenza. U@data.characters.f3_mother.name khange adinge ukumbonisa ukuba yakhiwa njani indlu, wazicingela ngokwakhe.
- 🏆 **Wamvumela akhokele**: Uye wamvumela abuze imibuzo kwaye aphonononge. Ukuthanda ukwazi kunceda abantwana bazithembe kwaye babenobuchule.
- 👏🏾 **Ukumncoma**: Wambonisa ukuba ukubanomdla kwaye nokuzama imibono yinto elungileyo.

SourceText:
We learned from @data.characters.f3_mother.name and her son how children can learn through play.  

Did you know that children (just like us) can also learn a lot from their mistakes?

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to learn from her mistake when she plays a bit too rough indoors.
text:
Sifundile ku@data.characters.f3_mother.name kunye nonyana wakhe ukuba abantwana bangakwazi njani ukufunda ngokudlala. 

Ubusazi ukuba abantwana (njengathi) bangakwazi ukufunda nabo kwimpazamo zabo?

Masijonge ukuba u@data.characters.f3_uncle.name umxhasa njani u@data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name ukuba afunde kwimpazamo zakhe xa edlala rhabaxa ngaphakathi endlini.

SourceText: I am not happy that you broke the vase, but thank you for realising your mistake and saying sorry. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?

SourceText: It’s OK, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.

SourceText: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.
text: Ngokwenene! U @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name ufunde izinto ezibalulekileyo kuba u @data.characters.f3_uncle.name uphendula ngendlela ezolileyo kwaye exhasayo.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you support your child as they learn and develop important skills.
text: Nazi ezinye ingcebiso zokunceda uxhase umntwana wakho njengoko efunda kwaye ephuhlisa izakhono ezibalulekileyo.

SourceText: LEARN BY PLAYING
text: FUNDA NGOKUDLALA

SourceText:
Play helps children develop important physical and social skills. 

Set aside time to play games with your child, be creative, and have fun together. Remember, through play, you also learn what kind of support your child may need.
text:
Ukudlala kunceda ukuphuhlisa izakhono ezibalulekileyo ngokwasemzimbeni kwaye nezakhono zentlalo. 

Beka ecaleni ixesha lokudlala imidlalo nomntana wakho, yiba nobuchule, kwaye nonwabe kunye. Khumbula, ngokudlala, ungafunda ngoluphi uhlobo lwenxaso umntwana wakho aludingayo.

SourceText:
You can support your child to play and make friends with other children, so they learn how to interact with others well. 

If your child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause and playing together.
text:
Ungaxhasa umntwana wakho ngokudlala kwaye wenze abahlobo kunye nabanye abantwana, ukuze bafunde ukuba kunxulumanwa kanjani nabanye ngokunjalo. 

Ukuba umntwana wakho uqalisa ukuziva onganyelwe nayiphina into kusuku lwakhe, bancedise ukwehlisa uxinzelelo ngokuthi nqumama kwaye nidlale kunye.

SourceText: BE PATIENT
text: YIBA NOMONDE

SourceText:
Learning new things takes time. Be patient and encourage your child to keep trying, even when things feel hard. 

Stay calm when they get angry or frustrated – your child will learn to do the same over time.
text:
Ukufunda izinto ezintsha kuthatha ixesha. Yiba nomonde kwaye ukhuthaze umntwana wakho ukuqhubeka ezama, nokuba izinto zivakala zinzima. 

Hlala uzolile xa besiba nomsindo okanye bexinekile - Umntwana wakho uyakufunda ukwenza okufanayo ngokuhamba kwexesha.

SourceText:
You can support them by praising them for trying, and helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks that are appropriate for their age.

Use play to help your child learn difficult skills, like losing, sharing, or taking turns.
text:
Ungabaxhasa ngokubancoma ngokuzama, kwaye ukubanceda ukwahlula imisebenzi emikhulu ibe yimesebenzi emincinci efanelekileyo kwiminyaka yabo.

Sebenzisa ukudlala ukunceda umntwana wakho afunde izakhono ezinzima, njengokohluleka, ukwabelana, okanye ukutshintshana.

SourceText: SUPPORT CURIOSITY
text: XHASA UMDLA

SourceText: Children learn by asking questions and exploring the things they are interested in. Give your child time and space to do this, and be patient when they make mistakes. We all learn from our mistakes!
text: Abantwana bafunda ngokubuza imibuzo kwaye baphonononge izinto abanomdla kuzo. Nika umntwana wakho ixesha kunye nethuba ukwenza lento, kwaye ubenomonde xa besenza iimpazamo. Sonke sifunda kwiimpazamo zethu!

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye ingcebiso

SourceText:
Your child may talk a lot and have many questions –  including difficult ones. You can give your child short but honest answers. 

If you need a break or more information, you can take a pause and tell your child you will respond to them later.
text:
Umntwana wakho angathetha kakhulu kwaye abenemibuzo emininzi - ukuquka neyona inzima. Unganika umntwana wakho impendulo emfutshane kodwa enyanisekileyo. 

Xa udinga ukhefu okanye incukacha ezithe vetshe, ungathi nqumama kwaye uxelele umntwana wakho ukuba uzakuphendula ethubeni.

SourceText: Now that you’ve learned tips to support your child’s learning through play, let’s come up with some practical ideas to try out!
text: Njengoba ngoku ufundile ingcebiso ukuxhasa umntwana wakho ukufunda bedlala, masize neengcebiso ezisebenzayo onokuzizama!

SourceText: What could you do to encourage your child to play and learn?
text: Ungenza ntoni ukukhuthaza umntwana wakho adlale kwaye afunde?

SourceText: Join their play
text: Zibandakanye emidlalweni yabo

SourceText: That’s right! Join in on any play activity your child is doing. You will strengthen your bond and encourage your child to play and learn more.
text: Kulungile! Zibandakanye nakowuphi umdlalo umntwana wakho awenzayo. Uzakomeleza ubudlelwane benu kwaye ukhuthaze umntwana wakho adlale kwaye afunde ngakumbi.

SourceText: Go outside together
text: Hambani niye phandle kunye

SourceText: Great idea. Try to look for opportunities to play and learn, like collecting leaves or rocks on the way home from school.
text: Umbono omhle. Zama ukujonga amathuba okudlala kwaye afunde, njengokuqokelela amagqabi okanye amatye endleleni esuka esikolweni.

SourceText: Use household items
text: Sebenzisa izinto ezise ndlini

SourceText: Yes! Get creative. Anything in your home could be a musical instrument, costume, or item in a role-play.
text: Ewe! Yiba nobuchule. Nantoni na esendlini yakho ingasisixhobo somculo, isinxibo somdlalo, okanye izinto ezisetyenziswayo kumdlalo wokulinganisa.

SourceText: Ask their ideas
text: Cela imbono zabo

SourceText: Exactly. If you are not sure how you could play together, your child will have many ideas for what you could do.
text: Ngokunjalo. Ukuba awuqinisekanga ukuba ningadlala kanjani nonke, umntwana wakho anganembono ezininzi zokuba ningenza ntoni.

SourceText: Other
text: Enye

SourceText: Wonderful! No matter what you choose, spending time playing with your child is what truly matters. You will help them develop key skills and broaden their imagination. Well done!
text: Kwakuhle! Nokuba yintonina oyikhethileyo, ukuchitha ixesha nidlala nomntwana wakho yeyonanto ibaluleke nyhani. Uyakubanceda ukuphuhisa izakhono ezibalulekileyo, kwaye wandise imifanekiso ngqondweni yabo. Wenze kakuhle!

SourceText:
Want to help your child develop and grow?

This week's home activity is to invite your child to play with you. Encourage them to ask questions and explore new things through play.
text:
Ufuna ukunceda umntwana wakho aphuhle kwaye akhule?

Umsebenzi wasekhaya kule veki kukumema umntwana wakho adlale kunye nawe. Bakhuthaze ukuba babuze imibuzo kwaye baphande izinto ezintsha ngemidlalo.

SourceText: Play helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her son become closer. Tap play to hear how
text: Ukudlala kuncede u @data.characters.media_female_14.name nonyana wakhe basondelelana. Cofa udlala ukuva kanjani
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_14.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My son was not really talking. I was worried about it but did not know how I could help him.

@global.app_name gave me lots of ideas for what I could do to help him develop at home. By playing together, we were able to practise many words in a fun way. He is speaking much more now, and we are closer because of the time we spend together.
text:
Unyana wam ebengathethi ncam. Ibindikhathaza lonto kodwa ndingayazi ukuba ndingamnceda njani.

I @global.app_name indinike iimbono ezininzi zokuba ndingenza njani ukumnceda aphuhle ekhaya. Ngokudlala sonke, siye sikwazi ukuzama amagama amaninzi ngendlela eyonwabisayo. Uthetha kakhulu ngoku, kwaye sisondelene ngenxa yexesha esilichithileyo kunye.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Could you make time to play and learn with your child this week?
text: Ungalenza ixesha lokudlala kwaye ufunde kunye nomntwana wakho kuleveki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That’s great! Even a few minutes of play each day can help your child learn and feel close to you.
text: Kwakuhle! Nokuba yimizuzwana embalwa yokudlala ngosuku ngalinye kunganceda umntwana wakho afunde kwaye azive esondele kuwe.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s okay. Even a few minutes a day can make a big difference. Try finding a small moment that works for you.
text: Kulungile. Nokuba yimizuzwana nje embalwa ngosuku kungawenza umehluko omkhulu. Zama ukufumana ixeshana elincinci elikusebenzelayo.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That’s okay. Try starting with one small moment, like sitting and watching your child play or asking what they’re building. Every little bit helps!
text: Kulungile. Zama ukuqala ngexeshana nje elincinci, njengokuhlala kwaye ubukele umntwana wakho edlala okanye ubuze yintoni le bayakhayo. Nentwana nje encinci iyanceda!

SourceText:
Today we are learning to talk about feelings with our children. 

Recognising emotions in ourselves and our children is an important skill.

Talking about feelings helps our children learn to express and manage their emotions – even the difficult ones.
text:
Namhlanje sifunda ngokuthetha malunga nemvakalelo kunye nabantwana bethu. 

Ukuqwalasela iimvakalelo zeziqu zethu kunye nabantwana sisakhono esibalulekileyo.

Ukuthetha malunga nemvakalelo kunceda abantwana bethu bafunde ukuveza kwaye bakwazi ukumelana nemvakalelo zabo - nezinzima ngakumbi.

SourceText: How will talking about feelings with your children help you and your family? Tap play to find out
text: Ukuthetha nabantwana bakho malunga ne mvakalelo kungakunceda njani kunye nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ufumanise

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Does your child ever get really angry, upset and you don’t know what to do? 

You can help your child to manage their emotions better by showing them how to talk about their feelings. You start with noticing and accepting all the emotions we have. We are all human.
text:
Molweni, kumntu wonke.

Ingaba umntwana wakho ukhe ebenomsindo, akhathazeke kwaye ungazi ukuba mawenze ntoni?

Ungamnceda umntwana wakho amelane nemvakalelo zakhe ngcono ngokubabonisa ngokuthetha malunga ne mvakalelo. Uqala ngokuqaphela kwaye wamnkele zonke imvakalelo esinazo. Sonke singabantu.

SourceText: Let’s take a look at how @data.characters.f3_mother.name and her daughter, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, talk about feelings in a practical way:
text: Makhe sijonge ukuba@data.characters.f3_mother.name kunye nentombi yakhe, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, bathetha njani ngemvakalelo ngendlela yokuziqhelanisa:

SourceText: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, I have 5 minutes to spend one-on-one time with you. What would you like to do?
text: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, ndinemizuzu emi- 5 yokuchitha ixesha kunye nawe sisodwa. Ungathanda senze ntoni?
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s play with the ball outside!
text: Masidlale ngebhola ngaphandle!

SourceText: I can’t do it!
text: Andikwazi ukuyenza!

SourceText: I see that your hands are tight and you are speaking loudly. It looks like you are upset, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. It’s not easy, let’s practise a little bit more. I know you can do it.
text: Ndiyabona ukuba izandla zakho zibophelelekile kwaye uthethela phezulu. Ukhangeleka ngathi ucaphukile, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. Akukho lula, Masizame kwakhona. Ndiyazi ungayenza lento.
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Five throws in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five!
text: Ubambe ka- 5 kulandelelana! Ubonakala uzingca kakhulu ngokuba ukwazile ukubamba kahlanu!

SourceText: Let’s do 10!
text: Masenze 10!

SourceText: Well done! I am very happy to be able to spend this time with you, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name.
text: Uqhube kakuhle! Ndivuya kakhulu ukuba ndikwazile ukuchitha eli xesha kunye nawe, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name.
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s talk about what happened when @data.characters.f3_mother.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name decided to play ball outside.
text: Masithethe malunga ngento eyenzekileyo ngoku u @data.characters.f3_mother.name kunye @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name bagqibe ukuba bayokudlala ibhola ngaphandle.

SourceText: Why does @data.characters.f3_mother.name name @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s feelings when she’s feeling angry and then proud?
text: Kutheni u@data.characters.f3_mother.name ebize imvakalelo zika @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name xana eziva enomsindo aphinde azingce?

SourceText: To make @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name feel better instantly
text: Ukwenza @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name azive ngcono ngoko nangoko
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Not quite. Naming emotions might not make someone feel better right away. The goal is to help her recognize her feelings so she can handle them better next time.
text: Hayi ncam. Ukuchaza imvakalelo akunakwenza umntu azive ngcono ngoko nangoko. Injongo kukunceda yena aqwalasele imvakalelo zakhe kwenzele akwazi ukuzilawula ngcono kwilixa elizayo.

SourceText: To help @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learn to recognise her own emotions
text: Ukunceda u-@data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name afunde ukuziqwalasela imvakalelo zakhe
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f3_mother.name models an important skill.
text: Kulungile. Ukubiza imvakalelo zika @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, u@data.characters.f3_mother.name ubonakalisa isakhono esibalulekileyo.

SourceText: To teach @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name how to solve problems on her own
text: Ifundisa u@data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name ukuba uyisombulula njani ingxaki ngokwakhe
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Not really. While solving problems is important, the main goal here is to help @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name recognise her emotions. Once she knows what she’s feeling, she’ll be better at solving problems next time.
text: Akunjalo. Ngelixa usombulula ingxaki kubalulekile, eyona njongo apha kukunceda @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name aqaphele imvakalelo zakhe. Ukwazi kwakhe ukuba uziva njani, uzakubangcono ekusombululeni ingxaki kwixesha elizayo.
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: To distract @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name from what’s bothering her
text: Ukumphazamisa u-@data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name kwinto emhluphayo
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Not quite. The goal isn’t to take her mind off her feelings. By naming her emotions, @data.characters.f3_mother.name is helping @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name understand what she’s feeling, so she can deal with it better next time.
text: Hayi ncam. Injongo akuko kuthatha ingqondo yakhe kwi mvakalelo zakhe. Ngokuchaza imvakalelo zakhe u @data.characters.f3_mother.name unceda u @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name ukuba aqonde imvakalelo zakhe, ukwenzela azokwazi ukumelana nazo kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText: We can learn a lot from @data.characters.f3_mother.name.
text: Singafunda lukhulu ku @data.characters.f3_mother.name.
note: The string @data.characters.f3_mother.name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
Notice how she: 
- 🗣️ Names @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s positive *and* difficult emotions
- 💜 Accepts whatever emotions @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s is feeling
- 🌹 Stays calm despite @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s frustration
- 😌 Uses words to describe @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s emotions
- ⭐ Shares her own feelings
text:
Qaphela ukuba unjani:
- 🗣️ Amagama ka @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name alungileyo *okunye* nemvakalelo ezinzima 
- 💜 Wamnkela naziphi na imvakalelo u @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name azivayo.
- 🌹 Uhlala ezolile nokuba u @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name unoxinizelelo.
- 😌 Usebenzisa amagama ukuchaza imvakalelo zika @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name 
- ⭐ Wabelana ngemvakalelo zakhe

SourceText: What could have happened if @data.characters.f3_mother.name had criticised or ignored @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name’s frustration?
text: Kungenzeke ntoni ukuba u-@data.characters.f3_mother.name ucalucale okanye akahoya ukudandatheka kuka @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name?

SourceText: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name would have given up
text: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name ebesonokuyekelela
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to help our children learn how to deal with their feelings.
text: Kulungile. Ukuqaphela kwaye uchaze imvakalelo zakho yinto ebalulekileyo ukunceda abantwana bethu bafunde ukumelana ne mvakalelo zabo.

SourceText: The same problem would happen again next time
text: Kwalengxaki inye ingaqhubeka kwakhona kwixesha elizayo

SourceText: That’s right. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn how to deal with their emotions.
text: Ilungile. Ukuqaphela kwaye uchaze imvakalelo zakho yinto ebalulekileyo ukunceda abantwana bethu bafunde ukumelana ne mvakalelo zabo.

SourceText: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name would not have learned how to catch a ball
text: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name ngeyengakhange akwazi ukufunda ukubamba ibhola
note: The string @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Exactly. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
text: Ngqo. Ukuqaphela kwaye uchaze imvakalelo zakho yinto ebalulekileyo ukunceda abantwana bethu bafunde izakhono ezitsha.

SourceText: With these three tips, you can help your child learn to manage their emotions well.
text: Ngezingcebiso zintathu, ungamnceda umntwana wakho afunde ukumelana ne mvakalelo zakhe kakuhle.

SourceText: NOTICE
text: Qaphela

SourceText: Recognise the *positive* and *difficult* emotions that you and your child feel.
text: Qwalasela *okulungileyo* kunye *nobunzima* bemvakalelo ezinokuthi wena nomntwana wakho nizive.

SourceText: To recognise feelings, pay attention to your thoughts and to your and your child’s words and actions.
text: Ukuze uziqonde iimvakalelo zakho, nikela ingqalelo kwiingcinga zakho nakumazwi nezenzo zomntwana wakho.

SourceText: ACCEPT
text: YAMNKELA

SourceText: Be open to how you and your child feel. All feelings are okay.
text: Vuleka kwindlela wena nomntwana wakho eniziva ngayo. Zonke iimvakalelo zilungile.

SourceText:
There are six basic emotions. Each send us an important message:
😊 Happy: Keep doing things that make you feel good. 

☹️ Sad: Something important in your life needs attention.

😠 Angry: Stand up for yourself and set limits.

🤢 Disgusted: Move away from something you don't like.

😯 Surprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.

😨 Afraid: Run away from danger.
 
As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text:
Kukho iimvakalelo ezintandathu ezisisiseko. Ngamnye usithumelela umyalezo obalulekileyo:
😊 Ndowabile: Qhubeka wenze into ekwenza uzive ulungile.

☹️ Ukukhathazeka: Into ebalulekileyo ebomini bakho ifuna ukuhoywa. 

😠 Umsindo: Yima ngokwakho kwaye ubeke imida.

🤢 Zonda: Bhekela kwinto ongayithandiyo.


😯 Ndimangalisiwe: Yima kwaye unikele ingqalelo okomzuzwana.


😨 Ukoyika: Balekela kude kwingozi.

Njengoko abantwana bekhula, bafunda ukuchonga ezinye iimvakalelo ezininzi, njengemvakalelo, imincili, ukuphoxeka, ukuzingca, ukubawedwa, uxolo, ityala, okanye ukubhideka.

SourceText: TALK
text: THETHA

SourceText:
Use words to describe your and your child’s emotions, so they can learn to do the same. 
 
This may be hard at first, but it is an important step to help manage emotions!
text:
Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza iimvakalelo zakho nezomntwana wakho, ukuze nabo bafunde ukwenza okufanayo.

Oku kunokuba nzima ekuqaleni, kodwa linyathelo elibalulekileyo lokunceda ukulawula iimvakalelo!

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye ingcebiso

SourceText:
Describe how you see your child’s emotion in a calm way. For example:
 
*“I notice you’re stomping your feet, talking loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry?”*
 
Share your own feelings with your child. For example: 
 
*“I know, I feel the same way when I can’t go out when I want to.”*
 
This shows your child that it's okay to share their feelings. They will learn to recognise emotions in themselves and others too.
text:
Chaza indlela ozibona ngayo iimvakalelo zomntwana wakho ngendlela ezolileyo. Umzekelo:

*"Ndiyaqaphela ukuba ubetha unyawo, uthethela phezulu, kwaye ubuso bakho bukhangeleka bukhathazekile. Ingaba uziva unomsindo?"*

Yabelana ngeemvakalelo zakho nomntwana wakho. Umzekelo:

*"Ndiyayazi, ndiziva ngendlela efanayo xa ndingakwazi ukuphuma ndibe ndifuna."*

Oku kubonisa umntwana wakho ukuba kulungile ukwabelana ngeemvakalelo zakhe. Uzakufunda ukuqaphela kuye nakwabanye ngokunjalo.

SourceText: Let’s put the tips you have learnt into practice.
text: Masisebenzise iingcebiso ozifundileyo.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her son are running late. Her son is struggling to tie his shoes but refuses help. How can @data.characters.f1_mother.name respond?
text: U@data.characters.f1_mother.name kunye nonyana wakhe bazokuba semva kwexesha. Unyana wakhe uyasokola ukubopha imitya yezihlangu zakhe kodwa akafuni ncedo. Angaphendula njani u@data.characters.f1_mother.name?

SourceText: Tie his shoes for him and get out the door. We are late!
text: Abophe izihlangu zakhe kwaye baphume. Silibazisekile!

SourceText: It is never fun to run late, but @data.characters.f1_mother.name will miss the opportunity to help her son learn to deal with his frustration if she doesn't help him first recognise what he’s feeling.
text: Akukho mnandi ukuhamba emva kwexesha, kodwa u@data.characters.f1_mother.name uzakuphoswa lithuba lokunceda unyana wakhe afunde ukumelana nonxunguphalo ukuba akamncedi aqale aqonde indlela aziva ngayo.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Understand that her son is feeling frustrated and help him name his feelings
text: Aqonde ukuba unyana wakhe uziva enxunguphele kwaye amncede achaze iimvakalelo zakhe

SourceText: That’s a great idea. She can also commit to practising shoe tying with him later, when he’s calmer, and praise him for naming his feelings and for making a good effort!
text: Licebo elilungileyo elo. Unokuzibophelela ekuziqhelisaneni nokubopha izihlangu zakhe kunye naye ngelinye ixesha, xa umoya wakhe uzolile, kwaye amncome ngokuchaza iimvakalelo zakhe nokwenza umzamo omhle!

SourceText:
Your home activity this week is to take a moment each day to talk about feelings – yours and your child’s. 
You can even try it out during one-on-one time today!
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya waleveki kukuthatha ithuba ngosuku ngalunye uthethe ngemvakalelo- zakho kunye nozomntwana wakho. Ungayizama ngexesha lenu ninedwa namhlanje!

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_8.name taught her daughter skills by naming her emotions
text: Mamela ukuba wenze njani u@data.characters.media_female_8.name ukufundisa intombi yakhe isakhono sokuchaza imvakalelo zakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_8.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My daughter used to get so frustrated and angry when she did not get her way. She would shout and scream, even when we went out, and I would also feel very angry and embarrassed. 

When I learned about emotions, I started to name and acknowledge her emotions. I helped her understand that it is okay to feel angry sometimes, but that she can show it in a different way. Now, she will tell me when she starts to feel angry, and we can find a solution together that works for everyone.
text:
Intombi yam ibisoloko ingxuphala kwaye ibanomsindo xa izinto zingahambanga ngendlela yakhe. Wayemane ekhwaza kwaye akhale, naxa siphumile, kwaye nam bendiziva ndinomsindo kakhulu kwaye ndineentloni.

Xa ndisiva ngemvakalelo, ndaqala ukuchaza kwaye ndivuma iimvakalelo zakhe. Ndamnceda aqonde ukuba kulungile ukuziva unomsindo ngamanye amaxesha, kodwa angayibonakalisa ngendlela eyohlukileyo. Ngoku, uzakundixelela xa eqalisa eziva enomsindo, kwaye sizokufumana isisombululo kunye esinosebenzela umntu wonke.

SourceText: Can you notice and talk about your and your child’s feelings today?
text: Ingaba unokuqaphela kwaye uthethe ngeemvakalelo zomntwana wakho namhlanje?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That’s great! It might be awkward to talk about feelings at first, but it will get better for everyone with practice.
text: Kulungile! Ekuqaleni kunganzima ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo, kodwa kungangcono kumntu wonke aziqhelanise.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: Give it a try! It might be awkward to talk about feelings at first, but it will get better for everyone with practice.
text: Yizame! Ekuqaleni kunganzima ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo, kodwa kusenokubangcono kumntu wonke aziqhelanise.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Learning to share emotions with our children can be challenging. You can start by recognising and naming one emotion you or your child felt today.
text: Kulungile. Ukufunda ukwabelana ngeemvakalelo kunye nabantwana bethu ingangumceli mngeni. Ungaqala ngokuqonda kwaye uchaze imvakalelo ibenye yakho kunye neyomntwana wakho eniyivileyo namhlanje.

SourceText: ⚠️ Sensitive Content
text: ⚠️Umxholo obuthathaka

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.
text:
Le modyuli iqulathe umxholo onokuba nobuthathaka. Unakho ukuyijonga ngokwakho kuqala. Izokunceda ukuzilungiselela kakuhle ukuba wabelane ngomxholo kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nabanye emvakoko.

Ukuba udinga inkxaso, jonga " uqhagamshelwano lweNkxaso" icandelo kwithala lwezoncedo.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about coping with grief.

Grief affects us all in different ways.

Whatever you feel, you are grieving in your own way, and that is okay.
text:
Umxholo wanamhlanje ungokumelana nosizi.

Usizi lusichaphazela sonke ngendlela ezohlukeneyo.

Nantoni nayo oyivayo, unosizi ngendlela yakho, kwaye lonto ilungile.

SourceText: What techniques can you use to cope with grief? Tap play to find out
text: Bobuphi ubuchule ongabusebenzisa ukumelana nosizi? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings.

Today's topic is coping with grief.

Taking care of ourselves is important, especially when we are facing challenging and difficult times such as coping with grief. We need to stay calm in order to think and act positively whenever we find ourselves overwhelmed. We may use techniques such as taking a pause to calm ourselves down.
text:
Molweni.

Umxholo wanamhlanje kukumelana nosizi.

Ukukhathalela iziqu zethu kubalulekile, ngakumbi xa sijongene nemiceli mngeni kunye namaxesha anzima afana nokumelana nosizi. Kufuneka sihlale sizolile sizokwazi ukucinga kwaye senze ngendlela elungileyo nanini naxa siziva songanyelwe yimeko. Singasebenzisa ubuchule obufana nokuthi nqumama ukwehlisa umoya ubephantsi.

SourceText:
Taking care of ourselves during grief helps us stay calm and present for our children. 
When we share and name our feelings openly, it can help the whole family feel less alone and more supported.
text:
Ukuzikhathalela ngexesha losizi kuyanceda ukuhlala unomoya ozolileyo kwaye sibekhona ebantwaneni bethu. 
Xa sisabelana kwaye sizichaze iimvakalelo zethu ngokuphandle ngendlela esiziva ngayo, inganceda usapho lonke luzive lungekho lodwa kwaye lukhathalelekile ngakumbi.

SourceText: Hear how naming feelings helped @data.characters.media_female_12.name feel closer to family while grieving
text: Mamela ukuba ukuchaza indlela aziva ngayo imncede njani u@data.characters.media_female_12.name azive esondele kusapho lwakhe ngethuba eselusizini
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_12.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
After I lost my husband, the parenting tips that I learnt were so helpful to me: I began breathing calmly whenever I was feeling so sad or angry, and my kids really felt the difference because I was learning to keep calm.

Naming our feelings and being open about how we are feeling has helped me feel closer to my child. Before, I felt like I was the only one who was going through these emotions, but now I know that my child is feeling the same things. We can talk about it and help each other. We don’t feel alone anymore.
text:
Emveni kokuba ndishiywe ngumyeni wam, iingcebiso zobuzali endithe ndazifunda ziye zaluncedo kakhulu kum: Ndiqalise ukuphefumla ngokuzolileyo naninina ndiziva ndikhathazekile okanye ndinomsindo, kwaye abantwana bam bayawuva umahluko ngokuba bendifunda ukuzigcina ndizolile.

Ukuchaza iimvakalelo zethu kwaye nokuba sikhululeke ukuthetha malunga nokuba siziva njani kuye kwandinceda umna ndaziva ndisondele kumntwana wam. Ngaphambili, Bendiziva ingathi ndim ndodwa odlula kwezimvakalelo, kodwa ngoku ndiyayazi ukuba umntwana wam uziva ngendlela efanayo. Siyakwazi ukuthetha malunga nazo kwaye sincedane. Khange siphinde sizive sisodwa.

SourceText:
Difficult emotions can lead to difficult behaviour – especially with children. Losing a caregiver or a loved one can make your teen feel worried, insecure, or angry, and can often make them act out.

Let’s see what happened with @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name who lost her mother 6 months ago:
text:
Imvakalelo ezinzima zingakhokelela kwisimilo esinzima - ngakumbi ebantwaneni. Ukushiywa ngumntu okukhathalelayo okanye umntu omthandayo kungenza umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ekhathazekile, engakhuselekanga, okanye enomsindo, kwaye ingabenza besoloko bekubonakalisa oko.

Masijonge kwenzeka ntoni ngo @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name owashiywa ngumama wakhe kwinyanga eziy 6 ezidlulileyo:
note: The string @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText: I miss @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name so much...
text: Ndikhumbula u @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name kakhulu...
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, you need to stop crying. It has been months already! This crying will not bring your @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name back and you are doing worse and worse in school!
text: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, kufanele uyeke ukukhala. Sekuzinyanga ngoku! Oku kukhala akuzombuyisa u @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name kwaye uye usenza kakubi nakakubi esikolweni!

SourceText: You just don't understand how I feel! You never listen!
text: Awuyiqondi indlela endiziva ngayo! Awuzange wamamela!

SourceText: Stop being so dramatic! Your behaviour is unacceptable!
text: Yeka ukuyibaxa! Isimilo sakho asamkelekanga!

SourceText: How did @data.characters.f4_father.name’s response make his daughter, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, feel?
text: Impendulo ka @data.characters.f4_father.name iyenze intombi yakhe @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, waziva njan?

SourceText: Confused
text: Ubhidekile

SourceText: Yes, telling someone to stop crying can make them feel even more sad, angry or confused.
text: Ewe, ukuxelela omnye umntu ukuba ayeke ukukhala kungabenza bazive bekhathazekile ngakumbi, benomsindo okanye bebhidekile.

SourceText: What could @data.characters.f4_father.name have done differently?
text: Yintoni @data.characters.f4_father.name ebenokuyenza ngokwahlukileyo?
note: The string @data.characters.f4_father.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Take a pause before responding and notice his own emotions
text: Yithi nqumama phambi kokuba uphendule kwaye uqwalasele imvakalelo zakhe

text: Cela @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name abelane malunga nokuba uziva njani
note: The string @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

note: The string @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Ask @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name what would help her feel better
