SourceText:
Yes, all these options are correct.

When we lose someone we love, it helps to recognise and share our feelings as a family.
text:
Ewe, onke lamacebo alungile.

Xa sishiywa ngumntu esimthandayo, iyasinceda ukuqaphela kwaye sabelane ngendlela esiziva ngayo silusapho.

SourceText:
Thank you for thinking along!

Let’s see what happens if @data.characters.f4_father.name tries to support @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name:
text:
Enkosi ngokucinga nathi!

Masijonge ukuba kwenzeka ntoni ukuba @data.characters.f4_father.name uzama ukuxhasa @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name:

SourceText: I know you are sad, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name. I also miss @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. What do you think we can do to help you feel better?
text: Ndiyayazi ukhathazekile, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name. Nam ndiyamkhumbula @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. Ucinga ukuba singenza ntoni ukwenza uzive ngcono?

SourceText: Maybe we can visit @data.characters.f4_aunt.name, so we can share stories about @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name?
text: Mhlawumbi singandwendwela @data.characters.f4_aunt.name, ukwenzela sabelane ngamabali malunga no @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name?

SourceText: I like that idea, let’s go see her on Saturday. Do you already want to tell me more about how you feel now?
text: Ndiyalithanda elocebo, masihambe siyokumbona ngoMgqibelo. Ingaba sewukulungele ukundixelela ngokubanzi malunga nokuba uziva njani ngoku?

SourceText: I honestly feel angry that she left. Is it okay to say that?
text: Ngokwenyaniso ndiziva ndicaphuka ngokuba ehambile. Ingaba kulungile ukutsho oko?

SourceText: Yes, it is normal to feel angry. We all have different feelings at different times, and that is okay. It is good to talk about this together, thank you for sharing with me.
text: Ewe, yinto eqhelekileyo ukuziva unomsindo. Sonke sinemvakalelo ezohlukeneyo ngamaxesha ohlukeneyo, kwaye lonto ilungile. Kulungile ukuba sithethe ngalento kunye, enkosi ngokwabelana kunye nam.

SourceText: Let's think about what happened in this story.
text: Makhe sicinge malunga nokwenzekileyo kweli bali.

SourceText: How did @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel after talking to her father, @data.characters.f4_father.name?
text: Ingaba @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name uzive njani emveni kokuthetha notata wakhe, @data.characters.f4_father.name?

SourceText: That’s right. Talking about her feelings helped @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel lighter and less alone inside.
text: Kulungile. Ukuthetha ngemvakalelo zakhe kumncedile @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name azive ekhaphukhaphu kwaye angabikho yedwa ngaphakathi.
note: The string @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Supported
text: Exhasekile

SourceText: Yes, knowing that her @data.characters.f4_father.role_name understood and accepted her feelings made @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel cared for and supported.
text: Ewe, ukwazi ukuba @data.characters.f4_father.role_name uziqondile kwaye uzamkele imvakalelo zakhe zamenza @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name waziva ekhathalelwe kwaye exhasekile.

SourceText: Comforted
text: Uthuthuzelekile

SourceText: Exactly. Sharing her sadness and anger openly made @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel comforted and closer to her father.
text: Ngokwenene. Ukwabelana ngosizi kunye nomsindo wakhe ngokuphandle kumenze @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name azive ethuthuzelekile kwaye esondele kutata wakhe.
note: The string @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText: What could have happened if @data.characters.f4_father.name got angry at his daughter, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, when she shared that she was feeling angry?
text: Yintoni ibinokwenzeka ukuba@data.characters.f4_father.name uzifumene enomsindo kwintombi yakhe, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, xa esabelana ngemvakalelo zokuba uziva enomsindo?

SourceText: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name might not trust her @data.characters.f4_father.role_name
text: Mhlawumbi u @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name ebenokungamthembi u @data.characters.f4_father.role_name

SourceText: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name and her @data.characters.f4_father.role_name might talk less and feel more alone
text: U @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name kunye no @data.characters.f4_father.role_name wakhe bangathetha kancinci kwaye bazive bebodwa nangakumbi

SourceText: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name might show more challenging behaviour
text: U @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name mhlawumbi angabonisa isimilo esingumceli mngeni nangakumbi
note: The string @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
All these options are correct.

Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each other’s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.
text:
Zonke ezimpendulo zichanekile.

Wonke umntu umelana nosizi ngokwahlukileyo. Singancedana omnye nomnye ngokwamkela iimvakalelo zethu kwaye size neengcebiso kunye ukuxhasa omnye nomnye.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you and your family through times of grief:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezinokunceda wena kunye nosapho lwakho ngamaxesha osizi:

SourceText: ACCEPT
text: YAMKELA

SourceText:
Losing someone we love can affect us for weeks, months or years. There’s no right way to feel, and no need to feel better quickly.

Your teen may feel sad, angry, confused, or unwell. They may have nightmares, pain, or school problems. Even if they seem happy, they might still feel sad. This is all normal.
text:
Ukushiywa ngumntu esimthandayo kungasichaphazela kangangeeveki, iinyanga okanye iminyaka. Akhondlela ichanekileyo yokuziva, kwaye akukho sidingo sokuziva ngcono ngokukhawuleza.

Umntana wakho ofikisayo angaziva ekhathazekile, enomsindo, ebhidekile, okanye engaphilanga. Anganawo namaphupha amabi, ubuhlungu, okanye ingxaki zesikolo. Nokuba babonakala bonwabile, bangeba basaziva bekhathazekile. Yonke lento iqhelekile.

SourceText: SAY GOODBYE
text: YITHI SALA KAKUHLE

SourceText:
Find a way to say goodbye that feels right for you and your family. Some people hold a ceremony or have a special meal to celebrate the person.

Ask your teen what they would want to do to say goodbye.
text:
Fumana indlela yokuthi sala kakuhle oyiva ilungile kuwe kunye nosapho lwakho. Abanye abantu babamba umsitho okanye babenesidlo esikhethekileyo ukubhiyozela lomntu.

Mbuze umntana wakho ofikisayo bafuna ukwenzantoni ukuthi sala kakuhle.

SourceText: TALK
text: THETHA

SourceText:
Talking or writing about the person can help bring comfort. Gently share your memories—both the happy ones and the hard ones.

Teens may sometimes feel the death was their fault. Kindly remind them it was not. Let them know they can always talk to you about their feelings, and show them it’s okay by sharing yours too.
text:
Ukuthetha okanye ukubhala malunga nomntu kunganceda ukuzisa intuthuzelo. Yabelana ngobunono ngenkumbulo zakho---zombini ezonwabisayo kunye nezinzima.

Abantwana abafikisayo ngamanye amaxesha baye bazive ngathi ukufa yimpazamo yabo. Bakhumbuze ngobubele ayompazamo yabo. Bazise ukuba ngalolonke ixesha bangathetha nawe malunga nemvakalelo zabo, kwaye babonise ukuba kulungile ukwabelana nangezakho.

SourceText:
When we are going through a difficult time, it can help to talk about or write down how we feel.

Let’s practise naming feelings. How do you feel now?
text:
Xa sidlula kwixesha elinzima, lonto inganceda ukuthetha malunga ngalo okanye sibhale phantsi indlela esiziva ngalo.

Masizame ukuchaza imvakalelo. Uziva njani ngoku?

SourceText: How could a person feel when someone they love passes away?
text: Angaziva njani umntu xa umntu abamthandayo esweleka?

SourceText: Sad
text: Ulusizi

SourceText: Angry
text: Unomsindo

SourceText: Scared
text: Usoyika

SourceText: Loved
text: Ethandwa

SourceText: Relieved
text: Ndikhululekile

SourceText: Brave
text: Ndikhaliphile

SourceText: Someone who is grieving can feel many different emotions. They might also feel lost, shocked, numb, guilty, lonely, or even hopeful — all of these are normal.
text: Umntu oselusizini angeva imvakalelo ezohlukeneyo. Kwakhona bangaziva belahlekile, bothukile, bendindisholo, enetyala, eyedwa, okanye enethemba elikhulu - zonke ezizinto ziqhelekile.

SourceText:
This week's home activity is to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.

You can remind your teen of some emotions they might feel - like happy, sad, scared, hopeful, angry, or lonely. There is no right or wrong feeling. Sharing emotions helps you both feel less alone.
text:
Umsebenzi wasekhaya waleveki kukwabelana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba uziva njani, kwaye ubacele ukuba bachaze iimvakalelo zabo.

Ungamkhumbuza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngemvakalelo anokuziva - njengoku vuya, ukukhathazeka, ukoyika, ukubanethemba, ukubanomsindo, okanye ukubawedwa. Akukho mvakalelo ilungileyo okanye engalunganga. Ukwabelana ngemvakalelo kunceda nina nobabini nizive ningekhekho nedwa.

SourceText: Can you share how you are feeling with your teen this week and invite them to name their feelings too?
text: Ungakwazi ukwabelana ukuba uziva njani wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki kwaye ubameme bachaze imvakalelo zabo?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: That’s wonderful. Talking about emotions helps you and your teen cope and connect during difficult times.
text: Kwakuhle. Ukuthetha ngemvakelelo kunceda wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nimelane kwaye niqhagamshelane ngexesha lobunzima.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a good start. Even trying to open a conversation about feelings can help your teen feel supported. Keep going - you are doing something very important.
text: Sisiqalo esihle eso. Nokuzama ukuqala incoko ngemvakalelo kunganceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive exhasiwe. Qhubekeka - wenza into ebaluleke kakhulu.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Talking about feelings can be hard, especially during grief. Try again when the time feels right - every small step towards openness helps.
text: Kulungile. Ukuthetha ngemvakalelo kunganzima, ngakumbi kwixeshalosizo. Zama kwakhona xa ixesha livakala lilungile - onke amanyathelo ajonge ekuthetheni phandle ayanceda.

SourceText: Grief can make both parents and teens feel alone - but talking about your feelings can help you cope together. Even small steps like checking in and sharing emotions can rebuild trust and connection.
text: Usizi lungenza bobabini abazali kunye nabantwana abafikisayo bazive bebodwa - kodwa ukuthetha ngemvakalelo zenu kunganinceda nimelane nazo kunye. Kwaye namanyathelo amancinane afana nokukrobana nokwabelana ngemvakalelo kungakwazi ukwakha kwakhona ukuthembana noqhagamshelwano.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name and her father learned to support each other
text: Mamela ukuba kunjani ku@data.characters.media_daughter_10.name notata wakhe bafunde njani ukuxhasana omnye nomnye
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I lost my mom, everything changed. I was so sad, but it felt like my dad couldn't understand. Our relationship suffered. We did our own things and we stopped talking to each other. But then something incredible happened.

My dad learnt all these things from the app about what to do when you lose someone. He asked me how I was doing and we started to talk again. He explained that he was sad too, and he even said he was sorry for not talking to me after my mom died. We can now see that it is hard for both of us, and we can help each other. He is supporting me and we are a lot closer.
text:
Mhla ndashiywa ngumama wam, yonke into yatshintsha. Ndandikhazekile kakhulu, kodwa ndaziva ingathi utata wam akayiqondanga. Ubudlelwane bethu babandezeleka. Besisenza izinto zethu kwaye sayeka ukuthetha sobabini. Kodwa kwaye kwenzeka into engakholelekiyo.

Utata wam wafunda zonke ezizinto kwi-app malunga nokuba wenza njani xa ushiywe ngumntu. Uye wandibuza ukuba ndiziva njani kwaye saqhubeka nokuthetha kwakhona. Uye wandicacisela ukuba naye ebekhathazekile, kwaye uye wathi ucela uxolo ngokungathethi nam emveni kokuba umama wam eswelekile. Ngoku siyabona ukuba kunzima kuthi sobabini, kwaye singancedana. Uyandixhasa kwaye sisondelelene kakhulu.

SourceText:
Today’s lesson is about giving instructions that work!
How we give instructions matters – children are more likely to listen when we say what we want them to do, not what not to do.
Instead of “Don’t touch that!”, try: “Please only touch things that belong to us.”
text:
Isifundo sanamhlanje singokunika imiyalelo esebenzayo!
Indlela esinikeza ngayo imiyalelo ibalulekile - abantwana bamamela kakhulu xa sisithi sifuna benze ntoni, kunaxa sisithi mabangenzi lonto.
Endaweni yokuba "sukubamba lonto!", zama: "Ndicela ubambe izinto ezi zezethu qha."

SourceText: Tap play to learn how giving positive instructions can help you and your family
text: Cofa dlala ukufunda ukuba ukunikeza ngemiyalelo elungileyo kungakunceda njani wena kunye nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Let’s try something: Don’t think about a pink elephant…
What did you think about? A pink elephant?

The same happens when we give negative instructions to our children. When we tell them “stop fighting” or “stop playing with your food”, they don’t know how to think about what we DO want them to do, only what we DON’T want them to do.”

When you give a positive instruction, your child is more likely to follow it.
text:
Molweni nonke.

Masizame into: Sukucinga ngendlovu epinki...
Ucinga ngantoni? Nge ndlovu epinki?

Kwenzeka into efanayo xa sinika imiyalelo engalunganga ebantwaneni bethu. Xa sisithi' mabayeke ukulwa "ókanye yekani udlala ngokutya kwenu'. Abayazi indlela yokucinga ngalento SIFUNA ukuba bayenze, bacinga kuphela into ESINGAFUNI ukuba bayenze.

Xa unika imiyalelo elungileyo, kunokwenzeka ukuba umntwana ayilandele.

SourceText: Here are three tips to give positive instructions that work.
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezintathu zokunikeza imiyalelo elungileyo emsebenzini.

SourceText: BE SPECIFIC
text: YIBA NGQO

SourceText:
Say the behaviour you want your child to do.
But before you do that, connect to them, so they are more likely to listen.
text:
Xela isimilo osifuna kumntwana wakho ayenze.
Kodwa phambi kokuba uqale, qhagamshelana nabo, bavamile kakhulu ukuba bamamele.

SourceText:
Use your child’s name to get their attention. Go down to their level. Make eye contact.

Then say exactly what you want them to do. For example: “Please take your shoes off when you come inside, dear”.
text:
Sebenzisa igama lomntwana wakho ukufumana ingqalelo kuye. Yehlela ezantsi kwizinga lwakhe. Yenza uqhagamshelwano lwamehlo.

Emva koko chaza into ofuna ukuba ayenze. Umzekelo: "Nceda ukhulule izihlangu zakho xa ungena ngaphakathi, sithandwa".

SourceText: BE REALISTIC
text: NYANISEKA

SourceText: Give one instruction at a time, and make sure that the instruction is something that your child can do.
text: Nika umyalelo ubemnye ngexesha, kwaye qiniseka ukuba umyalelo yinto umntwana wakho anokwazi ukuyenza.

SourceText: Giving a transition warning helps when you are asking them to change activities! For example: “In 10 minutes, you will need to pack away your toys so we can start getting ready for bed.”
text: Ukunikeza ngesilumkiso esinenguqu kuyanceda xa ubacela ukuba atshintshe imidlalo! Umzekelo: "Kwimizuzu eyi 10, kuzofuneka uqoqoshe izinto zakho zokudlala sizokwazi ukulungela ukulala."

SourceText: BE POSITIVE
text: OKULUNGILEYO

SourceText:
Try using positive words when giving instructions. For example, instead of “Don’t shout inside”, say “Talk in a quiet voice when we’re inside.” 

ALWAYS praise your child immediately when they follow your instruction. This will make them more likely to repeat the behaviour and listen to you next time!
text:
Zama ukusebenzisa amagama akwisimo esihle xa unikisa ngemiyalelo. Umzekelo, endaweni yokuba "Sukungxola ngaphakathi", yithi "Thetha ngelizwi elithuleyo xa singaphakathi."

Maxa wonke ncoma umntwana wakho ngoko nangoko xa elandele umyalelo wakho. Lonto izakumenza avamise ukuphinda eso similo kwaye akumamele kwixesha elizayo!

SourceText: More
text: Kaninzi

SourceText:
Give instructions in a firm voice and stay calm. Behave as if you expect your child to do what you ask.

Also, be kind to yourself if you forget sometimes. Learning how to give positive instructions is not easy, but it works!
text:
Nika imiyalelo ngelizwi eloqinileyo kwaye uhlale uzolile. Ziphathe ngendlela okungathi ulindele umntwana wakho enze into oyicelayo.

Kwaye, yibanenceba kuwe xa uye walibala ngamanye amaxesha. Ukufunda ukunikeza imiyalelo elungileyo akukho lula, kodwa kuyasebenza!

SourceText: To practise giving instructions that work, let's try turning our negative instructions into positive ones.
text: Ukuziqhelanisa nokunikeza imiyalelo kuyasebenza, masizame ukuguqula imiyalelo yethu engalunganga kwizinto ezintle.

SourceText: Select each option to see how to turn it into a positive instruction:
text: Khetha ukhetho lubelunye ubone ukuba ukuguqula njani libe kwimeko elungileyo yomyalelo:

SourceText: 🧸 Stop fighting with your siblings over toys!
text: 🧸 Yeka ukulwa nabantwana bakowenu ngezinto zokudlala!

SourceText: Try saying something like “Please take turns with toys! Each of you can have 5 minutes.”
text: Zama ukuthetha into efana "Ndicela nitshintshiselane ngezinto zokudlala! Ngamnye kuni angabanemizuzu emi 5."

SourceText: 🗣️ No shouting in the house!
text: 🗣️ Hayi akukhwazwa endlini!

SourceText: Try saying something like “Please speak with a quiet, indoor voice.”
text: Zama into efana "Nceda uthethe ngelizwi elizolileyo, ngaphakathi."

SourceText: 🍅 Stop throwing food!
text: 🍅 Yeka ukulahla ukutya!

SourceText: Try saying something like “Please keep your food on the plate.”
text: Zama into efana "Nceda ugcine ukutya kwakho epleyitini."

SourceText: 🖍️ Don't write on the walls!
text: 🖍️ Sukubhala emadongeni!

SourceText: Try saying something like “Please only write on paper.”
text: Zama ukuthetha into efana "Nceda ubhale ephepheni kuphela."

SourceText:
Ready to give it a go? This week's home activity is to give your child specific, realistic, and positive instructions. 

Remember to give one instruction at a time and praise them. This will help your child to follow your instructions.
text:
Ukulungele ukuyenza! Umsebenzi wasekhaya waleveki kukunika umntwana wakho umyalelo ocacileyo, osengqiqweni, kwaye olungileyo.

Khumbula ukunika umyalelo omnye ngexesha kwaye umncome. Oku kuyakunceda umntwana wakho ukuba alandele imiyalelo yakho.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_3.name learned to give her children positive instructions
text: Yiva ukuba u@data.characters.media_female_3.name wenze njani ukufunda ukunika abantwana bakhe imiyalelo elungileyo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my children the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learned about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my children. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “ don’t do this.” 
My children and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My child said one day “I really love this new mom,” and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Ngaphambili, ndandibakhulisa abantwana bam ngendlela endakhuliswa ngayo: Ndandibaxelela ukuba "musa ukuyenza lena, sukuyenza leya." Sasikade sisilwa, kodwa izinto ziye zatshintsha ngokwenene xa ndafunda ngokunikela imiyalelo elungileyo.

Ngoku ndigxile kwindlela yokuziphatha endifuna ukuyibona, kwaye ndinike imiyalelo ecacileyo nelula ebantwaneni bam. Ithathe ixesha ukufunda ukuthi "ndicela wenze lento" endaweni yokuba "ungayenzi lento."
Abantwana bam kunye nomyeni wam bandixelele ukuba lendlela yokwenza izinto, kuba ngoku bayayazi into ekufuneka yenziwe. Umntwana ngenye imini uthe "ndiyamthanda ngokwenene lo mama mtsha," kwaye nolwam uxinzelelo lwehle kakhulu.

SourceText: Your home activity is to give your child positive instructions. Can you do it?
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukunika umntwana wakho imiyalelo elungileyo Ungayenza lonto?

SourceText: Yes

SourceText: That’s great! It might feel a bit awkward at first, but the more you try, the easier it gets. Keep up the excellent effort!

SourceText:
Today's topic is about giving positive instructions!

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.

You will see the difference.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokunika imiyalelo elungileyo!

Ukuxelela abantwana bethu abafikisayo ukuba BENZE ntoni kusebenza ngcono kunokuba sibaxelele ukuba MABAYEKE ukwenza into.

Uzakuwubona umehluko.

SourceText: Giving positive instructions really works! Tap play to learn more
text: Ukunika imiyalelo elungileyo kuyasebenza ngokwenene! Cofa udlala ufunde ngakumbi

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions.

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do and they do it the way we want them to do it.

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Molweni, Molweni nonke.

Isihloko sanamhlanje yimiyalelo elungileyo.

Kubalulekile ukunika imiyalelo elungileyo kubantwana bethu, kuba xana sibanika imiyalelo elungileyo bayakwazi kwaye bayayiqonda into esilindele ukuba bayenze kwaye bayenze ngohlobo esifuna bayenze ngalo.

Oko, kwenza wonke umntu ekugqibeleni onwabe.

SourceText:
When you give positive instructions, your teen is more likely to listen! 

And remember to praise your teen for any good behaviour - the big and small things.
text:
Xa unika imiyalelo elungileyo, umntwana wakho ofikisayo uvame ukumamela ngakumbi!

Kwaye khumbula ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo namgayiphi na indlela yokuziphatha entle - izinto ezinkulu nezincinci.

SourceText: Press play to hear how positive instructions worked for @data.characters.media_female_3.name and her teens
text: Cofa udlala ukuze umamele imiyalelo elungileyo esebenzela u@data.characters.media_female_3.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “don’t do this.”

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day “I really love this new mom,” and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Ngaphambili, ndandiqhele ukukhulisa abantwana bam abafikisayo ngendlela endakhula ngayo: Ndandibaxelela ukuba "sanukuyenza lento, sanukuyenza naleya". Sasiqhele ukuxabana kakhulu, kodwa okunene izinto ziye zatshintsha xa bendifunda malunga nokunika imiyalelo elungileyo.

Ngoku ndigxile kwisimilo endifuna ukusibona, kwaye ndinike imiyalelo ecacileyo kwaye elula kubantwana bam abafikisayo. Kuthathe ixesha ukuthi "ndicela wenze lento" endaweni yokuba "sukuyenza lento"

Abantwana bam abafikisayo kunye nomyeni wam bayandixelela ukuba bayayithanda lendlela yokwenza izinto, kuba ngoku bayayazi into ekufuneka yenziwe. Umntwana wam ofikisayo wathi ngenye imini "Ndiyamthanda ngokwenene lomama wam umtsha," kwaye nowam umthambo woxinzelelo usezantsi kakhulu.

SourceText:
Let’s do a thought experiment!

DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.
text:
Makhe senze umfuniselo wokucinga!

SUKUCINGA NGENDLOVU.

SourceText:
What are you thinking about? 

You probably DID think about an elephant...
text:
Ucinga ngantoni?

Mhlawumbi UYE wacinga ngendlovu...

SourceText:
In the same way, when we tell our teens “don’t do that,” they often focus only on the thing we told them not to do.
They may not understand what we *DO* want.

And like most of us, they don’t enjoy being told what not to do.
text:
Ngendlela efanayo, xa sixelela abantwana bethu abafikisayo ''sukuyenza lonto'' amaxesha amanintsi bagxila kuphela kulento besibaxelele ukuba bangayenzi. 
Bangangayi qondi eyonanto esifuna *BAYENZE*.
 
Kwaye ngokufana nathi sonke, abakonwabeli ukuxelelwa into amabangayenzi.

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH!

What are you thinking about?
text:
NGOKU, CINGA NGE NGWE!

Ngoku ucinga ngantoni?

SourceText:
That’s right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing.

Teens will also feel more respected this way and are more likely to listen.
text:
Kulungile! Kuhle, imiyalelo ecacileyo inceda abantwana abafikisayo bagxile kulento bekufanele ukuba bayenze. 

Abantwana abafikisayo baye bazive behloniphekile ngakumbi ngale ndlela kwaye baye bamamele ngakumbi.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you give your teen clear and positive instructions!
text: Nanga amanye amacebiso anokunceda unike umntwana wakho ofikisayo imiyalelo ecacileyo nelungileyo!

SourceText: GET REAL
text: YIBA SENYANISWENI

SourceText: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.
text: Ingaba umntwana wakho ofikisayo angakwazi ukuyenza le nto uza kuyicela? Kusenokuba nzima kubo ukufunda ngelizwi eliphantsi imini yonke, kodwa isiqingatha seyure xa ufuna njalo kusenyanisweni.

SourceText: GET POSITIVE
text: OKULUNGILEYO

SourceText: Smile, look them in the eye and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
text: Ncuma, ubajonge emehlweni kwaye usebenzise amagama alungileyo. Bancome ngokukhawuleza nje ukuba beqalisa ukwenza into oyicelayo!

SourceText: GET CLEAR
text: CACISA

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don’t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‘please come home by 7pm’ instead of ‘come home on time’.
text: Rhoqo siyayazi into esiyifunayo ezintlokweni zethu, kodwa asiyithethi ngokucacileyo. Thetha kanye oko ufuna ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akwenze. Zama 'nceda ubuye ngo 7pm ekhaya' endaweni yokuba 'buyela ekhaya ngexesha'.

SourceText: This week's home activity is to give your teen positive instructions.
text: Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya kukunika umntwana wakho ofikisayo imiyalelo elungileyo.

SourceText: Remember, teenagers are much more likely to listen when we give positive, clear and realistic instructions.
text: Khumbula, abantwana abafikisayo bavame ukumamela xa sibanika imiyalelo elungileyo, ecacileyo kwaye enyanisekileyo.

SourceText: Can you give your teen positive instructions this week?
text: Ungamnika umntwana wakho ofikisayo umyalelo olungileyo kule veki?

SourceText: Yes

SourceText: That's great! Well done for trying. You will see the difference it makes.

SourceText: You can do it! Notice when you normally say ‘don’t do this!’ and think of a positive way to phrase it. You can try it out and see what happens.

SourceText: That's okay. It can be hard to try something new. Could you think of one situation where you often tell your teen ‘don’t do this’? Try to find a positive way to give that instruction.

SourceText:
Let’s do a quick practice to help you prepare for your home activity! 
Turn each of these instructions into positive ones:
text:
Masenze uqheliselo olukhawulezileyo ukukunceda ukulungiselela umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya!
Guqula umyalelo ngamnye kule ibeyelungileyo:

SourceText: 👕 Stop leaving your dirty clothes all over the place!
text: 👕Yeka ukushiya impahla yakho emdaka kwindawo yonke!

SourceText: You could say: "I know you’ve had a long day. Could you please put your clothes in the basket so it’s easier to keep things tidy? Thanks – it really helps."
text: Usenokuthi: "Ndiyayazi ubenosuku olude. Ungakwazi undinceda ufake iimpahla yakho kwibakethi ukwenzela kubelula ukugcina izinto zicocekile? Enkosi - iyanceda ngokwenene lonto."

SourceText: 🎵 Stop playing your music so loud in the house!
text: 🎵Yeka ukudlala umculo wakho phezulu endlini!

SourceText: You could say: "That’s great music. Who is the singer? Please turn the music off when you come into the house. You can play it in your room quietly if you want. Thank you!"
text: Usenokuthi: "Ngumculo omnandi lowo. Ngubani imvumi? Ndicela uwucime umculo xa ungena endlini. Ungawudlalela phantsi egumbini lakho ukuba uyafuna. Enkosi!

SourceText: 📱 Stop playing on your phone at the dinner table!
text: 📱Yeka ukudlala ngefowuni yakho kwitafile yesidlo sangokuhlwa!

SourceText: You could say: "I like that you enjoy your phone. Can you put it away during dinner so we can spend time together? Thanks – I really appreciate it."
text: Usenokuthi: Ndiyayithanda into yokuba uyonwabele ifowuni yakho. Ungakwazi ukuyibeka kude ngexesha lesidlo sangokuhlwa ukwenzela sichithe ixesha kunye? Enkosi - Ndiyayibulela ngokwenene lonto.".

SourceText: More positive instructions means less frustrations. And that is something we all want, right?
text: Imiyalelo eyongezelekileyo elungileyo ithetha ukudakumba okuncinci. Kwaye yinto esiyifunayo sonke, akunjalo?

SourceText: Hear how positive instructions helped @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name and her mother
text: Yiva imiyalelo elungileyo indlela emncede ngayo u@data.characters.media_daughter_3.name kunye nomama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was doing with @global.app_name. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like “Hmmm okay,” because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted – she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home.

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said “Thank you for being on time.” It was strange, but I liked it.

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.
text:
Kuqala ndandingakhathali nokuba umama wayesenza ntoni nge @global.app_name. Kodwa emva koko ndaqala ndabona utshintsho ngendlela anxulumana ngalo nathi.

Ngenye imini xana ndandiphuma nabahlobo bam, wathi kufuneka ndifike ekhaya ngo 6pm. Bendinje "Hmmmm kulungile". ngokuba uqhele ukungandiniki myalelo ocacileyo ngento ayifunayo - wayengathethi nto kwaye asuke andingxolise ngokufika ekhaya emva kwexesha.

Ukufika kwam ekhaya malunga no 5pm, umama wam waye wandiwola ngobubele wathi "Enkosi ngokufika ngethuba". Yaba ngumnqa lonto, kodwa ndayithanda.

Ukususela ngoko, saba nonxibelelwano olucacileyo ekhaya.
note: The string @global.app_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

Did you know that spending one-on-one time with your teen can help them do better at school? Today we will share some ideas to help you make the most of your time together.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singokuncedisa umntana wakho ofikisayo afunde.

Ingaba ubuyazi ukuba ukuchitha ixesha nomntana wakho ofikisayo nikunye kungabanceda benze ngcono esikolweni? Namhlanje sizakwabelana ngezimvo ezizakuninceda ukuba nisebenzise ixesha lenu nobabini libeyimpumelelo.

SourceText: Can having fun help teens learn? Yes! Tap play to learn how
text: Ingaba ukonwaba kuyabanceda abantwana abafikisayo bafunde? Ewe! Cofa udlala ukufunda njani

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!
text:
Molweni, nonke!

Isihloko sanamhlanje kukunceda umntana wakho ofikisayo afunde.

Kukho iindlela ezahlukene zemidlalo nezokonwaba esinokuzi sebenzisa nje ngabazali ukunceda abantwana bethu abafikisayo bafunde. Eminye yalemisebenzi ingakukudlala imidlalo kunye okanye nenze imisebenzi yasekhayeni kunye. Khumbula, abantwana bethu abafikisayo bafunda ngcono xa bonwabile!

SourceText:
Learning does not only happen in school - it happens through fun activities, teamwork, and everyday moments. 
When we involve our teens and share decisions, we help them feel capable, confident, and connected to us.
text:
Ukufunda akwenzeki esikolweni kuphela - kwenzeka ngemidlalo eyonwabisayo, ukubambisana, kwaye nangamathuba emihla ngemihla.
Xa sibandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kwaye sabelane ngezigqibo, sibanceda bazive babenokwazi, bezithemba, kwaye beqhagamshelene nathi.

SourceText: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her teen bond and learn
text: Yiva indlela ixesha lomnye nomnye elincede ngayo u@data.characters.media_female_14.name nomntwana wakhe ofikisayo basondelelane kwaye bafunde

SourceText:

SourceText:
Yes, talking while doing chores helped them both!

When you do a chore with your teen, take time for yourself, and give them space to talk, you help them feel safe to learn with you.

This is an easy way to build a good relationship and teach them things they won’t learn at school.
text:
Ewe, ukuthetha ngethuba besenza umsebenzi wasekhaya kubancedile bobabini! 

Xa usenza imisebenzi yasekhaya nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, ziphe ixesha lakho, ubanike ithuba lokuthetha, ubanceda bazive bekhuselekile ukufunda nawe.

Olu luhlobo olulula lokwakha ubudlelwana obuhle nokubafundisa izinto abangazifundiswayo esikolweni.

SourceText:
Let’s think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.
text:
Masicinge ngomsebenzi onowenza nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukubanceda ukuze bafunde.

Khumbula, abantwana abafikisayo bayikhumbula ngcono into abayifunda bonwabile.

SourceText:
**Here are some ideas you could try today:**

💬 Storytelling: Share a story from your childhood or culture—or let your teen share one with you. It’s a fun way to connect and learn.
🚶🏾‍♀️‍➡️Walking: Take a walk together. It’s healthy and gives you both time to talk and share feelings.
👩🏾‍🍳 Cooking or cleaning: Ask your teen to help with cooking or cleaning. It’s a good time to talk and teach them why these things matter.
text:
**Nazi ezinye iimbono ongazizama namhlanje:**

💬 Lixesha lebali: Balisa ibali ukusukela ebuncinaneni bakho okanye kwinkcubeko yakho - okanye vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo abalise enye yazo nawe. Luhlobo olonwabisayo lokufunda.

🚶🏾‍♀️‍➡️Ukuhamba: Thathani uhambo kunye. Lusempilweni kwaye lunika ixesha lokuncokola nelokwabelana ngemvakalelo.

👩🏾‍🍳 Ukupheka kunye nokucoca: Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ancede nokupheka okanye ukucoca. Lixesha elihle lokuthetha nelokubafundisa ngokubaluleka kwezizinto.

SourceText: Here are some skills you can use to help your teen learn!
text: Nazi ezinye izakhono onokuzisebenzisa ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo afunde!

SourceText: GET TOGETHER
text: INDIBANO

SourceText: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.
text: Abantu bafunda ngcono xa befunda nabanye. Chitha ixesha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo wenze ukuba nifunde kunye. Xa nisenza imisebenzi kunye, banike umtyhi wokufunda, benze iimpazamo kwaye babuze imibuzo.

SourceText: SUPPORT
text: INKXASO

SourceText: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them “learn how to learn”, because they feel safe with you.
text:
Umntwana wakho ofikisayo uzakufunda kuwe xa eyazi ukuba uyabaxhasa. Bayeke bazame kwaye ubenomonde ngabo.
Oku kubanceda "bafunde kufundwa njani", kuba baziva bekhuselekile kuwe.

SourceText: PRAISE
text: NCOMA

SourceText: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.
text: Ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo yindlela enamandla yokubanceda bazame kwakhona. Abantwana abafikisayo abazenzi kakhuhle izinto xa beqala kwaye kufuneka bafunde ukuzama kwakhona. Bancome ngokuzama ukwenza izinto, ukuze bafunde kwiimpazamo zabo.

SourceText:
Helping your teen learn can feel stressful, but doing fun daily activities together supports their growth and learning.

This week’s home practice is to try a few activities with your teen!
text:
Ukunceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo afunde kungenza uzive unoxinzelelo, kodwa ukwenza imisebenzi eyonwabisayo kunye kuxhasa ukukhula nokufunda kwabo.

Owaleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya wokuziqhelanisa kukuzama imisebenzi embalwa nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText:
It’s not always easy to find things to do with your teen.

Try dancing to your teen’s music or having a simple check-in chat, like asking, “What made you happy today?” or “How can I help you?”

SourceText:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje singohlahlo lwabiwo mali lwentsapho.

Iintsapho ezininzi zinoxinzelelo ngenxa yemali, ingakumbi ukuba abantwana abafikisayo baqhubeka becela izinto! 

Xa sisenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kunye, singavumelana ngendlela yokwenza yokusebenzisa KUNYE nokonga ukuthintela uxinzeleko kwaye basebenzele ukufezekissa amaphupha osapho lwabo.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje luhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho.

Kubalulekile ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali, kodwa kubaluleke nangakumbi ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali olubandakanya usapho lonke. 

Ukuyenza kunye kunceda ekwandiseni umlinganiselo wokuqonda indlela yokuchitha imali nilusapho nokuba longa kanganani usapho, yaye ningeza nendlela yokonga imali nilusapho.

SourceText: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?
text:
Xa siba bandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali, bafunda ukuthatha uxanduva ngemali kwaye basebenzele amaphupha.
Yinto leyo esiyifuna sonke ngabantwana bethu abafikisayo, akunjalo?

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_6.name involved her teens in budgeting
text: Yiva indlela u@data.characters.media_female_6.name abandakanye ngayo abantwana bakhe abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_6.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Saving and budgeting helps me as a parent, and it helps my teens as well to understand where the money goes.

My teens always asked for a lot of things and they did not understand when I said “I do not have money.” They would say “but you have a job!”

I sat down with them and showed them all the things we pay for and how much is left. They understand now and even give ideas on how we can save to work towards our goals like new shoes or a birthday and bigger goals like their school fees. For the older one, I even opened a savings account.
text:
Ukonga nokucwangcisa kuyandinceda njengomzali, kwaye iyabanceda nabantwana bam abafikisayo baqonde ukuba imali iyephi. 

Abantwana bam abafikisayo basoloko befuna izinto ezininzi kwaye abaqondi xa ndisithi "andinamali"
Basoloko besithi "kodwa unawo umsebenzi!"

Ndihleli phantsi nabo ndababonisa zonke izinto esizibhatalayo nemali eshekileyo. Bayaqonda ngoku kwaye banika nezimvo ukuba singonga njani ukuze sisebenzele injongo zethu njengezihlangu ezitsha okanye usuku lokuzalwa nenjongo ezinkulu ezinjengokubhatala imirhumo yesikolo. Komdala, ndiye ndamvulela uvimba wokonga imali.

A family budget can help @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name - and YOU!
text:
Ukujongana nemiceli mingeni yemali,njengemeko ka@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name, yenza uxinzelelo..

Uhlahlo labiwo mali losapho lunganceda u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name-kunye NAWE!

SourceText:
**There are four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK 
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE 
⚒️  Step 3: BUILD 
📋 Step 4: PLAN
text:
**Sinamanyathelo amane okwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali lwentsapho.**

💭 Inyathelo 1: CINGA 
🎯 Inyathelo 2: KHETHA 
⚒️  Inyathelo 3: YAKHA 
📋 Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA

SourceText: Can you complete these steps together with your family now?
text: Ningakwazi ukugqibezela lamanyathelo nikunye nilusapho?

SourceText: My family can join in now
text: Usapho lwam lungangenelela ngoku

SourceText: Let me try it out by myself
text: Makhe ndiyizame ngoku ngokwam

SourceText:
You need:

- 📓Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- 🫘 Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money

Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.
text:
Udinga: 

- 📓 Amaphepha (okanye iphephandaba elidala okanye ibhokisi yekhadbhodi) neepeni 
- 🫘 Amatye okanye iimbotyi okanye nantoni na enamasuntswana amaninzi amela imali. 

Thatha ithuba ukuze ufumane ezi zinto ngaphambi kokuba siqalise inyathelo lokuqala.

SourceText:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.
text:
**Inyathelo 1: CINGA**
Cinga ngento oyichitha kuyo imali nyanga nganye.

SourceText:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text:
- Zoba imifanekiso yezinto zonke enichitha kuzo imali nosapho lwakho nyanga nganye.
- Bhala ecaleni komfanekiso ngamye ukuba into nganye yimalini ngenyanga (akukho mfuneko yokuba wabelane ngamanani ukuba awufuni).
- Dibanisa yimalini oyichithayo ngenyanga.

SourceText:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.
text:
**Inyathelo 2: KHETHA**
Cinga ngezidingo neemfuno zakho.
- IMFUNO yinto onokuphila ngaphandle kwayo. 
- ISIDINGO yinto ongakwazi ukuphila ngaphandle kwayo.

SourceText:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?
text:
Jongani kuluhlu lwenu lwezinto enisebenzisa imali kuzo nize nikhethe:

- Zeziphi IZIDINGO eningenakuphila ngaphandle kwazo? Kutheni?
- Zeziphi IIMFUNO eningathanda nje ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekanga? Kutheni? 
- Zeziphi izinto eninokuzama ukungachithi mali eninzi kuzo?

SourceText:
**Step 3: BUILD**
Make a budget!
text:
**Inyathelo 3: YAKHA**
Yenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali!

SourceText:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is R2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is R100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.
text:
- Bhala phantsi ukuba uyimalini umvuzo wakho wenyanga.
- Thathani amatye athile okanye iimbotyi okanye nantoni na enamasuntswana amaninzi - lo ngumvuzo wakho wenyanga. 
umzekelo: Ukuba umvuzo wakho yi-R2000, yaye uneembotyi ezingama 20, mbotyi nganye yi-R100. 
- Gqibani ukuba niza kuthenga ntoni ngemali, uze ubeke amatye/ izinto kuloo mfanekiso. 

Aniqinisekanga ngezigqibo zenu? Ninengxaki ukwahlula phakathi “kwezidingo” “neemfuno”? Akukho ngxaki konke konke! Lomsebenzi uyakuba lula ngokuziqhelanisa.

SourceText:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
text:
**Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA**
Cwangcisa indlela onokonga ngayo imali, ukuze uhlangabezane neemeko ezingxamisekileyo ukuze ufikelele ekuwaqondeni amaphupho osapho lwakho!

SourceText:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called “emergencies”.
- Add a circle called “family goals”.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.
text:
Ukuba unokonga neyona mali incinci ukwenzela ikamva okanye imeko engxamisekileyo - ingenza umahluko omkhulu ngokuhamba kwexesha. 

- Yongeza isangqa esibizwa ngokuba “ungxamiseko”.
- Yongeza isangqa esithi “amaphupho osapho.”
- Ngoku zama ukuhamba hambisa imali yakho ukuze wonge intwana nyanga nganye ukwenzela amaphupha kunye nongxamiseko.

SourceText:
CONGRATULATIONS!!! 🎉 

You have made your budget! Remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!

Now, let's see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:
text:
SIYAVUYISANA!!! 🎉

Ulwenzile uhlahlo lwabiwo mali yakho! Khumbula ukwenza lo msebenzi kwakhona namanye amalungu osapho lwakho - ukuba niyavumelana ekucwangciseni ninonke ingenza umehluko omkhulu!

Ngoku, makhe sibone ukuba u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name ulwenze njani ucwangciso ngemali yakhe, njengokuba usenza:
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive.

I should save, but that feels impossible!
text:
Ndibafunela ikamva eliqaqambileyo abazukulwana bam, kodwa andazi ukuba ndingayifumana phi imali. Oomatshonisa bayingozi kwaye ukubabuyisela kubiza kakhulu. 

Ndimele ndonge imali, kodwa lonto ivakala ngathi ayinakwenzeka!

SourceText: My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?
text: Iphupha lam kukuqinisekisa ukuba umzukulwana wam ongumfana uyakwazi ukuya kwisikolo samabanga aphezulu kwaye umzukulwana wam oyintombazana akwazi ukufezekisa iphupha lakhe lokuya edyunivesithi. Ndingakwazi njani ukugcina imali eninzi ngale malana encinci endinayo?

SourceText: I know – let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a stokvel.
text: Ndiyazi - masiqale ngesicwangciso! Okokuqala, mandenze uhlahlo lwabiwo mali – isicwangciso sendlela endinokonga ngayo imali yam. Emva koko ndiza konga intwana yemali ngexesha – ndingade ndijoyine namaqela okonga mali.

SourceText: I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but do not need.
text: Kufanele ndithethe nabazukulwana bam ukuze sikhethe izinto esinokunciphisa inkcitho kuzo veki nganye. Baza kundincedisa ndicinge ngezinto esizifunayo kodwa esingazidingiyo.

SourceText: *(A few years later)*
text: *(Emva kweminyaka embalwa)*

SourceText: Look, we reached our dreams! I did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name’s high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name’s university. I am so proud of this.
text: Jonga, siwafezekisile amaphupha ethu! Andikhange ndiboleke mali kwizihlobo okanye koomatshonisa. Ngokubeka imali encinci veki nganye, ndikwazile ukuhlawula imali ka@data.characters.f2_son_15.name yamabanga aphakamileyo ndaza ndabeka imali ethile ka@data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name yasedyunivesithi. Ndiyazidla ngale nto.

SourceText: Saving is important for one more reason - emergencies! @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name also learnt this along the way:
text: Ukonga kubalulekile nangesinye isizathu - ungxamiseko! u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name uye wayifunda le nto apha endleleni:
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.
text: Ngobunye ubusuku kwabakho isichotho esibi esonakalisa uphahla lwam. Yonke into yayikhukhulisekile. Ngesaquphe kwafuneka ndizame imali yokulungisa uphahla. Ndaziva ndoyisakele.

SourceText:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.
text:
Ukuba nendlela yokonga imali bekunomncedisa u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name alungele izimo zongxamiseko ezifana nezi! 

Kukho indlela ezahlukeneyo zokonga: ekhayeni, nokuthenga izinto esinokuzithengisa sifumane ingeniso, ebhankini, okanye emgalelweni.

Cinga ngezinto eziluncedo nezingeloncedo kukhetho ngalunye lokonga.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: What is the best way your family can save?
text: Yeyiphi eyona ndlela ilungileyo usapho lwakho olunokonga ngayo?

SourceText: Save money at home
text: Yonga imali ekhayeni

SourceText: Buy things you can sell for profit
text: Thenga izinto onokuzithengisa ufumane inzuzo

SourceText: Save money at a bank
text: Yonga imali ebhankini

SourceText: Save in a stokvel/savings group
text: Yonga imali emigalelweni okanye kwiqela labantu lokonga

SourceText: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
text: Nokuba sesiphi isicwangciso sokonga osikhethayo, siya kuyinceda ngokwenene intsapho yakho iqhubele phambili!

SourceText:
We all have dreams for our family, just like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!

Let’s come up with some ideas for savings goals for you to make a budget plan.
text:
Sonke sinamaphupha ngentsapho zethu, njengo @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. Ngokubeka ecaleni imalana qho ngenyanga,nawe ungakwazi ukubaqonda!

Makhe size nezimvo ezithile zogcino zeenjongo zokonga zokuba wenze isicwangciso sohlahlo lwabiwo mali.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: What are your family savings goals?
text: Zeziphi iinjongo zokonga zosapho lwakho?

SourceText: Teens completing school/university
text: Abantwana abafikisayo abagqibezela isikolo/idyunivesithi

SourceText: Building / expanding a house for my family
text: Ukwakha/ukwandisa indlu yosapho lwam

SourceText: Starting a business
text: Ukuqalisa ishishini

SourceText: Buying a car for my family
text: Ukuthengela usapho lwam imoto

SourceText:
Such a great goal!

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!
text:
Liphupha elihle kakhulu elo! 

Ngokwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali oluhle nesicwangciso sokonga, ningaphumelela kwaye nizidle ngeziqu zenu!

SourceText: Here are this week’s takeaway skills to help you budget and save!
text: Nazi izakhono zaleveki ohamba nazo ezikuncede kuhlahlo labiwo mali kunye nokonga!

SourceText: STEP 1: THINK
text: Inyathelo 1: CINGA

SourceText: What do we spend on now?
text: Imali siyichitha entwenini ngoku?

SourceText:
Write down or draw what you spend money on as a family each month. 

How much does each item cost? 
How much money do you need in total?
text:
Bhala phantsi okanye uzobe ukuba nichitha malini ngenyanga njengosapho. 

Into nganye iyimalini?
Yimalini imali oyidingayo iphelele?

SourceText: STEP 2: CHOOSE
text: INYATHELO 2: KHETHA

SourceText: Talk together about needs and wants.
text: Thethani kunye ngezidingo kunye neemfuno.

SourceText:
Which expenses are a ‘need’ that you cannot live without? 
Which expenses are a ‘want’ that is nice to have but not essential? 
Which things could you try to spend less on? 

When we explain and listen to each other carefully, we can make good money choices together as a family.
text:
Zeziphi indleko "ezisisidingo" ongenakuphila ngaphandle kwazo? 
Zeziphi indleko "eziyimfuno" kumnandi ukuba nazo kodwa akubalulekanga? 
Zeziphi izinto onokuzama ukuchitha kancinci kuzo? 

Xa sicacisa kwaye simamelane kakuhle, singenza ukhetho olulungileyo lwemali oluhle sikunye silusapho.

SourceText: STEP 3: BUILD
text: INYATHELO 3: YAKHA

SourceText: Make your own budget.
text: Yenza uhlahlo labiwo mali lwakho.

SourceText:
Write down your income for the month. 
Take stones, beans, or anything with lots of bits - this is your income. 
Agree how much you will spend on each item, and put the objects on that image/word.
text:
Bhala ingeniso yakho yenyanga. 
Thatha amatye, imbotyi, okanye nantoni eninzi enamasuntswana - le yingeniso yakho. 
Vumelanani ukuba niza kuchitha malini kwinto nganye, kwaye ubeke into kuloo mfanekiso/igama.

SourceText: STEP 4: PLAN
text: INYATHELO 4: Cwangcisa

SourceText: Plan for emergencies and family goals.
text: Cwangcisela ngongxamiseko kunye namaphupha osapho.

SourceText: More tips
text: Iingcebiso ezingaphezulu

SourceText:
Draw a circle ‘emergencies’.
Draw a circle ‘saving’.
Move your ‘money’ around so you can save a bit every month for both.
text:
Zoba isangqa 'ungxamiseko'.
Zoba isangqa 'ukonga'
Susa 'imali' yakho ngeenxa zonke ukuze ukwazi ukugcina isuntswana rhoqo ngenyanga kuzo zombini.

SourceText:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.
text:
Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya kukuzama ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kwakhona - kwelixesha KUNYE nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nosapho!

Yinto ebalulekileyo neyonwabisayo ukuyenza nosapho lwakho - ithatha malunga nemizuzu eyi 30.

SourceText:
**Remember to use the four steps for doing a family budget:**

💭 Step 1: THINK (what do we spend on now?)
🎯 Step 2: CHOOSE (what are our needs and wants?)
⚒️ Step 3: BUILD (make your budget) 
📋 Step 4: PLAN (plan for emergencies and family goals)
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa amanyathelo amane ngokwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali losapho.**

💭 Inyathelo 1: CINGA (siyichitha kwintoni imali ngoku?)
🎯 Inyathelo 2: KHETHA (zeziphi izidingo nemfuno zethu?)
⚒️ Inyathelo 3: YAKHA (yenza uhlahlo labiwo mali lwakho) 
📋 Inyathelo 4: CWANGCISA (cwangcisela ungxamiseko namaphupha osapho)

SourceText: Can you make a budget with your family this week?
text: Ungakwazi ukwenza uhlahlo labiwo mali nosapho lwakho kuleveki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Wonderful! Making a family budget is a powerful way to set goals and reduce stress together. Keep it simple and celebrate every small success
text: Kwakuhle! Ukwenza uhlahlo labiwo mali losapho yindlela enamandla ukuzibekela amaphupha kwaye kunciphisa uxinzelelo kunye. Yigcine ilula kwaye ubhiyozele yonke impumelelo encinci

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a great start! Even talking about money as a family is a big step. Take it one conversation at a time - you are building important skills together.
text: Sisiqalo esihle eso! Nokuthetha nje ngemali njengosapho linyathelo elikhulu. Thatha incoko ibenye ngexesha- nakha izakhono ezibalulekileyo kunye.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Budgeting can feel difficult at first. Try starting with one small thing, like planning how to spend this week’s food money, and build from there.
text: Kulungile. Uhlahlo labiwo mali lungavakala lunzima ekuqaleni. Zama ukuqala ngento enye encinci, njengokucwangcisa indlela yokuchitha imali yokutya kuleveki, kwaye nakhe ukusuka apho.

SourceText:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!
text:
Xa sibandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo kuhlahlo lwabiwo mali, bafunda izakhono zobomi ezibalulekileyo, njengokuqonda umehluko phakathi kwemfuno nezidingo.

Ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali nabantwana bakho kuyanceda sibone ukuba sonke sidinga ukwenza ukhetho olunzima ngamanye amaxesha, kodwa lonto iyasinceda sibe nemali eyaneleyo ekupheleni kwenyanga - kunye nokuqonda amaphupha wethu!

SourceText: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
text: Ingaba ukwenza uhlahlo lwabiwo mali kungalunceda kusapho lwakho? Cofa dlala ufunde nangaphezulu

SourceText:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say “I do not have money,” but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point “she does not love me.”

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked “what are the needs and wants in our house.” I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
text:
Bendidla ngokumcela umama wam andithengele impahla ezintle maxa onke. Ngalo lonke ixesha, ebesithi "andinamali," kodwa bendiyazi ufumana imali kumalume wam. Bendingaqondi ukuba kutheni engavumi ukundithengela impahla. Bendikhe ndicinge ngelinye xesha "akandithandi."

Kodwa ngenye imini wandibiza wandihlalisa phantsi wandibuza "zeziphi iizidingo neemfuno apha ekhayeni lethu." Ndaqala ndadwelisa zonke iizidingo nemfuno zam. Waze umama wandincedisa ukuba ndisele ndicinga ngeezidingo zosapho.

Ukususela ngalamini, ndiyayiqonda andinokungena ndicele nangaliphi ixesha. Ngoku, xa ndifuna into, ndilinda kuphele inyanga xa sele sixoxile ngohlahlo lwabiwo mali sibone ukuba iyangena. Siqondana ngcono ngoku.

SourceText:
Today we are learning about spending one-on-one time with our children. 

Spending dedicated time with your child will make them feel valued and loved.
It will also build trust and respect, and support their learning.
text:
Namhlanje sifunda ngokuchitha ixesha elinye omnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bethu.
Ukuchitha ixesha elaneleyo kunye nomntwana wakho limenza azive exabisekile kwaye ethandwa.

Kuya kwakha ukuthembana kunye nentlonipho nokuxhasa ukufunda kwabo.

SourceText: Why is spending one-on-one time with your child important? Tap play to learn
text: Kutheni kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha elinye omnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufunde

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!

Our children don't need expensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one on one time with them.

By spending time together, you will understand your child better and they will learn many new things.

Having this time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. That will make everything easier at home!
text:
Molweni nonke!

Abantwana bethu abadingi zipho zexabiso. Esona sipho esingabanika sona kukuchitha ixesha elinye lomnye nomnye kunye.

Ngokuchitha ixesha kunye, uyakumqonda ngakumbi umntwana wakho kwaye uyakufunda izinto ezintsha ezininzi.

Ukuba neli xesha kunye nomntwana wakho kuyamenza azive ebalulekile kuba iyakumnceda ukuba azive ethandwa kwaye exabisekile. Iyakwenza yonke into ibelula ekhaya!

SourceText:
One-on-one time can be fun for both of you!

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name do this.
text:
Ixesha lomnye nomnye lingabamnandi kuni nobabini!

Makhe sijonge ukuba u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name kunye no@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name bakwenza njani oku.

SourceText: I have 5 minutes and I would like to spend it with you, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. What would you like to do?
text: Ndinemizuzu eyi 5 kwaye ndingathanda ukuyichitha nawe, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Yintoni ongathanda uyenza?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: I want to play dress-up!
text: Ndifuna ukudlala umdlalo wokunxiba!

SourceText: Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.
text: Ngumbono omhle, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Ndiyakubona ukhupha isikhafu esithyeli esinemigca eluhlaza.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, it’s for you.
text: u@data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, Sesakho.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Thank you, I love this scarf!
text: Enkosi, Ndiyasithanda esisikhafu!

SourceText: Wear it, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name!
text: Sinxibe, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name!
note: The string @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name finds a dress to wear.
text: u@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name ufumene ilokhwe yonxiba.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Well done for getting that dress on by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. You’re learning to do so many new things for yourself!
text: Wenze kakuhle ngokuzinxibisa ngokwakho loo lokhwe, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Ufunda ukuzenzela izinto ezininzi ezintsha ngokwakho!

- Look at your child. Get down to their level. Use their name.

SourceText:
When I first heard I have to spend one-on-one time with my daughter, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my daughter so that she thinks we have to do everything together. 

But I really wanted to build my relationship with her and I wanted her to open up about what was troubling her. 

So we tried the One-on-One Time. 

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we play her favourite game together and talk about things happening at school and with her friends.
text:

Kodwa enyanisweni bendifuna ukwakha ubudlelwane nomntwana wam ofikisayo kwaye athethe ngokukhululekileyo malunga nento emhluphayo. 

Siye sazama ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about spending one-on-one time with our teens. 

Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our teens never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo. 

Ukuba ngumzali kunganzima. Ngamanye amaxesha kuvakala ngathi abantwana bethu abasimameli.

Kodwa ingcali zisibonisa ukuchitha imizuzwana embalwa ngosuku nigxile kwixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kungancedisa ukwakha ukuthembana kunye no thando.

SourceText: Why is spending one-on-one time with your teens important? Click play to learn
text: Kutheni kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo? Cofa udlala ukuze ufunde

SourceText:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.
text:
Molo. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu sisodwa. 

Kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu ukuze basazi, ukwenzela nathi sifumane ithuba lokuba sibazi.

Khumbula, usapho olwazanayo luphila ngoxolo.

SourceText:
Let's discuss, what is one-on-one time?

One-on-one time is when you focus on your teens, without distractions like TVs or phones. Let your teens take lead in choosing what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can spend fifteen minutes a day together, but even five minutes a day is really good.
text:
Makhe sixoxe, Yintoni ixesha lomnye nomnye?

Ixesha lomnye nomnye kuxa uunike ingqwalasela kubantwana bakho ofikisayo, ngaphandle kweziphazamisi ezinje ngo MABONAKUDE okanye iminxeba. Yeka abantwana bakho bakhokhele ekukhetheni into eninokuyenza okanye eninokuthetha ngayo.

Kungakuhle ukuchitha imizuzu elishumi elinesihlanu ngosuku kunye, kodwa nemizuzu emihlanu ngosuku nayo ilungile.

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together.

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time.

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence and even about girlfriends and those things!
text:
Xana ndandiqala ukuva ukuba kufuneka ndichithe Ixesha Lomnye Nomnye kunye nomntwana wam ofikisayo, kwakunzima kum. Ndandingayazi ukuba mandiyenze nini okanye yintoni emandiyithethe. Ndandingafuni ukumosha umntwana wam ofikisayo ukwenzela acinge kufuneka senze yonke into kunye.

Kodwa ndandifuna nyhani ukwakha ubudlelwane nomntwana wam ofikisayo kwaye ndandifuna avule isifuba malunga nento emhluphayo. Ngoko sazama Ixesha Lomnye Nomnye kunye.

Ekuqaleni ibivakala ingaqhelekanga, kodwa iphele isonwabisa! Ngoku sibukela inkqubo yakhe kwi TV kunye kwaye sincokole ngayo. kwaye siyathetha nkqu malunga nohlobo unyana wam atshintsha ngalo ekubeni engumntana ofikisayo, kunye nangamantombazane nezinye izinto!

Let's think of ways to spend time with your teen.

It may take some time to get used to one-on-one time, but the more you do it, the better it gets!

You are an amazing parent for trying this.

SourceText: DAY

SourceText: PLAY
text: DLALA

SourceText:
Let your teen choose.

Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but they will come to enjoy this time with you!
text:
Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe.

Mxelele umntana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ungathanda ukuchitha ixesha kunye naye. Kwaye angakwazi ukukhetha into eninokuyenza okanye emanithethe ngayo. Angacinga ukuba ayiqhelekanga ekuqaleni, kodwa uzakubuya alonwabele eli xesha kunye nawe!

SourceText: STAY
text: HLALA

SourceText:
Focus on your teen.

Switch off the TV and put phones aside. Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show that you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.
text:
Qwalasela kumntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Cima i-UMABONAKUDE ubeke umnxeba ecaleni. Jonga emntwaneni wakho ofikisayo. Nqwala okanye uthi "ndiyabona" ukubonakalisa ukuba unike ingqwalasela. Kwamnkele akuthethayo ngaphandle kokumgxeka.

SourceText: Spending one-on-one time with your teen can be hard to plan. Here are some easy ideas that worked for other parents.
text: Ukuchitha ixesha lomnye nomnye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kunganzima ukulungiselela. Nazi ezinye indlela ezilula ezibasebenzeleyo abanye abazali.

SourceText:
**Ideas for one-on-one time with your teen:**
- Walk to the shops
- Play a game/sport
- Do a chore together
- Prepare dinner
- Eat breakfast/lunch/dinner
- Have tea after school
- Watch a TV show
- Review homework
- Chat before bedtime


**Remember to use your new skills:**
📅 **DAY**: try to do it every day,
⚽ **PLAY**: let your teen choose how to spend one-on-one time, and 
🎯 **STAY**: be focused on your teen!

- Ukuhamba nngenyawo ukuya ezivenkileni

- Yenzani imisebenzi yasekhaya kunye
- Lungisani isidlo sangokuhlwa
- Yidlani isidlo sakusasa/esasemini/nesangokuhlwa

- Bukelani inkqubo ka MABONAKUDE

🎯 **HLALA**: Qwalasela emntwaneni wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: Here's what @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name has to say about one-on-one time with her mother
text: Nantsi enye @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name angakuyithetha malunga nexesha lomnye nomnye kunye nomama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought “Maybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick.” But she said “No, I just want to spend time.” I was sceptical, but I accepted.

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own.

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.
text:
Xa umama wam ecela ukuba achithe ixesha kunye nam, Bendicinga "Mhlawumbi ikhona into engalunganga, mhlawubi uyagula". Kodwa wathi " Hayi, ndifuna nje ukuchitha ixesha". Ndandithandabuza, kodwa ndayamnkela.

Wandibuza ukuba ndithanda ukwenza ntoni na. Yayingaqhelekanga kwaye ndandingakhululekanga, kuba akazange achithe ixesha kunye nam ndindodwa.

 Qho emana ezama kwaye sichithe elixesha kunye, bekuvakala kamnandi. Uye wandibalisela ngokukhula kwakhe, izinto endangazange ndizive ngaphambili. Lonto indincede ukuba nam ndibalise ngokuqhubekekayo ebomini bam. Siye sathetha nangamakhwenkwe kwakunye nezinye iingxaki endinazo. Ndiyayazi ukuba ndingakwazi ukuthethe nomama wam ngoku.

SourceText:

Praise helps build a positive relationship and encourages good behaviour!

Let’s first reflect on our own experience with praise.
text:

SourceText: How did it make you feel?

SourceText:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.
text:
Sonke siziva ngcono xa sinconywa.

Ukuncoma umntwana wakho xa eziphethe kakuhle kuya kumenza afune ukuziphatha ngolo hlobo rhoqo. 

Yakha ubudlelwane obuhle kunye nobunothando phakathi kwakho.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!
text:
Molweni nonke.

Ugqibele nini ukunconywa? uyakwazi ukuzincoma ngento ngoku? Ukunconywa kusenza sizive sonwabile.

Kuhle ukubancoma abantwana bethu xa benze kakuhle. kuba xa sisenza loo nto, bayakwenza ngakumbi ngendlela entle yokuziphatha esifuna ukuyibona.

Kwaye masikhumbule ukuzincoma nathi ngezinto ezinkulu okanye ezincinci!

SourceText: That’s right, giving a simple and free reward helps our children to do behaviours that may be difficult for them.
text: Kulungile! Ukunika umvuzo olula nosimahla kunceda abantwana bethu benze izimilo ezinokuba nzima kubo.

SourceText: Here are some easy tips for how to use praise.
text: Nazi ezinye indlela ezilula zokusebenzisa ukuncoma.

SourceText: SEE IT
text: YIBONE

SourceText: Look for good behaviours that you can praise! It can be anything positive or helpful your child does or tries to do.
text: Khangela izimilo ezihle ongakwazi ukuzincoma! Ingayiyo nayiphina elungileyo okanye eluncedo eyenziwa ngumntwana wakhe okanye azama ukuyenza.

SourceText:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.
text:
Yima kwaye uqaphele ngokwenene xa benza into elungileyo. Nokuba ilindelekile kubo.

Mncome umntwana wakho *ngokuzama*. Oku kukhulisa ukuzazi kunye nokuzithemba kwabo, okubanceda bafunde izimilo ezitsha.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: YITHETHE

SourceText: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.
text: Bancome xa ubabona besenza into oyithandayo. Yenza oku yonke mihla - nokuba yinto encinci ngokwenene.

SourceText:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.
text:
Baxelele ngokucacileyo oko bakwenzileyo kakuhle.

Yiba nomdla kwaye uzimisele ngokwenene!

Ungabonisa ukuncoma kwakho ngoncumo olukhulu kunye nangamazwi.

SourceText: REWARD IT
text: YIVUZE

SourceText: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that may be difficult for them.
text: Nika umntwana wakho umvuzo olula, wasimahla wokumkhuthaza ukuba enze ngakumbi iizimilo ezinganobu nzima kuye.

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye ingcebiso

SourceText:
Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.
text:
Mange umntwana wakho, ixesha elongezelelweyo lokudlala kunye, okanye wenze isidlo asithandayo!

Imivuzo elula ingaba yinkuthazo enkulu kumntwana wakho ukuba aqhubeke ezama kwaye abonise isimilo esilungileyo.

SourceText: Now that you have learned a few tips on how to use praise, let’s think of specific things we can praise our children for.
text: Ngoku ke sewufundile iingcebiso ezimbalwa zokuba ukusebenzisa njani ukuncoma, makhe sicinge ngezinto ezithile esinokuncoma ngazo abantwana bethu.

SourceText: What is one behaviour your child regularly shows that you can praise them for?
text: Sesiphi esisimilo sinye umntwana wakho adla ngokusibonisa ongakwazi ukumncoma ngaso?

SourceText: Cleaning up or helping out
text: Ukucoca okanye ukuncedisa

SourceText: Being patient or polite

SourceText: Trying a new skill
text: Ukuzama isakhono esitsha

SourceText: Playing quietly
text: Edlala ngokuzolileyo

SourceText: Getting ready for school or bed
text: Ukulungiselela ukuya esikolweni okanye ukulala

SourceText: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!
text: Ewe, usenokwazi ukubancoma ngezi izimilo... Kunye nezinye ezininzi!

SourceText: Other
text: Enye indlela

SourceText: Whatever you choose to praise your child for is a great choice. You can praise them whenever they have done something well.
text: Nantoni na okhetha ukuyincoma ngomntwana wakho lukhetho olukhulu olo. Unokumncoma nanini na xa benze into entle.

SourceText:
Your home activity is to praise your child for at least 2 things every day.
Praise yourself too for all your hard work being a parent – you deserve it!
text:
Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukuncoma umntwana wakho ngezinto ezi 2 ubuncinane yonke imihla.
Zincome nawe ngawo wonke umsebenzi wakho onzima wokuba ngumzali-ikufanele lonto!

SourceText: Tap play to hear how simple praises helped @data.characters.media_female_2.name's family
text: Cofa udlala ukuze umamele ukuncoma okulula kuncede u@data.characters.media_female_2.name nosapho
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_2.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
When we learned about this praising thing, I thought “We were never praised for things as children, so why should we start now?”. But I got interested when I learned what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after learning about praise, I noticed my son doing what he does every day: Packing away his toys after playing. And I said “Thank you for packing away your toys, my boy, it really makes me happy that you are helping out to keep the house tidy.” My son was smiling and he even came to give me a hug, which he never does. 

This praising business is hard. I still forget to do it sometimes. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!
text:
Xa besifunda ngalento yokuncoma, ndicinge ukuba, Asizange sinconywe ngezinto sisengabantwana, ngoko ke kutheni sifanele siqalise ngoku? Kodwa ndaba nomdla xa ndandifunda ukuba inzuzo yokuncoma ingaba yintoni.

Kanye emva kokuba ndifunde ngokuncoma, ndaqaphela unyana wam esenza into ayenzayo mihla le. Ukupakisha izinto zakhe zokudlala emva kokudlala, Ndaye ndathi "Enkosi ngokupakisha izinto zakho zokudlala mfo wam, indenza ndonwabe nyani into yokuba uncedise ukugcina indlu icocekile. Unyana wam wayencumile wade wafika wandanga into angazange ayenze.

Lomsebenzi wokuncoma unzima Ndiyalibala ukuwenza ngamanye amaxesha. Kodwa ukuncoma kuyawenza umahluko nyani. Zange ndiyicinge into yokuncoma nje inokwenza utshintsho emntwini!

SourceText:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokuncoma.

Ukuncoma sisakhono esinamandla sobuzali.

Ukuba siyabancoma abantwana abafikisayo bethu xa besenza kakuhle, sizakubabona besenza izinto entle ngakumbi nangakumbi!

SourceText: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!
text: Ukuncoma kungakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukuze ufumanise!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!
text:
Molweni nonke.

Isihloko sethu sanamamhlanje simalunga nokuncoma.

Kulungile kakhulu ukuncoma abantwana bethu xa besenza kakuhle ngokuba xa sisenza njalo, bazakwenza ngakumbi kwisimilo esilungileyo esifuna ukusibona.

Kwaye nathi masingalibali ukuzincoma xa sisenza kakuhle!

SourceText: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!
text: Ukuncoma yindlela elula yokwakha ukuzithemba komntwana wakho ofikisayo kunye nokuqinisa unxibelelwano lwenu. Inene iyasebenza!

SourceText: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home
