note: The string @data.characters.media_female_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

SourceText:
All of those things are true!

When her teens are happy, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels happy. And she got her work done.
text:
Zonke ezo zinto ziyinyani!

Xa abantwana bakhe abafikisayo bonwabile, u@data.characters.f1_mother.name uziva onwabile. Kwaye umsebenzi wakhe ugqibekile.

SourceText:
Here are some skills to help you praise your teens.
You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
text:
Nazi izakhono zokukunceda wena uncome abantwana bakho abafikisayo.
Ungabancoma nabanye abantu abadala kwindlu yakho, Qaphela ihlobo abasabela ngalo!

SourceText: SEE IT
text: YIBONE

SourceText: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Jonga nayiphi na into umntwana wakho ofikisayo ayenzayo eluncedo okanye elungileyo ubancome ngayo. Bangangayibonakalisi, kodwa ungababona besenza into elungileyo kwakhona. Izakubabonakalisa ukuba uyaqaphela kwaye uyakhathala.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: YITHETHE

SourceText: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
text: Yiba nentshiseko – nyaniseka xa uyitsho!

SourceText: REPEAT IT
text: YIPHINDE

SourceText: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.
text: Zama ukufumanisa into oza kubabulela ngayo suku ngalunye. Nditsho nento encinci kakhulu.

SourceText: It can be hard to think of reasons to praise your teen! Here are some ideas from other parents:
text: Kunganzima ukucinga ngezizathu zokuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo! Nazi ezinye iimbono zabanye abazali:

SourceText:
**Thank you for...**
- Being kind to someone
- Cleaning your room
- Joining a family meal
- Greeting other family members
- Looking after your siblings
- Coming home on time
- Showing thoughtfulness
- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'
- Going to school on time
- Doing chores or schoolwork
text:
**Enkosi ngo...**
- Ngokuba nobuntu komnye umntu
-Ukucoca igumbi lakho
-Ukuhlala nosapho kwisidlo
-Ukubulisa amanye amalungu osapho
-Ukujonga abantwana bakowenu
-Ukubuya ngexesha
-Ukubonisa ukucinga
-Ukuthi 'ndiyacela ' okanye 'ndiyabulela'
-Ukuya esikolweni kwangexesha
-Ukwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya okanye umsebenzi wesikolo

SourceText: This week's home activity is to praise your teen once a day. It will only take 10 seconds!
text: Kuleveki umsebenzi wasekhaya kukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo kanye ngosuku. Iyakuthatha imizuzwana eli 10!

SourceText: You can do it! Try praising your teen for something simple at first, like looking after their siblings or going to school.
text: Ungayenza! Zama ukuncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngento elula kuqala, njengokujonga abantwana bakowabo okanye ukuya esikolweni.

SourceText: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."

SourceText: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour, the more positive behaviour you will see.
text: Khumbula, ukuncoma sisixhobo esinamandla. Okukhona uthatha ingqalelo kwindlela yokuziphatha entle, kukona uzakubona isimilo esilungileyo ngakumbi.

SourceText: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother
text: Mamela ku@data.characters.media_daughter_2.name ukuba ivakala njani into yokunconywa ngumama wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I was grateful that my mother learnt about praise.

My mother always noticed when I was doing something wrong. She would shout at me and hit me.

But when my mother did the workshop, she would praise me for little things. First I thought “What is going on?” but then it continued. I liked it so I did more good things I thought she would like.

It feels great that my mother sees the good things I do, and not just the bad things.

I even said it to her once. During one-on-one time, I said “Thank you, mom, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.” This made us both very happy.
text:
Bendinombulelo yinto yokufunda kukamama malunga nokuncoma.

Umama wam ebesoloko eqaphela xa ndisenza into engalunganga. Ebedla ngokundingxolisa kwaye andibethe.

Kodwa ngethuba umama wam esenza izifundo, ebendincoma ngezinto ezincinci. Kuqala bendicinga "Kuqhubeka ntoni?" kodwa yaqhubekeka. Ndiyithandile kwaye ndenza izinto ezilungileyo endicinga uzakuzithanda.

Ivakala kamnandi into yokuba umama wam eyibona imisebenzi emihle endiyenzayo, hayi izinto ezingalunganga kuphela.

Bendikhe ndamxelela kanye. Ngexesha lomnye nomnye, ndithe " Enkosi, mama, ngokuthetha into entle xa ndisenza kakuhle, hayi xa ndisenza izinto ezingalunganga kuphela." Lento isenze sonwaba xa sisobabini.

SourceText:
I'M HUNGRY! HE HIT ME! I'M BORED!
Sound familiar? 

Every family faces challenges. Learning how to solve problems together with your child can help you when you have conflict in your home. 

It also teaches your children how to solve problems on their own. This will set them up for success throughout their life. What a gift!
text:
NDILAMBILE! UNDIBETHILE! NDIDIKIWE!
Ivakala iqhelekile? 

Intsapho nganye zijamelene nemiceli mngeni. Ukufunda indlela yokusombulula iingxaki kunye nomntwana wakho kunokunceda xa unengxabano ekhayeni lakho.

Ikwafundisa abantwana bakho ukuba bangayisombulula njani ngokunokwabo. Oku kuya kubamisela impumelelo ebomini babo bonke. Esinjani isipho!

SourceText: Tap play to hear how solving problems with your children can you and your family
text: Cofa udlala ukuva ukusombulula iingxaki kunye nabantwana bakho unako kunye nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

As parents, it can feel like we have to solve a million problems for our children every day: Where is my toy car? I am not going to school! Why can’t you buy me new shoes now?

By involving our children in solving problems, they learn to find solutions more and more independently. 

Life has its challenges. If you help your child solve small problems today, you give them the skills to deal with any bigger challenges later in life.
text:
Molweni nonke!

Njengabazali, ingavakala ngathi kumele sisombulule izigidi zeengxaki zabantwana bethu mihla yonke. Iphi imoto yam yokudlala? Andiyi esikolweni! Kutheni ungandithengeli izihlangu ezintsha ngoku?

Ngokubandakanya abantwana bethu ekusombululeni iingxaki, bafunda ukuzifumanela izisombululo kunye nokuzimela ngakumbi nangakumbi.

Ubomi bunemiceli mngeni yabo. Ukuba unceda umntwana wakho akwazi ukusombulula iingxaki ezincinci namhlanje, ubanika isakhono sokumelana nayo nayiphi na imiceli mngeni emikhulu phambili phaya ebomini.

SourceText:
**In the next story, @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name and @data.characters.f2_son_8.name use four steps to solve a problem:**

1) 💡 KNOW IT: Talk to your child about what the problem is
2) 🔧 SOLVE IT: Think of possible solutions together
3) 🎯 TRY IT: Choose one solution to try
4) 💭 REFLECT: See if it worked. If not, try another solution
text:
**Kwibali elilandelayo, u@data.characters.f2_grandfather.name kunye no@data.characters.f2_son_8.name basebenzisa amanyathelo amane okusombulula ingxaki.**

1)💡 YAZI: Thetha nomntwana wakho malunga nokuba yintoni ngxaki.
2) 🔧 YISOMBULULE: Cinga ngesisombululo esinokubakhona kunye.
3) 🎯 YIZAME: Khetha isisombuluo esinye oza kuzama ngaso.
4) 💭 CINGISISA: Jonga ukuba iyasebenza. ukuba ayisebenzi, Zama esinye isisombululo

SourceText: How can we make sure you get all your work done and still get to bed on time so that you get enough sleep?

SourceText: Shall we make a rule that you start your homework half an hour after you get home from school? That way, you can finish it and have some time to eat and relax before bed, too!
text: Singakwazi ukwenza umthetho wokuba uqala umsebenzi wakho wesikolo emva kwesiqingatha seyure emva kokuba ubuyile eskolweni? Ngalo ndlela, ungakwazi ukuyigqiba kwaye ube nexesha lokutya kwaye nelokuphumla ngaphambi kokulala!

SourceText:
When a problem comes up, take a deep breath before you respond. 

Then help your child work on the problem with you using these four steps.
text:
Xa kuvela ingxaki, phefumla nzulu, ngaphambi kokuba uphendule. 

Emva koko nceda umntwana wakho asebenze kwingxaki kunye nawe usebenzisa lamanyathelo mane.

SourceText: KNOW IT
text: YAZI

SourceText:
Put the problem into words.

Talk to your child about what the problem is.
text:
Yibeke ngamazwi ingxaki.

Thetha nomtwana wakho malunga nokuba yintoni ingxaki.

SourceText: _"I can hear you arguing because you don’t want to watch the same television programme. I know I said you both could watch TV after you’ve helped clean up after dinner, but we only have one television. How can we solve this problem?"_
text: _"Ndiyaniva ukuba niyaxambulisana kuba anifuni kubukela inkqubo enye kumabonakude. Ndiyayazi ukuba ndithe ningabukela umabonakude nobabini emva kokuba nincedise ukucoceni emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa, kodwa sinomabonakude omnye nje. Singayisombulula njani le ngxaki?"_

SourceText: SOLVE IT
text: YISOMBULULE

SourceText:
Together, think of possible solutions to this problem.
What could you or your child do differently in this situation in the future?
text:
Kunye, cingani ngezisombululo ezinokubakho kule ngxaki.
Yintoni wena okanye umntwana wakho onokuyenza ngokwahlukileyo kule meko kwixesha elizayo?

SourceText: _"One option is for us not to turn the television on at all. You can also take turns choosing a programme or select one you both want to watch. What do you both think?"_
text: _''Olunye ukhetho kukuba angavuli umabonakude kwaphela. Ningatshintshana ukukhetha inkqubo okanye ukhethe enye enifuna ukuyibukela nobabini. Nicinga ntoni nobabini?"_

SourceText: TRY IT
text: YIZAME

SourceText:
Choose one solution together.

Try it next time you are in a similar situation, and praise your child for trying!
text:
Khetha isisombululo esinye kunye.

Yizame kwixesha elilandelayo ukwimeko efanayo, kwaye umncome umntwana wakho ngokuzama oko!

SourceText:
_"Okay boys, do you remember what we said last night about the TV? Who can remember the solution we came up with?"
"That's right – well done for remembering! Let's try to pick a programme that you both want to watch – I can even come watch with you!"_
text:
_"Kulungile bafana, niyakhumbula ukuba sithethe ntoni phezolo ngo MABONAKUDE? Ngubani osasikhumbulayo isisombululo esize naso?"
"Kulungile - wenze kakuhle ukukhumbula! Masizame ukukhetha inkqubo enifuna ukuyibukela nobabini - ndingeza nam ndizokubukela kunye nani!"_

SourceText: REFLECT
text: Cingisisa

SourceText: After you’ve tried it, decide with your child whether or not your solution worked.
text: Emva kokuba uyizamile, yenza isigqibo nomntwana wakho ukuba isisombululo sakho sisebenzile na okanye hayi.

SourceText: What you could say
text: Yintoni onokuthi uyithethe

SourceText: After the programme ends… _“Well that was an exciting game! I never knew I liked watching soccer so much, so thank you for introducing me to something new! I think we all had fun watching that together.”_
text: Emva kokuba inkqubo iphelile... _"Ewe Ibingumdlalo onika umdla! Zange ndiyazi ukuba ndiyakuthanda ukubukela ibhola ekhatywayo kakhulu, ngoko ke ndiyabulela ngondazisa ngento entsha! Ndicinga ukuba sonke sikonwabele ukubukela loo nto kunye."_

SourceText: Let’s think of some common problems we could solve with our children.
text: Makhe sicinge ngeengxaki eziqhelekileyo esinokuzisombulula kunye nabantwana bethu.

SourceText: Do you experience any of these problems at home with your children?
text: Ingaba ufumana nayiphi na kwezi ngxaki ekhaya kunye nabantwana bakho?

SourceText: Too much screen time
text: Ixesha lokubukela ngokugqithisileyo

SourceText: Coming home late
text: Ukubuya emva kwexesha ekhaya

SourceText: Fighting with other children
text: Ukulwa kunye nabanye abantwana

SourceText: Not sharing toys
text: Ukungabelani ngezinto zokudlala

SourceText: Talk with your child and use the steps of problem-solving together to come up with solutions that you can try out.
text: Thetha nomtwana wakho kwaye nisebenzise amanyathelo okusombulula ingxaki kunye ukuze nize nezisombululo eninokwazi ukuzizama.

SourceText:
Your home activity is to identify a problem your child may have and practise the four steps of problem-solving together: Know It, Solve It, Try It, Reflect. 

Knowing how to solve problems is something they can use for the rest of their lives!
text:
Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukuchonga ingxaki umntwana wakho onokuba nayo kwaye uzame amanyathelo amane okusombulula iingxaki kunye: Yazi, Yisombulule, Yizame, Cingisisa. 

Ukwazi ukuba uzisombulula njani iingxaki yinto abangayisebenzisa ubomi babo bonke!

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_female_5.name and her daughter use the four steps of problem solving
text: Mamela u @data.characters.media_female_5.name kunye nentombi yakhe besebenzisa njani amanyathelo amane okusombulula ingxaki
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_5.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school. 

Only when I started spending One-on-One Time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the four steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.
text:
Bendingenabo ubudlelwana obulungileyo nentombi yam. Bendisoloko ndimngxolisa kwaye ebengafuni
ukuya esikolweni. 

Xa ndandiqala ukuchitha ixesha naye lomnye nomnye, ndafumanisa ukuba akafuni ukuya esikolweni kuba exhatshazwa esikolweni. Sihleli phantsi sasebenzisa amanyathelo ayi 6 wokusombulula ingxaki. Siyibonile ingxaki, kwaye sakhangela isisombululo sisonke. "Ndingenza ntoni njengomzali ukuze ukwazi ukuya esikolweni kwaye uzive ukhuselekile?"

Siye savumelana ukuba ndizothetha notitshala ukuze sizokufumana izisombululo kunye kwaye sisondelelene ngoku.

SourceText: How can problem solving help you and your family?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje singokusombulula ingxaki.

Sonke siyayazi ukuba ebomini akhona amaxesha apho sikhe sijamelane neengxaki, kwaye sonke siyayazi ngandlela ithile xa sithi sizifumane sikwezimeko, kubanzima ukucinga ngezisombululo ezikhawulezileyo nezilungileyo.

Ngenxa yoko, kubalulekile ukuba xa sijamelene neengxaki khesime, siphefumle, sizole kwaye sicinge ngezakhono zokusombulula ingxaki esinokuzisebenzisa. 

Masikhumbule ukubandakanya abantwana bethu abafikisayo xa sisombulula iingxaki.
Oku kuyakubanceda babenoxanduva kwaye bafunde ngokusombulula iingxaki ezizezabo kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText:
As parents, we sometimes think we need to fix every problem by ourselves. And teens can think the same! 

By involving your teen, you strengthen your relationship as well as their confidence. Together you can overcome anything.
text:
Singabazali, ngamanye amaxesha sicinga ukuba kufuneka silungise zonke iingxaki ngokwethu. Kwaye nabantwana abafikisiyo bacinga ngendlela enye!

Ngokubandakanya umntwana wakho ofikisayo, uqinisa ubudlelwane kwakunye nokuzithemba kwabo. Ninonke ningoyisa yonke into.

SourceText: Can problem solving keep your teens safe? It did for @data.characters.media_female_4.name - tap play to hear her story
text: Ingaba ukusombulula iingxaki kungangcina abantwana bakho abafikisayo bekhuselekile? Yenzekile ku@data.characters.media_female_4.name - cofa dlala uzokuva ibali lakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the 6 steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.
text:
Bendingenabo ubudlelwane ubuhle kunye nentombi yam. Bendisoloko ngalo lonke ixesha ndimngxolisa, kwaye 
bengafuni ukuya ukuya esikolweni. 

Kuphela xa ndaqalisa ukuchitha ixesha Lomnye Nomnye kunye naye, ndaye ndaqonda ukuba engafuni nje ukuya esikolweni uyaxhatshazwa esikolweni. Siye sahlala phantsi sasebenzisa amanyathelo ama 6 okusombulula ingxaki. Siyibonile ingxaki, kwaye sakhangela izisombululo kunye:"Yintoni endingayenza njengomzali ukwenzela ukwazi ukuya esikolweni kwaye uzive ukhuselekile?"

Sivumelene ukuba ndizakuya ku titshala ukufumana indlela eya phambili. Siye sazifumana ngokwenene izisombululo kunye,
kwaye sisondelene ngoku..

SourceText:
When you face a problem, take a few deep breaths to help you stay calm. 
Then, try to handle the problem using these four steps!
text:
Xa ujongene nengxaki, tsala umoya kambalwa ukukunceda uhlale uzolile.
Emva koko, zama ukulungisa ingxaki usebenzisa lamanyathelo mane!

SourceText: KNOW IT
text: YAZI

SourceText: Identify the problem.
text: Fumanisa ingxaki.

SourceText: SOLVE IT
text: YISOMBULULE

SourceText: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.
text: Cinga ngezisombululo ezinokubakho nokuthi kungenzeka ntoni ukuba sinokuzisebenzisa.

SourceText: TRY IT
text: SIZAME

SourceText: Choose a solution and try it out.
text: Khetha isisombululo uze usizame.

SourceText: TEST IT
text: SIVAVANYE

SourceText: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.
text: Ngaba sisebenzile? Kulunge kakhulu! Ukuba asikhange sisebenze, khawuzame esinye isisombululo.

SourceText: Let’s see how problem solving works in real life— using this week’s 4 steps: know it, solve it, try it, and test it.
text: Makhe sijonge ukuba ukusombulula ingxaki kusebenza njani kubomi bamanyhani - ukusebenzisa lamanyathelo amane (4) aleveki: yazi, sombulula, zama, kwaye yivavanye.

SourceText: Now tell me, why are you so hungry? Did you not eat your lunch at school?

SourceText: That is the problem. There is a guy at school who bullies me. He says if I do not give my lunch to him every day, he and his friends will hurt me. He makes me so mad!
text: Yingxaki leyo. Kukho omnye umfana pha esikolweni ondintlontayo. Uthi ukuba andimniki isidlo sam sasemini imihla yonke, yena nabahlobo bakhe bazakundilimaza. Uyandiphambanisa!

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that but am glad that you told me, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. It does not mean that you can eat everybody’s dinner. After we speak, you need to go to the shop to buy some more bread. But first, what do you think we should do about the bully problem?

Emva kokuba sithethile, kufuneka uyokuthenga esinye isonka evenkileni. Kodwa kuqala, ucinga ukuba sifanele senze ntoni ngale ngxaki yokuntlontwa?

SourceText: Well… I want to just hit him or get him back.

SourceText: I don’t know. He is bigger than me so he will probably hurt me more. And I could get into trouble at school and get expelled.

SourceText: Yes, that could happen. What could we do instead?

SourceText: I guess I could tell the teacher. But then the other kids will call me a snitch. Maybe you could talk to the teacher?

SourceText:
**Remember, you can use the 4 steps to solve problems:**

💭 Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
📋 Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions) 
⚒️ Step 3: TRY IT (try one) 
🎯 Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)

⚒️ Inyathelo lesithathu: YIZAME (zama enye) 
🎯 Inyathelo lesine: YIVAVANYE (zama esinye isisombululo ukuba le ayisebenzi)

SourceText: I am not trying to accuse your friend or be jealous. I am worried that when someone gives a gift it is hard to say 'no' when they ask something in return – like sex. If you want to have a phone, we will save up together so you can make your own decisions without owing him anything.

SourceText:
This is a great option! 

Parenting teens is really hard. Often there are no simple and easy solutions, but now @data.characters.f1_mother.name learned she can talk to her daughter about these things.

Before, she worried alone, now they can come up with solutions together!
text:
Yindlela elungileyo!

Ukuba ngumzali ebantwaneni abafikisayo kunzima nyhani. Kusoloko kungekho ndlela ilula necacileyo yokusombulula, kodwa ngoku@data.characters.f1_mother.name ufunde ukuba angathetha nentombi yakhe ngezi zinto.

Ngaphambili, ebekhathazeka eyedwa, ngoku banokuza nezisombululo bebobabini!

SourceText: This makes me realise we should talk about boyfriends and protecting yourself. Many teens your age get pregnant or become HIV positive. Let’s go to the clinic so you can talk with the nurse to learn how you can stay safe.
text: Oku kwenza ndiqonde ukuba simele sithethe ngamakhwenkwe nokuzikhusela. Abantwana abasafikisayo abaninzi abalingana nawe bayakhulelwa okanye babe ne- ngculaza (HIV). Masiye ekliniki ukuze uthethe nomongikazi ukuze ubone indlela onokuhlala ngayo ukhuselekile.

SourceText: Okay, thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
text: Kulungile, enkosi, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. 

Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!
text:
Xa kusenzeka into embi, amaxesha amaninzi siye sikhathazeke siphinde sisole. Kodwa okona kufunwa ngabantwana bethu abafikisayo ngumntu onokubanceda bafumane isisombululo bekunye.

Bamamele, wamnkele indlela ababona ngayo nabaziva ngayo izinto, ubabulele ngokuba bekuthemba.

Ukufundisa abantwana bakho abafikisayo ngokuqubisana neengxaki kunganceda ubomi babo bonke. Eso sipho!

SourceText:
**Here are some examples of problems other parents solved with their teens:**

- My teenager does not want to go to school
- I am worried my teenager will get pregnant or will get someone pregnant
- I am worried about what my teen does online
- My teenager is hanging out with bad friends
- My teenager is lazy
- My teenager is not doing their school work
- My teenager might be using drugs
text:
**Nantsi eminye imizekelo yeengxaki ezisonjululwa ngabanye abazali nabantwana babo abafikisayo:**

- Umntwana wam akafuni kuya esikolweni
- Ndinexhala lokuba umntwana wam angakhulelwa okanye akhulelise umntu
- Ndinexhala ngezinto ezenziwa ngumntwana wam ofikisayo kumakhasi onxibelelwano
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo uhlala nabahlobo abangalunganga
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo uyonqena
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo akawenzi umsebenzi wakhe wesikolo
- Umntwana wam ofikisayo kusenokwenzeka usebenzisa iziyobisi

SourceText: Your home activity this week is to teach your teenagers the steps for problem-solving and use them together when a problem comes up.
text: Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kuleveki kukufundisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngendlela zokusombulula ingxaki aphinde azisebenzise zonke xa iingxaki zifika.

SourceText:
**Remember to use the four steps of problem-solving:** 
💭 Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
📋 Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions) 
⚒️ Step 3: TRY IT (try one) 
🎯 Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa amanyathelo amane ukusombulula ingxaki:**
💭 Inyathelo 1: YAZI (chonga ingxaki)
📋 Inyathelo 2: YISOMBULULE (chonga isisombululo)
⚒️ Inyathelo 3: YIZAME (zama enye)
🎯 Inyathelo 4: YIVAVANYE (zama esinye isisombululo ukuba le ayisebenzi)

SourceText: Can you solve one problem together with your teen this week - using the four steps?
text: Ningasombulula ingxaki enye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki - usebenzisa indlela ezine?

SourceText: That's great! Working together with your teen will bring so many good outcomes for you both.
text: Kulungile! Ukusebenzisana nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kungazisa iziphumo ezininzi ezihle kuni nobabini.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You can do it! Try it out with a ‘small’ problem that may come up, so you can see how it works before tackling a bigger challenge.
text: Ungayenza! Yizame ngengxaki 'encinci' enokuvela, uzokwazi ukubona ukuba isebenza njani ngaphambi kokuba uqubisane nengxaki enkulu.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. Just remember that when a situation feels overwhelming, it can really help to use the four steps of problem solving with your teen to break the problem down.
text: Kulungile. Ukhumbule ke xa imeko ibonakala ikongamele, kungakunceda ukusebenzisa indlela ezine zokusombulula ingxaki nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukohlulahlula ingxaki.

SourceText:
We all have problems, but they don’t define us! You can choose to address challenges and try different solutions together with your teen. 
This shows your teen that they are never alone and gives them a key skill to use at home, with friends, and for life!
text:
Sonke sinengxaki, kodwa azichazi ubuthina! Ungakhetha ukuchaza imiceli mingeni uzame izisombululo ezahlukeneyo nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.
Oku kubonisa ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akayedwa kuphinde kubanike isakhono esingundoqo abanokusisebenzisa ekhaya, nezihlobo, nasebomini!

SourceText: Can you make an impact on your community with these skills? Hear @data.characters.media_son_2.name's story
text: Ungenza igalelo ekuhlaleni ngezizakhono? Mamela ibali lika@data.characters.media_son_2.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_son_2.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree “okay let’s try this one.”

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
text:
Xa utata wam wayendixelela ngamanyathelo okusombulula ingxaki, yandinceda nosapho lwam, yaphinda yandinceda nakwizihlobo zam.

Ndizixelele izihlobo zam ngalamanyathelo, ngoku xa siphikisana sihlala phantsi wonke umntu aze nezisombululo. Siye sijonge okuhle nokubi kwisisombululo ngasinye, sivumelane " kulungile masizame esi"

Izihlobo zam ziye lento zayithatha ukuyenza emakhayeni abo, kwaye iyazinceda iintsapho zabo nazo!

Kuhle xa abanye bekumamela kwaye bazamkele izimvo zakho nokuba umncinci. Singayenza imvisiswano nezihlobo kunye nentsapho zethu.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about rules.

Rules help teens understand what is expected of them.

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nemithetho.

Imithetho inceda abantwana abafikisayo baqonde oko kulindelekileyo kubo. 

Abantwana abafikisayo bavamisa ngakumbi ekulandeleni imithetho xa imithetho niyenza KUNYE nomntwana wakho ofikisayo uze umncome ngalonto!

SourceText: Should rules be important for you and your family? Click play to find out
text: Ingaba kufanele ibaluleke imithetho kuwe nakusapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is rules.

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members.

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules.

A household with family rules lives in peace.
text:
Molweni, kuni nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje yimithetho.

Imithetho ikhuthaza uxolo ekhayeni ize ikhuthaze ukuqondana phakathi kwamalungu osapho.

Imithetho ikhuthaza uxanduva kwilungu ngalinye losapho, ngoko, kubalulekile ukuba nemithetho yosapho.

Ikhaya elinemithetho yosapho liphila ngoxolo.

SourceText: When we make rules together, it shows our teens that rules are there to keep everyone safe and respected - not just to control them. Setting rules as a family helps build trust and responsibility for both teens and parents.
text: Xa sisenza imithetho kunye, lonto ibonisa abantwana bethu abafikisayo ukuba imithetho ikhona ukuze igcine wonke umntu ekhuselekile kwaye ehloniphekile hayi nje ukubakhusela, Ukubeka imithetho silikhaya inceda ekwakheni ukuthembana kwaye noxanduva kubobonke abantwana abafikisayo nabazali.

SourceText: Rules worked for @data.characters.media_female_7.name and her teens. Tap play to hear more
text: Imithetho imsebenzele u@data.characters.media_female_7.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo. Cofa udlala ukuva ngakumbi
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
My teenagers always just disappeared. I did not know where they were and I would get so worried and angry with them. I used to say, “This is my house, and these are my rules, if you do not want to follow them you can leave and stay in your own place.”

When we learnt in @global.app_name about rules, I learnt that there are rules for teens and for adults and for everyone. If we follow the rules as parents, our teens will follow our example.

I explained my worry and we all agreed: We all follow the rule and say where we are going when we leave the house. Coming up with rules together helped us a lot, as my teens do not see me anymore as that annoying parent that just makes up unnecessary rules.
text:
Abantwana bam abafikisayo basoloko benyamalala. Ndiye ndingabazi apho bakhoyo kwaye ndiyakhathazeka kakhulu kwaye ndibanimsindo ngakubo. Bendiqhele ukuthi, Yindlu yam lena, kwaye yimithetho yam, ukuba awufuni kuyilandela ungahamba uyokuzihlalela kweyakho indawo.

Xana besifunde ku @global.app_name malunga nemithetho, Ndifunde into yokuba kunemithetho yabantwana abafikisayo kunye neyabantu abadala kunye neyomntu wonke. Ukuba silandela imithetho singabazali, abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazakulandela umzekelo wethu.

Ndikucacisile ukuxhalaba kwam kubo kwaye sivumelene: Sonke silandela umthetho kwaye siyatsho ukuba siyaphi xana simnka endlini. Ukuza nemithetho sisonke kuncede kakhulu, njengabantwana bam abafikisayo abandiboni njengamzali odikayo kwakhona owenza nje imithetho engenamsebenzi.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Yes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?

SourceText: Here are this week’s takeaway skills to help learn how to set rules with your teen!
text: Nazi izakhono onokuzithatha kuleveki ukukunceda ufunde ukuba ungayibeka njani imithetho kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: TEAM RULES
text: IMITHETHO YEQELA

SourceText: Household rules help to keep our teenagers safe and to understand what is expected from them. When you involve a teenager in making rules they are more likely to follow them.
text: Imithetho yekhaya inceda ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile kwaye baqonde ukuba yintoni elindelekileyo kubo. Xa umbandakanya umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekwenzeni imithetho banokuzimisela ngakumbi ekuyilandeleni.

SourceText: REAL RULES
text: IMITHETHO YOKWENENE

SourceText: Plan rules WITH your teenager. Start with one new rule first – you can add another one later. Discuss the reasons for the rule and listen to their views.
text: Cwangcisa KUNYE nomntwana wakho ofikisayo imithetho. Qala ngomthetho omnye omtsha - ungongezelela omnye mva. Xoxani ngezizathu zalemithetho kwaye umamele izimvo zabo.

SourceText: PRAISE RULES!
text: IMIGAQO YOKUNCOMA!

SourceText: Praise your teen for planning a rule with you, and praise them for keeping it!
text: Mncome umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngokucwangcisa umthetho kunye nawe, uze ubancome ngokuwugcina!

SourceText: Rules are important to keep your teens safe – not only offline, but also online. There’s more about this in the lesson on teen safety, but let’s already have a first look now!
text: Imithetho ibalulekile ukugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile - hayi kuphela ngaphandle kwe intanethi, kodwa nakwi-intanethi. Kukho okungakumbi ngalento kwisifundo malunga nokhuseleko lomntwana wakho ofikisayo, kodwa masiqalise sijonge ngoku!

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, have you done your homework?

SourceText: Just a minute @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name, I’m finishing this Tiktok video.

SourceText: You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like Tiktok.
text: Ungumdanisi obalaseleyo ngokwenene! Ndixelele isizathu sokuba uthande uTiktok.

SourceText: All my friends are on it, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers.
text: Bonke abahlobo bam bakuye, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. Ndinenani elingapha ko 600 labathandi kunye no 120 yabalandeli.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
I’m proud of how well you dance, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name. But we need to make sure you are safe.

I know your friends look at Tiktok, but with an open account, there are other people who look at videos of teenagers for their own sexual needs. Sometimes they contact teenagers. They pretend to be nice but end up threatening and abusing teens.
text:
Ndiyazingca ngendlela entle odanisa ngayo, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name. Kodwa kufuneka siqiniseke ukuba ukhuselekile.

Ndiyayazi abahlobo bakho bayamjonga uTiktok, kodwa nge akhawunti evuliweyo, kukho abantu abajonga imiboniso yabantwana abafikisayo ngeemfuno zesondo zabo. Ngamanye amaxesha baqhagamshelana nabantwana abafikisayo. Bazenza ngathi balungile kodwa ekugqibeleni baphela beboyikisa kwaye bebahlukumeza.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
Let’s look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. 

Look – you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know from school and our community, but not people you don't know.

Can we make a rule together that you can use Tiktok, but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!
text:
Makhe sijonge kunye kwi-intanethi ukuze sibone ukuba singaqhubeka njani siqiniseka ukuba wonwabile kodwa ukwakhuselekile. Khangela – ungenza i-akhawunti yakho ibe yimfihlo uze ulawule abantu abakulandelayo.

Ungamkela abantu obaziyo esikolweni nakwindawo esihlala kuyo, kodwa hayi abantu ongabaziyo.

Ingaba singawenza kunye umthetho onokuwusebenzisa kuTiktok, kodwa kwi-akhawunti yabucala? Ndiyathemba uyazi ukuba ngubani omawumamkele!

SourceText: I’m proud of you, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name!
text: Ndiyazingca ngawe, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name! should not be translated.

SourceText:
It was wonderful to see @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughter, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, make a rule together. 

Now let's practise making rules.

Write down one important rule you would like to make with your teenager – you will be doing this as your home practice this week.
text:
Bekukuhle ukubona u@data.characters.f1_mother.name kunye nentombi yakhe, u@data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, besenza imithetho kunye.

Ngoku masiziqhelanise ngokwenza imithetho.

Bhala phantsi umthetho obalulekileyo ubemnye ongathanda ukuwenza nomntwana wakho ofikisayo - uzakuyenza lento njengomsebenzi wokuziqhelanisa ekhaya kuleveki.

SourceText:
**Here are some examples of rules other families made:**
- ⚽ Teen can play outside after finishing homework
- 👪🏽 All family members eat dinner together
- 🍽️ Teen 1 does dishes on Sunday and Monday, Teen 2 on Tuesday and Wednesday
- 💜 We speak to each other politely and nicely
- 🎶 When listening to music you need to use earphones
text:
**Nantsi eminye yemizekelo yemithetho eyenziwe zezinye iintsapho:**
- ⚽ Abantwana abafikisayo bangadlala phandle emva kokugqiba ukwenza umsebenzi wesikolo
- 👪🏽 Onke amalungu osapho adla kunye isidlo sangokuhlwa 
- 🍽️ Umntwana 1 ofikisayo uhlamba izitya ngeCawa nangoMvulo, Umntwana 2 ofikisayo uzihlamba ngoLwesibini nangoLwesithathu
- 💜 Sithetha ngesimilo nakakuhle
- 🎶 Xa umamele umculo kumele usebenzise i-earphones

SourceText:
This week's home activity is to set one rule together with your teen.

Remember to praise your teen afterwards!
text:
Owaleveki umsebenzi, kukwenza umthetho ube mnye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

Khumbula ukumncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo emva koko!

SourceText:
**Remember to use your skills for rule setting:**

⚽ Team rules: When making the rule, work together like a team. 
🔎 Real rules: Agree on real rules that are clear and fair. For example, you could agree that everyone says where they are going before leaving the house.
🎉 Praise rules: Praise when rules are followed!
text:
**Khumbula ukusebenzisa izakhono zokuseka imithetho:**

⚽ Imithetho yeqela: Xa nisenza umthetho, sebenzani njengeqela.
🔎 Imithetho eyiyo: Vumelanani kwimithetho eyiyo ecacileyo kwaye elungileyo. Umzekelo, ningavumelana ekubeni wonke umntu atsho ukuba uyaphi phambi kokuba ahambe endlini.
🎉 Imithetho yokuncoma: Ncoma xa imithetho ilandelwe!

SourceText: Can you set one rule together with your teen this week?
text: Ungakwazi ukumisela umthetho ubemnye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Fantastic! Setting a rule together helps your teen feel involved and respected. It is a big step toward building trust and cooperation.
text: Kwakuhle! Ukumisela umthetho kunye kumnceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azive ebandakanyekile kwaye ehloniphekile. Lelona nyathelo elikhulu ekwakheni ukuthembana nokusebenzisana.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: You can do it! Even beginning the conversation shows your teen that their voice matters. Take it one step at a time.
text: Ungayenza! Kwaye nokuqala incoko ibonisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ilizwi lakhe libalulekile. Thatha inyathelo libelinye ngexesha.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: That's okay. It can take time to agree on new rules. You could start by asking your teen what they think is important - small talks can lead to big changes.
text: Kulungile. Ingathatha ixesha ukuvumelana ngemithetho emitsha. Ungaqala ngokubuza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ucinga yintoni ebalulekileyo - intetho ezincinci zingakhokhelela kutshintsho olukhulu.

SourceText: Clear, simple rules made together with your teen are not about control - they are about keeping them safe and building responsibility. When teens understand the reasons behind the rules, they are more likely to follow them.
text: Imithetho ecacileyo nelula eniyenze kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ayikho ngokulawula - ingokubagcina bekhuselekile kunye nokwakha uxanduva. Xa abantwana abafikisayo beziqonda izizathu ezingaphaya kwemithetho, bangakwazi ukuyilandela kakuhle.

SourceText: Can teens value rules too? Hear @data.characters.media_daughter_5.name's story
text: Ingaba abantwana abafikisayo bangayixabisa imithetho nabo? Mamela ibali lika @data.characters.media_daughter_5.name
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_5.name's should not be translated.

SourceText:
I never liked rules and I used to forget rules a lot.

One day, I was playing with my friends. The rule at home was that we should be in the yard by 6pm, but I forgot again. By 6:30 it was getting dark and I was still outside and playing with my phone. Then a boy came, grabbed my phone and ran away.

I understood that rules can really help to keep us safe, so I changed my behaviour and I was in the yard by 5pm from then.
text:
Andizange ndiyithande imithetho kwaye bendisoloko ndiyilibala kakhulu.

Ngenye imini, Bendidlala kunye nabahlobo bam. Umthetho ekhaya yayikukuba kufuneka sibesengaphakathi ngo 6pm, kodwa ndalibala kwakhona. Nge 6:30 bekusele kumnyama kwaye bendisengaphandle kwaye ndidlala nge fowuni yam. Ngoko umfana weza, waxutha ifowuni yam waye wabaleka.

Ndayiqonda ukuba imithetho ingalunceda ngokwenene ukusigcina sikhuselekile, ngoko ndatshintsha isimilo sam kwaye ndabangaphakathi ngentsimbi yesi 5pm ukusukela ngoko.

SourceText:
Today’s topic is about creating rules and routines with our children.

When rules are part of a routine, they’re easier to follow. They help children understand what’s expected, take responsibility, and stay safe – all while making the home more calm and peaceful. And that’s something we all want, right?
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokwenza imithetho kunye nesiqhelo nabantwana bethu.

Xa imithetho iyinxalenye yesiqhelo, kulula ukuyilandela. Zinceda abantwana baqonde okulindelekileyo, bathathe uxanduva, kwaye bahlale bekhuselekile - konke oku sikwenzela ikhaya elizolileyo kwaye nelinoxolo ngakumbi. Kwaye yinto esiyifuna sonke, andithi?

SourceText: Tap play to learn how rules and routines can help you and your family
text: Cofa udlala ufunde uba imithetho nesiqhelo zingakunceda njani wena nosapho lwakho

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Do you have moments in the day with your child that feel stressful? Is it bedtime or getting ready for school?

Rules can help! Having clear rules and routines actually helps children know what is expected of them, which helps reduce the struggles of the more stressful moments in the day.
text:
Molweni nonke

Ingaba ninawo amaxesha ngosuku nomntwana wakho apho niziva ninoxinzelelo? Ingaba lixesha lokudlala okanye elokulungiselela isikolo? 

Imithetho inganceda! Ukuba nemithetho ecacileyo kunye nenkqubo zesiqhelo kuye kuncede abantwana bayazi okulindelekileyo kubo, yinto leyo enceda
ukunciphisa ubunzima ngexesha loxinzelelo olungamandla ngosuku.

SourceText:
Children are more likely to follow rules if you create them together. 

Let’s look at an example. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name watches too much TV before finishing her homework. @data.characters.f1_mother.name helps her set a family rule:
text:
Abantwana banokuyilandela imithetho xa niyenza kunye.

Masijonge umzekelo. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name ubukela iTV kakhulu phambi kokuba agqibe umsebenzi wasekhaya. @data.characters.f1_mother.name umnceda abeke imithetho yosapho:

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, it is important that you get your homework done so you can do well in school. Let’s make a rule about watching TV so that you have enough time for homework, too.
text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, kubalulekile ukuba wenze umsebenzi wakho wesikolo ukwenzela uzokwenza kakuhle esikolweni. Masenze umthetho ngokubukela iTV ukwenzela ukuba ubenexesha elaneleyo lokwenza umsebenzi wesikolo, nawo.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Okay, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
text: Kulungile, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: What do you think would be a fair rule?
text: Ucinga ukuba umthetho olungileyo ingangowuphi?

SourceText: Hmmm… Maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework?
text: Hmmm... Mhlawumbi ndingayibukela iTV kangakoko ndifuna, kodwa kuphela emva kokuba ndenze umsebenzi wam wasekhaya?

SourceText: I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 30 minutes per day so that you have time for other fun and relaxing things too. How does that sound?
text: Ndiyawuthanda lo mbono, kodwa masilicuthe libe yimizuzu eyi 30 ngosuku ngalunye ukwenzela ubenalo nelinye ixesha lokwenza ezinye izinto ezonwabisayo neziphumlisayo. Ivakala njani lonto?

SourceText: That’s okay.
text: Ilungile lonto.

SourceText:
Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. 
Last night, you mentioned that your math tests have become easier for you. I am proud of you! We can increase your TV time to 45 minutes each day… as long as you still do your homework first.
text: Enkosi ngokwenza umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya phambi kokuba ubukele iTV, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. Ebusuku izolo, ukhankanye into yokuba uvavanyo lwezibalo luya lubalula kuwe. Ndiyazidla ngawe! Singalinyusa ixesha lakho lokubukela iTV ngemizuzu eyi 45 suku ngalunye... uba nje usaqala ngomsebenzi wakho wasekhaya.

SourceText:
Creating daily routines (like rules around meals, school and bedtime) can help your child feel safe, secure, and calm.

Let’s look at @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. They have set up a routine around bedtime that is working really well!
text:
Ukwenza isiqhelo semihla ngemihla ( njenge mithetho malunga nokutya, isikolo kunye namaxesha okulala) inganceda umntana wakho azive ekhuselekile, eqinisekile kwaye ezolile.

Masijonge u @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name kunye nomzukulwana wakhe, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Bamisele isiqhelo malunga namaxesha okulala asebenza kakuhle kakhulu!

SourceText: Time to get ready for bed, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.

SourceText: You were so well-behaved in the bath, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.

SourceText: Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!

SourceText: You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have time to read a story. Which book would you like to read?
text: Wenze kakuhle ukulungiselela ukulala! Ngoku, sinexesha lokufunda ibali. Yeyiphi incwadi onokuthatha ukuyifunda?

SourceText: Yay! Can you read me the story about the lion?
text: Yay! Ungandifundela ibali ngengonyama?

SourceText: “The end…” I’m glad you chose that story for us to read, it’s one of my favourites! Goodnight, my dear. I love you very much.
text: "Isiphelo...'' Ndiyavuya ukuba ukhethe elabali ukuba silifunde, lelinye lendiwathandayo! Ubusuku obuhle, sithandwa sam. Ndiyakuthanda kakhulu.

SourceText: Every day
text: Ngazo zonke intsku

SourceText:
Exactly. Being consistent with a routine – especially at the end of the day when everyone is tired – makes activities easier to follow for children. 

With a bit of practice, bedtime can become a happy time of connecting with your child!
text:
Kunjalo. Ukungaguquguquki nesiqhelo - ngakumbi ekupheleni kosuku xa wonke umntu ediniwe - kwenza kubelula ebantwaneni ukulandela imisebenzi!

Ngokuzama kancinci, ixesha lokulala lingaba lixesha elonwabisayo lokunxulumana nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: These four tips will help you create rules and routines to bring more structure and peace in your home.
text: Ezi ngcebiso zine zizakunceda ukwenza imithetho kunye nesiqhelo kuzakuzisa ubume obungaphezulu kunye noxolo ekhayeni lakho.

SourceText: BE A TEAM
text: YIBANI LIQELA

SourceText: When you involve your child in making rules they are more likely to follow them.
text: Ukuba ubandakanya umntana wakho ekwenzeni imithetho, banokuyilandela nangakumbi.

SourceText:
Plan rules WITH your child. Discuss the reasons for the rule and ask about their ideas.

Older children can share their own ideas of what they think the rule should be and you can agree together. They will feel appreciated and heard.
text:
Cwangcisa imithetho KUNYE nomtwana wakho. Xoxani izizathu zemithetho kwaye ubuze nangengceebiso zakhe.

Abantwana abadala bangabelana ngeengcebiso zabo ukuba bacinga umthetho ungathini kwaye ningavumelana kunye. Bazakuziva bexatyisiwe kwaye bemanyelwa.

SourceText: BE REALISTIC
text: NYANISEKA

SourceText:
Consider your child’s age and developmental level when creating rules and routines. They have to be able to do what is expected of them.

Remember: Only introduce one new rule or routine at a time – you can add another one later.
text:
Cingela iminyaka yomntwana wakho kunye nenqanaba lokukhula kwakhe xa usenza imithetho kunye nesiqhelo. Funeka bakwazi ukwenza into elindelekileyo kubo.

Khumbula: Yazisa umthetho omtsha ubemnye kuphela okanye isiqhelo ngexesha - ungongeza omnye emva koko.

SourceText:
Start with small and clear rules your child can follow. If a rule feels too hard, work together to break it into smaller steps.

Make rules realistic for what your child can do. Be specific – instead of “clean up,” say “put your blocks away.”
text:
Qala ngemithetho emincinci ecacileyo umntana wakho anokuyilandela. Xa umthetho uvakala unzima, sebenzani kunye niwucalule ubengamanyathelo amancinci.

Yenza imithetho yokwenyani enokwenziwa ngumntana wakho. Mngqale - endaweni ka "coca" ithi "zisuse izitena zakho."

SourceText: BE CONSISTENT
text: UKUNGAGUQUKUQUKI

SourceText:
Make sure your child follows the rules and routines daily.

That way, your child knows what to expect and this will help them to feel secure. They will learn to be more independent and responsible.
text:
Qinisekisa ukuba umntwana wakho ulandela umthetho kunye nesiqhelo yonke imihla.

Ngalo ndlela, umntwana wakho uzakuyazi ukuba yintoni amakayilindele kwaye lento izakumnceda azive ekhuselekile. Uzakufunda ukuzimela ngakumbi kwaye abenoxanduva.

SourceText: More tips
text: Ezinye ingcebiso

SourceText: Activities become easier when children learn and get comfortable with the routine.
text: Imisebenzi iye ibelula ukuyilawula xana abantwana befunda kwaye beqhelene nenkqubo yemihla ngemihla.

SourceText: Now that you learned a few tips, let’s come up with ideas for rules and routines in your home.
text: Ngoku njengokuba ufunde ingcebiso ezimbalwa, masize nemibono yemithetho kunye nesiqhelo ekhayeni lakho.

SourceText: Would you like to try one of these rules with your child?
text: Ungathanda ukuzama eminye yalemithetho nomntwana wakho?

SourceText: Your child can play after finishing homework
text: Umntwana wakho angadlala emveni kokuba egqibile ukwenza umsebenzi wesikolo

SourceText: All family members eat dinner together
text: Bonke abantu bosapho batya isidlo sasebusuku kunye

SourceText: Your child helps to clear the dishes after dinner
text: Umntwana wakho uncedisa ukususa izitya emva kwesidlo sasebusuku

SourceText: Your child packs away their toys before bedtime
text: Umntwana wakho upakisha izinto zakhe zokudlala ngaphambili kokulala

SourceText: This is a great rule! Discuss it with your child and family, or come up with a different rule that will help you at home.
text: Lo ngumthetho olungileyo! Xoxa nomntwana wakho kunye nosapho lwakho okanye uze nenye eyahlukileyo eya kukuncenda ekhaya.

SourceText: In which of these areas would you like to create routines with your child?
text: Yeyiphi kwezindawo ongathanda ukwenza umzila nomntwana wakho?

text: Umabonakude okanye ixesha lemfonomfono

SourceText: Wonderful! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child.

SourceText:
Your home activity is to set *one* rule and *one* routine with your child this week. 

Remember to be realistic and consistent, and praise your child for following each rule or routine!
text:
Umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya kukubeka umthetho *omnye* kunye *nenye* inkqubo nomntwana wakho kule veki.

Khumbula ukuba nenyani kwaye ungaguquguquku, umncome umntwana wakho ngokulandela umthetho okanye inkqubo nganye!

SourceText: Routines helped @data.characters.media_female_7.name and her family. Tap play to hear their story
text: Iinkqubo zanceda u@data.characters.media_female_7.name kunye nosapho lwakhe. Cofa dlala ukuze uve ibali labo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Bedtime was always a struggle in our house. My children wanted to keep watching TV and I would always end up shouting at them: “Go to bed now! You know you have to be ready for school early in the morning!”. Some days I was just too tired, and I would let them watch more TV. 

When we learned in @global.app_name about rules, I learned that it is important to be consistent. I discussed with my children why watching TV till late is a problem, and we came up with a rule together to switch off the TV at 8 and be ready for bed by 8.30. Now everyone knows what is expected of them, and we can end the day peacefully.
text:
Ixesha lokulala lalisoloko linzima endlwini yethu. Abantwana
bam babefuna ukuzigcina bebukele umabonakude kwaye. Ndandiphela ndibangxolisa oko: "Hamba uyolala ngoku! Uyayazi ukuba kufuneka ulungele ukuya esikolweni kwangethuba kusasa!". Ngezinye iintsuku ndiye ndidinwe kakhulu, kwaye bendibavumela babukele u mabonakude ngakumbi.

X besifunda kwi @global.app_name malunga nemithetho, Ndifundile ukuba kubalulekile ukungaguquguquki. Ndixoxile kunye nabantwana bam kukuba kutheni ukubukela umabonakude. kude kude kudlule ixesha kuyingxaki, kwaye siye saza nomthetho kunye wokucima mabonakude ngentsimbi yesi 8 kwaye silungele ukuyolala ngentsimbi 8.30. Ngoku wonke umntu uyayazi okulindelekileyo kubo, kwaye singakwazi ukuligqiba usuku ngoxolo.

text: Ewe

SourceText: That's great! I hope it makes your home feel easier to manage for everyone.
text: Kulungile! Ndiyathemba ukuba yenza uve ikhaya lakho kulula ukuphatha wonke umntu.

SourceText: You can do it! Setting rules and routines is hard in the beginning, but it becomes easier when you find a way that works for you.

SourceText: No
