SourceText:
Helping your teen learn to notice danger, speak up, and protect themselves builds real confidence.

Practising together makes it more likely they will act when something feels wrong.
text:
Unkuncedisa umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba afunde ukuqwalasela ingozi, ukuthetha phandle, nokuzikhusela kwakha ukuzithemba kwenene.

Ukwenza kunye kwenza kube lula ukuba bathathe amanyathelo xa kukho into evakala ingalunganga.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name used her voice to stay safe
text: Yiva indlela u @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name asebenzise ngayo ilizwi lakhe ukuhlala ekhuselekile
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_9.name should not be translated.

SourceText: It helped me a lot that I learnt I can use my voice to stay safe. A while ago, I was walking home alone and some man began to follow me and I felt scared. My father taught me that the most important thing is to be safe, so I turned around and said loud and clear ‘Why are you following me, I don’t want that’. It really surprised the man and even some other people looked at us, so the man walked away. I felt so relieved and even told my father. He said I did well and I felt really good. Before, I would have been too scared, also what other people think, but now I feel confident.
text: Indincedile kakhulu into yokuba ndifunde ukusebenzisa ilizwi lam ukuhlala ndikhuselekile. Kudalana, ndandisendleleni egodukayo ndedwa kwaye kwabakho umntu oyindoda ondilandelayo ndaziva ndisoyika. Utata wam wandixelela ukuba eyonanto ibalulekileyo kukukhuseleka, ndaye ndakuquka ndatsho ngokukhwaza nangokucacileyo ' undilandelela ntoni, andiyifuni lonto'. Yayothusa le ndoda lento kwaye nabanye abantu bajonga kuthi, lendoda yahambela kude. Ndaziva ndikhululekile kwaye ndaxelela utata wam. Wathi ndenze kakuhle kwaye ndaziva kamnandi. Ngaphambili, bendisoyika kakhulu kwaye ndicinga ukuba bazakuthini abanye abantu, kodwa ngoku ndiziva ndizithemba.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about managing stress.

We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you – and your family.
text:
Isihloko sanamhlanje simalunga nokulawula uxinzelelo.

Siyayazi kunzima kangakanani na ukukhulisa abantwana abafikisayo kula amaxesha. Ukufunda ukulawula uxinzelelo lwakho kunceda wena - kunye nosapho lwakho.

SourceText: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out
text: Ingaba ukulawula uxinzelelo kungakunceda wena nosapho lwakho? Cofa udlala ukufumanisa

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.
text:
Molweni, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamhlanje kukulawula uxinzelelo. 

Kubalulekile ukwazi indlela yokulawula uxinzelelo lwethu. Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana bethu bangaziphatha ngeendlela ezinokusenza sizive sinoxinzelelo yaye nathi bazali sinokwenza abantwana bethu bazive benonxinzelelo nabo. 

Ngoko, kubalulekile ukuqaphela xa siziva sinoxinzelelo kwaye sime siphefumle. Loo nto iya kunceda ulawule uxinzelelo.

SourceText:
With a few small changes, you can feel more peaceful in your normal day-to-day life.

When you are peaceful, your family members will get calmer too!
text:
Kutshintsho oluncinci, ungaziva unoxolo ngakumbi kubomi bakho besiqhelo bemihla ngemihla.

Xa unoxolo, nosapho lwakho luyazola!

SourceText: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens
text: Yima, phefumla. Ngoku mamela ukuba ukuma ithutyana kunceda njani u@data.characters.media_female_4.name kunye nabantwana bakhe abafikisayo
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!
text:
Ubomi bunzima ngamanye amaxesha. Phambi kokuba ndizibandakanye kwi @global.app_name, bendihlala ndinengcwangu ngalo lonke ixesha. Bendikhuphela umsindo wam kumntu wonke osekhayeni, ibingengobantwana bam bodwa kodwa nomyeni wam. Babebalekela kude xa ndifika ekhayeni kuba babeyazi ndizakubangxolisa.

Ukufunda ukuma kwaye ndiphefumle bekunzima ekuqaleni. Kodwa ngalo lonke ixesha ndizama, yandinceda ndehlisa umoya. Ngoku abantwana bam abasabalekeli kude xa ndifika ekhayeni kwaye bamamela ngcono kunangexesha bendithethela phezulu nabo!
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

text: Makhe sijonge indlela uxinezeleko olunokuthi maxa wambi lube ngaphaya kwamandla, kuthi sonke:

SourceText:
Now let's look at an example where something simple, like a Safety Word, can help manage stress and keep your teen safe. 

First, think back to when you were a teenager. Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! Let’s have a look:
text:
Ngoku masijonge kumzekelo apho kukho into elula, njengeGama eliKhuselekileyo, linganceda ukulawula uxinzelelo kwaye ligcine umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile. 

Kuqala, cinga emva ngexesha apho wawusengumntwana ofikisayo. Lalikhe lakhona ixesha apho wawusengozini kodwa wawungakwazi ukuxelela usapho lwakho kuba babezakuba nomsindo?

Lento YAPHANTSE ukwenzeka ku@data.characters.f1_son_18.name kunye no@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name! makhe sijonge:

SourceText: Don’t tell the adults, but I am going to a bar with my friends tonight.
text: Ungabaxeleli abantu abadala, kodwa ndiya emzini othengisa utywala nabahlobo bam ebusuku.

SourceText: Have fun! I told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.
text: Yonwaba! Ndibaxelele ukuba ndihlala nentombi yam endithandana nayo, kodwa apho ndiya khona ndiya epatini.

SourceText: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can’t tell my parents – they will be so angry!
text: Ndicinga ukuba basebenzisa iziyobisi. Singabanjwa sonke. Kodwa andinakubaxelela abazali bam – baya kuba nomsindo kakhulu!

SourceText: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I can’t tell my parents – I lied about coming to this party.
text: Ndiyoyika. Wonke umntu unxile kakhulu ukuba angandigodusa. Lo mfana uthi angandigodusa, kodwa ufuna siqale kwakhe. Andinakubaxelela abazali bam - ndibaxokisile ngokuza kule pati.

SourceText: These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name then remembered what their father told them:
text: Ezi zimeko ezinobungozi! Kungumbulelo, u@data.characters.f1_son_18.name kunye no@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name baye bakhumbula into utata wabo ewayebaxelele yona:

SourceText:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‘Aunty Cecilia’ as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry – even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.
text:
Ndiyakhathala ngokhuseleko lwakho ngaphezu kwayo nayiphi into. Ukuba uye wakhathazeka, okanye usoyika, ungandifowunela rhoqo malunga noncedo, okanye undixelele ngalonto. 

Singasebenzisa umfanekiso ongengowenyani ka 'kaAunty Cecilia' njengeGama loKhuseleko? Itsho nje into malunga noAunt Cecilia, Ndiyathembisa into yokuba ndizakuzama kangangoko ndinako ukunceda kwaye andizukhathazeka -- noba wenza into ongamelanga ukuba uyayenza.

SourceText: Hey @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?
text: Hey @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, unjani uAunty Cecilia ngoku?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: *(on the other side of the phone)* Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?
text: *(Kwelinye icala le phone)* Akukho nto intle. Sidinga wena ekhaya. Ndizazokulanda njengangoku. Uphi?

SourceText: (🤔_thinking_) I think my friends are in trouble. I don’t want to stop being their friend, but I’m worried. Maybe @data.characters.f1_father.role_name knows what to do.
text: (🤔_ecinga_) Ndicinga abahlobo bam basengxakini. Andifuni ukuyeka ukuba ngumhlobo wabo, kodwa ndikhathazekile. Mhlawumbi u@data.characters.f1_father.role_name uyayazi into amakayenze.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, I just remembered, Aunty Cecilia said she will come visit tomorrow.
text: @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, Ndiye ndakhumbula, Aunty Cecilia uthe uzakuza azokusindwendwela ngomso.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.role_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: *(on the other side of the phone)* Okay, I need you at home to help get things ready. I will come pick you up now. Where are you?
text: *(kwelinye icala le fowuni)* Kulungile, Ndiyakudinga ekhayeni uzokunceda ukulungisa izinto. Ndizazokulanda ngoku. Uphi?

SourceText:
Having a Safety Word can help your teen stay safe too. You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‘help’.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.
text:
Ukuba neGama loKhuseleko kunganceda umntana wakho ofikisayo ahlale ekhuselekile naye. Ungakhetha naliphi igama njengeGama loKhuseleko. Lusapho lwakho kuphela oluyaziyo ukuba kuthetha 'uncedo'. 

Umntana wakho ofikisayo angalibiza eligama ukwazisa ukuba basengxakini ngaphandle kokuba nomsindo okanye ubohlwaye, ngoko ungakwazi ukubanceda.

SourceText:
**What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:**

🥑 A specific food
👵🏽 A specific family member
🐒 A specific animal
🤔 Something else
text:
**Leliphi iGama loKhuseleko ongalilikhetha kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo? Nazi ezinye iimbono ezisuka kwezinye intsapho.**

🥑 Ukutya okuthile
👵🏽 Ilungu losapho oluthile 
🐒 Isilwanyana esithile
🤔 Into engenye

SourceText: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!
text: Nazi izakhono ezimbalwa ongazisebenzisa ukunceda wena ukwazi ukumelana nonxinzelelo ongazisebenzisa kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!

SourceText: BREATHE
text: PHEFUMLA

SourceText:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
text:
Phefumla ngokucothayo. Yima.

Ngaphambi kokuba uthethe nantoni na, ngokucothayo phefumla uphinde uwukhuphe izihlandlo ezintlanu. Loo nto iya kukwenza uzole, kwaye ikunike ithuba lokucinga.

SourceText: SHARE
text: YABELANANI

SourceText:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
text:
Yabelana ngendlela oziva ngayo.

Lento inzima. Uninzi lwethu lwaxelelwa ukuba lungakhali, okanye lubonise abantwana indlela esiva ngayo. Kodwa ungaphefumla nzulu ngokuzolileyo kwaye ubaxelele indlela oziva ngayo. Baya kuqonda ngcono, kwaye bafunde kuwe indlela yokuhlangabezana kunye noxinzelelo.

SourceText: SHOW
text: BONISA

SourceText:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
text:
Babonise uyakhathala

Nale inzima! Uxinzelelo lwenza ukuba sinike ingqalelo kwiziqu zethu. Kodwa abantwana bethu abafikisayo bayayidinga inkxaso yethu. Babuze indlela abaziva ngayo. Mamela kubo kwaye ubathuthuzele. Zama ubanga okanye uthi ‘Ndiyaqonda’. Ingatshintsha yonke into.

SourceText: SEEK
text: FUNA

SourceText:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?
text:
Funa okulungileyo.

Ungakwazi wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ukucinga ngezinto ezinokuba luncedo? Ningakwazi ukwenza into elungileyo nobabini ukususa iingqondo zenu kuxinzelelo?

SourceText:
There are two home activities for this week:

1) Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset with your teen, take five breaths in and out before you react.
And when you're both calm, share with each other how you feel. 

2) Choose a "Safety Word" with your teen, and think of a situation together when you could use this.
text:
Kunemisebenzi emibini yasekhaya kule veki:

1) Naninina uziva unoxinzelelo okanye ucatshukiswe ngumntwana wakho osafikisayo, phefumla kahlanu ngaphakathi nangaphandle phambi kokuba uphendule.
Kwaye xa nobabini nizolile, yabelanani kunye ngendlela eniziva ngayo. 

2) Khetha i "Gama loKhuseleko" kunye nomtana wakho ofikisayo, kwaye nicinge ngesimo kunye apho ninokwazi usebenzisa lento.

SourceText:
**Remember to:** 

😮‍💨 BREATHE: take five breaths in and out before you react
🤝🏾 SHARE: when you're both calm, share with your teen how you feel
💙 SHOW: ask them how they feel to show you care
🔍 SEEK: find something positive in this situation together
text:
**Khumbula uku:**

😮‍💨 PHEFUMLA: phefumla kahlanu ngaphakathi nangaphandle phambi kokuba uphendule
🤝🏾 YABELANA: xa nobabini nizolile, yabelanani wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngohlobo oziva ngalo
💙 BONISA: babuze ukuba baziva njani ukubonisa ukuba uyakhathala
🔍 FUNA: fumanani into elungileyo kwesisimo kunye

SourceText: Can you respond calmly and choose a “Safety Word” with your teen this week?
text: Ungakwazi uphendula ngokuzolileyo kwaye ukhethe "Igama loKhuseleko" kunye nomntana wakho ofikisayo kuleveki?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ewe

SourceText: Great! Staying calm and having a “Safety Word” will help you and your family.
text: Kulungile! Ukuhlala uzolile kwaye "uneGama loKhuseleko" izakunceda wena kunye nosapho lwakho.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ndicinga njalo

SourceText: That’s a good start. When you are stressed, remember to take a few deep breaths, it will make it easier to respond calmly.
text: Eso sisiqalo esilungileyo. Xa unoxinzelelo, khumbula ukuphefumla kancinci, Lonto izakwenza kubelula ukuphendula ngokuzolileyo.

SourceText: No
text: Hayi

SourceText: I understand, sometimes we just don’t have capacity. Try to keep spending time with your teen - whenever you are ready you can practise responding calmly and find a Safety Word together.
text: Ndiyayiqonda, ngamanye amaxesha asinawo umthamo. Zama uqhubeke uchitha ixesha nomntana wakho ofikisayo - naninina ulungele ungazilungiselela uphendula ngokuzolileyo kwaye ufumane iGama loKhuseleko kunye.

SourceText: Remember, when we practice responding calmly and sharing how we feel, our teens learn to do the same. This skill will help them their whole life!
text: Khumbula, xa sizama ukuphendula zolileyo kwaye sabelane ngendlela esiziva ngayo, abantwana bethu abafikisayo bafunda ukwenza ngokufanayo. Esisakhono siyakubanceda ubomu babo bonke!

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father
text: Mamela indlela u@data.characters.media_son_1.name afunde ngayo ukuhlala ezolile kutata wakhe
note: The string @data.characters.media_son_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
text:
Naninina ndisenza into engalunganga, utata wam uye abenomsindo kakhulu kum kwaye andibethe. Uye angakwazi nokundimamela kwaye ndiye ndibenomsindo kakhulu kuye nakwabanye abantu.

Ngoku, xa enomsindo uye aphefumle kambalwa kuqala phambi kokuba aphendule. Lonto yenza wonke umntu abenomoya ozolileyo endaweni yokubangela umlo omkhulu.

Indincedile nyhani lonto ekhaya kunye nasesikolweni, ngokuba nam andisabaphoxi bonke abantu kwaye andise ngomntu onengcwangu. Xa ndiziva ndinomsindo nyani okanye ndinoxinzelelo, Nam ndiye ndiphefumle ngohlobo uTata wam enza ngalo. Ndingumntu owohlukileyo.

I’ll be helping you learn using @global.app_name! In the next few steps, I’ll ask you a few questions, so that I can make your learning experience just right for you!

SourceText: Welcome to @global.app_name! To participate, you'll need a partner in parenting. There are 2 parenting experts to choose from:

note: The string @global.app_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Welcome to @global.app_name! We’re so happy you’re here! Let’s find the right guide to support you in your parenting. Who would you like to learn with?
text: Wamnkelekile e @global.app_name! Siyavuya ulapha! Masifumane isikhokelo esilungileyo sokuxhasa wena ebuzalini. Ungathanda ukufunda nabani?
note: The string @global.app_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi, I am @fields.facilitator_name! I am a grandmother of three and a retired social worker. I love sharing tools for parenting with love and respect.
text: Molo ngingu @fields.facilitator_name! Ndingumakhulu wabathathu kwaye ndingunontlalontle odla umhlala phantsi. Ndiyathatha ukwabelana ngezixhobo zobuzali ngothando nangentlonipho.
note: The string @fields.facilitator_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi, I am @fields.facilitator_name! I am a retired teacher and a grandfather of two. I guide parents with warmth, firmness, and care.
text: Molo, Ndingu @fields.facilitator_name! Ndingu titshala odla umhlala phantsi kwaye ndingu tatomkhulu wababini. I Ndikhokela abazali ngemfudumalo, ngogxininiso, kunye nenkathalo.
note: The string @fields.facilitator_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Who would you like to be your guide?
text: Ungathanda ukuba ibengubani inkokheli yakho?

SourceText: Quick pause
text: Ukunqumama okukhawulezileyo

SourceText:
Sit down, close your eyes, and listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
Notice how you feel. When you are ready, open your eyes. 
Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text: Hlala phantsi, vala amehlo wakho, kwaye umamele umphefumlo wakho xa ungena ngaphakathi nangaphandle. Qaphela ukuba uziva njani. Xa sele ulungile, vula amehlo wakho. Zama lento nanini na uziva uxinzelelekile kwaye ube udinga ikhefu lokunxulumana nawe.

SourceText: Power of three
text: Amandla abantu abathathu

SourceText:
Close your eyes.
Let's use the magic power of 3 to stay present and relax. 

Name 3 sounds you can hear right now.
Name 3 smells you can smell right now.
Name your 3 favourite foods.
What are 3 things you can be gratefful for right now.

At the end of a touch day, thinking of 3 things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text:
Vala amehlo wakho.
Masisebenzise umlingo wamandla ka 3 ukuhlala sikhona kwaye sikhululekile.

Chaza izandi ezi 3 ozivayo ngoku.
Chaza amavumba abeyi 3 owavayo ngoku.
Chaza ukutya okuthandayo kubeyi 3.
Zeziphi izinto eziyi 3 onokuzivuyela ngoku.

Ekupheleni kosuku obelunzima, ukucinga ngezinto eziyi 3 ezisonwabisayo kungasinceda sifumane isibindi sokuqhuba kwakhona kusuku lwangomso.

SourceText: One thing today
text: Into enye namhlanje

SourceText:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love.

Well done, you are a hero!
text:
Vala amehlo akho uze ucinge ngosuku olulandelayo. 

Chaza into enye onombulelo ngayo. 
Chaza into enye oyenze kakuhle. 
Chaza into enye oyithandayo.

Wenze kakuhle, uliqhawe!

SourceText: Breathe to three
text: Phefumla kathathu

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.

Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

You are a star!
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Sebenzisa amandla amangalisayo enani elinguntathu ukuze sihlale silapha size siphole.

Phefumla uze ubale uyo kutsho kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3. 
Phefumla uze ubale uphele kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3. 
Phefumla uze ubale uyo kutsho kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3. 
Phefumla uze ubale uphele kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3.
Ingaba uziva unomahluko? Ukutsala umphefumlo ezantsi kunceda umzimba kunye nengqondo uzole!

Uyinkwenkwezi!

SourceText: In and out
text: Tsala uze ukhuphe

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Listen to your breath as it goes in and out five times.

Notice how you feel.

When you are ready, open your eyes again. You are in control!
text:
Vala amehlo wakho.

Mamela umphefumlo wakho njengokuba ungena uphinde uphuma kahlanu

Qaphela ukuba uziva njani

Xa ulungile, vula amehlo wakho kwakhona. Uselulawulweni lwakho!

SourceText: Think about today
text: Cinga malunga nemini yanamhlanje

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Take a minute to think about the day.

Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.  
Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Thatha umzuzu ucinge malunga nosuku lwakho.

Cinga malunga nento elungileyo okanye emnandi oye wayenza.
Zincome ngokwenza into enye kakuhle namhlanje. 
Cinga ngento enye onokuyenza ngendlela eyahlukileyo ngomso.  
Cinga ngento enye ozingca ngayo.

SourceText: Pause to respond
text: Nqumama ukuze uphendule

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? 

Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly 5 times. 

Then try responding in a calmer way.

Millions of parents say this helps – A LOT.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Ngaba abantwana bakho bakhe bakwenze ngathi ufuna ukukrasa? 

Zinike unqumamo lwemizuzwana eli-10. Tsala uze ukhuphe umoya ucotha amatyeli ama-5. 

Emva koko zama ukuphendula uzolile.

Izigidi zabazali zithi lento iyanceda - KAKHULU.

SourceText: Small things
text: Izinto ezincinci

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  

Take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.   

What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?  
What is one thing that brings you happiness?  
What is one thing that you love?  

They do not have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text:
Vala amehlo wakho.

Thatha umzuzu uyeke into oyenzayo ukuze unxibelelane nokuphefumla kwakho.   

Yeyiphi into enye onombulelo ngayo ngoku?  
Yeyiphi into enye ekwenza wonwabe?  
Yeyiphi into enye oyithandayo?  

Akunyanzelekanga ibe zizinto ezinkulu. Ngamanye amaxesha izinto ezincinci ebomini zezona zibaluleke kakhulu!

SourceText: Body scan
text: Uhlolo lomzimba

SourceText:
Here is an activity to relax your body: 

Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can. 
Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.  
Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?  
Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe into the area and, when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.  
Do this for a few breaths.  

Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?

You can also try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text:
Nantsi into yokwenza umzimba wakho ukhululeke:  

Hlala ngokukhululekileyo uze uvale amehlo akho ukuba unako.  
Yiba nombono weringi yegolide ihlola umzimba wakho wonke, ukusuka ezinyaweni zakho ukuya entloko.   
Nikela ingqalelo njengoko isehla inyuka kumzimba wakho. Ngaba zikhona indawo ezingathi ziqinile? Zindindisholo? Zibuhlungu?   
Nikela ingqalelo kwezo ndawo okomzuzwana. Tsalela umoya kulo ndawo uze xa uphefumla, uzame ukukhupha nayiphi intlungu okanye ukuqinia.   
Kwenze oku ngokuphefumla kambalwa.   

Vula amehlo akho. Uvakalelwa njani ngoku umzimba wakho?

Ungayizama ngokwakho lento kwilixa xana ungqengqile ebhedini ungakwazi ukulala!

SourceText: Feel the ground
text: Yiva umhlaba

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Notice your connection with the ground beneath you. 
What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body do not?  
Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool. 
Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.

Try this next time you feel alone or are doing a mundane activity like washing up. It can really help!
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Phawula indlela onxibelelene ngayo kunye nomhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho.  
Ngawaphi amalungu omzimba wakho achukumisa umhlaba? Ngawaphi angawuchukumisiyo?   
Phawula apho kufudumele khona nalapho kubanda khona.  
Yiva umhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho nokuxhasayo. Vumela umzimba wakho wehle ukuze uxhaswe ngumhlaba.

Zama lento kwixa elizayo xa uziva uwedwa okanye usenza nawuphi na umsebenzi njengokuhlamba impahla. Ingakunceda nyhani!

SourceText: Counting sounds
text: Ukubala izandi

SourceText:
Sit down and close your eyes.
How many sounds can you hear?  
Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. 
After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear? 

Try again for another ten seconds.  
Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? 
Notice how you feel now.
text:
Hlala phantsi uze uvale amehlo akho.
Zingaphi izandi ozivayo?  
Mamela izandi ezingaphakathi nangaphandle kwegumbi. Zibale usebenzisa iminwe yakho. 
Emva kwemizuzwana elishumi, mingaphi iminwe oyibambileyo? Uve izandi ezingaphi? 

Zama kwakhona kangangemizuzwana elishumi.  
Ngaba uve izandi ezintsha? Zikhona izandi ozivileyo ngaphakathi komzimba wakho? 
Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo ngoku.

SourceText: Feel your feelings
text: Yiva indlela ovakalelwa ngayo

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?

Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
It is ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?
text:
Vala amehlo wakho.

Ingaba wakhe wava into engamandla ekubangela ufune ukuyibalekela? 

Endaweni yokubhekela kuloo mvakalelo, makhe sisondele kuyo okomzuzwana. 
Kulungile. Vala amehlo akho ukuba uziva ukhululekile. Tsala umoya kakhulu. 

Funa ukwazi. Uva ndawoni emzimbeni wakho? Ngaba kushushu okanye kuyabanda? Kuqinile okanye kuthambile? Kubambekile okanye Kukhululekile? 
Zibuze imibuzo. Indixelela ntoni? Idinga ntoni? Ndingazibonisa njani ububele ngoku?

SourceText: Your song
text: Ingoma yakho

SourceText:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:   

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?   

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together. 

Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text:
Nantsi into emnandi enokukunceda ususe unxinzelelo:

Khetha ingoma ebonisa into oyifunayo ngalomzuzu. Ngaba ufuna ingoma ezolileyo ukuze ipholise umphefumlo wakho odiniweyo okanye ingoma edlamkileyo ukuze ikwenze ukhuphe uxinezeleko lwakho?   

Shenxisa izinto ukuze kubekho indawo yokujuxuzela umculo. Ungalibali ukuphefumla xa ushukuma. Ukuphefumla kunye nokushukuma kwakho makuhambelane!

SourceText: Ground & gratitude
text: Umhlaba nombulelo

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Take a moment to feel the ground under your feet.
Think of something you feel grateful for.
Focus on your breath.
Breathe in and out.

In and out.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 
Thatha ithuba ukuze uve umhlaba ongaphantsi kweenyawo zakho. 
Cinga ngento oziva unombulelo ngayo.
Nikela ingqalelo kwindlela ophefumla ngayo.
Tsala uze ukhuphe umoya.

Utsala umoya ngaphakathi nangaphadle.

SourceText: Notice how you feel
text: Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo

SourceText:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.

Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!
text:
Molo, Uziva njani ngoku, Wonwabile, Ukhathazekile, unomsindo, wonwabe kakhule? unexhala?

Qaphela apho uyiva khona emzimbeni wakho. Qaphela zeziphi ingcinga ozidibana nezomvakalelo. Tsala moya ezantsi.

Zibulele ngokuthatha ixesha lokujongana neemvakalelo kunye neengcinga zakho!

SourceText: Pause power
text: Amandla onqumamo

SourceText:
Let’s practice a calming trick that we call ‘Pause Power’.

Plant your feet on the ground and breathe in and out three times as slowly as you can. Imagine you are smelling a flower or blowing out a candle.

Ta-da! Pause Power!

This is a great trick to use when you are feeling frustrated because it will help to calm you down.
text:
Masenze iqhinga elizolileyo esilibiza ngokuba ngu 'Nqumama Ngamandla'

Tyala inyawo zakho emhlabeni kwaye phefumla ngaphakathi nangandle amaxesha amathathu ngokucotha kangangoko unako. Khawube nomfanekiso wakho unuka ityatyambo okanye ucima/ uvuthela ikhandlela.

Ta-da! Nqumama Ngamandla!

Lilungile eliqhinga ulisebenzisileyo xana uziva udanile kuba ingakunceda uzole ubesezantsi/ wehle.

SourceText: Praise yourself
text: Zincome

SourceText:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!
text:
Ukuzincoma kungaluncedo kakhulu, ingakumbi ngeentsuku ekunzima ngazo. 

Cinga ngeveki yakho uze ugqibezele esi sivakalisi: “Kule veki, ndiyazingca ngokuba...” Ingayiyo nantoni na emalunga nokuba ngumzali!

Cinga ngento enye oyenze kakuhle namhlanje. Ngoku, thatha iingalo zakho uze UZANGE!

SourceText: Taking care of yourself
text: Ukuzinakekela

SourceText:
Sit comfortably and close your eyes. 

Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?

Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:

May I be peaceful.
May I be safe.
May I be healthy.
May I be happy.
May there be love in my family.
May I feel loved.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text:
Hlala ngokukhululekileyo uze uvale amehlo akho. 

Qonda ukuba kwenzeka ntoni kuwe ngeli thuba. Ucinga ntoni? Ngaba iingcinga zakho zilungile okanye azilunganga. Uziva njani? Uvakalelwa kamnandi okanye kakubi? Uvakalelwa njani umzimba wakho? Ngaba uva umzimba ubambekile okanye ukhululekile?

Nxibelelana nentlziyo yakho ngendlela enobubele. Usenokufuna ukubeka isandla sakho phezu kwentliziyo okanye kwesifuba sakho. Zixelele la mazwi ngaphakathi:

Kwanga ndinganoxolo.
Kwanga ndingakhuseleka.
Kwanga ndingasempilweni.
Kwanga ndingonwaba.
Kwanga kungakho uthando kwintsapho yam.
Kwanga ndingaziva ndithandwa.

Thatha umzuzu ujolise kwizimvo zakho. Phawula ukuba uva nokuba nguwuphi umahluko.

SourceText: Take a pause
text: Nqumama

SourceText:
Step 1. Close your eyes and take a deep breath. 

Step 2. Ask yourself, "What am I thinking?" Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative.
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Remind yourself that whatever you feel, it is okay.
Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

Step 3. Focus on your breath. Feel your breath as it goes in and out. You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath. Do this for about 10 breaths.

Step 4. Expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room. 

Step 5. Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. When you are ready, open your eyes.

Well done for taking a pause. You can do this anytime you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your children!
text:
Inyathelo 1. Vala amehlo akho uze utsale umoya kakhulu. 

Inyathelo 2. Zibuze, “Ndicinga ngantoni?” Phawula ukuba iingcinga zakho zilungile okanye azilunganga.
Phawula ukuba uziva njani ngokweemvakalelo.
 Phawula ukuba iimvakalelo zakho zintle okanye azintlanga. Zikhumbuze ukuba nokuba uvakalelwa njani, kulungile oko.
Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo umzimba wakho. Phawula ukuba kukho indawo ebuhlungu okanye ebambekileyo.

Inyathelo 3. Nikela ingqalelo kwindlela ophefumla ngayo. Yiva umphefumlo wakho njenjoko ungena uze uphume. Unokubeka isandla esiswini sakho uze usive sinyuka size sehle njengoko uphefumla. Kwenze oku njengoko uphefumla kayi-10.

Inyathelo 4. Yandisa ukwazi umzimba wakho wonke. Mamela izandi zegumbi. 

Inyathelo 5. Thatha ithutyana ukuze lokuba ujonge ukuba uzive ngendlela eyahlukileyo na. Xa sele ukulungele, vula amehlo akho!

Uphumelele ekunqumameni. Ungayenza nangaliphi ixesha xana uziva unoxinzelelo. Ikunika ithuba lokuba uzole. Nokuba yimiphefumlo embalwa okanye unxulumana nomhlaba ongaphantsi kuwe kuyamenza umehluko. Unganqumama kunye nabantwana bakho!

SourceText: Physical activity
text: Umsebenzi womzimba

SourceText:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.

Let your hands hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.

Relax your arms and let them swing sideways while you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.

Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles – remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.

Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!

Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience.

Well done! You can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text:
Yima uze wolule iingalo zakho ziye phezulu. Tyhala nawaphi na amafu uze uvumele ilanga libe phezu kwakho. Yolula amacala akho omabini. Zolule ngaphambili nangasemva.

Beka izandla zakho emacaleni. Nyusa amagxa kancinci aye ngasezindlebeni njengoko uphefumla, nciphisa amehlo akho uze ubambe umoya wakho. Yeka amagxa akho njengoko umzimba wakho ukhululeka.

Yekelela iingalo zakho uze uzijingise emacaleni ngelixa ujika umziba wakho wangasentla. Iingalo zakho mazibethe umqolo wakho kancinci njengeko ujika usiya kwelinye icala.

Beka unyawo phambi kolunye uze wenze izangqa ngamaqatha, khumbula ukujikeleza kuwo omabini amacala. Unyawo ngalunye malwenze izangqa ezine kwicala ngalinye.

Ngoku shukumisa umzimba wakho wonke ngokukhawuleza kangoko unako. shukumisa phezulu! Goba uye ezantsi! Zivocavoce ujikelezisa isinqe!

Vala amehlo akho uze uphakamise iingalo zakho ucotha ziye entla kwentloko yakho njengoko utsala umoya. Thoba iingalo zakho ngokucotha zize zibe secaleni njengoko ukhupha umoya.

Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge ngamava akho.

Kulungile! Ungasenza esiseluleki nangaliphi na ixesha xana uzive ngathi udinda ukususa uxinzelelo kwaye ufune ukudlamkisa ingqondo kunye nomzimba.

SourceText: List of things
text: Uluhlu lwezinto

SourceText:
Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
* Listening to your favourite music
* Going for a walk (if possible)
* Doing some exercise
* Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
* Calling up a friend
* Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
* Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
* Watching your favourite TV show

Pick one and do it today!
text:
Yenze uluhlu lwezinto ezisempilweni othanda ukuzenza. Nanga amanye amacebiso:
* Ukumamela ingoma oyithandayo
* Ukuhambahamba (ukuba kuvumelekile)
* Ukujima/ Ukuzilolonga
* Ukusela ikomityi yeti uwedwa
* Ukufowunela umhlobo wakho
* Ukucula, ukudanisa, ukuthandaza okanye ukufunda
* Ukuhlala elangeni uvale amehlo
* Ukubukela inkqubo oyithandayo ekwi-T. V.

Khetha ibe nye kwaye uyenze namhlanje!

SourceText: Connect
text: Nxulumana

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Xa uzikhathalele, uhoye abantwana bakho. Sonke kufuneka sinxulumane. Zama ukuthetha nabahlobo, usapho, kunye nolunye uthungelwano lwenkxaso yonke imihla. Ukuba sekulithuba ugqibele ukufowunela umntu, kwenze ngoku oko!

SourceText: Prevent anger
text: Thintela umsindo

SourceText:
Think about what makes you angry. When does it happen? How do you normally react?

Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text:
Cinga malunga nento ekwenza ube nomsindo. Kwenzeka nini? Uqhele ukusabela njani?

Thintela ukuba nomsindo kwasekuqaleni. Lala okanye uphumle xa udiniwe. Zama ukutya into xa ulambile. Cela umntu akuxhase xa uziva ngathi uwedwa.

SourceText: Angry? Take a break
text: Unomsindo? Thatha ikhefu

SourceText:
Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.

Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have a safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text:
Ukulawula umsindo kunobunzima kakhulu. Thatha ikhefu xa uziva usiba nomsindo ngakubantwana bakho okanye omnye umntu.

Yiya kwenye indawo kangangemizuzu emi- 5 uze ukwazi ukubuyisa ulawulo lwemvakalelo zakho zakho. Ukuba kunendawo ekhuselekileyo phandle, yiya khona. Uza kudlula kule nto!
